missions.localised_description: The half-breed scum of Lahmia sends a force that must be stopped. Engage the fleshy, festering Undead!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A Wood Elf host is close. Intercept and destroy it!

missions.localised_description: A Wood Elf host is close. Intercept and destroy it!

localised_description.last_approved_text: War is not the only answer. An alliance is required so we may continue to exist.

missions.localised_description: War is not the only answer. An alliance is required so we may continue to exist.

localised_description.last_approved_text: These breathers have raiders our tombs for centuries. It is time to raid their lands and plunder their crypts!

missions.localised_description: These breathers have raiders our tombs for centuries. It is time to raid their lands and plunder their crypts!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Dark Elf lands hide much valuable lore and secrets to eternal life. Raid their lands and seek such knowledge!

missions.localised_description: The Dark Elf lands hide much valuable lore and secrets to eternal life. Raid their lands and seek such knowledge!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Crack open the Dwarfen Holds and raid their lands, homes and tombs for anything of value.

missions.localised_description: Crack open the Dwarfen Holds and raid their lands, homes and tombs for anything of value.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This young race of men have stolen secrets that belong to Khemri. We shall go, raid and return what has always been ours.

missions.localised_description: This young race of men have stolen secrets that belong to Khemri. We shall go, raid and return what has always been ours.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Orcs have looted and stolen from us for too long. Now, raid their slum lands!

missions.localised_description: The Orcs have looted and stolen from us for too long. Now, raid their slum lands!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Enter High Elf lands and take! No longer will these arrogant breathers keep what should be ours!

missions.localised_description: Enter High Elf lands and take! No longer will these arrogant breathers keep what should be ours!

localised_description.last_approved_text: No longer will the Lizardmen hide their so-called knowledge from our Liche Priests. Seek out their treasures, their plaques of lore. Raid their habitat.

missions.localised_description: No longer will the Lizardmen hide their so-called knowledge from our Liche Priests. Seek out their treasures, their plaques of lore. Raid their habitat.

localised_description.last_approved_text: We shall plunder the resources of the ratmen. Raid their warrens, destroy their under-world!

missions.localised_description: We shall plunder the resources of the ratmen. Raid their warrens, destroy their under-world!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This inferior king hides relics we need. Raid his lands, scatter the sands and his legions. All we survey is ours.

missions.localised_description: This inferior king hides relics we need. Raid his lands, scatter the sands and his legions. All we survey is ours.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Seek out the lands claimed by the Lahmia's bastard children - raid the lands of their bloodlines. Vengeance will be ours!

missions.localised_description: Seek out the lands claimed by the Lahmia's bastard children - raid the lands of their bloodlines. Vengeance will be ours!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Enter the tree-strewn paths of the Wood Elves and take their life-source - claim it for the kings of Nehekhara!

missions.localised_description: Enter the tree-strewn paths of the Wood Elves and take their life-source - claim it for the kings of Nehekhara!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Under the desert sands awaits a long-dead legion, eternally loyal and ready to serve. All it needs are the Liche Priests to utter an incantation of awakening.

missions.localised_description: Under the desert sands awaits a long-dead legion, eternally loyal and ready to serve. All it needs are the Liche Priests to utter an incantation of awakening.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Destroy a living city of Bretonnia. Send their presents fleeing into our bony embrace!

missions.localised_description: Destroy a living city of Bretonnia. Send their presents fleeing into our bony embrace!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Seek out a city of the Dark Elves and raze it to the ground. Every stone must tumble. Ptra demands nothing less.

missions.localised_description: Seek out a city of the Dark Elves and raze it to the ground. Every stone must tumble. Ptra demands nothing less.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Dwarfholds of the stunted are a ripe target for our legions. Make it so.

missions.localised_description: The Dwarfholds of the stunted are a ripe target for our legions. Make it so.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This new empire's death god inhabits every stone and garden in their vile realm. Topple their city.

missions.localised_description: This new empire's death god inhabits every stone and garden in their vile realm. Topple their city.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Orcs gather in one of their settlements. Raise the legions and destroy it.

missions.localised_description: The Orcs gather in one of their settlements. Raise the legions and destroy it.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Gleaming towers of the High Elves rival the height of our pyramids. This cannot be allowed to stand - literally.

missions.localised_description: The Gleaming towers of the High Elves rival the height of our pyramids. This cannot be allowed to stand - literally.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The temple-cities of the Lizardmen are a cache of lost lore that could bring about the Day of Awakening, unseal their crypts and burn what is left.

missions.localised_description: The temple-cities of the Lizardmen are a cache of lost lore that could bring about the Day of Awakening, unseal their crypts and burn what is left.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Seek out the Skaven nests and put an end to these vermin once and for all!

missions.localised_description: Seek out the Skaven nests and put an end to these vermin once and for all!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The city of a rival Tomb King encroaches on our greatness! Raze it, and execute the Necrotect to ensure our pyramid remains the greatest death shrine.

missions.localised_description: The city of a rival Tomb King encroaches on our greatness! Raze it, and execute the Necrotect to ensure our pyramid remains the greatest death shrine.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The only way to halt the Vampire threat is to destroy these night stalkers where they slumber.

missions.localised_description: The only way to halt the Vampire threat is to destroy these night stalkers where they slumber.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Wood Elves lurk in the deep woods. Send in your skeletal legions and fell any tree that could hold such vermin.

missions.localised_description: The Wood Elves lurk in the deep woods. Send in your skeletal legions and fell any tree that could hold such vermin.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Raise a Tomb Prince and add him to your legions.

missions.localised_description: Raise a Tomb Prince and add him to your legions.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A Necrotect is needed to enhance the war statuary in our legions and ensure the greatness of death shrines.

missions.localised_description: A Necrotect is needed to enhance the war statuary in our legions and ensure the greatness of death shrines.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Summon a Liche Priest from the Mortuary Cult to serve.

missions.localised_description: Summon a Liche Priest from the Mortuary Cult to serve.

localised_description.last_approved_text: We require a Screaming Skull Catapult to ensure your reign.

missions.localised_description: We require a Screaming Skull Catapult to ensure your reign.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Bring forth the desert knights to serve your majesty.

missions.localised_description: Bring forth the desert knights to serve your majesty.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Summon the bodyguard from the Burial Chamber so they may serve in battle.

missions.localised_description: Summon the bodyguard from the Burial Chamber so they may serve in battle.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The archers of ancient Nehekhara remain the best in the world. Ensure they join your legions.

missions.localised_description: The archers of ancient Nehekhara remain the best in the world. Ensure they join your legions.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Awaken the war statuary. Stone must march with sand.

missions.localised_description: Awaken the war statuary. Stone must march with sand.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Order the chariots into service at once.

missions.localised_description: Order the chariots into service at once.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The blessing of Asaph, the Asp-Goddess, has waned of late. The divine venom in Khalida’s veins flows sluggishly, and her Venom Staff seems devoid of the goddess' fury. Deeply concerned by this, she summons her priestesses for counsel. After much deliberation, they propose a ritual to invoke the Asp-Goddess and awaken her blessing once more. The incantations cannot be performed without due honours, however. To provide a fitting stage for the ceremony, the Temple of Asaph must be restored to its former glory.

missions.localised_description: The blessing of Asaph, the Asp-Goddess, has waned of late. The divine venom in Khalida’s veins flows sluggishly, and her Venom Staff seems devoid of the goddess' fury. Deeply concerned by this, she summons her priestesses for counsel. After much deliberation, they propose a ritual to invoke the Asp-Goddess and awaken her blessing once more. The incantations cannot be performed without due honours, however. To provide a fitting stage for the ceremony, the Temple of Asaph must be restored to its former glory.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Khalida arranges herself in the restored temple, and the priestesses begin their invocations. As the chant rises, Khalida begins to feel the venom quickening within her. Opening her mind in supplication to the goddess, she hears Asaph's familiar voice whisper to her "Khalida, my chosen. You feel my blessing once more. But it is weakened, for there is foul work afoot. The cursed Lahmians meddle once more... they sully my sacred ground. Locate my shrine at the Springs of Eternal Life. Purge it of Lahmian filth. With this ritual, you have given me a tribute of magic. Next you must restore beauty...". As the voice of the goddess fades, Khalida sends for her agents. Asaph's shrine must be found.

missions.localised_description: Khalida arranges herself in the restored temple, and the priestesses begin their invocations. As the chant rises, Khalida begins to feel the venom quickening within her. Opening her mind in supplication to the goddess, she hears Asaph's familiar voice whisper to her "Khalida, my chosen. You feel my blessing once more. But it is weakened, for there is foul work afoot. The cursed Lahmians meddle once more... they sully my sacred ground. Locate my shrine at the Springs of Eternal Life. Purge it of Lahmian filth. With this ritual, you have given me a tribute of magic. Next you must restore beauty...". As the voice of the goddess fades, Khalida sends for her agents. Asaph's shrine must be found.

localised_description.last_approved_text: When Khalida enters Asaph's shrine, a scene of desecration greets her. Thousands of snake-bones litter the cave floor and the springwater is befouled by necromancy. The source of the corruption, a black orb, lies upon the altar of Asaph. Enraged, Khalida bellows in fury and shatters the artefact, then curtly orders her priestesses to prepare a rite of purification. As their intonations fill the caverns, the corrupted waters turn pure again, and serpents emerge from crevices to form a writhing carpet. Khalida hears the voice of Asaph, stronger now "The beauty of my shrines is restored, but vengeance is yet unanswered. You will find our enemies on the river turned to ash. Destroy them in my name!" Emerging from the cavern, Khalida orders her forces to march tirelessly for Ash River. The spawn of Neferata will be undone!

missions.localised_description: When Khalida enters Asaph's shrine, a scene of desecration greets her. Thousands of snake-bones litter the cave floor and the springwater is befouled by necromancy. The source of the corruption, a black orb, lies upon the altar of Asaph. Enraged, Khalida bellows in fury and shatters the artefact, then curtly orders her priestesses to prepare a rite of purification. As their intonations fill the caverns, the corrupted waters turn pure again, and serpents emerge from crevices to form a writhing carpet. Khalida hears the voice of Asaph, stronger now "The beauty of my shrines is restored, but vengeance is yet unanswered. You will find our enemies on the river turned to ash. Destroy them in my name!" Emerging from the cavern, Khalida orders her forces to march tirelessly for Ash River. The spawn of Neferata will be undone!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Though exiled by Settra, Grand Hierophant Khatep remains true to his duty as Liche Lord of Khemri. Since then he has scoured the Land of the Dead, seeking a method to restore Nehekhara to its former glory, and thus return to his rightful place in the City of Kings. Now his tireless quest brings him to the New World. Perhaps some clue may lie sequestered in its ancient ruins…

missions.localised_description: Though exiled by Settra, Grand Hierophant Khatep remains true to his duty as Liche Lord of Khemri. Since then he has scoured the Land of the Dead, seeking a method to restore Nehekhara to its former glory, and thus return to his rightful place in the City of Kings. Now his tireless quest brings him to the New World. Perhaps some clue may lie sequestered in its ancient ruins…

localised_description.last_approved_text: Deep beneath the ruins, Khatep finds himself in a maze of bone-strewn catacombs. At its focus he stands door bearing a weeping-eye sigil. Behind it lies a hidden library, the final resting place of some Druchii sorceror. To the Hierophant's shock, the shelves around his bones are stacked with Mortuary Cult tomes! Have the Dark Elves truly been dabbling in the arts of resurrection? This demands further enquiry - Khatep must know more. An ancient map on the crumbling desk marks the location of a city - and a sister library...

missions.localised_description: Deep beneath the ruins, Khatep finds himself in a maze of bone-strewn catacombs. At its focus he stands door bearing a weeping-eye sigil. Behind it lies a hidden library, the final resting place of some Druchii sorceror. To the Hierophant's shock, the shelves around his bones are stacked with Mortuary Cult tomes! Have the Dark Elves truly been dabbling in the arts of resurrection? This demands further enquiry - Khatep must know more. An ancient map on the crumbling desk marks the location of a city - and a sister library...

localised_description.last_approved_text: Khatep enters the great library and scours it for further clues. Among the array of magical texts, bestiaries, and codices, one tome stands out for its more recent binding. Khatep is staggered to find within its pages a new liturgy, capable of binding a soul to a living host. There is some risk to both participants, of course, but could this be the answer? A way to renew Settra - and others besides - to true life? Surely this would restore Khatep's honour and station! Divining an appropriate site for the liturgy will require a powerful expenditure of energy - a Nehekharan Rite should suffice.

missions.localised_description: Khatep enters the great library and scours it for further clues. Among the array of magical texts, bestiaries, and codices, one tome stands out for its more recent binding. Khatep is staggered to find within its pages a new liturgy, capable of binding a soul to a living host. There is some risk to both participants, of course, but could this be the answer? A way to renew Settra - and others besides - to true life? Surely this would restore Khatep's honour and station! Divining an appropriate site for the liturgy will require a powerful expenditure of energy - a Nehekharan Rite should suffice.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Arkhan spies the parched lands in need of taming - he shall bring them into shadow. It is a desert of the dead that should answer not to a Tomb King, but a Liche King… And on the horizon is Khemri itself, where Settra sits smug on the throne. His time will come.

missions.localised_description: Arkhan spies the parched lands in need of taming - he shall bring them into shadow. It is a desert of the dead that should answer not to a Tomb King, but a Liche King… And on the horizon is Khemri itself, where Settra sits smug on the throne. His time will come.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As Arkhan's shadow realm expands, he will inevitably encounter the borders of hostiles. Those Tomb Kings are too blind - their rotting eyes lost - to see what gifts Nagash shall bring unto the world. It is the Liche King's task to prepare the way, to coat the land in shadow for the Arch-Necromancer's resurrection!

missions.localised_description: As Arkhan's shadow realm expands, he will inevitably encounter the borders of hostiles. Those Tomb Kings are too blind - their rotting eyes lost - to see what gifts Nagash shall bring unto the world. It is the Liche King's task to prepare the way, to coat the land in shadow for the Arch-Necromancer's resurrection!

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter II: The Kingdom of Arkhan

missions.localised_title: Chapter II: The Kingdom of Arkhan

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Liche King's empire will rise from the bones of his enemies. Even mighty Settra shall kneel - if he hasn't done so already - or be destroyed. Continue the conquest - raze what is useless, hunt what is needed, make ready the lands for the Mortarch's call. The kingdom of Arkhan is all.

missions.localised_description: The Liche King's empire will rise from the bones of his enemies. Even mighty Settra shall kneel - if he hasn't done so already - or be destroyed. Continue the conquest - raze what is useless, hunt what is needed, make ready the lands for the Mortarch's call. The kingdom of Arkhan is all.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter III: In Sight of the Black Tower

missions.localised_title: Chapter III: In Sight of the Black Tower

localised_description.last_approved_text: The living and the dead will suffer at the hands of the Liche King. For countless generations, Arkhan the Black has vented his rage at many foes, but now, on the eve of great change, the Liche King tempers his anger into domination. He prepares the way for the only possible arrival.

missions.localised_description: The living and the dead will suffer at the hands of the Liche King. For countless generations, Arkhan the Black has vented his rage at many foes, but now, on the eve of great change, the Liche King tempers his anger into domination. He prepares the way for the only possible arrival.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Finally, after countless centuries, Arkhan the Black, the Liche King, shall raise and destroy and take what is rightfully his - the world! Bequeathed to him by the Supreme Lord of the Undead himself. All shall bow before the Black King, they will have no choice for their souls shall belong to Arkhan.

missions.localised_description: Finally, after countless centuries, Arkhan the Black, the Liche King, shall raise and destroy and take what is rightfully his - the world! Bequeathed to him by the Supreme Lord of the Undead himself. All shall bow before the Black King, they will have no choice for their souls shall belong to Arkhan.

localised_description.last_approved_text: There are those who encroach on Lybaras, who mistake that the stillness and calm of High Queen Khalida as inaction or indolence. They will learn, the queen rises from her throne, trespassers, intruders and usurpers shall rue the day they invoked the rage of Khalida!

missions.localised_description: There are those who encroach on Lybaras, who mistake that the stillness and calm of High Queen Khalida as inaction or indolence. They will learn, the queen rises from her throne, trespassers, intruders and usurpers shall rue the day they invoked the rage of Khalida!

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter I: The Throne of Lybaras

missions.localised_title: Chapter I: The Throne of Lybaras

localised_description.last_approved_text: Khalida is beloved by Asaph; the snake shall strike through her champion, seeking out enemies both living or dead. But before the serpent can hunt, it must secure its nest. The queendom of Lybaras is ripe for expansion.

missions.localised_description: Khalida is beloved by Asaph; the snake shall strike through her champion, seeking out enemies both living or dead. But before the serpent can hunt, it must secure its nest. The queendom of Lybaras is ripe for expansion.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter II: Realm of the Asp Goddess

missions.localised_title: Chapter II: Realm of the Asp Goddess

localised_description.last_approved_text: Before the asp can strike it must coil, tensing its body for the inevitable attack. Khalida should ready her empire in the same way. Her followers must coil, creating a solid foundation for the imminent attack.

missions.localised_description: Before the asp can strike it must coil, tensing its body for the inevitable attack. Khalida should ready her empire in the same way. Her followers must coil, creating a solid foundation for the imminent attack.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With Lybaras thriving, the queen can look to spreading her venom throughout the land. But her ultimate goal is nothing as vacuous as Settra - she cares not for how mighty her empire grows, merely that this will leave her unchallenged to hunt the real foe - the spawn of Lahmia.

missions.localised_description: With Lybaras thriving, the queen can look to spreading her venom throughout the land. But her ultimate goal is nothing as vacuous as Settra - she cares not for how mighty her empire grows, merely that this will leave her unchallenged to hunt the real foe - the spawn of Lahmia.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter IV: The Realm of Venom

missions.localised_title: Chapter IV: The Realm of Venom

localised_description.last_approved_text: All shall tremble before a queen mighty and merciless. She will purge the lands of Vampire taint. But do not let the living think themselves safe from Khalida, for they are the stock on which the hated night creatures feed. Let the High Queen purge the world no matter if hearts beats within her prey or not.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter V: High Queen of Nehekhara

missions.localised_title: Chapter V: High Queen of Nehekhara

localised_description.last_approved_text: For centuries Khatep has wandered the world in anguish. His desire is to return to Khemri and be forgiven for the sin of rousing Settra before the Day of Awakening. To make amends, the Liche Lord must gather around him other outcasts of Khemri and forge a powerbase, then answers may be found and, if not outright forgiveness... leniency from the Imperishable.

To make amends, the Liche Lord must gather around him other outcasts of Khemri and forge a powerbase, then answers may be found and, if not outright forgiveness... leniency from the Imperishable.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter I: Anguish of the Liche Lord

missions.localised_title: Chapter I: Anguish of the Liche Lord

localised_description.last_approved_text: Nehekhara beckons. But the time is not right, the return to the Land of the Dead must come with greatness and a vast trove of fresh lore. To that end, Khatep needs to continue his expansion in the chill realms.

missions.localised_description: Nehekhara beckons. But the time is not right, the return to the Land of the Dead must come with greatness and a vast trove of fresh lore. To that end, Khatep needs to continue his expansion in the chill realms.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter II: Resurgence of the Liche Lord

missions.localised_title: Chapter II: Resurgence of the Liche Lord

localised_description.last_approved_text: The claws of the Liche Lord delve deeper into the land. No longer a mere itinerant, the exile and his outcast followers have put down roots and must continue to expand. If they can't go to Nehekhara - yet - then the desert shall come to them!

missions.localised_description: The claws of the Liche Lord delve deeper into the land. No longer a mere itinerant, the exile and his outcast followers have put down roots and must continue to expand. If they can't go to Nehekhara - yet - then the desert shall come to them!

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter III: Bring the Desert to Them

missions.localised_title: Chapter III: Bring the Desert to Them

localised_description.last_approved_text: The nascent empire of Undeath, under the stewardship of the Grand Hierophant, thrives. The Mortuary Cult has ever been willing to serve the Tomb Kings, but now their leader wields its power to serve the Cult itself. But such influence is meaningless if their sole, original purpose cannot be fulfilled - to bring about the Day of Awakening.

The Mortuary Cult has ever been willing to serve the Tomb Kings, but now their leader wields its power to serve the Cult itself. But such influence is meaningless if their sole, original purpose cannot be fulfilled - to bring about the Day of Awakening.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter IV: Rise of the Liche Lord

missions.localised_title: Chapter IV: Rise of the Liche Lord

localised_description.last_approved_text: Now, at last, is the time for the Liche Lord to exercise the power he has been building. Now is the time to grow the empire he has founded and show those in Khemri and its surrounding kingdoms that the exiles are ready to return.

missions.localised_description: Now, at last, is the time for the Liche Lord to exercise the power he has been building. Now is the time to grow the empire he has founded and show those in Khemri and its surrounding kingdoms that the exiles are ready to return.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Oh mighty, Settra... Great King, the Imperishable, Khemrikhara, The Great King of Nehekhara, King of Kings, Opener of the Way, Wielder of the Divine Flame, Punisher of Nomads, The Great Unifier, Commander of the Golden Legion, Sacred of Appearance, Bringer of Light, Father of Hawks, Builder of Cities, Protector of the Two Worlds, Keeper of the Hours, Chosen of Ptra, High Steward of the Horizon, Sailor of the Great Vitae, Sentinel of the Two Realms, The Undisputed, Begetter of the Begat, Scourge of the Faithless, Carrion-feeder, First of the Charnel Valley, Rider of the Sacred Chariot, Vanquisher of Vermin, Champion of the Death Arena, Mighty Lion Of The Infinite Desert, Emperor Of The Shifting Sands, He Who Holds The Sceptre, Great Hawk Of The Heavens, Arch-Sultan of Atalan, Waker of the Hierotitan, Monarch of the Sky, Majestic Emperor of the Shifting Sands, Champion of the Desert Gods, Breaker of the Ogre Clans, Builder of the Great Pyramid, Terror of the Living, Master of the Never-Ending Horizon, Master of the Necropolises, Taker of Souls, Tyrant to the Foolish, Bearer of Ptra's Holy Blade, Scion of Usirian, Scion of Nehek, The Great, Chaser of Nightmares, Keeper of the Royal Herat, Founder of the Mortuary Cult, Banisher of the Grand Hierophant, High Lord Admiral of the Deathfleets, Guardian of the Charnal Pass, Tamer of the Liche King, Unliving Jackal Lord, Dismisser of the Warrior Queen, Charioteer of the Gods, He Who Does Not Serve, Slayer of Redditras, Scarab Purger, Favoured of Usirian, Player of the Great Game, Liberator of Life, Lord Sand, Wrangler of Scorpions, Emperor of the Dunes, Eternal Sovereign of the Khemri's Legions, Seneschal of the Great Sandy Desert, Curserer of the Living, Regent of the Eastern Mountains, Warden of the Eternal Necropolis, Herald of the all Heralds, Caller of the Bitter Wind, God-Tamer, Master of the Mortis River, Guardian of the Dead, Great Keeper of the Obelisks, Deacon of the Ash River, Belated of Wakers, General of the Mighty Frame, Summoner of Sandstorms, Master of all Necrotects, Prince of Dust, Tyrant of Araby, Purger of the Greenskin Breathers, Killer of the False God's Champions, Tyrant of the Gold Dunes, Golden Bone Lord, Avenger of the Dead, Carrion Master, Eternal Warden of Nehek's Lands, Breaker of Djaf's Bonds... and many, many more... begin your conquest!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Khemri has ever-been the greatest city and capital of Nehekhara. To let such status wane would taint not only the city but mighty Settra as well. The city must expand beyond its traditional borders. Any in the path of expansion must submit and give unquestioning allegiance to Khemri and its king, or feel his wrath.

missions.localised_description: Khemri has ever-been the greatest city and capital of Nehekhara. To let such status wane would taint not only the city but mighty Settra as well. The city must expand beyond its traditional borders. Any in the path of expansion must submit and give unquestioning allegiance to Khemri and its king, or feel his wrath.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Now is the moment for the King of Kings to expand his domain. The world is a cauldron of war and instability begging for the dominance of Settra to bring order. Make it so.

missions.localised_description: Now is the moment for the King of Kings to expand his domain. The world is a cauldron of war and instability begging for the dominance of Settra to bring order. Make it so.

localised_description.last_approved_text: It is said that every man has a master - be it a parent, a superior, a lord or even a god. But not Settra - he serves none but himself and has done for eternity. For he is the King of Kings and so all other kings must bow to him. Yet there are still those who shun his greatness. Capture such wayward settlements, so their denizens can be corrected!

missions.localised_description: It is said that every man has a master - be it a parent, a superior, a lord or even a god. But not Settra - he serves none but himself and has done for eternity. For he is the King of Kings and so all other kings must bow to him. Yet there are still those who shun his greatness. Capture such wayward settlements, so their denizens can be corrected!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Even the Gods look upon Settra in deference… or they should. The Great King shall rule all; a vast empire that no living monarch could ever hope to attain. That is not a mere desire that is fate being bent to the will of Settra the Imperishable!

missions.localised_description: Even the Gods look upon Settra in deference… or they should. The Great King shall rule all; a vast empire that no living monarch could ever hope to attain. That is not a mere desire that is fate being bent to the will of Settra the Imperishable!

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter V: Kingdom of the Gods

missions.localised_title: Chapter V: Kingdom of the Gods

localised_description.last_approved_text: Warlord Doomclaw makes many demands of Tretch. The first is to gain a substantial tail-hold in this ice-ravaged land. Gnaw deep into this realm's roots so it may one day rival Crookback Mountain as a lair for Clan Rictus.

missions.localised_description: Warlord Doomclaw makes many demands of Tretch. The first is to gain a substantial tail-hold in this ice-ravaged land. Gnaw deep into this realm's roots so it may one day rival Crookback Mountain as a lair for Clan Rictus.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter I: From the Deep Warrens

missions.localised_title: Chapter I: From the Deep Warrens

localised_description.last_approved_text: A tail-hold in this region is not enough. No-no. The Clan must spread, must infest the underground and riddle it with our spawn. We shall take this realm's wealth and use it for our ends - that is the Clan Rictus way.

missions.localised_description: A tail-hold in this region is not enough. No-no. The Clan must spread, must infest the underground and riddle it with our spawn. We shall take this realm's wealth and use it for our ends - that is the Clan Rictus way.

localised_description.last_approved_text: It goes well for Tretch - yet again the Craventail has proven himself resilient and able to almost preternaturally dodge trouble, much to the annoyance of his foes. Yet… the labour is not yet complete. The rise of Clan Rictus must continue.

missions.localised_description: It goes well for Tretch - yet again the Craventail has proven himself resilient and able to almost preternaturally dodge trouble, much to the annoyance of his foes. Yet… the labour is not yet complete. The rise of Clan Rictus must continue.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter III: The Rise of Rictus

missions.localised_title: Chapter III: The Rise of Rictus

localised_description.last_approved_text: Rictus is well established in its new land. Craventail's burgeoning proto-empire continues to grow, gnawing just under the surface. Yet, there are still many nuisances in this world - both vermin and ‘things’ - best to eradicate all so that only Clan Rictus remains. For the Horned Rat! …and his brave, dedicated servant.

missions.localised_description: Rictus is well established in its new land. Craventail's burgeoning proto-empire continues to grow, gnawing just under the surface. Yet, there are still many nuisances in this world - both vermin and ‘things’ - best to eradicate all so that only Clan Rictus remains. For the Horned Rat! …and his brave, dedicated servant.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter IV: Gnawing at the World

missions.localised_title: Chapter IV: Gnawing at the World

localised_description.last_approved_text: The plan is all but complete; Clan Rictus has grown like a canker, establishing a noisome empire to rival any nest-lair in the Under-Empire, yes-yes! A few more tasks will ensure Tretch can rival the Council - Lord Doomclaw himself will surely be proud-incensed!

missions.localised_description: The plan is all but complete; Clan Rictus has grown like a canker, establishing a noisome empire to rival any nest-lair in the Under-Empire, yes-yes! A few more tasks will ensure Tretch can rival the Council - Lord Doomclaw himself will surely be proud-incensed!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Mostly recovered from his ordeal, the Liche Priest employs his new-found knowledge, guiding Arkhan's army with the efficiency of a hunting-dog. As they approach their destination, Arkhan senses something is amiss. His own Black Tower seems to be the destination. \n\n Arkhan's concern grows to mounting horror as he watches rank after rank of Skaven warriors marching into view. He spies ragged banners proclaiming the armies of three - no, four! Four clans are present. A veritable Vermintide! The foremost warlord holds aloft the Staff of Nagash and laughs at the top of its wet lungs. A subterfuge, then... this is Settra's doing! He has gifted the staff to the faithless ratmen in return for Arkhan's destruction - and on his own turf. Betrayed by both a god and a king, Arkhan's horror turns to dark rage and steely determination. This will be a fight to remember... if he can survive the Skaven onslaught.

missions.localised_description: Mostly recovered from his ordeal, the Liche Priest employs his new-found knowledge, guiding Arkhan's army with the efficiency of a hunting-dog. As they approach their destination, Arkhan senses something is amiss. His own Black Tower seems to be the destination. \n\n Arkhan's concern grows to mounting horror as he watches rank after rank of Skaven warriors marching into view. He spies ragged banners proclaiming the armies of three - no, four! Four clans are present. A veritable Vermintide! The foremost warlord holds aloft the Staff of Nagash and laughs at the top of its wet lungs. A subterfuge, then... this is Settra's doing! He has gifted the staff to the faithless ratmen in return for Arkhan's destruction - and on his own turf. Betrayed by both a god and a king, Arkhan's horror turns to dark rage and steely determination. This will be a fight to remember... if he can survive the Skaven onslaught.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The books, along with the Necromancer’s staff, have awoken the Black Pyramid. And so the carrion circle. The Tomb Kings have always lusted for power in life and especially in death. Settra comes, leading an undying alliance to wrest the pyramid from its creator’s most loyal servant. The Followers of Nagash raise their warriors even as the Black Pyramid climbs into the sky. The battle for its control is about to begin.

missions.localised_description: The books, along with the Necromancer’s staff, have awoken the Black Pyramid. And so the carrion circle. The Tomb Kings have always lusted for power in life and especially in death. Settra comes, leading an undying alliance to wrest the pyramid from its creator’s most loyal servant. The Followers of Nagash raise their warriors even as the Black Pyramid climbs into the sky. The battle for its control is about to begin.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The five books are found. The Liche Priests begin the ultimate incantation, igniting the power within the stirring Black Pyramid. Nagash’s ultimate legacy is ripe for domination. However, the Arch-Necromancer’s greatest lackey, the Liche King, has deployed his legions and lieutenants to defend the master’s shrine. \n\nArkhan himself remains mysteriously absent… for now.
