localised_description.last_approved_text: "The answers can be found in the ruins, master-Lord. Send minions to hunt through them and precious things can be yours… Unless it’s a rat trap."\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_treasure_hunting]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_treasure_hunting}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "The answers can be found in the ruins, master-Lord. Send minions to hunt through them and precious things can be yours… Unless it’s a rat trap."\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_treasure_hunting]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_treasure_hunting}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The brood mothers’ bellies are full. New pups are being born and the burrows swell, master. We must make room, before they eat each other. Upgrade the lairs."\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "The brood mothers’ bellies are full. New pups are being born and the burrows swell, master. We must make room, before they eat each other. Upgrade the lairs."\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: Even among the Skaven, Warlord Tretch is famed for his guile and instinct for self-preservation. His sixth sense has delivered him from peril on countless occasions, and ensured his promotion over other Skaven whose survival instincts are not so finely honed. This uncanny good fortune drives his peers and superiors to distraction... he seems impossible to kill!\n\nThis doesn’t stop them trying, however, and a sudden directive from the Council of Thirteen to raise a force for an imminent yet unexplained mission has Tretch's whiskers twitching. Another suicide mission? He will bide his time and play along... for now.

missions.localised_description: Even among the Skaven, Warlord Tretch is famed for his guile and instinct for self-preservation. His sixth sense has delivered him from peril on countless occasions, and ensured his promotion over other Skaven whose survival instincts are not so finely honed. This uncanny good fortune drives his peers and superiors to distraction... he seems impossible to kill!\n\nThis doesn’t stop them trying, however, and a sudden directive from the Council of Thirteen to raise a force for an imminent yet unexplained mission has Tretch's whiskers twitching. Another suicide mission? He will bide his time and play along... for now.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Tretch's heightened suspicions keep him in a state of readiness. So when three of Clan Eshin's finest come at him from behind during an inspection of his new troops, he is ready. Clocking their reflections in the eyes of a dim-witted Clanrat, he whirls to slit the first assassin's throat. Its companions, realising the futility of their mission, screech in fear and skitter southwards into the night. Around the corpse's neck is found a curious amulet of Greenskin origin...\n\nThe remaining assassins are last seen going to ground nearby. There will be many hiding places, but their movements will be curtailed. A raid may flush them out.

missions.localised_description: Tretch's heightened suspicions keep him in a state of readiness. So when three of Clan Eshin's finest come at him from behind during an inspection of his new troops, he is ready. Clocking their reflections in the eyes of a dim-witted Clanrat, he whirls to slit the first assassin's throat. Its companions, realising the futility of their mission, screech in fear and skitter southwards into the night. Around the corpse's neck is found a curious amulet of Greenskin origin...\n\nThe remaining assassins are last seen going to ground nearby. There will be many hiding places, but their movements will be curtailed. A raid may flush them out.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The interrogation concluded, Tretch releases the assassin - but not before plucking out his eyes and leaving him to wander blind among the still-burning fields. The assassin was generous with his information; it seems the hit was orchestrated by a high-ranking official of a rival clan. Furthermore, the same clan has employed a mercenary army of Greenskins to move in and decimate Clan Rictus upon Tretch's death!\n\nProtocol prevents direct retaliation against the rival Skaven Lord, but Warlord Tretch demands a target for his fury. Before he was blinded, the assassin gave a rough location for where the Greenskins are mustering their forces. An example must be made for those who dare to cross Clan Rictus!

missions.localised_description: The interrogation concluded, Tretch releases the assassin - but not before plucking out his eyes and leaving him to wander blind among the still-burning fields. The assassin was generous with his information; it seems the hit was orchestrated by a high-ranking official of a rival clan. Furthermore, the same clan has employed a mercenary army of Greenskins to move in and decimate Clan Rictus upon Tretch's death!\n\nProtocol prevents direct retaliation against the rival Skaven Lord, but Warlord Tretch demands a target for his fury. Before he was blinded, the assassin gave a rough location for where the Greenskins are mustering their forces. An example must be made for those who dare to cross Clan Rictus!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Tretch’s agent in the north has successfully located the burrow in which the Greenskins muster. They await orders from their paymasters, quite unaware that Tretch plans to land the mortal blow first...

missions.localised_description: Tretch’s agent in the north has successfully located the burrow in which the Greenskins muster. They await orders from their paymasters, quite unaware that Tretch plans to land the mortal blow first...

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Black Pyramid, Nagash's greatest legacy, is a construction of pure, malevolent power. Though eternally loyal to his master, Arkhan would slay a legion to wield even just a little of it. If he can lay his hands on the Staff of Nagash, a fraction will be his to command. No record exists of the staff's whereabouts, but a tool of such arcane eminence does not pass through the world without trace. \n\n Arkhan Summons his agents. He orders them forth to hunt high and low for word of the staff. He bids them be discreet, to cloak their hunt beneath the guise of everyday activity… none must know of Arkhan's the Black's design.

missions.localised_description: The Black Pyramid, Nagash's greatest legacy, is a construction of pure, malevolent power. Though eternally loyal to his master, Arkhan would slay a legion to wield even just a little of it. If he can lay his hands on the Staff of Nagash, a fraction will be his to command. No record exists of the staff's whereabouts, but a tool of such arcane eminence does not pass through the world without trace. \n\n Arkhan Summons his agents. He orders them forth to hunt high and low for word of the staff. He bids them be discreet, to cloak their hunt beneath the guise of everyday activity… none must know of Arkhan's the Black's design.

localised_description.last_approved_text: An agent returns to Arkhan with news of his investigations. The Staff of Nagash is found - in the hands of Settra the Imperishable himself! Arkhan audibly rattles with outrage. How to wrest it from the false king's grasp? He must contrive the most subtle and cunning of plans... as his mind embraces the problem, a course of action presents itself. He will need the assistance of those members of the Mortuary Cult who remain loyal to him... and the very gods themselves. \n\n As he enters the small, incense-wreathed temple of his loyal Mortuary Cultists, Arkhan requests that they construct him a powerful artefact. Silently, he knows they hunger for Canopic Jars to fuel their dark studies, and will gladly work to ensure that more flow their way. When the donkey sees the carrot, it will comply...

missions.localised_description: An agent returns to Arkhan with news of his investigations. The Staff of Nagash is found - in the hands of Settra the Imperishable himself! Arkhan audibly rattles with outrage. How to wrest it from the false king's grasp? He must contrive the most subtle and cunning of plans... as his mind embraces the problem, a course of action presents itself. He will need the assistance of those members of the Mortuary Cult who remain loyal to him... and the very gods themselves. \n\n As he enters the small, incense-wreathed temple of his loyal Mortuary Cultists, Arkhan requests that they construct him a powerful artefact. Silently, he knows they hunger for Canopic Jars to fuel their dark studies, and will gladly work to ensure that more flow their way. When the donkey sees the carrot, it will comply...

localised_description.last_approved_text: With his Liche Priests suitably pliant, the second phase of Arkhan's plan may commence. It is somewhat more ambitious: to gain the favour of Tahoth, the ibis-headed God of Knowledge, and plead his assistance with the search. But what manner of feat will turn a god's head? Tapping the Realm of Souls to enliven a great Construct may just do it. Arkhan sets his most capable Liche Priest to a dual task: bring life to stone, while beseeching Tahoth for an audience.

missions.localised_description: With his Liche Priests suitably pliant, the second phase of Arkhan's plan may commence. It is somewhat more ambitious: to gain the favour of Tahoth, the ibis-headed God of Knowledge, and plead his assistance with the search. But what manner of feat will turn a god's head? Tapping the Realm of Souls to enliven a great Construct may just do it. Arkhan sets his most capable Liche Priest to a dual task: bring life to stone, while beseeching Tahoth for an audience.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With a subsonic grind of marble on sandstone, the mighty Warsphinx raises its leonine head: the beast is quickened. The loyal Liche Priest then shudders violently, his eyelids fluttering in deep agitation. As he stills, the eyes snap open to fix Arkhan with an ageless, scholarly gaze, and an ancient voice issues from his lips "I am here. Who entreats Tahoth, Lord of the Wise?"\n\nElated, Arkhan addresses the god. "It is I, Lord, your servant Arkhan! I ask a boon - I must locate the staff of my master." Tahoth tilts the Priest's head with a painful-sounding rasp of sinew. "Its journey is known to us," the god tells Arkhan. "I grant my knowledge to this vessel. Let it act as your guide. May your quarry serve you well." And with that, the audience is over. Tahoth departs, and the Liche Priest collapses.

missions.localised_description: With a subsonic grind of marble on sandstone, the mighty Warsphinx raises its leonine head: the beast is quickened. The loyal Liche Priest then shudders violently, his eyelids fluttering in deep agitation. As he stills, the eyes snap open to fix Arkhan with an ageless, scholarly gaze, and an ancient voice issues from his lips "I am here. Who entreats Tahoth, Lord of the Wise?"\n\nElated, Arkhan addresses the god. "It is I, Lord, your servant Arkhan! I ask a boon - I must locate the staff of my master." Tahoth tilts the Priest's head with a painful-sounding rasp of sinew. "Its journey is known to us," the god tells Arkhan. "I grant my knowledge to this vessel. Let it act as your guide. May your quarry serve you well." And with that, the audience is over. Tahoth departs, and the Liche Priest collapses.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Khemrian warrior-king Alcadizaar has dominated Arkhan's thoughts of late. How could he - a mere mortal - resist Nagash's power and slay him? What a resilient soul the man must have had! To bind such a soul into his Tomb Blade, the Liche King reasons, would amplify its power magnificently. But to perform such a rite, Alcadizaar's remains will be required. His tomb lies in a far-distant, cursed city. Arkhan dispatches an agent to scout the area.

missions.localised_description: The Khemrian warrior-king Alcadizaar has dominated Arkhan's thoughts of late. How could he - a mere mortal - resist Nagash's power and slay him? What a resilient soul the man must have had! To bind such a soul into his Tomb Blade, the Liche King reasons, would amplify its power magnificently. But to perform such a rite, Alcadizaar's remains will be required. His tomb lies in a far-distant, cursed city. Arkhan dispatches an agent to scout the area.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As Arkhan and his force approach, his nose wrinkles to a familiar stench... Necromancy! These enterprising reptiles must have uncovered lore pertaining to revivification. Clearly they mean to raise Alcadizaar themselves. But to what purpose? The greater implications are not lost on Arkhan; this band of recalcitrant reptiles must be eradicated, and Alcadizaar's remains recovered. Only then will the Tomb Blade reach its full potential!

missions.localised_description: As Arkhan and his force approach, his nose wrinkles to a familiar stench... Necromancy! These enterprising reptiles must have uncovered lore pertaining to revivification. Clearly they mean to raise Alcadizaar themselves. But to what purpose? The greater implications are not lost on Arkhan; this band of recalcitrant reptiles must be eradicated, and Alcadizaar's remains recovered. Only then will the Tomb Blade reach its full potential!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Rite performed, the Pits of Zardok are indicated as a suitable site for the liturgy. Khatep orders a living human specimen captured and caged, that he might practice the liturgy without risk to mighty Settra. The time has come to test its value!

missions.localised_description: The Rite performed, the Pits of Zardok are indicated as a suitable site for the liturgy. Khatep orders a living human specimen captured and caged, that he might practice the liturgy without risk to mighty Settra. The time has come to test its value!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The golden age is long past but Settra, in his infinite pride, will see it born anew. As a symbol of intent, he demands a statue be raised in his image, one worthy of the greatest ruler that has ever walked the earth. It must be an effigy of pure magnificence. Settra issues his orders. Only the finest materials may be used in its construction - Ka-Sabar marble, Tilean gold, and black opals from the Sylvanias. Anything less will arouse his severest displeasure.

missions.localised_description: The golden age is long past but Settra, in his infinite pride, will see it born anew. As a symbol of intent, he demands a statue be raised in his image, one worthy of the greatest ruler that has ever walked the earth. It must be an effigy of pure magnificence. Settra issues his orders. Only the finest materials may be used in its construction - Ka-Sabar marble, Tilean gold, and black opals from the Sylvanias. Anything less will arouse his severest displeasure.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The materials having been secured, a design for the statue is presented. It is a stunning, 200-foot likeness of the king in his youth, raising aloft the Blessed Blade of Ptra. He experiences a rare flash of pleasure, which swiftly turns to rage. His blade! Ensconced still in its reliquary, that none might grasp it while he slept. It must be returned. But first, fresh labourers must be raised for the statue's completion. Settra demands nothing less than a massacre.

missions.localised_description: The materials having been secured, a design for the statue is presented. It is a stunning, 200-foot likeness of the king in his youth, raising aloft the Blessed Blade of Ptra. He experiences a rare flash of pleasure, which swiftly turns to rage. His blade! Ensconced still in its reliquary, that none might grasp it while he slept. It must be returned. But first, fresh labourers must be raised for the statue's completion. Settra demands nothing less than a massacre.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The time has come for Settra to retrieve the Blessed Blade of Ptra, and wield his birthright once more in the reformation of Nehekhara. Drawing close to the blade's resting-place in the Charnel Valley, Settra's scouts report activity. A glory-hunting alliance of Dwarfs and men is here in force and approaching the reliquary! The fires of fury are stoked within Settra's withered heart. Larcenous dogs! They dare to defile this place! Settra will send a mighty tribute to the Realm of Souls this day!

missions.localised_description: The time has come for Settra to retrieve the Blessed Blade of Ptra, and wield his birthright once more in the reformation of Nehekhara. Drawing close to the blade's resting-place in the Charnel Valley, Settra's scouts report activity. A glory-hunting alliance of Dwarfs and men is here in force and approaching the reliquary! The fires of fury are stoked within Settra's withered heart. Larcenous dogs! They dare to defile this place! Settra will send a mighty tribute to the Realm of Souls this day!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Settra surveys the world around him and finds it wanting. All will submit to his rule; all will serve the Imperishable. The time has come for Settra to regain his crown – spirited away by tomb-defiling Northmen as he slept away the ages. The King of Kings will see his birthright returned! \n\nThe lands of the Northmen are far distant though, and a significant journey will be required. But first, wood must be hewn, timbers sealed, and a fleet constructed. Settra must put the Necrotects to work and construct a port capable of rebuilding his royal barge.

missions.localised_description: Settra surveys the world around him and finds it wanting. All will submit to his rule; all will serve the Imperishable. The time has come for Settra to regain his crown – spirited away by tomb-defiling Northmen as he slept away the ages. The King of Kings will see his birthright returned! \n\nThe lands of the Northmen are far distant though, and a significant journey will be required. But first, wood must be hewn, timbers sealed, and a fleet constructed. Settra must put the Necrotects to work and construct a port capable of rebuilding his royal barge.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Settra's agents bring him word of a place in the north where petty natives have risen above their station, their power bought with ancient treasures of Nehekharan origin. He has witnessed the rise and fall of empires, and senses this is no mere coincidence. A force must be deployed at once to obtain hostages and divine the location of the Crown of Nehekhara. \n\nRaids must be ordered, with a single aim: seize those who know the whereabouts of Nehekharan relics. Slay the rest.

missions.localised_description: Settra's agents bring him word of a place in the north where petty natives have risen above their station, their power bought with ancient treasures of Nehekharan origin. He has witnessed the rise and fall of empires, and senses this is no mere coincidence. A force must be deployed at once to obtain hostages and divine the location of the Crown of Nehekhara. \n\nRaids must be ordered, with a single aim: seize those who know the whereabouts of Nehekharan relics. Slay the rest.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Deep in the Ice Tooth Mountain, a Norscan host lurks in wait. Their leader knows he harbours a relic of great significance, even if he does not glean its origin. In due course, he will know the truth and its terrible price. The king will not be denied a second time. Today, Settra will regain his crown and exact his bloody vengeance!

missions.localised_description: Deep in the Ice Tooth Mountain, a Norscan host lurks in wait. Their leader knows he harbours a relic of great significance, even if he does not glean its origin. In due course, he will know the truth and its terrible price. The king will not be denied a second time. Today, Settra will regain his crown and exact his bloody vengeance!

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Since the Army of the Seven Kings, you and your followers have despised the Tomb Kings. They are the jealous weaklings who destroyed Nehekhara rather than let our master dominate all. And now one of those spiteful kings thinks to challenge you. Decimate his legions!"

missions.localised_description: "Since the Army of the Seven Kings, you and your followers have despised the Tomb Kings. They are the jealous weaklings who destroyed Nehekhara rather than let our master dominate all. And now one of those spiteful kings thinks to challenge you. Decimate his legions!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Asaph demands, your highness. You must strike at your enemies and those that threaten far Lybaras! Hunt them down."

missions.localised_description: "Asaph demands, your highness. You must strike at your enemies and those that threaten far Lybaras! Hunt them down."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Sire, it is time to raise the legions. The more books you gather, the more they will require protection. The lore within such tomes is beyond any value."

missions.localised_description: "Sire, it is time to raise the legions. The more books you gather, the more they will require protection. The lore within such tomes is beyond any value."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Your majesty, it is wise to construct certain buildings. Their function will be of use when hunting down your master's remaining books and will ensure success in taking control of the Black Pyramid."

missions.localised_description: "Your majesty, it is wise to construct certain buildings. Their function will be of use when hunting down your master's remaining books and will ensure success in taking control of the Black Pyramid."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "My master, Arkhan, the brethren have need of more Canopic Jars. Such a resource is required if the Mortuary Cult is to be of full use to your plans, Liche King."

missions.localised_description: "My master, Arkhan, the brethren have need of more Canopic Jars. Such a resource is required if the Mortuary Cult is to be of full use to your plans, Liche King."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "My queen, the hunt for the tomes of the Arch-Necromancer must continue. A search of nearby ruins may not produce a book itself, but could put us on the correct path."

missions.localised_description: "My queen, the hunt for the tomes of the Arch-Necromancer must continue. A search of nearby ruins may not produce a book itself, but could put us on the correct path."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Your majesty, curse all your enemies, let the years weigh upon them. But there is one who must be dealt with now - hunt him in battle, King of Liches."

missions.localised_description: "Your majesty, curse all your enemies, let the years weigh upon them. But there is one who must be dealt with now - hunt him in battle, King of Liches."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "An alliance might be of use, sire. If we cannot make all the world dead, then let use the breathers for our own aims. We can then take their bones at a later time."

missions.localised_description: "An alliance might be of use, sire. If we cannot make all the world dead, then let use the breathers for our own aims. We can then take their bones at a later time."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "There is a need for souls, sire. A tithe needs to be paid to the Mortuary Cult. We ask not to enrich ourselves but for the magics we deal in. It is the fastest route to locating all of Nagash's tomes."

missions.localised_description: "There is a need for souls, sire. A tithe needs to be paid to the Mortuary Cult. We ask not to enrich ourselves but for the magics we deal in. It is the fastest route to locating all of Nagash's tomes."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "My Lord, let these mortal fools think we are nothing but dust. Let them come, lure them to your legions… then we shall show them that dust, like sand, can combine into a mighty storm! You are that storm, mighty Khatep!"

missions.localised_description: "My Lord, let these mortal fools think we are nothing but dust. Let them come, lure them to your legions… then we shall show them that dust, like sand, can combine into a mighty storm! You are that storm, mighty Khatep!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Grand Hierophant, the creatures of the army that comes at us have some interesting organs. Harvest them, Liche Lord, for they will make for exotic Canopic Jars and powerful ingredients in an incantation."

missions.localised_description: "Grand Hierophant, the creatures of the army that comes at us have some interesting organs. Harvest them, Liche Lord, for they will make for exotic Canopic Jars and powerful ingredients in an incantation."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "My queen, we must consider reinforcing our stronghold, perhaps with shrines to the desert gods whose voices remain far across the seas. If we call to them, they will send us favour."

missions.localised_description: "My queen, we must consider reinforcing our stronghold, perhaps with shrines to the desert gods whose voices remain far across the seas. If we call to them, they will send us favour."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The dead do not hunger, yet the Carrion must still be fed. That is the way it has always been. Hunt out these foes, for they are weaklings, the gods and their pets will be sated by their destruction."

missions.localised_description: "The dead do not hunger, yet the Carrion must still be fed. That is the way it has always been. Hunt out these foes, for they are weaklings, the gods and their pets will be sated by their destruction."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Sire, mighty Khemrikhara, I pass a message from your herald that the enemy moves. I humbly advise that we intercept them, let them feel the glare of the Great King and the bite of your sword!"

missions.localised_description: "Sire, mighty Khemrikhara, I pass a message from your herald that the enemy moves. I humbly advise that we intercept them, let them feel the glare of the Great King and the bite of your sword!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "I communed with others in my order, sire. We believe the time will soon be upon us, but that moment might leave us vulnerable. Summon Ushabti, these guardians can stand sentinel while we are exposed."

missions.localised_description: "I communed with others in my order, sire. We believe the time will soon be upon us, but that moment might leave us vulnerable. Summon Ushabti, these guardians can stand sentinel while we are exposed."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "My king, o great Settra, our stocks of Canopic jars must be refreshed if we are to perform the deeds requested of you, Great King."

missions.localised_description: "My king, o great Settra, our stocks of Canopic jars must be refreshed if we are to perform the deeds requested of you, Great King."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "All shall bow before the Khemrikhara, but I regret to inform there is one that defies you, Great King. He must be punished!"

missions.localised_description: "All shall bow before the Khemrikhara, but I regret to inform there is one that defies you, Great King. He must be punished!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Your majesty, mighty Settra, it is time to bring about a kingdom to rival one you had when you lived. A new golden age, a kingdom of the dead - all hail, Settra!"

missions.localised_description: "Your majesty, mighty Settra, it is time to bring about a kingdom to rival one you had when you lived. A new golden age, a kingdom of the dead - all hail, Settra!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Your majesty, even in these far flung lands there are legions… lost sentinels of Nehekhara that rode far and wide at the orders of monarchs from generations past. We have the power to find them, my queen."

missions.localised_description: "Your majesty, even in these far flung lands there are legions… lost sentinels of Nehekhara that rode far and wide at the orders of monarchs from generations past. We have the power to find them, my queen."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Mighty Settra, this creature dares mock you. He thinks to disrespect the Great King. While you could send any servant to vanquish this one, I know you, o king, will take much greater pleasure in destroying him in battle yourself."

missions.localised_description: "Mighty Settra, this creature dares mock you. He thinks to disrespect the Great King. While you could send any servant to vanquish this one, I know you, o king, will take much greater pleasure in destroying him in battle yourself."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "As you know, Grand Hierophant, the Canopic Jars are critical to our work within the cult. Our stocks need to be replenished. We must find more, Liche Lord."

missions.localised_description: "As you know, Grand Hierophant, the Canopic Jars are critical to our work within the cult. Our stocks need to be replenished. We must find more, Liche Lord."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The accursed spawn of Neferata are abroad, my queen. They do not deserve a moment to exist. Bring these fell creatures to battle."

missions.localised_description: "The accursed spawn of Neferata are abroad, my queen. They do not deserve a moment to exist. Bring these fell creatures to battle."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The jackal-headed god demands his due. Slay for Djaf; reap the souls, for such a tally will be used to judge your worth when you stand before Usirian."

missions.localised_description: "The jackal-headed god demands his due. Slay for Djaf; reap the souls, for such a tally will be used to judge your worth when you stand before Usirian."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Nehekhara was your master's possession long after many of these bandaged fools were rotting in their crypts. Conquer it in Nagash's name, prepare the lands for the return of the Necromancer!"

missions.localised_description: "Nehekhara was your master's possession long after many of these bandaged fools were rotting in their crypts. Conquer it in Nagash's name, prepare the lands for the return of the Necromancer!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "They slur us, master. These bloody vessels dare cast aspersions upon the Mortuary Cult. There is only one way to answer such an accusation!"

missions.localised_description: "They slur us, master. These bloody vessels dare cast aspersions upon the Mortuary Cult. There is only one way to answer such an accusation!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "We must spread our web of curiosity far and wide, Liche Lord. Send our brethren into the world to capture such lore."

missions.localised_description: "We must spread our web of curiosity far and wide, Liche Lord. Send our brethren into the world to capture such lore."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Sire, the first book is found. Yet, despite it being no business of the local fauna, these living creatures seem alarmed. They will attack - but we should strike first. After all, just like the asp, the best defence is always to attack!"

missions.localised_description: "Sire, the first book is found. Yet, despite it being no business of the local fauna, these living creatures seem alarmed. They will attack - but we should strike first. After all, just like the asp, the best defence is always to attack!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "My liege, may I remind you that the construction of a burial chamber is all-consuming if your legacy is to be prepared. Yes, we are dead, but should we perish our remains must be held in state to ensure a bridge to the Realm of Souls. Commission a Necrotect for its construction at your earliest opportunity."

missions.localised_description: "My liege, may I remind you that the construction of a burial chamber is all-consuming if your legacy is to be prepared. Yes, we are dead, but should we perish our remains must be held in state to ensure a bridge to the Realm of Souls. Commission a Necrotect for its construction at your earliest opportunity."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "To find more of Nagash's books we should look to the lineage of Thutep, the second brother - the true king of Khemri - the one Nagash murdered to take the throne!"

missions.localised_description: "To find more of Nagash's books we should look to the lineage of Thutep, the second brother - the true king of Khemri - the one Nagash murdered to take the throne!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Sire, like hunting jackals with a fresh scent, the other Tomb Kings will surely round on you now a book of Nagash is in your possession. Attack is the best defence! Hunt out the jackals, the weaker kings, for rivals will no longer be rivals if they cease to exist."

missions.localised_description: "Sire, like hunting jackals with a fresh scent, the other Tomb Kings will surely round on you now a book of Nagash is in your possession. Attack is the best defence! Hunt out the jackals, the weaker kings, for rivals will no longer be rivals if they cease to exist."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Your influence… your dominance… over the region must be absolute, sire. Only then can we search for the books without interference from nagging mortals or our own rivals."

missions.localised_description: "Your influence… your dominance… over the region must be absolute, sire. Only then can we search for the books without interference from nagging mortals or our own rivals."

localised_description.last_approved_text: Though exiled by Settra, Grand Hierophant Khatep remains true to his duty as Liche Lord of Khemri. Since then he has scoured the Land of the Dead, seeking a method to restore Nehekhara to its former glory, and thus return to his rightful place in the City of Kings. Now his tireless quest brings him to the New World. Perhaps some clue may lie sequestered in its ancient ruins…

missions.localised_description: Though exiled by Settra, Grand Hierophant Khatep remains true to his duty as Liche Lord of Khemri. Since then he has scoured the Land of the Dead, seeking a method to restore Nehekhara to its former glory, and thus return to his rightful place in the City of Kings. Now his tireless quest brings him to the New World. Perhaps some clue may lie sequestered in its ancient ruins…

localised_description.last_approved_text: Deep beneath the ruins, Khatep finds himself in a maze of bone-strewn catacombs. At its focus he stands door bearing a weeping-eye sigil. Behind it lies a hidden library, the final resting place of some Druchii sorceror. To the Hierophant's shock, the shelves around his bones are stacked with Mortuary Cult tomes! Have the Dark Elves truly been dabbling in the arts of resurrection? This demands further enquiry - Khatep must know more. An ancient map on the crumbling desk marks the location of a city - and a sister library...

missions.localised_description: Deep beneath the ruins, Khatep finds himself in a maze of bone-strewn catacombs. At its focus he stands door bearing a weeping-eye sigil. Behind it lies a hidden library, the final resting place of some Druchii sorceror. To the Hierophant's shock, the shelves around his bones are stacked with Mortuary Cult tomes! Have the Dark Elves truly been dabbling in the arts of resurrection? This demands further enquiry - Khatep must know more. An ancient map on the crumbling desk marks the location of a city - and a sister library...

localised_description.last_approved_text: Khatep enters the great library and scours it for further clues. Among the array of magical texts, bestiaries, and codices, one tome stands out for its more recent binding. Khatep is staggered to find within its pages a new liturgy, capable of binding a soul to a living host. There is some risk to both participants, of course, but could this be the answer? A way to renew Settra - and others besides - to true life? Surely this would restore Khatep's honour and station! Divining an appropriate site for the liturgy will require a powerful expenditure of energy - a Nehekharan Rite should suffice.

missions.localised_description: Khatep enters the great library and scours it for further clues. Among the array of magical texts, bestiaries, and codices, one tome stands out for its more recent binding. Khatep is staggered to find within its pages a new liturgy, capable of binding a soul to a living host. There is some risk to both participants, of course, but could this be the answer? A way to renew Settra - and others besides - to true life? Surely this would restore Khatep's honour and station! Divining an appropriate site for the liturgy will require a powerful expenditure of energy - a Nehekharan Rite should suffice.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Great Vortex falters. It is vulnerable and the Witch King seeks to take advantage - to enter and channel its energies - to wrest the power of Chaos from the Gods themselves! Before Malekith can do this, he must imbue the Circlet of Iron - an ancient band older than the Elves - with an unholy crux.\n\nWhile Malekith knows that a crux is needed before he can enter the Vortex, frustratingly, he lacks knowledge of this arcane boon's location. He must consult an oracle, kept by the sorceresses, and their services do not come cheap, even if you are the Witch King.

missions.localised_description: The Great Vortex falters. It is vulnerable and the Witch King seeks to take advantage - to enter and channel its energies - to wrest the power of Chaos from the Gods themselves! Before Malekith can do this, he must imbue the Circlet of Iron - an ancient band older than the Elves - with an unholy crux.\n\nWhile Malekith knows that a crux is needed before he can enter the Vortex, frustratingly, he lacks knowledge of this arcane boon's location. He must consult an oracle, kept by the sorceresses, and their services do not come cheap, even if you are the Witch King.

localised_description.last_approved_text: “North,” answer the Hags, trying the Witch King’s patience, for the northern borders of Naggaroth are vast. He demands a more specific location with a threat that Ghrond will burn if a satisfactory answer is not given. The Death Hags look unmoved - they know that Ghrond is Morathi’s city, and that her son would not risk her wrath. Perhaps they do not know the Witch King?

missions.localised_description: “North,” answer the Hags, trying the Witch King’s patience, for the northern borders of Naggaroth are vast. He demands a more specific location with a threat that Ghrond will burn if a satisfactory answer is not given. The Death Hags look unmoved - they know that Ghrond is Morathi’s city, and that her son would not risk her wrath. Perhaps they do not know the Witch King?

localised_description.last_approved_text: Following a display of Malekith’s temper, the Death Hags are suddenly more forthcoming. Malekith must indeed travel northwards, to the Altar of Ultimate Darkness - a shrine of pure Chaos. The power residing within the altar must be absorbed by the Circlet of Iron, before it can, ironically, be used against the Chaos Gods should Malekith step into the Vortex and take dominion.

missions.localised_description: Following a display of Malekith’s temper, the Death Hags are suddenly more forthcoming. Malekith must indeed travel northwards, to the Altar of Ultimate Darkness - a shrine of pure Chaos. The power residing within the altar must be absorbed by the Circlet of Iron, before it can, ironically, be used against the Chaos Gods should Malekith step into the Vortex and take dominion.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Destroyer was forged by the Witch King himself, as a symbol of his determination to rid the world of High Elven kin. The touch of the Destroyer is especially potent against mages. It is a momentous piece of weapon-smithing and yet it has never been blessed by the Elven Maker-God, Vaul.\n\nMalekith considers it a great insult that the god has not deigned to heap praise upon him for his great work. The Witch King, while brooding about this, decides to salve his mood with an outing…

missions.localised_description: Destroyer was forged by the Witch King himself, as a symbol of his determination to rid the world of High Elven kin. The touch of the Destroyer is especially potent against mages. It is a momentous piece of weapon-smithing and yet it has never been blessed by the Elven Maker-God, Vaul.\n\nMalekith considers it a great insult that the god has not deigned to heap praise upon him for his great work. The Witch King, while brooding about this, decides to salve his mood with an outing…

localised_description.last_approved_text: The raids prove a vague distraction, as do the screams of the slaves, but with the Vortex swirling out of control, Malekith cannot afford such time ruminating. He decides to tackle Vaul’s snub head on; If the god will not come to him, then he shall force matters. To start with, Destroyer will need to be slaked in much blood.

missions.localised_description: The raids prove a vague distraction, as do the screams of the slaves, but with the Vortex swirling out of control, Malekith cannot afford such time ruminating. He decides to tackle Vaul’s snub head on; If the god will not come to him, then he shall force matters. To start with, Destroyer will need to be slaked in much blood.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Vaul’s Anvil is a volcano within which lies the shrine of the Elven Smith-God. It is the most sacred of sites, and now the Witch King has it in his sights. With Destroyer in hand, he marches relentlessly upon Ulthuan’s shores, to the tip of the Dragon Spine Peninsula and into the volcano itself. As expected, the High Elf guardians are waiting within.

missions.localised_description: Vaul’s Anvil is a volcano within which lies the shrine of the Elven Smith-God. It is the most sacred of sites, and now the Witch King has it in his sights. With Destroyer in hand, he marches relentlessly upon Ulthuan’s shores, to the tip of the Dragon Spine Peninsula and into the volcano itself. As expected, the High Elf guardians are waiting within.

localised_description.last_approved_text: "A wise move, Sire. Do not let the vermin get any tail-hold on sovereign Druchii lands. Continue the purge and secure the whole region."\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "As a daughter of Ghrond, I know what trouble it has caused you in the past, my king. And now with Morathi absent, they stray further from your yoke. My contacts in the city tell me they have their own plans for the scrolls we seek. Direct action is required."\n\nLearn more about ritual resource sites [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_resource_sites]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_resource_sites}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text:
"You are right, sire. Act quickly, and flush the infestation from the ruins. Do not let the ratmen take what they seek. Capture their filthy nests!"

Skaven inhabit their Underworld, making their settlements indistinguishable from ruins until approached.

Learn more about the Skaven Underworld [[url:script_link_campaign_skaven_underworld]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_skaven_underworld}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "I shall not tutor you, sire, on how to run your kingdom - you have been ruling for longer than I have existed. Yet... I will venture that Hag Graef could be a stronger ally than outright enemy at this stage. Perhaps offer their lords a chair closer to yours at the obsidian table? A non-aggression pact is a good start..."\n\nLearn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_non_aggression_pacts}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Quell this rebellion, for you are the Witch King! Restore public order."\n\nLearn more about public order [[url:script_link_campaign_public_order]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_public_order}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_title.last_approved_text: Who Dares Defy the Witch King?

missions.localised_title: Who Dares Defy the Witch King?

localised_description.last_approved_text: "You cannot do this alone, sire. Demand that the black-armoured ranks of Naggaroth muster. Raise another army, and give it to your most ‘loyal’ Dreadlord to command."\n\nLearn more about raising armies [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_forces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_raising_forces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

And keep an eye for other ‘rogue armies’ in the campaign to come."\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

If I may suggest, send some expendable wretches to search them."\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_treasure_hunting]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_treasure_hunting}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Fostering trade relations will strengthen your support further in The Dark Crag, seek a trade agreement."\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreements [[url:script_link_campaign_trade]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_trade}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Sire, the race to dominate the Vortex will be a long one. While I seek to fill the goblet with lifeforce, I beseech you prepare the infrastructure of the kingdom to make this endeavour more efficient. It is time to upgrade."\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Momentum gathers. Druchii flock to your banners. Betrayal is inevitable if you do not rule with a strong hand, for now take advantage of your growing following and expand your settlements."\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Betrayal is inevitable if you do not rule with a strong hand, for now take advantage of your growing following and expand your settlements."\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text:
The Witch King has been without his Spellshield for a few centuries after losing it in the southern lands whilst fighting the reptiles over tablets of lost lore. While its loss bothers Malekith, it doesn't trouble him greatly, for he is the owner of countless arcane artefacts.

However, now it has been found – well, according to the Dreadlord, Strenious Kingslayer, it has. He brazenly enters the Black Council’s chamber and approaches the obsidian table – where the Witch King sits with his most loyal advisors – proclaiming that he knows the Supreme Spellshield’s whereabouts and will share it for a price. In the chamber sit a hundred Lords, none of whom can remember such an audacious attempt to provoke the Witch King; many see Strenious’ life lasting only seconds more!

Yet Malekith does not unleash his legendary rage. Instead, he sits back upon his chair and simply asks how much the Dreadlord wants...

missions.localised_description:
The Witch King has been without his Spellshield for a few centuries after losing it in the southern lands whilst fighting the reptiles over tablets of lost lore. While its loss bothers Malekith, it doesn't trouble him greatly, for he is the owner of countless arcane artefacts.

However, now it has been found – well, according to the Dreadlord, Strenious Kingslayer, it has. He brazenly enters the Black Council’s chamber and approaches the obsidian table – where the Witch King sits with his most loyal advisors – proclaiming that he knows the Supreme Spellshield’s whereabouts and will share it for a price. In the chamber sit a hundred Lords, none of whom can remember such an audacious attempt to provoke the Witch King; many see Strenious’ life lasting only seconds more!

Yet Malekith does not unleash his legendary rage. Instead, he sits back upon his chair and simply asks how much the Dreadlord wants...

localised_description.last_approved_text: Malekith sets about raising a force to accompany this Captain Kingslayer to Lustria. He keeps Strenious close, and even shares the odd jest. Maybe the Witch King is impressed by this Dreadlord’s gall? It makes a refreshing change to all the usual schemes and secret plots, and so is the talk of Naggarond.

missions.localised_description: Malekith sets about raising a force to accompany this Captain Kingslayer to Lustria. He keeps Strenious close, and even shares the odd jest. Maybe the Witch King is impressed by this Dreadlord’s gall? It makes a refreshing change to all the usual schemes and secret plots, and so is the talk of Naggarond.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Strenious Kingslayer leads the Witch King to Lustria. There, on board his Black Ark, as it is moored off the savage coast, he reveals that deep in the Mosquito Swamps the Witch King’s shield can be found, hanging as a trophy from the palanquin of a Slann Mage-Priest. Malekith makes a great show of thanking the Captain, and pays him then and there. As Strenious smiles upon the wealth he’s suddenly accumulated, the Witch King grabs the captain by the throat and casually throws him over the side of the great vessel. His fortune follows him into the sea, for Malekith cares not for riches, it is power he has always craved.\n\nStrenious’ crew do not bat an eyelid at their master’s sudden death, but quickly make themselves busy when the Witch King orders his army disembarked for an expedition to retrieve the lost shield.

missions.localised_description: Strenious Kingslayer leads the Witch King to Lustria. There, on board his Black Ark, as it is moored off the savage coast, he reveals that deep in the Mosquito Swamps the Witch King’s shield can be found, hanging as a trophy from the palanquin of a Slann Mage-Priest. Malekith makes a great show of thanking the Captain, and pays him then and there. As Strenious smiles upon the wealth he’s suddenly accumulated, the Witch King grabs the captain by the throat and casually throws him over the side of the great vessel. His fortune follows him into the sea, for Malekith cares not for riches, it is power he has always craved.\n\nStrenious’ crew do not bat an eyelid at their master’s sudden death, but quickly make themselves busy when the Witch King orders his army disembarked for an expedition to retrieve the lost shield.

localised_description.last_approved_text: "I question your competence, my Queen - you let traitors run rampant! These are sovereign Druchii lands not for the likes of conspirators and turncoats. Continue the purge and secure the whole region."\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "I question your competence, my Queen - you let traitors run rampant! These are sovereign Druchii lands not for the likes of conspirators and turncoats. Continue the purge and secure the whole region."\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Oh dear, you seem to be having trouble? Despite your involvement in our creation, you can’t help but make enemies of our kin can you? Clar Karond defy us, we need the scrolls they are hoard. Take their shrine."\n\nLearn more about ritual resource sites [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_resource_sites]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_resource_sites}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Take their shrine."\n\nLearn more about ritual resource sites [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_resource_sites]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_resource_sites}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "I notice you let traitors steal what we need. I wonder, does your son know how you reign over such incompetence? I would remedy this situation quickly. Flush the cravens from the ruins. Capture their hideouts!”\n\nLearn more about settlements [[url:script_link_campaign_settlements]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_settlements}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Good. But the task is not yet complete. localised_description.last_approved_text: "Surely these traitors have crossed you for the last time? Kill every last one of them."\n\nLearn more about factions [[url:script_link_campaign_factions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_factions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "You control the entire province. All within now obey Morathi. How quaint. Now, issue a commandment - let’s see just how loyal they are!"\n\nLearn more about commandments [[url:script_link_campaign_commandments]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_commandments}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "It is time, sorceress. Enact the Ritual of the Tortured Oracle!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Your thrall awaits their first mission. Make it challenging..."\n\nLearn more about heroic actions [[url:script_link_campaign_hero_actions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_hero_actions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "There are agents and factors that wish to petition your favour. Ensure they have a place to assemble so we can weed out potential vassals... and traitors."\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "We have the location for the vassals to congregate. Now it is time to summon these ‘heroes’ to serve."\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Now it is time to summon these ‘heroes’ to serve."\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "How does someone like you, make allies? Me, Hellebron, Clar Karond... you certainly know how to make enemies. But now you must seek allies. These Druchii respect the Hag Sorceress. Use this, and offer a non-aggression pact."\n\nLearn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_non_aggression_pacts}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

These Druchii respect the Hag Sorceress. Use this, and offer a non-aggression pact."\n\nLearn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_non_aggression_pacts}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Now, sister of Ghrond, raise another army, and put it under command of one of your seduced puppets. You will need many warriors if we are to put your son in the Vortex..."\n\nLearn more about raising armies [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_forces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_raising_forces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

You will need many warriors if we are to put your son in the Vortex..."\n\nLearn more about raising armies [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_forces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_raising_forces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "How adorable. These mortal fools have strayed far. They do not answer to their Emperor. Deal with them quickly, my queen, or else they could become a thorn in your side, and that would be dreadful."\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Deal with them quickly, my queen, or else they could become a thorn in your side, and that would be dreadful."\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The ritual is all but prepared, but you frustrate my plans, my queen. If you want your son to win this race to the Vortex, then you must furnish me with the scrolls of Hekarti that will power the ritual. I suggest searching the ruins. Send some expendable minion to seek them... or you could even go yourself."\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_treasure_hunting]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_treasure_hunting}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "The ritual is all but prepared, but you frustrate my plans, my queen. If you want your son to win this race to the Vortex, then you must furnish me with the scrolls of Hekarti that will power the ritual. I suggest searching the ruins. Send some expendable minion to seek them... or you could even go yourself."\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_treasure_hunting]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_treasure_hunting}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Gain their trust, sister. Foster trade - it will enrich you, make your economy stronger. Seek a trade agreement with these Druchii."\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreements [[url:script_link_campaign_trade]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_trade}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "Gain their trust, sister. Foster trade - it will enrich you, make your economy stronger. Seek a trade agreement with these Druchii."\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreements [[url:script_link_campaign_trade]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_trade}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Momentum gathers. Druchii flock to your banners. Betrayal is inevitable if you do not rule with a strong hand, for now take advantage of your growing following and expand your settlements."\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "Momentum gathers. Druchii flock to your banners. Betrayal is inevitable if you do not rule with a strong hand, for now take advantage of your growing following and expand your settlements."\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: Morathi, mother of the Witch King, Hag Sorceress of Ghrond. More than any other, she is responsible for the Druchii; for splitting the greatest of all races in twain. It is a claim few have made directly to her face, but one she would not deny - and would actually revel in - before flaying the skin off the accuser, of course.\n\nThe instruments of such torture would be her paired weapons; the spear, Heartrender and sister blade, the Darksword. These were gifts from her son. But relations between mother and child have soured of late, with the Witch King banishing her from his sight. And so, in a fit of pique, she puts her paired weapons aside to focus on inflicting misery upon any who cross her path.

missions.localised_description: Morathi, mother of the Witch King, Hag Sorceress of Ghrond. More than any other, she is responsible for the Druchii; for splitting the greatest of all races in twain. It is a claim few have made directly to her face, but one she would not deny - and would actually revel in - before flaying the skin off the accuser, of course.\n\nThe instruments of such torture would be her paired weapons; the spear, Heartrender and sister blade, the Darksword. These were gifts from her son. But relations between mother and child have soured of late, with the Witch King banishing her from his sight. And so, in a fit of pique, she puts her paired weapons aside to focus on inflicting misery upon any who cross her path.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The raiding has proved a useful respite for the Hag Sorceress, there are many slaves to torture and souls to claim. And yet the six-armed Goddess, Hekarti, is as thirsty as Khaine. Morathi must recruit more of her kin if she is to continue this journey out from the under the shadow of her son’s dominion.

missions.localised_description: The raiding has proved a useful respite for the Hag Sorceress, there are many slaves to torture and souls to claim. And yet the six-armed Goddess, Hekarti, is as thirsty as Khaine. Morathi must recruit more of her kin if she is to continue this journey out from the under the shadow of her son’s dominion.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With a force worthy of Ghrond, Morathi rides forth in search of even more victims. She cares not whether these are the insufferable reptiles that lurk in the south, more puppets of her son, or even the filthy vermin that have been spotted more and more of late. Of course, the greatest prizes are the Asur - their souls always taste the sweetest!

missions.localised_description: With a force worthy of Ghrond, Morathi rides forth in search of even more victims. She cares not whether these are the insufferable reptiles that lurk in the south, more puppets of her son, or even the filthy vermin that have been spotted more and more of late. Of course, the greatest prizes are the Asur - their souls always taste the sweetest!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Morathi’s sojourn has proved restorative, if rudderless. Although she would not admit it - and should anyone suggest it, they would be first on the skin-flensing table - this has been about getting the attention of Malekith, proving to the Witch King what a powerful and indispensable force she is. But alas her achievements are of little consequence, and her son’s gaze remains fixed on the failing Vortex…\n\nAt least, that is what she wants her enemies to believe, for Morathi is intelligent and cunning. Let Hellebron and Felicion believe that she unleashes a trail of destruction as nothing more than a temper tantrum; the Hag Sorceress has a far worthier target in her sights. But first she will need captives and plenty of them, for preparations must be made before she can bring her dark arts to bear.

missions.localised_description: Morathi’s sojourn has proved restorative, if rudderless. Although she would not admit it - and should anyone suggest it, they would be first on the skin-flensing table - this has been about getting the attention of Malekith, proving to the Witch King what a powerful and indispensable force she is. But alas her achievements are of little consequence, and her son’s gaze remains fixed on the failing Vortex…\n\nAt least, that is what she wants her enemies to believe, for Morathi is intelligent and cunning. Let Hellebron and Felicion believe that she unleashes a trail of destruction as nothing more than a temper tantrum; the Hag Sorceress has a far worthier target in her sights. But first she will need captives and plenty of them, for preparations must be made before she can bring her dark arts to bear.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The rites have been spoken and the seals of Hoeth broken; it is time for Morathi to conduct a ritual of her current patron, Hekarti. And with it shall come the power she needs to seek out her true target - a sanctuary of her hated kin. And when that is taken, her son and her enemies will surely notice her!

missions.localised_description: The rites have been spoken and the seals of Hoeth broken; it is time for Morathi to conduct a ritual of her current patron, Hekarti. And with it shall come the power she needs to seek out her true target - a sanctuary of her hated kin. And when that is taken, her son and her enemies will surely notice her!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The High Elf colony of Arnheim has no right to be on the Black Coast, and yet it has proved a stubborn canker to remove. However, Morathi, banished to the southern part of Naggarond by her son, and weaving a trail of destruction ever since, now has it in sight. If she can destroy Arnheim, she hopes to return to the Witch King’s good graces and once again take up Heartrender and the Darksword, gifts from her beloved, if temperamental son.

missions.localised_description: The High Elf colony of Arnheim has no right to be on the Black Coast, and yet it has proved a stubborn canker to remove. However, Morathi, banished to the southern part of Naggarond by her son, and weaving a trail of destruction ever since, now has it in sight. If she can destroy Arnheim, she hopes to return to the Witch King’s good graces and once again take up Heartrender and the Darksword, gifts from her beloved, if temperamental son.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The accursed demands to aid Skavenblight have left your resources depleted and your position weak. Raiding the enemy will furnish what you require, and keep your minions busy enough to prevent them plotting against you.

missions.localised_description: The accursed demands to aid Skavenblight have left your resources depleted and your position weak. Raiding the enemy will furnish what you require, and keep your minions busy enough to prevent them plotting against you.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Great Vortex falters. It is vulnerable and the Witch King seeks to take advantage - to enter and channel its energies - to wrest the power of Chaos from the Gods themselves! Before Malekith can do this, he must imbue the Circlet of Iron - an ancient band older than the Elves - with an unholy crux.\n\nWhile Malekith knows that a crux is needed before he can enter the Vortex, frustratingly, he lacks knowledge of this arcane boon's location. He must consult an oracle, kept by the Sorceresses, and their services do not come cheap, even if you are the Witch King.

missions.localised_description: The Great Vortex falters. It is vulnerable and the Witch King seeks to take advantage - to enter and channel its energies - to wrest the power of Chaos from the Gods themselves! Before Malekith can do this, he must imbue the Circlet of Iron - an ancient band older than the Elves - with an unholy crux.\n\nWhile Malekith knows that a crux is needed before he can enter the Vortex, frustratingly, he lacks knowledge of this arcane boon's location. He must consult an oracle, kept by the Sorceresses, and their services do not come cheap, even if you are the Witch King.

localised_description.last_approved_text: “North,” answer the Hags, trying the Witch King’s patience, for the northern borders of Naggaroth are vast. He demands a more specific location with a threat that Ghrond will burn if a satisfactory answer is not given. The Death Hags look unmoved - they know that Ghrond is Morathi’s city, and that her son would not risk her wrath. Perhaps they do not know the Witch King?

missions.localised_description: “North,” answer the Hags, trying the Witch King’s patience, for the northern borders of Naggaroth are vast. He demands a more specific location with a threat that Ghrond will burn if a satisfactory answer is not given. The Death Hags look unmoved - they know that Ghrond is Morathi’s city, and that her son would not risk her wrath. Perhaps they do not know the Witch King?

localised_description.last_approved_text: Following a display of Malekith’s temper, the Death Hags are suddenly more forthcoming. Malekith must indeed travel northwards, to the Altar of Ultimate Darkness - a shrine of pure Chaos. The power residing within the altar must be absorbed by the Circlet of Iron, before it can, ironically, be used against the Chaos Gods should Malekith step into the Vortex and take dominion.

missions.localised_description: Following a display of Malekith’s temper, the Death Hags are suddenly more forthcoming. Malekith must indeed travel northwards, to the Altar of Ultimate Darkness - a shrine of pure Chaos. The power residing within the altar must be absorbed by the Circlet of Iron, before it can, ironically, be used against the Chaos Gods should Malekith step into the Vortex and take dominion.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Destroyer was forged by the Witch King himself, as a symbol of his determination to rid the world of High Elven kin. The touch of the Destroyer is especially potent against mages. It is a momentous piece of weapon-smithing and yet it has never been blessed by the Elven Maker-God, Vaul.\n\nMalekith considers it a great insult that the god has not deigned to heap praise upon him for his great work. The Witch King, while brooding about this, decides to salve his mood with an outing…

missions.localised_description: Destroyer was forged by the Witch King himself, as a symbol of his determination to rid the world of High Elven kin. The touch of the Destroyer is especially potent against mages. It is a momentous piece of weapon-smithing and yet it has never been blessed by the Elven Maker-God, Vaul.\n\nMalekith considers it a great insult that the god has not deigned to heap praise upon him for his great work. The Witch King, while brooding about this, decides to salve his mood with an outing…

localised_description.last_approved_text: The raids prove a vague distraction, as do the screams of the slaves, but with the Vortex swirling out of control, Malekith cannot afford such time ruminating. He decides to tackle Vaul’s snub head on; If the god will not come to him, then he shall force matters. To start with, Destroyer will need to be slaked in much blood.

missions.localised_description: The raids prove a vague distraction, as do the screams of the slaves, but with the Vortex swirling out of control, Malekith cannot afford such time ruminating. He decides to tackle Vaul’s snub head on; If the god will not come to him, then he shall force matters. To start with, Destroyer will need to be slaked in much blood.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Vaul’s Anvil is a volcano within which lies the shrine of the Elven Smith-God. It is the most sacred of sites, and now the Witch King has it in his sights. With Destroyer in hand, he marches relentlessly upon Ulthuan’s shores, to the tip of the Dragon Spine Peninsula and into the volcano itself. As expected, the High Elf guardians are waiting within.

missions.localised_description: Vaul’s Anvil is a volcano within which lies the shrine of the Elven Smith-God. It is the most sacred of sites, and now the Witch King has it in his sights. With Destroyer in hand, he marches relentlessly upon Ulthuan’s shores, to the tip of the Dragon Spine Peninsula and into the volcano itself. As expected, the High Elf guardians are waiting within.

localised_description.last_approved_text:
The Witch King has been without his Spellshield for a few centuries after losing it in the southern lands whilst fighting the reptiles over tablets of lost lore. While its loss bothers Malekith, it doesn't trouble him greatly, for he is the owner of countless arcane artefacts.

However, now it has been found – well, according to the Dreadlord, Strenious Kingslayer, it has. He brazenly enters the Black Council’s chamber and approaches the obsidian table – where the Witch King sits with his most loyal advisors – proclaiming that he knows the Supreme Spellshield’s whereabouts and will share it for a price. In the chamber sit a hundred Lords, none of whom can remember such an audacious attempt to provoke the Witch King; many see Strenious’ life lasting only seconds more!

Yet Malekith does not unleash his legendary rage. Instead, he sits back upon his chair and simply asks how much the Dreadlord wants...

missions.localised_description:
The Witch King has been without his Spellshield for a few centuries after losing it in the southern lands whilst fighting the reptiles over tablets of lost lore. While its loss bothers Malekith, it doesn't trouble him greatly, for he is the owner of countless arcane artefacts.

However, now it has been found – well, according to the Dreadlord, Strenious Kingslayer, it has. He brazenly enters the Black Council’s chamber and approaches the obsidian table – where the Witch King sits with his most loyal advisors – proclaiming that he knows the Supreme Spellshield’s whereabouts and will share it for a price. In the chamber sit a hundred Lords, none of whom can remember such an audacious attempt to provoke the Witch King; many see Strenious’ life lasting only seconds more!

Yet Malekith does not unleash his legendary rage. Instead, he sits back upon his chair and simply asks how much the Dreadlord wants...

localised_description.last_approved_text: Malekith sets about raising a force to accompany this Captain Kingslayer to Lustria. He keeps Strenious close, and even shares the odd jest. Maybe the Witch King is impressed by this Dreadlord’s gall? It makes a refreshing change to all the usual schemes and secret plots, and so is the talk of Naggarond.

Maybe the Witch King is impressed by this Dreadlord’s gall? It makes a refreshing change to all the usual schemes and secret plots, and so is the talk of Naggarond.
