His fortune follows him into the sea, for Malekith cares not for riches, it is power he has always craved.\n\nStrenious’ crew do not bat an eyelid at their master’s sudden death, but quickly make themselves busy when the Witch King orders his army disembarked for an expedition to retrieve the lost shield.

missions.localised_description: Strenious Kingslayer leads the Witch King to Lustria. There, on board his Black Ark, as it is moored off the savage coast, he reveals that deep in the Mosquito Swamps the Witch King’s shield can be found, hanging as a trophy from the palanquin of a Slann Mage-Priest. Malekith makes a great show of thanking the Captain, and pays him then and there. As Strenious smiles upon the wealth he’s suddenly accumulated, the Witch King grabs the captain by the throat and casually throws him over the side of the great vessel. His fortune follows him into the sea, for Malekith cares not for riches, it is power he has always craved.\n\nStrenious’ crew do not bat an eyelid at their master’s sudden death, but quickly make themselves busy when the Witch King orders his army disembarked for an expedition to retrieve the lost shield.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Morathi, mother of the Witch King, Hag Sorceress of Ghrond. More than any other, she is responsible for the Druchii; for splitting the greatest of all races in twain. It is a claim few have made directly to her face, but one she would not deny - and would actually revel in - before flaying the skin off the accuser, of course.\n\nThe instruments of such torture would be her paired weapons; the spear, Heartrender and sister blade, the Darksword. These were gifts from her son. But relations between mother and child have soured of late, with the Witch King banishing her from his sight. And so, in a fit of pique, she puts her paired weapons aside to focus on inflicting misery upon any who cross her path.

missions.localised_description: Morathi, mother of the Witch King, Hag Sorceress of Ghrond. More than any other, she is responsible for the Druchii; for splitting the greatest of all races in twain. It is a claim few have made directly to her face, but one she would not deny - and would actually revel in - before flaying the skin off the accuser, of course.\n\nThe instruments of such torture would be her paired weapons; the spear, Heartrender and sister blade, the Darksword. These were gifts from her son. But relations between mother and child have soured of late, with the Witch King banishing her from his sight. And so, in a fit of pique, she puts her paired weapons aside to focus on inflicting misery upon any who cross her path.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The raiding has proved a useful respite for the Hag Sorceress, there are many slaves to torture and souls to claim. And yet the six-armed goddess, Hekarti, is as thirsty as Khaine. Morathi must recruit more of her kin if she is to continue this journey out from the under the shadow of her son’s dominion.

missions.localised_description: The raiding has proved a useful respite for the Hag Sorceress, there are many slaves to torture and souls to claim. And yet the six-armed goddess, Hekarti, is as thirsty as Khaine. Morathi must recruit more of her kin if she is to continue this journey out from the under the shadow of her son’s dominion.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With a force worthy of Ghrond, Morathi rides forth in search of even more victims. She cares not whether these are the insufferable reptiles that lurk in the south, more puppets of her son, or even the filthy vermin that have been spotted more and more of late. Of course, the greatest prizes are the Asur - their souls always taste the sweetest!

missions.localised_description: With a force worthy of Ghrond, Morathi rides forth in search of even more victims. She cares not whether these are the insufferable reptiles that lurk in the south, more puppets of her son, or even the filthy vermin that have been spotted more and more of late. Of course, the greatest prizes are the Asur - their souls always taste the sweetest!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Morathi’s sojourn has proved restorative, if rudderless. Although she would not admit it - and should anyone suggest it, they would be first on the skin-flensing table - this has been about getting the attention of Malekith, proving to the Witch King what a powerful and indispensable force she is. But alas her achievements are of little consequence, and her son’s gaze remains fixed on the failing Vortex…\n\nAt least, that is what she wants her enemies to believe, for Morathi is intelligent and cunning. Let Hellebron and Felicion believe that she unleashes a trail of destruction as nothing more than a temper tantrum; the Hag Sorceress has a far worthier target in her sights. But first she will need captives and plenty of them, for preparations must be made before she can bring her dark arts to bear.

missions.localised_description: Morathi’s sojourn has proved restorative, if rudderless. Although she would not admit it - and should anyone suggest it, they would be first on the skin-flensing table - this has been about getting the attention of Malekith, proving to the Witch King what a powerful and indispensable force she is. But alas her achievements are of little consequence, and her son’s gaze remains fixed on the failing Vortex…\n\nAt least, that is what she wants her enemies to believe, for Morathi is intelligent and cunning. Let Hellebron and Felicion believe that she unleashes a trail of destruction as nothing more than a temper tantrum; the Hag Sorceress has a far worthier target in her sights. But first she will need captives and plenty of them, for preparations must be made before she can bring her dark arts to bear.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The rites have been spoken and the seals of Hoeth broken; it is time for Morathi to conduct a ritual of her current patron, Hekarti. And with it shall come the power she needs to seek out her true target - a sanctuary of her hated kin. And when that is taken, her son and her enemies will surely notice her!

missions.localised_description: The rites have been spoken and the seals of Hoeth broken; it is time for Morathi to conduct a ritual of her current patron, Hekarti. And with it shall come the power she needs to seek out her true target - a sanctuary of her hated kin. And when that is taken, her son and her enemies will surely notice her!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The High Elf colony of Arnheim has no right to be on the Black Coast, and yet it has proved a stubborn canker to remove. However, Morathi, banished to the southern part of Naggarond by her son, and weaving a trail of destruction ever since, now has it in sight. If she can destroy Arnheim, she hopes to return to the Witch King’s good graces and once again take up Heartrender and the Darksword, gifts from her beloved, if temperamental son.

missions.localised_description: The High Elf colony of Arnheim has no right to be on the Black Coast, and yet it has proved a stubborn canker to remove. However, Morathi, banished to the southern part of Naggarond by her son, and weaving a trail of destruction ever since, now has it in sight. If she can destroy Arnheim, she hopes to return to the Witch King’s good graces and once again take up Heartrender and the Darksword, gifts from her beloved, if temperamental son.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As the two moons rise into the Lustrian sky, Teclis is touched by a troubling dream. No mere nightmare, this is a vision sent by Lileath warning of peril back on Ulthuan. The Witch King strides upon the Elven homeland once more, and he is not even contained within Anlec. Events surrounding the Great Vortex seem to be happening even faster than Loremaster Talarian could have predicted.\n\nTeclis knows that the search of way-fragments must continue, but he cannot ignore the Witch King on Ulthuan, and so makes preparations for an early return.

missions.localised_description: As the two moons rise into the Lustrian sky, Teclis is touched by a troubling dream. No mere nightmare, this is a vision sent by Lileath warning of peril back on Ulthuan. The Witch King strides upon the Elven homeland once more, and he is not even contained within Anlec. Events surrounding the Great Vortex seem to be happening even faster than Loremaster Talarian could have predicted.\n\nTeclis knows that the search of way-fragments must continue, but he cannot ignore the Witch King on Ulthuan, and so makes preparations for an early return.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Another night and another troubled dream sent by the Goddess Lileath. Communication with the gods is never precise but it seems that she is concerned for Vaul, the Maker-God. The Witch King invades Vaul's shrine in Caledor, upon Ulthuan itself. There the dark king spits spiteful hexes, as he besieges the enraged volcano in which Vaul's Anvil sits. If not stopped, it is only a matter of time before he claims it, weakening the Asur's connection with the gods of the Cadai.\n\nTeclis must raise a host and travel to the Dragon Spine as fast as he is able.

missions.localised_description: Another night and another troubled dream sent by the Goddess Lileath. Communication with the gods is never precise but it seems that she is concerned for Vaul, the Maker-God. The Witch King invades Vaul's shrine in Caledor, upon Ulthuan itself. There the dark king spits spiteful hexes, as he besieges the enraged volcano in which Vaul's Anvil sits. If not stopped, it is only a matter of time before he claims it, weakening the Asur's connection with the gods of the Cadai.\n\nTeclis must raise a host and travel to the Dragon Spine as fast as he is able.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Witch King has attacked Vaul’s Anvil, desperate to break in and cause untold mischief upon the works of the Maker-God. Through arcane skill, Teclis' force arrives to defend the shrine before the Witch-king's sorceresses cast a fell net of magic over the area, cutting it off from the rest of Ulthuan. Teclis knows Malekith must be stopped. He unsheathes his sword - a weapon forged by himself that has been quiet of late. But now it glows with power enthused by the blessing of Vaul, by battle's end it will be a formidable blade once more.

missions.localised_description: The Witch King has attacked Vaul’s Anvil, desperate to break in and cause untold mischief upon the works of the Maker-God. Through arcane skill, Teclis' force arrives to defend the shrine before the Witch-king's sorceresses cast a fell net of magic over the area, cutting it off from the rest of Ulthuan. Teclis knows Malekith must be stopped. He unsheathes his sword - a weapon forged by himself that has been quiet of late. But now it glows with power enthused by the blessing of Vaul, by battle's end it will be a formidable blade once more.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The War Crown is seldom seen outside the walls of the White Tower. Even Teclis himself wears it only in times of great need, so he sets off to Lustria without it. However, it quickly becomes apparent that circumstances are direr than even the High Loremaster realised, and so he sends for the crown. A pair of Great Eagles are dispatched from Saphery with the crown securely held their claws. An epic journey follows, crossing the Great Ocean and then the continent itself.\n\n Perhaps it was inevitable, on a flight that long, that the Eagles would not reach Teclis. Something has gone wrong - the crown and its winged escort are lost. An artefact of such power and reverence cannot be allowed to simply vanish. Teclis knows of a ritual of Isha that should be invoked, for a mother always knows where her children lie, and the War Crown is of Isha's making.

missions.localised_description: The War Crown is seldom seen outside the walls of the White Tower. Even Teclis himself wears it only in times of great need, so he sets off to Lustria without it. However, it quickly becomes apparent that circumstances are direr than even the High Loremaster realised, and so he sends for the crown. A pair of Great Eagles are dispatched from Saphery with the crown securely held their claws. An epic journey follows, crossing the Great Ocean and then the continent itself.\n\n Perhaps it was inevitable, on a flight that long, that the Eagles would not reach Teclis. Something has gone wrong - the crown and its winged escort are lost. An artefact of such power and reverence cannot be allowed to simply vanish. Teclis knows of a ritual of Isha that should be invoked, for a mother always knows where her children lie, and the War Crown is of Isha's making.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The ritual grants Teclis knowledge, but not the whole answer. He knows that the Eagles were brought down deliberately, somewhere over the Spine of Sotek. Yet that mountain chain is vast; Isha’s influence will have to be cast across Lustria for the Crown to quickly make itself known.

missions.localised_description: The ritual grants Teclis knowledge, but not the whole answer. He knows that the Eagles were brought down deliberately, somewhere over the Spine of Sotek. Yet that mountain chain is vast; Isha’s influence will have to be cast across Lustria for the Crown to quickly make itself known.

localised_description.last_approved_text:
The location is revealed. Isha’s light guides Teclis and his Sapherian host to a dark, dank cavern in the north of mountain chain. On entering the cave, the High Elves are assaulted by a unholy stench. Some turn their noses up and even consider returning to the surface, but Teclis gives them a stern look and bids they advance further into the depths.

A piercing scream echoes through the cavern; the master of the lair is in residence! Bones drop from the ceiling to come crashing amidst the High Elven host. The carcasses of two Eagles litter the cavern floor. Teclis looks up to see the hunter that ripped them from the sky - a gigantic Undead bat…

But even this beast does not seem to be alone, for in the shadows, scuttling all around the periphery of the cave, the Elves hear mocking chitters!

missions.localised_description:
The location is revealed. Isha’s light guides Teclis and his Sapherian host to a dark, dank cavern in the north of mountain chain. On entering the cave, the High Elves are assaulted by a unholy stench. Some turn their noses up and even consider returning to the surface, but Teclis gives them a stern look and bids they advance further into the depths.

A piercing scream echoes through the cavern; the master of the lair is in residence! Bones drop from the ceiling to come crashing amidst the High Elven host. The carcasses of two Eagles litter the cavern floor. Teclis looks up to see the hunter that ripped them from the sky - a gigantic Undead bat…

But even this beast does not seem to be alone, for in the shadows, scuttling all around the periphery of the cave, the Elves hear mocking chitters!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Ever since the two-tailed Dragon was seen burning across the sky the world has become even more of an uncertain place. The Vortex grows more unstable, and the enemies of the Asur seek to take advantage. Unsurprisingly, it is the Druchii that are most aggressive. Reports of coastal raids are flooding into Lothern and even that the Witch King is now abroad. Fear spreads that Dark Elves land upon Ulthuan and are trying inveigle themselves into the populace - ready to pounce upon neighbours when bidden by Malekith.\n\nFinubar calls his unofficial war council of which Tyrion is the central pillar. The king asks that his generals issue proclamations, and send military presences across the regions to calm his subjects. A difficult task in this climate of unease.

missions.localised_description: Ever since the two-tailed Dragon was seen burning across the sky the world has become even more of an uncertain place. The Vortex grows more unstable, and the enemies of the Asur seek to take advantage. Unsurprisingly, it is the Druchii that are most aggressive. Reports of coastal raids are flooding into Lothern and even that the Witch King is now abroad. Fear spreads that Dark Elves land upon Ulthuan and are trying inveigle themselves into the populace - ready to pounce upon neighbours when bidden by Malekith.\n\nFinubar calls his unofficial war council of which Tyrion is the central pillar. The king asks that his generals issue proclamations, and send military presences across the regions to calm his subjects. A difficult task in this climate of unease.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Ulthuan’s residents remain on edge. Tyrion’s presence is a small comfort, but the Asur have always been highly attuned to the magical eddies that assail the world. And all - from Swordmaster to poet to humble cordwainer - feel the doom encroach as the Vortex fails.\n\nAmidst this unease, the rumours of Dark Elves hidden amongst the populace persists, and that an assassination attempt on the Phoenix King and his foremast champions is imminent. It is fortunate that the world’s best bodyguards reside on Ulthuan - in Chrace to be specific.

missions.localised_description: Ulthuan’s residents remain on edge. Tyrion’s presence is a small comfort, but the Asur have always been highly attuned to the magical eddies that assail the world. And all - from Swordmaster to poet to humble cordwainer - feel the doom encroach as the Vortex fails.\n\nAmidst this unease, the rumours of Dark Elves hidden amongst the populace persists, and that an assassination attempt on the Phoenix King and his foremast champions is imminent. It is fortunate that the world’s best bodyguards reside on Ulthuan - in Chrace to be specific.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Now is the time for Tyrion to prove worthy of the title ‘Defender’. After sowing disquiet across the inner and outer kingdoms, the enemy finally makes its move; however, Tyrion is there to strike back! With the Everqueen’s blessing, he rides forth, to bring ruin on the trespassers. Unfortunately the Dragon Armour of Aenarion is damaged in the onslaught. A lucky strike perhaps? Or something more contrived? In any event, the armour must be returned to where it was forged for repair.

missions.localised_description: Now is the time for Tyrion to prove worthy of the title ‘Defender’. After sowing disquiet across the inner and outer kingdoms, the enemy finally makes its move; however, Tyrion is there to strike back! With the Everqueen’s blessing, he rides forth, to bring ruin on the trespassers. Unfortunately the Dragon Armour of Aenarion is damaged in the onslaught. A lucky strike perhaps? Or something more contrived? In any event, the armour must be returned to where it was forged for repair.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Tyrion returns the Dragon Armour to Vaul’s Anvil, where it was first created. While Tyrion impatiently waits within while Vaul's smiths reknit the armour, he is called to the shrine’s entrance. Druchii gather! They certainly knew of Tyrion’s whereabouts, perhaps the armour’s failing was a trap after all? Tyrion prepares his host for war; he will face the hated foe without his usual protection, although he does not need it, for he is Ulthuan’s Defender!

missions.localised_description: Tyrion returns the Dragon Armour to Vaul’s Anvil, where it was first created. While Tyrion impatiently waits within while Vaul's smiths reknit the armour, he is called to the shrine’s entrance. Druchii gather! They certainly knew of Tyrion’s whereabouts, perhaps the armour’s failing was a trap after all? Tyrion prepares his host for war; he will face the hated foe without his usual protection, although he does not need it, for he is Ulthuan’s Defender!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Tyrion, son of Arathion, is the greatest warrior in Ulthuan - some say the greatest warrior to have ever lived upon the Elven island. For an Elf, he is a being of simple tastes, and a rare straight-talker who despises dressing up his words in needless confections and double-meanings - unlike the princes that frequent the court of the Phoenix Throne.\n\nIn Tyrion’s mind it is these dandy fools that will be their race’s undoing; while they prance about court furthering their own agendas, the Vortex struggles, and invasion is imminent. Tyrion quits the court in disgust and goes about mustering a force to repel the inevitable.

missions.localised_description: Tyrion, son of Arathion, is the greatest warrior in Ulthuan - some say the greatest warrior to have ever lived upon the Elven island. For an Elf, he is a being of simple tastes, and a rare straight-talker who despises dressing up his words in needless confections and double-meanings - unlike the princes that frequent the court of the Phoenix Throne.\n\nIn Tyrion’s mind it is these dandy fools that will be their race’s undoing; while they prance about court furthering their own agendas, the Vortex struggles, and invasion is imminent. Tyrion quits the court in disgust and goes about mustering a force to repel the inevitable.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Elven lust for intrigue can be insatiable… and often self-destructive. A certain cohort of princes, envious of Tyrion’s influence over King Finubar, seeks to exploit the situation of the failing Vortex and Teclis’ sudden departure to Lustria for his own gain. The jealous princes utter a poisonous rumour in court and let's their race's proclivity for scandal do the rest... \n\nTyrion’s pride burns as deeply as any Dwarf’s, and that can make him predictable. The veiled insult eats at Tyrion - the claim that he is only so renowned because of the sword he wields has him cast it aside to prove it is not so. Yet such rumours have a tendency to grow like a spider's web, catching larger flies. Soon the talk of the courts is that Tyrion is no campaigner. While those in battle may fear the Defender of Ulthuan - on grander strategies, such as depriving the foe of hideaways or destroying enemy supply routes, Tyrion is clueless - or so the rumours asserted. Tyrion could ignore such bunkum, but his pride prevents him. He shall prove the naysayers wrong!

missions.localised_description: The Elven lust for intrigue can be insatiable… and often self-destructive. A certain cohort of princes, envious of Tyrion’s influence over King Finubar, seeks to exploit the situation of the failing Vortex and Teclis’ sudden departure to Lustria for his own gain. The jealous princes utter a poisonous rumour in court and let's their race's proclivity for scandal do the rest... \n\nTyrion’s pride burns as deeply as any Dwarf’s, and that can make him predictable. The veiled insult eats at Tyrion - the claim that he is only so renowned because of the sword he wields has him cast it aside to prove it is not so. Yet such rumours have a tendency to grow like a spider's web, catching larger flies. Soon the talk of the courts is that Tyrion is no campaigner. While those in battle may fear the Defender of Ulthuan - on grander strategies, such as depriving the foe of hideaways or destroying enemy supply routes, Tyrion is clueless - or so the rumours asserted. Tyrion could ignore such bunkum, but his pride prevents him. He shall prove the naysayers wrong!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Tyrion has proven himself more than a mere warrior, but a capable general and leader of the Asur! Back in court, the conniving princes hide their victorious smiles, Tyrion has played into their hands. The princes whisper to others that the so-called Defender of Ulthuan has grown out of control, that he should be ostracised from Finubar’s warrior council. They say this all while sipping the finest wine from silver chalices, and secretly agree to reconvene in Saphery.\n\nOf course, even as these nobles bask in their self-congratulatory hubris, they forget that while Tyrion is no politician he is certainly no puppet either. It will soon be time to teach these fools a lesson in manners and he will not need Sunfang to do so!

missions.localised_description: Tyrion has proven himself more than a mere warrior, but a capable general and leader of the Asur! Back in court, the conniving princes hide their victorious smiles, Tyrion has played into their hands. The princes whisper to others that the so-called Defender of Ulthuan has grown out of control, that he should be ostracised from Finubar’s warrior council. They say this all while sipping the finest wine from silver chalices, and secretly agree to reconvene in Saphery.\n\nOf course, even as these nobles bask in their self-congratulatory hubris, they forget that while Tyrion is no politician he is certainly no puppet either. It will soon be time to teach these fools a lesson in manners and he will not need Sunfang to do so!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The conspiracy is traced to Saphery, where the princes' lies have spread to the Loremasters. While Tyrion simply tries to hunt down and face his accusers, he finds an aggressive battle line in the lee of the White Tower, for the mages of Hoeth have ever been Teclis' people. The princes would have that Tyrion’s recent actions prove that he is not the honourable Defender of Ulthuan but a Druchii sympathiser - a weakness of his lineage! Battle is inevitable...

missions.localised_description: The conspiracy is traced to Saphery, where the princes' lies have spread to the Loremasters. While Tyrion simply tries to hunt down and face his accusers, he finds an aggressive battle line in the lee of the White Tower, for the mages of Hoeth have ever been Teclis' people. The princes would have that Tyrion’s recent actions prove that he is not the honourable Defender of Ulthuan but a Druchii sympathiser - a weakness of his lineage! Battle is inevitable...

localised_description.last_approved_text: Kroq-Gar is ancient - a Saurus that has spent his existence fighting the myriad enemies of the Lizardmen. Such a long life has seen him, on occasion, fall into conflict with rival Slann whose interpretation of the Great Plan differs from his own. Nevertheless, when a summons comes from Lord Mazdamundi, the oldest and most powerful of all living Mage-Priests, Kroq-Gar is duty-bound to answer.\n\nThe command from Mazdamundi is weak, no doubt a result of the Great Warding’s disintegration, which in turn is due to the fading Vortex on the High Elf Isle of Ulthuan. The ancient Saurus decides that a Skink must tap into the Geomantic Web directly, to clarify Mazdamundi’s directive.

missions.localised_description: Kroq-Gar is ancient - a Saurus that has spent his existence fighting the myriad enemies of the Lizardmen. Such a long life has seen him, on occasion, fall into conflict with rival Slann whose interpretation of the Great Plan differs from his own. Nevertheless, when a summons comes from Lord Mazdamundi, the oldest and most powerful of all living Mage-Priests, Kroq-Gar is duty-bound to answer.\n\nThe command from Mazdamundi is weak, no doubt a result of the Great Warding’s disintegration, which in turn is due to the fading Vortex on the High Elf Isle of Ulthuan. The ancient Saurus decides that a Skink must tap into the Geomantic Web directly, to clarify Mazdamundi’s directive.

localised_description.last_approved_text:
Lord Mazdamundi wishes to grant Kroq-Gar use of a revered artefact, the Hand of the Gods. Kroq-Gar’s service to Lizard-kind is beyond counting, yet the Saurus must still prove himself worthy of the mantle and ensure his own thoughts align with Mazdamundi’s xenophobic interpretation of the Great Plan.

A few leagues from the Hexoatl, the City of the Sun, Elven servants of Ulthuan interfere with the Fallen Gates - an ancient portal of the Old Ones. Their intention may be honourable, but they cannot be allowed to tamper with mechanisms far beyond their limited understanding. The Asur must be stopped before their meddling summons something far more dangerous.

Kroq-Gar stands ready, but Mazdamundi counsels that a larger cohort is needed to face the Elves.

missions.localised_description:
Lord Mazdamundi wishes to grant Kroq-Gar use of a revered artefact, the Hand of the Gods. Kroq-Gar’s service to Lizard-kind is beyond counting, yet the Saurus must still prove himself worthy of the mantle and ensure his own thoughts align with Mazdamundi’s xenophobic interpretation of the Great Plan.

A few leagues from the Hexoatl, the City of the Sun, Elven servants of Ulthuan interfere with the Fallen Gates - an ancient portal of the Old Ones. Their intention may be honourable, but they cannot be allowed to tamper with mechanisms far beyond their limited understanding. The Asur must be stopped before their meddling summons something far more dangerous.

Kroq-Gar stands ready, but Mazdamundi counsels that a larger cohort is needed to face the Elves.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Fallen Gates are a cosmic device of the Old Ones, a stellar bridge that once reached across the stars to who-knows-where. Even the Slann Mage-Priests do not pretend to know its ancient inner workings, so the High Elves' meddling is a great trespass. There is no time for communication, no time for diplomacy, a swift punishment is needed to prevent disaster!

Even the Slann Mage-Priests do not pretend to know its ancient inner workings, so the High Elves' meddling is a great trespass. There is no time for communication, no time for diplomacy, a swift punishment is needed to prevent disaster!

Even the Slann Mage-Priests do not pretend to know its ancient inner workings, so the High Elves' meddling is a great trespass. There is no time for communication, no time for diplomacy, a swift punishment is needed to prevent disaster!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Revered Spear of Tlanxla was once a great weapon of an Old One deity, which could reportedly cut down mortals as swiftly as an Ogre biting through a ratman’s skull. Kroq-Gar has been honoured to wield the spear for hundreds of years, slaying countless warmblood invaders. However, since the forked-tongue comet of Sotek was seen in the heavens, the spear’s power has waned. At the Last Defender’s behest, Skink arbitrators look for a method to restore it, proffering that a mighty tribute to Tlanxla would be a good place to start.

missions.localised_description: The Revered Spear of Tlanxla was once a great weapon of an Old One deity, which could reportedly cut down mortals as swiftly as an Ogre biting through a ratman’s skull. Kroq-Gar has been honoured to wield the spear for hundreds of years, slaying countless warmblood invaders. However, since the forked-tongue comet of Sotek was seen in the heavens, the spear’s power has waned. At the Last Defender’s behest, Skink arbitrators look for a method to restore it, proffering that a mighty tribute to Tlanxla would be a good place to start.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The answer to the loss of power in Kroq-Gar's spear, it seems, is simple. Tlanxla was a god that thrived on sacrifice and so the spear must be bathed in the blood of many enemies. To a seasoned warrior such as Kroq-Gar, this makes perfect sense; the harvest should be reaped immediately!

missions.localised_description: The answer to the loss of power in Kroq-Gar's spear, it seems, is simple. Tlanxla was a god that thrived on sacrifice and so the spear must be bathed in the blood of many enemies. To a seasoned warrior such as Kroq-Gar, this makes perfect sense; the harvest should be reaped immediately!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The blood of many has been spilled and with it comes a message whispered to the ancient Saurus through a waking vision. Within the Well of Time is a fissure of power that spans the barrier of eons. It has opened up and Tlanxla reaches through, ready to touch his spear and reignite the lost force within.\n\nKroq-Gar must make haste across the Mosquito Swamps to the Well of Time to return the spear to its maker. However, Dark Elves have been drawn to the temporal power spilling from a fissure deep within the well - the Druchii invaders must be dealt with before the spear can be re-charged!

missions.localised_description: The blood of many has been spilled and with it comes a message whispered to the ancient Saurus through a waking vision. Within the Well of Time is a fissure of power that spans the barrier of eons. It has opened up and Tlanxla reaches through, ready to touch his spear and reignite the lost force within.\n\nKroq-Gar must make haste across the Mosquito Swamps to the Well of Time to return the spear to its maker. However, Dark Elves have been drawn to the temporal power spilling from a fissure deep within the well - the Druchii invaders must be dealt with before the spear can be re-charged!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Great Vortex of the High Elves is under attack. For millennia, the Asur have arrogantly believed it is their magic that has sustained the Vortex. While they may have put the arcane foundations in place, it is the Great Warding of the Slann - a massive undertaking that keeps most Mage-Priests dormant, such is the concentration needed - that has kept the Vortex functioning.\n\nHowever, since the comet, the Great Warding suffers. Lord Mazdamundi, always the most licentious of Slann, has set about rectifying this by removing the taint of the warmbloods from his realm.

missions.localised_description: The Great Vortex of the High Elves is under attack. For millennia, the Asur have arrogantly believed it is their magic that has sustained the Vortex. While they may have put the arcane foundations in place, it is the Great Warding of the Slann - a massive undertaking that keeps most Mage-Priests dormant, such is the concentration needed - that has kept the Vortex functioning.\n\nHowever, since the comet, the Great Warding suffers. Lord Mazdamundi, always the most licentious of Slann, has set about rectifying this by removing the taint of the warmbloods from his realm.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The purge goes well, yet warmbloods still dare to desecrate Lustria or is it a Slann Mage-Priest whose interpretations of the Great Plan are heretical? In either case, the interlopers cannot be allowed to live! In Mazdamundi’s anger, he reaches for the Cobra Mace, his own personal relic, and realises for the first time since his awakening that it is not on his bloated person!\n\nOne of his Skink attendants reminds the Slann that the mace was left at the sacred Isle of the Crimson Skull to be recharged amidst its red minerals, which are found nowhere else in the Old World. Mazdamundi orders that they collect the relic, but only after the enemy settlement is taken or destroyed.

missions.localised_description: The purge goes well, yet warmbloods still dare to desecrate Lustria or is it a Slann Mage-Priest whose interpretations of the Great Plan are heretical? In either case, the interlopers cannot be allowed to live! In Mazdamundi’s anger, he reaches for the Cobra Mace, his own personal relic, and realises for the first time since his awakening that it is not on his bloated person!\n\nOne of his Skink attendants reminds the Slann that the mace was left at the sacred Isle of the Crimson Skull to be recharged amidst its red minerals, which are found nowhere else in the Old World. Mazdamundi orders that they collect the relic, but only after the enemy settlement is taken or destroyed.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With his realm purged, Lord Mazdamundi makes haste for the Isle of the Crimson Skull to collect the Cobra Mace, for he will need it during his labours to come. They arrive upon the beach to see that the foulest of all warmbloods, the Skaven, have scoured the island, attracted by the crimson rocks. It may not be Warpstone, but even so, the ratmen recognise the value it holds.\n\nLord Mazdamundi is outraged and immediately orders their utter extinction!

missions.localised_description: With his realm purged, Lord Mazdamundi makes haste for the Isle of the Crimson Skull to collect the Cobra Mace, for he will need it during his labours to come. They arrive upon the beach to see that the foulest of all warmbloods, the Skaven, have scoured the island, attracted by the crimson rocks. It may not be Warpstone, but even so, the ratmen recognise the value it holds.\n\nLord Mazdamundi is outraged and immediately orders their utter extinction!

localised_description.last_approved_text: It was Chotec, Lord of the Sun, who ignited the closest star and warmed the world, or so claims an ancient plaque discovered by Lord Mazdamundi. However, the plaque was found incomplete; fragments of the text remain lost.\n\nAs with any Old One, Chotec's legacy is an important part of the Great Plan and so should be reclaimed if possible. Mazdamundi orders cohorts of Skinks to begin raids of the local area to hunt for the lost part of the plaque, if riches can also be secured to fund the search, then all the better.

missions.localised_description: It was Chotec, Lord of the Sun, who ignited the closest star and warmed the world, or so claims an ancient plaque discovered by Lord Mazdamundi. However, the plaque was found incomplete; fragments of the text remain lost.\n\nAs with any Old One, Chotec's legacy is an important part of the Great Plan and so should be reclaimed if possible. Mazdamundi orders cohorts of Skinks to begin raids of the local area to hunt for the lost part of the plaque, if riches can also be secured to fund the search, then all the better.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A fragment of the lost plaque is found and hurried into Mazdamundi’s hands. The Slann Mage-Priest studies and learns that Chotec was an Old One whose temper was as fierce as the fire he controlled - as hot as the sun itself! Of all the Slann, Mazdamundi is the fiercest, with a temper just like Chotec.\n\nOn Mazdamundi’s orders, the Skink attendants prepare the way for fire and fury as he begins the chants to initiate the Ritual of Ferocity.

missions.localised_description: A fragment of the lost plaque is found and hurried into Mazdamundi’s hands. The Slann Mage-Priest studies and learns that Chotec was an Old One whose temper was as fierce as the fire he controlled - as hot as the sun itself! Of all the Slann, Mazdamundi is the fiercest, with a temper just like Chotec.\n\nOn Mazdamundi’s orders, the Skink attendants prepare the way for fire and fury as he begins the chants to initiate the Ritual of Ferocity.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The ritual is set; the essence of Chotec has been summoned, but from whence will it come? The plaque alludes to the next step. It is an act that pleases Mazdamundi greatly, for it aligns with his personal interpretation of the Great Plan. Captives must be sought, their blood not yet spilled - although that will come in time. And when it does, knowledge of the radiance of Chotec shall be revealed.

missions.localised_description: The ritual is set; the essence of Chotec has been summoned, but from whence will it come? The plaque alludes to the next step. It is an act that pleases Mazdamundi greatly, for it aligns with his personal interpretation of the Great Plan. Captives must be sought, their blood not yet spilled - although that will come in time. And when it does, knowledge of the radiance of Chotec shall be revealed.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Of course, where else should the essence of Old One come but through the Fallen Gates? This is an ancient portal - a cosmic bridge across which the Old Ones travelled quickly to the City of the Sun and the rest of Lustria.\n\nUpon arrival at the Fallen Gates, preparations are set; the ancient stellar engines start to fire up, the pylons begin to thrum… And then, Chaos comes. The nemesis of the Old Ones - the ancient enemy - emerges from the jungle, desperate to stop the radiance of an Old One being summoned and imbued within the banner of the Solar-City. Lord Mazdamundi turns from the preparations, ready to defend at all costs.

missions.localised_description: Of course, where else should the essence of Old One come but through the Fallen Gates? This is an ancient portal - a cosmic bridge across which the Old Ones travelled quickly to the City of the Sun and the rest of Lustria.\n\nUpon arrival at the Fallen Gates, preparations are set; the ancient stellar engines start to fire up, the pylons begin to thrum… And then, Chaos comes. The nemesis of the Old Ones - the ancient enemy - emerges from the jungle, desperate to stop the radiance of an Old One being summoned and imbued within the banner of the Solar-City. Lord Mazdamundi turns from the preparations, ready to defend at all costs.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Curses! Dwarf Gouger has been stolen. Queek immediately slays two of his most trusted lieutenants, who were clearly to blame; it is irrelevant that he was the last one in possession of it! Killing his loyal followers is not enough to sate the Headtaker’s rage, so he lashes out at the closest enemies, for they are clearly the thieves… in some way. And deep down in his verminous mind he knows that keeping his horde busy will distract them from his own incompetence in losing one of Clan Mors' most priceless artefacts.

missions.localised_description: Curses! Dwarf Gouger has been stolen. Queek immediately slays two of his most trusted lieutenants, who were clearly to blame; it is irrelevant that he was the last one in possession of it! Killing his loyal followers is not enough to sate the Headtaker’s rage, so he lashes out at the closest enemies, for they are clearly the thieves… in some way. And deep down in his verminous mind he knows that keeping his horde busy will distract them from his own incompetence in losing one of Clan Mors' most priceless artefacts.

localised_description.last_approved_text: In the aftermath of Queek’s real - or maybe false - rage, one of his snivelling minions approaches and concludes that a Clan Eshin assassin was the actual thief. For a moment, Queek is tempted to rip out the messenger’s throat at this news, but realises that if he keeps killing his loyal servants he’ll run out of followers. Instead, Queek settles for a swipe with his claw, sending the inferior flying, before rearing to his full height and demanding the perpetrator must be found. He promotes the servant he has just struck to ‘chief-finder’, giving Queek a convenient scapegoat should the search prove fruitless.

missions.localised_description: In the aftermath of Queek’s real - or maybe false - rage, one of his snivelling minions approaches and concludes that a Clan Eshin assassin was the actual thief. For a moment, Queek is tempted to rip out the messenger’s throat at this news, but realises that if he keeps killing his loyal servants he’ll run out of followers. Instead, Queek settles for a swipe with his claw, sending the inferior flying, before rearing to his full height and demanding the perpetrator must be found. He promotes the servant he has just struck to ‘chief-finder’, giving Queek a convenient scapegoat should the search prove fruitless.

localised_description.last_approved_text:
Queek’s agent returns to his master. He approaches cautiously, sniffing the air to pick up what mood the Headtaker is in. As expected, Queek is impatient but stays his wrath until the ‘chief-finder’ has given his report.

 "Most vengeful of warrior-lords", begins the agent, with tail flat on the floor in a sign of submission. Queek’s whiskers twitch in appreciation at the ego-boosting address, but otherwise he remains silent and still. "The assassin-thief has deliberately fled in Dwarf territory. I suspect a trap."

Queek rises to his full height in triumph.

"I knew it! Beard-things!", he says with glee. He ignores the agent’s meek protestations that he suspects a ruse, for Queek has a battle-lust about him and immediately sends his minions scuttling forth to raise a horde as quickly as possible.

missions.localised_description:
Queek’s agent returns to his master. He approaches cautiously, sniffing the air to pick up what mood the Headtaker is in. As expected, Queek is impatient but stays his wrath until the ‘chief-finder’ has given his report.

 "Most vengeful of warrior-lords", begins the agent, with tail flat on the floor in a sign of submission. Queek’s whiskers twitch in appreciation at the ego-boosting address, but otherwise he remains silent and still. "The assassin-thief has deliberately fled in Dwarf territory. I suspect a trap."

Queek rises to his full height in triumph.

"I knew it! Beard-things!", he says with glee. He ignores the agent’s meek protestations that he suspects a ruse, for Queek has a battle-lust about him and immediately sends his minions scuttling forth to raise a horde as quickly as possible.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A Clan Mors force runs through the Underway with Queek at its head. Already the Warlord can taste the stench of the Dwarf-things on the stale air. His underling - the ‘chief-finder’ - in fear of his life, tries once more to state that it’s a trap. But Queek waves the coward away - after all, he is Queek Headtaker, what could go wrong? A messenger intercepted in an off-shoot tunnel is captured, on his way to report to the Grand Warlord himself - this was nothing but a ruse by Gnawdwell himself to keep Queek on his toes! Headtaker takes the news surprisingly well, as he relishes the opportunity to kill lots of Dwarfs and prove himself to his master!

missions.localised_description: A Clan Mors force runs through the Underway with Queek at its head. Already the Warlord can taste the stench of the Dwarf-things on the stale air. His underling - the ‘chief-finder’ - in fear of his life, tries once more to state that it’s a trap. But Queek waves the coward away - after all, he is Queek Headtaker, what could go wrong? A messenger intercepted in an off-shoot tunnel is captured, on his way to report to the Grand Warlord himself - this was nothing but a ruse by Gnawdwell himself to keep Queek on his toes! Headtaker takes the news surprisingly well, as he relishes the opportunity to kill lots of Dwarfs and prove himself to his master!

localised_description.last_approved_text:
Queek Headtaker is the Right-Claw of Warlord Gnawdwell, the chief enforcer of the utterly powerful Clan Mors. While Queek, of late, has spent much of his time in the City of Pillars, his duties as Gnawdwell’s primary intimidator have seen him scamper and skitterleap across continents.

You’d think a rat so busy and dedicated to Clan Mors’ ascendancy would have no time for some lesser rivals’ petty insults, but this is Queek...

Word has reached the Headtaker that a Warlord from a rival clan is boasting that his armour is better. Most would ignore such a slight, or mark it in their memories for vengeance at a more opportune time, but Queek abandons his current objective and puts all his energy into seeking out the liar!

missions.localised_description:
Queek Headtaker is the Right-Claw of Warlord Gnawdwell, the chief enforcer of the utterly powerful Clan Mors. While Queek, of late, has spent much of his time in the City of Pillars, his duties as Gnawdwell’s primary intimidator have seen him scamper and skitterleap across continents.

You’d think a rat so busy and dedicated to Clan Mors’ ascendancy would have no time for some lesser rivals’ petty insults, but this is Queek...

Word has reached the Headtaker that a Warlord from a rival clan is boasting that his armour is better. Most would ignore such a slight, or mark it in their memories for vengeance at a more opportune time, but Queek abandons his current objective and puts all his energy into seeking out the liar!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Headtaker scours the land in search for the one who dares slight him. It is a wasteful campaign, but none in his circle of advisors dares to question the undertaking, lest they face Queek’s wrath instead. In the aftermath of his search, Queek is confronted by several enemy forces; the Warlord is excited by the prospect of topping up his trophy rack. In his lust for battle, he almost forgets why he started this campaign in the first place!

missions.localised_description: Headtaker scours the land in search for the one who dares slight him. It is a wasteful campaign, but none in his circle of advisors dares to question the undertaking, lest they face Queek’s wrath instead. In the aftermath of his search, Queek is confronted by several enemy forces; the Warlord is excited by the prospect of topping up his trophy rack. In his lust for battle, he almost forgets why he started this campaign in the first place!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Queek ignores the alleged insult, but it seems the boaster isn’t done with him. Once more, taunts reach Headtaker, but this time the more cunning side rather than the wrathful part of Queek emerges. Headtaker determines that he will be the richest rat there is - then no snivelling vermin with shiny, more Warpstone-y armour will dare tell him otherwise!

missions.localised_description: Queek ignores the alleged insult, but it seems the boaster isn’t done with him. Once more, taunts reach Headtaker, but this time the more cunning side rather than the wrathful part of Queek emerges. Headtaker determines that he will be the richest rat there is - then no snivelling vermin with shiny, more Warpstone-y armour will dare tell him otherwise!

localised_description.last_approved_text: No little vermin boaster is better than the Right Paw of Warlord Gnawdwell! Queek's agent reports a sighting of his rival close to nearby ruins. Despite protestations from minions loyal to Clan Mors, Queek orders the area raided – its wealth stolen for Queek… And if the boastful one can be located, then he can be gouged too!

missions.localised_description: No little vermin boaster is better than the Right Paw of Warlord Gnawdwell! Queek's agent reports a sighting of his rival close to nearby ruins. Despite protestations from minions loyal to Clan Mors, Queek orders the area raided – its wealth stolen for Queek… And if the boastful one can be located, then he can be gouged too!

localised_description.last_approved_text: At last, Queek has the rival Clan Warlord cornered! It is fitting that the boaster was found, cowering, underground, deep below ruins that may have been important to some Wizard or other. Queek cares not; what matters is that the two will face off in battle and the shiniest armour will be the Headtaker's own!

missions.localised_description: At last, Queek has the rival Clan Warlord cornered! It is fitting that the boaster was found, cowering, underground, deep below ruins that may have been important to some Wizard or other. Queek cares not; what matters is that the two will face off in battle and the shiniest armour will be the Headtaker's own!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Liber Bubonicus, a rancid tome full of vile lore collected by Pestilens’ Plaguelords, is currently in Skrolk’s possession. In a devious move, his minions led a large expedition from the Old World down into the long abandoned Mortuary of Tzulaqua, via a trail of worthless trinkets leading deep under the ruined pyramid. A few of the greedy fools were lost to ancient traps, but most made it to the sacrificial chamber.\n\nThere, on a simple stone plinth, rested the Liber Bubonicus. If the book was left closed they may have lived, but one of the Man-things opened the Liber Bubonicus and from its pages sprouted a thousand plague-flies. The swarm buzzed, biting, laying eggs, and spreading an awful pox. The ploy worked! The Horned Rat is surely pleased, yet Skrolk is weary and must now recuperate.

missions.localised_description: The Liber Bubonicus, a rancid tome full of vile lore collected by Pestilens’ Plaguelords, is currently in Skrolk’s possession. In a devious move, his minions led a large expedition from the Old World down into the long abandoned Mortuary of Tzulaqua, via a trail of worthless trinkets leading deep under the ruined pyramid. A few of the greedy fools were lost to ancient traps, but most made it to the sacrificial chamber.\n\nThere, on a simple stone plinth, rested the Liber Bubonicus. If the book was left closed they may have lived, but one of the Man-things opened the Liber Bubonicus and from its pages sprouted a thousand plague-flies. The swarm buzzed, biting, laying eggs, and spreading an awful pox. The ploy worked! The Horned Rat is surely pleased, yet Skrolk is weary and must now recuperate.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Skrolk’s cunning trap worked better than even he could perceive, but the cost was high, so he must bathe in filth and corruption to restore himself once more; a ritual should do the job. When ready, he will return to the Mortuary of Tzulaqua and collect the Liber Bubonicus.

missions.localised_description: Skrolk’s cunning trap worked better than even he could perceive, but the cost was high, so he must bathe in filth and corruption to restore himself once more; a ritual should do the job. When ready, he will return to the Mortuary of Tzulaqua and collect the Liber Bubonicus.

localised_description.last_approved_text: On completion of the ritual, Skrolk quickly gathers about him a verminous horde and scampers to the crypt, where his prize surely waits. The pestilent Lord arrives at the dank cave that leads into the crypt. His Plague Monks gnash the air, eager to descend, but he holds them back with a flick of his claw. Cautiously, he sniffs the air; his whiskers twitch. Something is not quite right…

missions.localised_description: On completion of the ritual, Skrolk quickly gathers about him a verminous horde and scampers to the crypt, where his prize surely waits. The pestilent Lord arrives at the dank cave that leads into the crypt. His Plague Monks gnash the air, eager to descend, but he holds them back with a flick of his claw. Cautiously, he sniffs the air; his whiskers twitch. Something is not quite right…

localised_description.last_approved_text: Skrolk’s deadly rod has been at his side for the many decades the Plaguelord has walked the world. It is said that the rod was awarded to Skrolk in the wake of his blindness. When he clawed at his own eyes after bearing witness to Arch-Plaguelord Nurglitch, Skrolk wished no other vision to obscure that glimpse of pestilent perfection.\n\nDespite this, Nurglitch does not brook failure, and remains unimpressed with Skrolk’s performance since the Vortex became vulnerable. Matters are not helped by the Rod of Corruption’s recent inability to cast rust upon metal. Flesh will still slough from bones when struck, but where before metal would oxidise and corrode, it remains gleaming. Skrolk suspects that the recent Vortex activity and his rod’s lack of corruption are linked, but first he must appease the Arch-Plaguelord and bolster Clan Pestilens' forces.

missions.localised_description: Skrolk’s deadly rod has been at his side for the many decades the Plaguelord has walked the world. It is said that the rod was awarded to Skrolk in the wake of his blindness. When he clawed at his own eyes after bearing witness to Arch-Plaguelord Nurglitch, Skrolk wished no other vision to obscure that glimpse of pestilent perfection.\n\nDespite this, Nurglitch does not brook failure, and remains unimpressed with Skrolk’s performance since the Vortex became vulnerable. Matters are not helped by the Rod of Corruption’s recent inability to cast rust upon metal. Flesh will still slough from bones when struck, but where before metal would oxidise and corrode, it remains gleaming. Skrolk suspects that the recent Vortex activity and his rod’s lack of corruption are linked, but first he must appease the Arch-Plaguelord and bolster Clan Pestilens' forces.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The cold-bloods have become the focus of Skrolk’s impotent rage. Back in Skavenblight, Arch-Plaguelord Nurglitch tuts at Skrolk’s performance, but still the Lizardmen must pay the price. But Lord Skrolk is more cunning than most. To outsiders he may seem to be lashing out, but those who know Skrolk know there is method in his fury. The Lizardmen hide knowledge; they have many secrets and one is the power to eat metal. Once he is rid of the reptiles, he will scour their plaques with eyes that cannot see until he finds out how to restore the Rod of Corruption.

missions.localised_description: The cold-bloods have become the focus of Skrolk’s impotent rage. Back in Skavenblight, Arch-Plaguelord Nurglitch tuts at Skrolk’s performance, but still the Lizardmen must pay the price. But Lord Skrolk is more cunning than most. To outsiders he may seem to be lashing out, but those who know Skrolk know there is method in his fury. The Lizardmen hide knowledge; they have many secrets and one is the power to eat metal. Once he is rid of the reptiles, he will scour their plaques with eyes that cannot see until he finds out how to restore the Rod of Corruption.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Lord Skrolk has discovered what the Lizardmen hide and the thing that he seeks - the power to befoul metal and restore the Rod of Corruption. To the north of Lustria lies the Island of the Crimson Skull; it is the Skull itself that Skrolk seeks, as it is made from a unique mineral that can be powdered into a red oxidising material that eats iron and steel. Once spread upon the Rod of Corruption, Skrolk’s weapon will be powerful once again. Then he can return to his grand schemes.\n\nFirst, he must deal with the Council while the Great Vortex remains unstable, but that is what this lick-spittle scribe is for. Let the Council be distracted by this scheme, so Skrolk can plan his ascension to Arch-Plaguelord without interference.

missions.localised_description: Lord Skrolk has discovered what the Lizardmen hide and the thing that he seeks - the power to befoul metal and restore the Rod of Corruption. To the north of Lustria lies the Island of the Crimson Skull; it is the Skull itself that Skrolk seeks, as it is made from a unique mineral that can be powdered into a red oxidising material that eats iron and steel. Once spread upon the Rod of Corruption, Skrolk’s weapon will be powerful once again. Then he can return to his grand schemes.\n\nFirst, he must deal with the Council while the Great Vortex remains unstable, but that is what this lick-spittle scribe is for. Let the Council be distracted by this scheme, so Skrolk can plan his ascension to Arch-Plaguelord without interference.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Beheld by fair Valaya, did the dark-hearted elgi target our honourable throng. Find the cur and its allies. Kill all elgi scum!

missions.localised_description: Beheld by fair Valaya, did the dark-hearted elgi target our honourable throng. Find the cur and its allies. Kill all elgi scum!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Witnessed by an enraged Grimnir, did the so-called Asur come at our beards with dishonourable intent. List the grudge and slay this despicable elgi!

missions.localised_description: Witnessed by an enraged Grimnir, did the so-called Asur come at our beards with dishonourable intent. List the grudge and slay this despicable elgi!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Seen by Thungni, Ancestor God of Runesmiths, the reptile assassin attacked us unprovoked. This creature shames his whole race and must be descaled.

missions.localised_description: Seen by Thungni, Ancestor God of Runesmiths, the reptile assassin attacked us unprovoked. This creature shames his whole race and must be descaled.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Under Grungni's angry gaze, the ratman assassin struck against the proud Dawi in our throng. This thaggoraki needs a grudgin' and fast!

missions.localised_description: Under Grungni's angry gaze, the ratman assassin struck against the proud Dawi in our throng. This thaggoraki needs a grudgin' and fast!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Under Valaya's sorrowful eyes the assassin of the vile elgi came and attacked the proud hero of our clan. This one can measure his life in moments for his grudge is due.

missions.localised_description: Under Valaya's sorrowful eyes the assassin of the vile elgi came and attacked the proud hero of our clan. This one can measure his life in moments for his grudge is due.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Witnessed by Grimnir did the beardless elgi swine attempt to murder a great thane of the clans. Vengeance is demanded at once!

missions.localised_description: Witnessed by Grimnir did the beardless elgi swine attempt to murder a great thane of the clans. Vengeance is demanded at once!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Seen by a disgusted Grungni, the reptiles dared to slither close and attack a mightily-bearded Hero of the clans. That goes in the book, and all lizards will pay the price!

missions.localised_description: Seen by a disgusted Grungni, the reptiles dared to slither close and attack a mightily-bearded Hero of the clans. That goes in the book, and all lizards will pay the price!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Under Grimnir's seething gaze did the 'raki send one of their sneaky bastard assassins to slay a great warrior. We shall see its tail and whiskers plucked from its scrawny body for this!

missions.localised_description: Under Grimnir's seething gaze did the 'raki send one of their sneaky bastard assassins to slay a great warrior. We shall see its tail and whiskers plucked from its scrawny body for this!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Seen by Valaya's own eyes, the vicious elgi attacks our khazids. This saboteur needs bringing to Dawi justice. Ensure that it happens!

missions.localised_description: Seen by Valaya's own eyes, the vicious elgi attacks our khazids. This saboteur needs bringing to Dawi justice. Ensure that it happens!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Beheld by a wrathful Grimnir, this elgi plays a guest while busy sowing destruction as Dawi backs are turned - wanton acts that demand vengeance!

missions.localised_description: Beheld by a wrathful Grimnir, this elgi plays a guest while busy sowing destruction as Dawi backs are turned - wanton acts that demand vengeance!

localised_description.last_approved_text: As seen by Valaya, the Lizardmen of the south have sent a cold-blooded agent to disrupt our homes. Such flagrant trespass will have to be answered in kind.

missions.localised_description: As seen by Valaya, the Lizardmen of the south have sent a cold-blooded agent to disrupt our homes. Such flagrant trespass will have to be answered in kind.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Witnessed by a wrathful Grimnir, the ratmen send their agents up through the Underway - OUR Underway - to cause mischief in the Dwarfholds. Have the creature found and slain.

missions.localised_description: Witnessed by a wrathful Grimnir, the ratmen send their agents up through the Underway - OUR Underway - to cause mischief in the Dwarfholds. Have the creature found and slain.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Looked upon in shame by Grimnir, the cheating elgi curs have brought low our throng. This defeat must be avenged.

missions.localised_description: Looked upon in shame by Grimnir, the cheating elgi curs have brought low our throng. This defeat must be avenged.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Viewed by a deplored Grimnir, the elgi host came and by some quirk of fate or outright cheat, they have defeated us in battle. Log that in the book!

missions.localised_description: Viewed by a deplored Grimnir, the elgi host came and by some quirk of fate or outright cheat, they have defeated us in battle. Log that in the book!

localised_description.last_approved_text: As seen by Grungni, the inscrutable Lizardmen unfairly attacked and defeated our throng - an injustice that must be brought upon these cold-blooded cravens.

missions.localised_description: As seen by Grungni, the inscrutable Lizardmen unfairly attacked and defeated our throng - an injustice that must be brought upon these cold-blooded cravens.

localised_description.last_approved_text: An outrage in Grungni's sight, the filthy, devious ratmen have ambushed honourable Dawi warriors and slain many fine fellows. The most vile of grudges - vengeance is demanded!

missions.localised_description: An outrage in Grungni's sight, the filthy, devious ratmen have ambushed honourable Dawi warriors and slain many fine fellows. The most vile of grudges - vengeance is demanded!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Witnessed by Valaya, the filthy murder-worshipping elgi raid our lands. Stop these thin-skinned wazzocks and settle this grudge.

missions.localised_description: Witnessed by Valaya, the filthy murder-worshipping elgi raid our lands. Stop these thin-skinned wazzocks and settle this grudge.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Under the withering gaze of Valaya, the so-called 'High Elves' raid our lands. The low elgi filth! Mark it in the Dammaz Kron and bring them to justice.

missions.localised_description: Under the withering gaze of Valaya, the so-called 'High Elves' raid our lands. The low elgi filth! Mark it in the Dammaz Kron and bring them to justice.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Under the very eyes of Grimnir did the Lizardmen raid Dwarfen lands. A crime against the Ancestors; revenge is the only answer against these filthy reptiles.

missions.localised_description: Under the very eyes of Grimnir did the Lizardmen raid Dwarfen lands. A crime against the Ancestors; revenge is the only answer against these filthy reptiles.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Seen by an enraged Grungni, the stealing Thaggoraki raid our lands, taking our hard-earned treasures and innocent Dawi lives. Revenge is demanded!

missions.localised_description: Seen by an enraged Grungni, the stealing Thaggoraki raid our lands, taking our hard-earned treasures and innocent Dawi lives. Revenge is demanded!

localised_description.last_approved_text: In view of Valaya, the damnable, dark-hearted goth-loving elgi dare to sack our holds. Have every last one of them found and killed!

missions.localised_description: In view of Valaya, the damnable, dark-hearted goth-loving elgi dare to sack our holds. Have every last one of them found and killed!

localised_description.last_approved_text: In Grungni's deplored sight, the sour-faced elgi sacked a Hold of our kin. These humourless wazzocks need a good spanking!

missions.localised_description: In Grungni's deplored sight, the sour-faced elgi sacked a Hold of our kin. These humourless wazzocks need a good spanking!

localised_description.last_approved_text: In Morgrim's strained sight did the reptiles come and sack our settlements like the cowardly cold-blooded mongrel things they are! It is recorded and so requires action!

missions.localised_description: In Morgrim's strained sight did the reptiles come and sack our settlements like the cowardly cold-blooded mongrel things they are! It is recorded and so requires action!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Seen by a disgusted Grungni, the noisome vermin dare to enter our Holds like the chuf-eating bastards they are. A great crime must be righted - kill the thaggoraki!

missions.localised_description: Seen by a disgusted Grungni, the noisome vermin dare to enter our Holds like the chuf-eating bastards they are. A great crime must be righted - kill the thaggoraki!

localised_description.last_approved_text: In Valaya's very own sight did the Bretonnian chufs dare take our homes and mines. Bring it back into Dwarf hands and curse every umgi for this treacherous act!

missions.localised_description: In Valaya's very own sight did the Bretonnian chufs dare take our homes and mines. Bring it back into Dwarf hands and curse every umgi for this treacherous act!

localised_description.last_approved_text: As witnessed by the Mother of Home and Hearth, the dark-hearted elgi take Dawi settlements for their own. The cravens must pay and the Khazids returned to the Karaz Ankor.

missions.localised_description: As witnessed by the Mother of Home and Hearth, the dark-hearted elgi take Dawi settlements for their own. The cravens must pay and the Khazids returned to the Karaz Ankor.

localised_description.last_approved_text: By Grimnir's stare, the Sigmar-loving umgi dare to take our homes and mountains. Record it in the book and ensure the settlement is returned to the Dawi.

missions.localised_description: By Grimnir's stare, the Sigmar-loving umgi dare to take our homes and mountains. Record it in the book and ensure the settlement is returned to the Dawi.

localised_description.last_approved_text: By Valaya's sight do the elgi come to our realms and take our towns. A curse on these thin folk. Return the stolen settlement to us at once!

missions.localised_description: By Valaya's sight do the elgi come to our realms and take our towns. A curse on these thin folk. Return the stolen settlement to us at once!

localised_description.last_approved_text: As witnessed by Smednir, the Lizardmen have taken our mines and towns. A crime whose coldblooded perpetrators must be punished!

missions.localised_description: As witnessed by Smednir, the Lizardmen have taken our mines and towns. A crime whose coldblooded perpetrators must be punished!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Seen by Grimnir, the Undead dare to ransack and occupy our settlement. A grudge has been recorded, ensure it is settled.

missions.localised_description: Seen by Grimnir, the Undead dare to ransack and occupy our settlement. A grudge has been recorded, ensure it is settled.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As spied by a wrathful Grimnir, did the tree-hugging elgi bastards come and take our settlement. What do these gits even want with rock and metal? Get them out!

missions.localised_description: As spied by a wrathful Grimnir, did the tree-hugging elgi bastards come and take our settlement. What do these gits even want with rock and metal? Get them out!

localised_description.last_approved_text: "I agree, High Loremaster. You should exert your control across all of the local area. While this may put you at odds with the local fauna it shall dramatically improve the probability of success for the wider goal."\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The Druchii are close, High Loremaster, they sniff out and claim the power stored in the Chamber of Visions. You must take it from them - capture the settlement."\n\nLearn more about ritual resource sites [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_resource_sites]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_resource_sites}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

You must take it from them - capture the settlement."\n\nLearn more about ritual resource sites [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_resource_sites]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_resource_sites}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "High Loremaster, you must act quickly. The Lizardmen have been allies at times, but foes more often. The key to powering the rituals lies within those ruins. I will focus on preparing the first ritual, while you gain purchase in the jungle realms by capturing a settlement."\n\nLearn more about settlements [[url:script_link_campaign_settlements]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_settlements}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

I will focus on preparing the first ritual, while you gain purchase in the jungle realms by capturing a settlement."\n\nLearn more about settlements [[url:script_link_campaign_settlements]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_settlements}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "That was well done, High Loremaster. But we must not waste a moment, for the Vortex falters. Erect a waystone and collect the fragments so we can power the next ritual."\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "As Bel-Korhadris, the seventh Phoenix King, did when he built the White Tower of Hoeth, we must gather our lore or open ancient scroll rooms and archives. The knowledge and wonders we shall uncover will aid us in these perilous times."\n\nLearn more about technologies [[url:script_link_campaign_technology]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_technology}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The ritual nears ready for enactment, but it is clear that other powers seek to grasp the Vortex in its weakened state. Quickly! Gather as many way-fragments as you can."\n\nLearn more about ritual currency [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_currency]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_currency}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

You must purge them, so we can focus on the greater objective."\n\nLearn more about factions [[url:script_link_campaign_factions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_factions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "With the entire province under your control, my prince, it is time to enact a Commandment."\n\nLearn more about commandments [[url:script_link_campaign_commandments]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_commandments}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "It is time, Prince Teclis. We must enact the Ritual of Prophecy!"\n\nLearn more about rituals [[url:script_link_campaign_rituals]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rituals}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Now you have strong, loyal, heroic allies, waste no more time and set them to work."\n\nLearn more about heroic actions [[url:script_link_campaign_hero_actions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_hero_actions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "We need the heroes of Asur to step forward. For now is the time of heroes. Erect a totem that will bring them forth!"\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "You are not quite without friends in this wilderness, High Loremaster. Far to the east stands the Citadel of Dusk, from which your kind patrol the southern seas. It may be prudent to reach out to the commanders of such a fortress."\n\nLearn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_non_aggression_pacts}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

It may be prudent to reach out to the commanders of such a fortress."\n\nLearn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_non_aggression_pacts}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Prince Teclis, your brother asks for progress, he has even despatched his Squire to join us and report back. It is a minor discretion I’m sure we will overcome. In the meantime, I strongly suggest that you muster another force and appoint a commander to lead it, that should appease Tyrion’s war council."\n\nLearn more about raising armies [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_forces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_raising_forces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The secrets of all creation can be sought by the Asur, my prince. Just give the word and the Loremasters will seek it."\n\nLearn more about technologies [[url:script_link_campaign_technology]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_technology}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Displaced warriors and other such remnants of the Old World do not always go quietly into the dark. Sometimes they find each other and create rogue forces. These must be dealt with."\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

These must be dealt with."\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Way-fragments are needed for the ritual. Lustria is filled with forgotten ruins that could hold such power – seek to discover them. But beware, High Loremaster, there may well be other secrets hidden within."\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_treasure_hunting]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_treasure_hunting}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The Elves of the Citadel of Dusk are merchants at heart, guarding as they do the southern trade routes to Ulthuan. Seeking a commercial agreement with them may wise."\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreements [[url:script_link_campaign_trade]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_trade}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "You must strengthen your cities, my prince. From a strong foundation you can strike out on your quest to repair the Vortex. The populace gathers to support you, enhance and upgrade your settlement."\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].
