The populace gathers to support you, enhance and upgrade your settlement."\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: As the two moons rise into the Lustrian sky, Teclis is touched by a troubling dream. No mere nightmare, this is a vision sent by Lileath warning of peril back on Ulthuan. The Witch King strides upon the Elven homeland once more, and he is not even contained within Anlec. Events surrounding the Great Vortex seem to be happening even faster than Loremaster Talarian could have predicted.\n\nTeclis knows that the search of way-fragments must continue, but he cannot ignore the Witch King on Ulthuan, and so makes preparations for an early return.

missions.localised_description: As the two moons rise into the Lustrian sky, Teclis is touched by a troubling dream. No mere nightmare, this is a vision sent by Lileath warning of peril back on Ulthuan. The Witch King strides upon the Elven homeland once more, and he is not even contained within Anlec. Events surrounding the Great Vortex seem to be happening even faster than Loremaster Talarian could have predicted.\n\nTeclis knows that the search of way-fragments must continue, but he cannot ignore the Witch King on Ulthuan, and so makes preparations for an early return.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Another night and another troubled dream sent by the goddess Lileath. Communication with the gods is never precise but it seems that she is concerned for Vaul, the Maker-God. The Witch King invades Vaul's shrine in Caledor, upon Ulthuan itself. There the Dark King spits spiteful hexes, as he besieges the enraged volcano in which Vaul's shrine sits. If not stopped, it is only a matter of time before he claims it, weakening the Asur's connection with the gods of the Cadai.\n\nTeclis must raise a host and travel to the Dragon Spine as fast as he is able.

missions.localised_description: Another night and another troubled dream sent by the goddess Lileath. Communication with the gods is never precise but it seems that she is concerned for Vaul, the Maker-God. The Witch King invades Vaul's shrine in Caledor, upon Ulthuan itself. There the Dark King spits spiteful hexes, as he besieges the enraged volcano in which Vaul's shrine sits. If not stopped, it is only a matter of time before he claims it, weakening the Asur's connection with the gods of the Cadai.\n\nTeclis must raise a host and travel to the Dragon Spine as fast as he is able.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Witch King has attacked Vaul’s Anvil, desperate to break in and cause untold mischief upon the works of the Maker-God. Through arcane skill, Teclis' force arrives to defend the shrine before the Witch-king's sorceresses cast a fell net of magic over the area, cutting it off from the rest of Ulthuan. Teclis knows Malekith must be stopped. He unsheathes his sword - a weapon forged by himself that has been quiet of late. But now it glows with power enthused by the blessing of Vaul, by battle's end it will be a formidable blade once more.

missions.localised_description: The Witch King has attacked Vaul’s Anvil, desperate to break in and cause untold mischief upon the works of the Maker-God. Through arcane skill, Teclis' force arrives to defend the shrine before the Witch-king's sorceresses cast a fell net of magic over the area, cutting it off from the rest of Ulthuan. Teclis knows Malekith must be stopped. He unsheathes his sword - a weapon forged by himself that has been quiet of late. But now it glows with power enthused by the blessing of Vaul, by battle's end it will be a formidable blade once more.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The War Crown is seldom seen outside the walls of the White Tower. Even Teclis himself wears it only in times of great need, so he sets off to Lustria without it. However, it quickly becomes apparent that circumstances are direr than even the High Loremaster realised, and so he sends for the crown. A pair of Great Eagles are dispatched from Saphery with the crown securely held their claws. An epic journey follows, crossing the Great Ocean and then the continent itself.\n\n Perhaps it was inevitable, on a flight that long, that the Eagles would not reach Teclis. Something has gone wrong - the crown and its winged escort are lost. An artefact of such power and reverence cannot be allowed to simply vanish. Teclis knows of a ritual of Isha that should be invoked, for a mother always knows where her children lie, and the War Crown is of Isha's making.

missions.localised_description: The War Crown is seldom seen outside the walls of the White Tower. Even Teclis himself wears it only in times of great need, so he sets off to Lustria without it. However, it quickly becomes apparent that circumstances are direr than even the High Loremaster realised, and so he sends for the crown. A pair of Great Eagles are dispatched from Saphery with the crown securely held their claws. An epic journey follows, crossing the Great Ocean and then the continent itself.\n\n Perhaps it was inevitable, on a flight that long, that the Eagles would not reach Teclis. Something has gone wrong - the crown and its winged escort are lost. An artefact of such power and reverence cannot be allowed to simply vanish. Teclis knows of a ritual of Isha that should be invoked, for a mother always knows where her children lie, and the War Crown is of Isha's making.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The ritual grants Teclis knowledge, but not the whole answer. He knows that the Eagles were brought down deliberately, somewhere over the Spine of Sotek. Yet that mountain chain is vast; Isha’s influence will have to be cast across Lustria for the Crown to quickly make itself known.

missions.localised_description: The ritual grants Teclis knowledge, but not the whole answer. He knows that the Eagles were brought down deliberately, somewhere over the Spine of Sotek. Yet that mountain chain is vast; Isha’s influence will have to be cast across Lustria for the Crown to quickly make itself known.

localised_description.last_approved_text:
The location is revealed. Isha’s light guides Teclis and his Sapherian host to a dark, dank cavern in the north of mountain chain. On entering the cave, the High Elves are assaulted by a unholy stench. Some turn their noses up and even consider returning to the surface, but Teclis gives them a stern look and bids they advance further into the depths.

A piercing scream echoes through the cavern; the master of the lair is in residence! Bones drop from the ceiling to come crashing amidst the High Elven host. The carcasses of two Eagles litter the cavern floor. Teclis looks up to see the hunter that ripped them from the sky - a gigantic Undead bat…

But even this beast does not seem to be alone, for in the shadows, scuttling all around the periphery of the cave, the Elves hear mocking chitters!

missions.localised_description:
The location is revealed. Isha’s light guides Teclis and his Sapherian host to a dark, dank cavern in the north of mountain chain. On entering the cave, the High Elves are assaulted by a unholy stench. Some turn their noses up and even consider returning to the surface, but Teclis gives them a stern look and bids they advance further into the depths.

A piercing scream echoes through the cavern; the master of the lair is in residence! Bones drop from the ceiling to come crashing amidst the High Elven host. The carcasses of two Eagles litter the cavern floor. Teclis looks up to see the hunter that ripped them from the sky - a gigantic Undead bat…

But even this beast does not seem to be alone, for in the shadows, scuttling all around the periphery of the cave, the Elves hear mocking chitters!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Ever since the two-tailed Dragon was seen burning across the sky the world has become even more of an uncertain place. The Vortex grows more unstable, and the enemies of the Asur seek to take advantage. Unsurprisingly, it is the Druchii that are most aggressive. Reports of coastal raids are flooding into Lothern and even that the Witch King is now abroad. Fear spreads that Dark Elves land upon Ulthuan and are trying inveigle themselves into the populace - ready to pounce upon neighbours when bidden by Malekith.\n\nFinubar calls his unofficial war council of which Tyrion is the central pillar. The king asks that his generals issue proclamations, and send military presences across the regions to calm his subjects. A difficult task in this climate of unease.

missions.localised_description: Ever since the two-tailed Dragon was seen burning across the sky the world has become even more of an uncertain place. The Vortex grows more unstable, and the enemies of the Asur seek to take advantage. Unsurprisingly, it is the Druchii that are most aggressive. Reports of coastal raids are flooding into Lothern and even that the Witch King is now abroad. Fear spreads that Dark Elves land upon Ulthuan and are trying inveigle themselves into the populace - ready to pounce upon neighbours when bidden by Malekith.\n\nFinubar calls his unofficial war council of which Tyrion is the central pillar. The king asks that his generals issue proclamations, and send military presences across the regions to calm his subjects. A difficult task in this climate of unease.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Ulthuan’s residents remain on edge. Tyrion’s presence is a small comfort, but the Asur have always been highly attuned to the magical eddies that assail the world. And all - from Swordmaster to poet to humble cordwainer - feel the doom encroach as the Vortex fails.\n\nAmidst this unease, the rumours of Dark Elves hidden amongst the populace persists, and that an assassination attempt on the Phoenix King and his foremast champions is imminent. It is fortunate that the world’s best bodyguards reside on Ulthuan - in Chrace to be specific.

missions.localised_description: Ulthuan’s residents remain on edge. Tyrion’s presence is a small comfort, but the Asur have always been highly attuned to the magical eddies that assail the world. And all - from Swordmaster to poet to humble cordwainer - feel the doom encroach as the Vortex fails.\n\nAmidst this unease, the rumours of Dark Elves hidden amongst the populace persists, and that an assassination attempt on the Phoenix King and his foremast champions is imminent. It is fortunate that the world’s best bodyguards reside on Ulthuan - in Chrace to be specific.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Now is the time for Tyrion to prove worthy of the title ‘Defender’. After sowing disquiet across the inner and outer kingdoms, the enemy finally makes its move; however, Tyrion is there to strike back! With the Everqueen’s blessing, he rides forth, to bring ruin on the trespassers. Unfortunately the Dragon Armour of Aenarion is damaged in the onslaught. A lucky strike perhaps? Or something more contrived? In any event, the armour must be returned to where it was forged for repair.

missions.localised_description: Now is the time for Tyrion to prove worthy of the title ‘Defender’. After sowing disquiet across the inner and outer kingdoms, the enemy finally makes its move; however, Tyrion is there to strike back! With the Everqueen’s blessing, he rides forth, to bring ruin on the trespassers. Unfortunately the Dragon Armour of Aenarion is damaged in the onslaught. A lucky strike perhaps? Or something more contrived? In any event, the armour must be returned to where it was forged for repair.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Tyrion returns the Dragon Armour to Vaul’s Anvil, where it was first created. While Tyrion impatiently waits within while Vaul's smiths reknit the armour, he is called to the shrine’s entrance. Druchii gather! They certainly knew of Tyrion’s whereabouts, perhaps the armour’s failing was a trap after all? Tyrion prepares his host for war; he will face the hated foe without his usual protection, although he does not need it, for he is Ulthuan’s Defender!

missions.localised_description: Tyrion returns the Dragon Armour to Vaul’s Anvil, where it was first created. While Tyrion impatiently waits within while Vaul's smiths reknit the armour, he is called to the shrine’s entrance. Druchii gather! They certainly knew of Tyrion’s whereabouts, perhaps the armour’s failing was a trap after all? Tyrion prepares his host for war; he will face the hated foe without his usual protection, although he does not need it, for he is Ulthuan’s Defender!

localised_description.last_approved_text: "It is no surprise that the Dark Elves prove stubborn, my prince. They have always coveted Ulthuan since before the Sundering. But they have no place here. Purge the province of Druchii - this is Asur land!"\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "It is no surprise that the Dark Elves prove stubborn, my prince. They have always coveted Ulthuan since before the Sundering. But they have no place here. Purge the province of Druchii - this is Asur land!"\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Caledor has often stood apart from the Phoenix Throne. And now they do so again, hoarding the way-fragments for their own gain, while we need them for the next ritual. Desperate times calls for desperate action. War must come to Caledor, my prince. Take Vaul’s Anvil!"\n\nLearn more about ritual resource sites [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_resource_sites]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_resource_sites}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

And now they do so again, hoarding the way-fragments for their own gain, while we need them for the next ritual. Desperate times calls for desperate action. War must come to Caledor, my prince. Take Vaul’s Anvil!"\n\nLearn more about ritual resource sites [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_resource_sites]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_resource_sites}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "My prince, I fear the purpose of this ill-advised invasion by our Dark Elf kin - the Druchii - is to distract us from their true cause. Their search for scrolls is a concern and we cannot let them sully Ulthuan either - let alone encroach on Lothern. I will focus on preparing the first ritual, while you defend our homeland and expel these fools."\n\nLearn more about settlements [[url:script_link_campaign_settlements]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_settlements}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

I will focus on preparing the first ritual, while you defend our homeland and expel these fools."\n\nLearn more about settlements [[url:script_link_campaign_settlements]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_settlements}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Such sorrow when Asur comes to blows with Asur, yet it was unavoidable. I fear this will not be the last we witness this in the campaign to come. You must move swiftly on - consecrate a waystone, so we may collect the fragments."\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "As Bel-Korhadris, the seventh Phoenix King, did when he built the White Tower of Hoeth, we must gather our lore or open ancient scroll rooms and archives. The knowledge and wonders we shall uncover will aid us in these perilous times."\n\nLearn more about technologies [[url:script_link_campaign_technology]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_technology}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "With the entire province under your control, my prince, it is time to enact a commandment."\n\nLearn more about commandments [[url:script_link_campaign_commandments]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_commandments}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "It is time, Prince Tyrion. We must enact the Ritual of Prophecy!"\n\nLearn more about rituals [[url:script_link_campaign_rituals]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rituals}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Now you have strong, loyal, heroic allies, waste no more time and set them to work."\n\nLearn more about heroic actions [[url:script_link_campaign_hero_actions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_hero_actions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "We cannot and should not fight all of Ulthuan, my prince. Please the Phoenix King and seek common cause with Yvresse."\n\nLearn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_non_aggression_pacts}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "You are highly thought of, Prince Tyrion. And yet you have made enemies both here and abroad. Ambitious Princes and clandestine agents of the Witch King seek to disrupt the harmonious ways of the Asur. Unrest can fester and impede our goal. Solve any public order issues."\n\nLearn more about public order [[url:script_link_campaign_public_order]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_public_order}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Ambitious Princes and clandestine agents of the Witch King seek to disrupt the harmonious ways of the Asur. Unrest can fester and impede our goal. Solve any public order issues."\n\nLearn more about public order [[url:script_link_campaign_public_order]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_public_order}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "You do not command enough war hosts, my prince. It is time to summon the citizen-militia of Ulthuan, and appoint a trusted commander at their helm."\n\nLearn more about raising armies [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_forces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_raising_forces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The secrets of all creation can be sought by the Asur, my prince. Just give the word and the Loremasters will seek it."\n\nLearn more about technologies [[url:script_link_campaign_technology]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_technology}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Not all armies fight for their race or Lord, some are displaced creatures, such as the Greenskin filth that has found their way onto our homeland despite its innate protections. Engage this force and be prepared to confront other rogue armies in the campaign to come."\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Engage this force and be prepared to confront other rogue armies in the campaign to come."\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "I need way-fragments to power the ritual. The ruins of the world offer many lost secrets, some of which conceal the power we need. Search the ruins, but be on your guard, my prince."\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_treasure_hunting]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_treasure_hunting}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "I need way-fragments to power the ritual. The ruins of the world offer many lost secrets, some of which conceal the power we need. Search the ruins, but be on your guard, my prince."\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_treasure_hunting]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_treasure_hunting}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "King Finubar is keen that economic activity continue, even under this dread pall. It is a wise move. We must be both militarily and economically strong to survive. The commerce should flow."\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreements [[url:script_link_campaign_trade]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_trade}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "King Finubar is keen that economic activity continue, even under this dread pall. It is a wise move. We must be both militarily and economically strong to survive. The commerce should flow."\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreements [[url:script_link_campaign_trade]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_trade}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "My prince, with the Vortex faltering we should look upon our infrastructure and enhance its properties. We cannot afford to stagnate in such a troubled age."\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "My prince, with the Vortex faltering we should look upon our infrastructure and enhance its properties. We cannot afford to stagnate in such a troubled age."\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "You must strengthen your cities, my prince. From a strong foundation you can strike out on your quest to repair the Vortex. The populace gathers to support you, enhance and upgrade your settlement."\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "You must strengthen your cities, my prince. From a strong foundation you can strike out on your quest to repair the Vortex. The populace gathers to support you, enhance and upgrade your settlement."\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: Tyrion, son of Arathion, is the greatest warrior in Ulthuan - some say the greatest warrior to have ever lived upon the Elven island. For an Elf, he is a being of simple tastes, and a rare straight-talker who despises dressing up his words in needless confections and double-meanings - unlike the princes that frequent the court of the Phoenix Throne.\n\nIn Tyrion’s mind it is these dandy fools that will be their race’s undoing; while they prance about court furthering their own agendas, the Vortex struggles, and invasion is imminent. Tyrion quits the court in disgust and goes about mustering a force to repel the inevitable.

missions.localised_description: Tyrion, son of Arathion, is the greatest warrior in Ulthuan - some say the greatest warrior to have ever lived upon the Elven island. For an Elf, he is a being of simple tastes, and a rare straight-talker who despises dressing up his words in needless confections and double-meanings - unlike the princes that frequent the court of the Phoenix Throne.\n\nIn Tyrion’s mind it is these dandy fools that will be their race’s undoing; while they prance about court furthering their own agendas, the Vortex struggles, and invasion is imminent. Tyrion quits the court in disgust and goes about mustering a force to repel the inevitable.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Elven lust for intrigue can be insatiable… and often self-destructive. A certain cohort of princes, envious of Tyrion’s influence over King Finubar, seeks to exploit the situation of the failing Vortex and Teclis’ sudden departure to Lustria for his own gain. The jealous princes utter a poisonous rumour in court and let's their race's proclivity for scandal do the rest... \n\nTyrion’s pride burns as deeply as any Dwarf’s, and that can make him predictable. The veiled insult eats at Tyrion - the claim that he is only so renowned because of the sword he wields has him cast it aside to prove it is not so. Yet such rumours have a tendency to grow like a spider's web, catching larger flies. Soon the talk of the courts is that Tyrion is no campaigner. While those in battle may fear the Defender of Ulthuan - on grander strategies, such as depriving the foe of hideaways or destroying enemy supply routes, Tyrion is clueless - or so the rumours asserted. Tyrion could ignore such bunkum, but his pride prevents him. He shall prove the naysayers wrong!

missions.localised_description: The Elven lust for intrigue can be insatiable… and often self-destructive. A certain cohort of princes, envious of Tyrion’s influence over King Finubar, seeks to exploit the situation of the failing Vortex and Teclis’ sudden departure to Lustria for his own gain. The jealous princes utter a poisonous rumour in court and let's their race's proclivity for scandal do the rest... \n\nTyrion’s pride burns as deeply as any Dwarf’s, and that can make him predictable. The veiled insult eats at Tyrion - the claim that he is only so renowned because of the sword he wields has him cast it aside to prove it is not so. Yet such rumours have a tendency to grow like a spider's web, catching larger flies. Soon the talk of the courts is that Tyrion is no campaigner. While those in battle may fear the Defender of Ulthuan - on grander strategies, such as depriving the foe of hideaways or destroying enemy supply routes, Tyrion is clueless - or so the rumours asserted. Tyrion could ignore such bunkum, but his pride prevents him. He shall prove the naysayers wrong!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Tyrion has proven himself more than a mere warrior, but a capable general and leader of the Asur! Back in court, the conniving princes hide their victorious smiles, Tyrion has played into their hands. The princes whisper to others that the so-called Defender of Ulthuan has grown out of control, that he should be ostracised from Finubar’s warrior council. They say this all while sipping the finest wine from silver chalices, and secretly agree to reconvene in Saphery.\n\nOf course, even as these nobles bask in their self-congratulatory hubris, they forget that while Tyrion is no politician he is certainly no puppet either. It will soon be time to teach these fools a lesson in manners and he will not need Sunfang to do so!

missions.localised_description: Tyrion has proven himself more than a mere warrior, but a capable general and leader of the Asur! Back in court, the conniving princes hide their victorious smiles, Tyrion has played into their hands. The princes whisper to others that the so-called Defender of Ulthuan has grown out of control, that he should be ostracised from Finubar’s warrior council. They say this all while sipping the finest wine from silver chalices, and secretly agree to reconvene in Saphery.\n\nOf course, even as these nobles bask in their self-congratulatory hubris, they forget that while Tyrion is no politician he is certainly no puppet either. It will soon be time to teach these fools a lesson in manners and he will not need Sunfang to do so!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The conspiracy is traced to Saphery, where the princes' lies have spread to the Loremasters. While Tyrion simply tries to hunt down and face his accusers, he finds an aggressive battle line in the lee of the White Tower, for the mages of Hoeth have ever been Teclis' people. The princes would have that Tyrion’s recent actions prove that he is not the honourable Defender of Ulthuan but a Druchii sympathiser - a weakness of his lineage! Battle is inevitable...

missions.localised_description: The conspiracy is traced to Saphery, where the princes' lies have spread to the Loremasters. While Tyrion simply tries to hunt down and face his accusers, he finds an aggressive battle line in the lee of the White Tower, for the mages of Hoeth have ever been Teclis' people. The princes would have that Tyrion’s recent actions prove that he is not the honourable Defender of Ulthuan but a Druchii sympathiser - a weakness of his lineage! Battle is inevitable...

localised_description.last_approved_text: Kroq-Gar is ancient - a Saurus that has spent his existence fighting the myriad enemies of the Lizardmen. Such a long life has seen him, on occasion, fall into conflict with rival Slann whose interpretation of the Great Plan differs from his own. Nevertheless, when a summons comes from Lord Mazdamundi, the oldest and most powerful of all living Mage-Priests, Kroq-Gar is duty-bound to answer.\n\nThe command from Mazdamundi is weak, no doubt a result of the Great Warding’s disintegration, which in turn is due to the fading Vortex on the High Elf Isle of Ulthuan. The ancient Saurus decides that a Skink must tap into the Geomantic Web directly, to clarify Mazdamundi’s directive.

missions.localised_description: Kroq-Gar is ancient - a Saurus that has spent his existence fighting the myriad enemies of the Lizardmen. Such a long life has seen him, on occasion, fall into conflict with rival Slann whose interpretation of the Great Plan differs from his own. Nevertheless, when a summons comes from Lord Mazdamundi, the oldest and most powerful of all living Mage-Priests, Kroq-Gar is duty-bound to answer.\n\nThe command from Mazdamundi is weak, no doubt a result of the Great Warding’s disintegration, which in turn is due to the fading Vortex on the High Elf Isle of Ulthuan. The ancient Saurus decides that a Skink must tap into the Geomantic Web directly, to clarify Mazdamundi’s directive.

localised_description.last_approved_text:
Lord Mazdamundi wishes to grant Kroq-Gar use of a revered artefact, the Hand of the Gods. Kroq-Gar’s service to Lizard-kind is beyond counting, yet the Saurus must still prove himself worthy of the mantle and ensure his own thoughts align with Mazdamundi’s xenophobic interpretation of the Great Plan.

A few leagues from the Hexoatl, the City of the Sun, Elven servants of Ulthuan interfere with the Fallen Gates - an ancient portal of the Old Ones. Their intention may be honourable, but they cannot be allowed to tamper with mechanisms far beyond their limited understanding. The Asur must be stopped before their meddling summons something far more dangerous.

Kroq-Gar stands ready, but Mazdamundi counsels that a larger cohort is needed to face the Elves.

missions.localised_description:
Lord Mazdamundi wishes to grant Kroq-Gar use of a revered artefact, the Hand of the Gods. Kroq-Gar’s service to Lizard-kind is beyond counting, yet the Saurus must still prove himself worthy of the mantle and ensure his own thoughts align with Mazdamundi’s xenophobic interpretation of the Great Plan.

A few leagues from the Hexoatl, the City of the Sun, Elven servants of Ulthuan interfere with the Fallen Gates - an ancient portal of the Old Ones. Their intention may be honourable, but they cannot be allowed to tamper with mechanisms far beyond their limited understanding. The Asur must be stopped before their meddling summons something far more dangerous.

Kroq-Gar stands ready, but Mazdamundi counsels that a larger cohort is needed to face the Elves.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Fallen Gates are a cosmic device of the Old Ones, a stellar bridge that once reached across the stars to who-knows-where. Even the Slann Mage-Priests do not pretend to know its ancient inner workings, so the High Elves' meddling is a great trespass. There is no time for communication, no time for diplomacy, a swift punishment is needed to prevent disaster!

missions.localised_description: The Fallen Gates are a cosmic device of the Old Ones, a stellar bridge that once reached across the stars to who-knows-where. Even the Slann Mage-Priests do not pretend to know its ancient inner workings, so the High Elves' meddling is a great trespass. There is no time for communication, no time for diplomacy, a swift punishment is needed to prevent disaster!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Revered Spear of Tlanxla was once a great weapon of an Old One deity, which could reportedly cut down mortals as swiftly as an Ogre biting through a ratman’s skull. Kroq-Gar has been honoured to wield the spear for hundreds of years, slaying countless warmblood invaders. However, since the forked-tongue comet of Sotek was seen in the heavens, the spear’s power has waned. At the Last Defender’s behest, Skink arbitrators look for a method to restore it, proffering that a mighty tribute to Tlanxla would be a good place to start.

missions.localised_description: The Revered Spear of Tlanxla was once a great weapon of an Old One deity, which could reportedly cut down mortals as swiftly as an Ogre biting through a ratman’s skull. Kroq-Gar has been honoured to wield the spear for hundreds of years, slaying countless warmblood invaders. However, since the forked-tongue comet of Sotek was seen in the heavens, the spear’s power has waned. At the Last Defender’s behest, Skink arbitrators look for a method to restore it, proffering that a mighty tribute to Tlanxla would be a good place to start.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The answer to the loss of power in Kroq-Gar's spear, it seems, is simple. Tlanxla was a god that thrived on sacrifice and so the spear must be bathed in the blood of many enemies. To a seasoned warrior such as Kroq-Gar, this makes perfect sense; the harvest should be reaped immediately!

missions.localised_description: The answer to the loss of power in Kroq-Gar's spear, it seems, is simple. Tlanxla was a god that thrived on sacrifice and so the spear must be bathed in the blood of many enemies. To a seasoned warrior such as Kroq-Gar, this makes perfect sense; the harvest should be reaped immediately!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The blood of many has been spilled and with it comes a message whispered to the ancient Saurus through a waking vision. Within the Well of Time is a fissure of power that spans the barrier of eons. It has opened up and Tlanxla reaches through, ready to touch his spear and reignite the lost force within.\n\nKroq-Gar must make haste across the Mosquito Swamps to the Well of Time to return the spear to its maker. However, Dark Elves have been drawn to the temporal power spilling from a fissure deep within the well - the Druchii invaders must be dealt with before the spear can be re-charged!

missions.localised_description: The blood of many has been spilled and with it comes a message whispered to the ancient Saurus through a waking vision. Within the Well of Time is a fissure of power that spans the barrier of eons. It has opened up and Tlanxla reaches through, ready to touch his spear and reignite the lost force within.\n\nKroq-Gar must make haste across the Mosquito Swamps to the Well of Time to return the spear to its maker. However, Dark Elves have been drawn to the temporal power spilling from a fissure deep within the well - the Druchii invaders must be dealt with before the spear can be re-charged!

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Impressive work, Last Defender, but the task is not yet complete. Purge the Rat-spawn from all settlements in this region."\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "It is unfortunate that this is not the first time you have made war against coldbloods, nor, I fear, will it be the last. Yet fight them you must, for they are mistaken in their will to keep the plaques from us. Capture the Golden Tower."\n\nLearn more about ritual resource sites [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_resource_sites]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_resource_sites}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text:
"Last Defender! The Xa’Kota - Unnatural Spawn of the Rat - infest our Southland realms. They squat in our lost cities and steal our lore. Purge them, mighty Kroq-Gar. Reclaim the ruins!"

Skaven inhabit their Underworld, making their settlements indistinguishable from ruins until approached.

Learn more about the Skaven Underworld [[url:script_link_campaign_skaven_underworld]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_skaven_underworld}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Not all prey need be hunted, Last Defender. Take these tree-climbing servants. localised_description.last_approved_text: "The spawning pools and barrios are crowded, master. We must look to our settlements - expand and enhance. As per the Old Ones’ plan."\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Great Vortex of the High Elves is under attack. For millennia, the Asur have arrogantly believed it is their magic that has sustained the Vortex. While they may have put the arcane foundations in place, it is the Great Warding of the Slann - a massive undertaking that keeps most Mage-Priests dormant, such is the concentration needed - that has kept the Vortex functioning.\n\nHowever, since the comet, the Great Warding suffers. Lord Mazdamundi, always the most licentious of Slann, has set about rectifying this by removing the taint of the warmbloods from his realm.

missions.localised_description: The Great Vortex of the High Elves is under attack. For millennia, the Asur have arrogantly believed it is their magic that has sustained the Vortex. While they may have put the arcane foundations in place, it is the Great Warding of the Slann - a massive undertaking that keeps most Mage-Priests dormant, such is the concentration needed - that has kept the Vortex functioning.\n\nHowever, since the comet, the Great Warding suffers. Lord Mazdamundi, always the most licentious of Slann, has set about rectifying this by removing the taint of the warmbloods from his realm.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The purge goes well, yet warmbloods still dare to desecrate Lustria or is it a Slann Mage-Priest whose interpretations of the Great Plan are heretical? In either case, the interlopers cannot be allowed to live! In Mazdamundi’s anger, he reaches for the Cobra Mace, his own personal relic, and realises for the first time since his awakening that it is not on his bloated person!\n\nOne of his Skink attendants reminds the Slann that the mace was left at the sacred Isle of the Crimson Skull to be recharged amidst its red minerals, which are found nowhere else in the Old World. Mazdamundi orders that they collect the relic, but only after the enemy settlement is taken or destroyed.

missions.localised_description: The purge goes well, yet warmbloods still dare to desecrate Lustria or is it a Slann Mage-Priest whose interpretations of the Great Plan are heretical? In either case, the interlopers cannot be allowed to live! In Mazdamundi’s anger, he reaches for the Cobra Mace, his own personal relic, and realises for the first time since his awakening that it is not on his bloated person!\n\nOne of his Skink attendants reminds the Slann that the mace was left at the sacred Isle of the Crimson Skull to be recharged amidst its red minerals, which are found nowhere else in the Old World. Mazdamundi orders that they collect the relic, but only after the enemy settlement is taken or destroyed.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With his realm purged, Lord Mazdamundi makes haste for the Isle of the Crimson Skull to collect the Cobra Mace, for he will need it during his labours to come. They arrive upon the beach to see that the foulest of all warmbloods, the Skaven, have scoured the island, attracted by the crimson rocks. It may not be Warpstone, but even so, the ratmen recognise the value it holds.\n\nLord Mazdamundi is outraged and immediately orders their utter extinction!

missions.localised_description: With his realm purged, Lord Mazdamundi makes haste for the Isle of the Crimson Skull to collect the Cobra Mace, for he will need it during his labours to come. They arrive upon the beach to see that the foulest of all warmbloods, the Skaven, have scoured the island, attracted by the crimson rocks. It may not be Warpstone, but even so, the ratmen recognise the value it holds.\n\nLord Mazdamundi is outraged and immediately orders their utter extinction!

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Lord Mazdamundi, you are wise indeed. We cannot let the warmbloods prosper in our realms. Taking back one temple-city is not enough, we must purge the entire realm."\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "The interpretation of the Great Plan over the millennia is dense and complex - some knowledge has regretfully been lost. We must discover forgotten lore and fathom new methods of warfare against the warmbloods. Construction of this building will allow us to begin."\n\nLearn more about technologies [[url:script_link_campaign_technology]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_technology}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "You are correct, revered master. The ritual is prepared but more plaques are needed. It is clear the warmbloods attempt to tamper with the Vortex; for the sake of the Great Warding we must be first. Act quickly!"\n\nLearn more about ritual currency [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_currency]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_currency}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "You are correct, revered master. The ritual is prepared but more plaques are needed. It is clear the warmbloods attempt to tamper with the Vortex; for the sake of the Great Warding we must be first. Act quickly!"\n\nLearn more about ritual currency [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_currency]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_currency}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Tolerate these creatures no longer, my master. Your interpretation of the Great Plan is quite clear on this. Annihilate them!"\n\nLearn more about factions [[url:script_link_campaign_factions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_factions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "Tolerate these creatures no longer, my master. Your interpretation of the Great Plan is quite clear on this. Annihilate them!"\n\nLearn more about factions [[url:script_link_campaign_factions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_factions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Lord Mazdamundi, with all nodes in this province now under your direct influence, you have achieved harmony. Issue a Commandment, all will obey."\n\nLearn more about commandments [[url:script_link_campaign_commandments]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_commandments}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "Lord Mazdamundi, with all nodes in this province now under your direct influence, you have achieved harmony. Issue a Commandment, all will obey."\n\nLearn more about commandments [[url:script_link_campaign_commandments]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_commandments}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The correct alignment is upon us, Lord Mazdamundi. Enact the Ritual of Prognostication!"

missions.localised_description: "The correct alignment is upon us, Lord Mazdamundi. Enact the Ritual of Prognostication!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The servant awaits your attention, my master. Send him on a critical task to further the Great Plan!"\n\nLearn more about heroic actions [[url:script_link_campaign_hero_actions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_hero_actions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "The servant awaits your attention, my master. Send him on a critical task to further the Great Plan!"\n\nLearn more about heroic actions [[url:script_link_campaign_hero_actions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_hero_actions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Master, force alone will not achieve the Great Plan. We must seek out chosen ones to perform certain tasks. Erect a beacon to summon them."\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "Master, force alone will not achieve the Great Plan. We must seek out chosen ones to perform certain tasks. Erect a beacon to summon them."\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "We are ready, master. The chosen ones gather, basking in the sun. Call them."\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "We are ready, master. The chosen ones gather, basking in the sun. Call them."\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "In time all trespassers must be eliminated form Lustria, but with the Great Warding in crisis we must choose our immediate enemies carefully. I suggest a non-aggression pact with these warmbloods."\n\nLearn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_non_aggression_pacts}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "In time all trespassers must be eliminated form Lustria, but with the Great Warding in crisis we must choose our immediate enemies carefully. I suggest a non-aggression pact with these warmbloods."\n\nLearn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_non_aggression_pacts}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Master! While your every thought and whim is law, the comet flying so low, has had an unnerving effect on some spawn-kin. They dare question - question! - your interpretation of the Great Plan. Such discordance must be dealt with. Restore public order."\n\nLearn more about public order [[url:script_link_campaign_public_order]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_public_order}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "Master! While your every thought and whim is law, the comet flying so low, has had an unnerving effect on some spawn-kin. They dare question - question! - your interpretation of the Great Plan. Such discordance must be dealt with. Restore public order."\n\nLearn more about public order [[url:script_link_campaign_public_order]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_public_order}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The grand contemplation is over! As is your desire Lord Mazdamundi, the constellations assent - spawn Saurus and Skinks, a new cohort is needed for the great purpose."\n\nLearn more about raising armies [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_forces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_raising_forces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "The grand contemplation is over! As is your desire Lord Mazdamundi, the constellations assent - spawn Saurus and Skinks, a new cohort is needed for the great purpose."\n\nLearn more about raising armies [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_forces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_raising_forces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Skink researchers and archivists are poised to do your bidding, ancient master. Select the field of knowledge you require and they shall begin."\n\nLearn more about technologies [[url:script_link_campaign_technology]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_technology}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "Skink researchers and archivists are poised to do your bidding, ancient master. Select the field of knowledge you require and they shall begin."\n\nLearn more about technologies [[url:script_link_campaign_technology]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_technology}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "These lost warmblood servants roam far from their island, revered master. We do not have time to relocate such rogue elements back to their Ilse. I suggest a quick eradication."\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "These lost warmblood servants roam far from their island, revered master. We do not have time to relocate such rogue elements back to their Ilse. I suggest a quick eradication."\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The Ritual of Prognostication is nearly prepared. A few more Sacred Plaques are required. If we send scouting groups into ruins lost to us, we may discover more. Although other hazards and warmblood traps could also be present - an acceptable risk."\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_treasure_hunting]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_treasure_hunting}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "The Ritual of Prognostication is nearly prepared. A few more Sacred Plaques are required. If we send scouting groups into ruins lost to us, we may discover more. Although other hazards and warmblood traps could also be present - an acceptable risk."\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_treasure_hunting]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_treasure_hunting}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The Untamed Ones put great stock in insignificant baubles and yellow metal. We should gain their trust and barter with them. Seek a trade agreement."\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreements [[url:script_link_campaign_trade]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_trade}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "The Untamed Ones put great stock in insignificant baubles and yellow metal. We should gain their trust and barter with them. Seek a trade agreement."\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreements [[url:script_link_campaign_trade]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_trade}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Great master, the stars have moved into a favourable alignment. At your will, it is time to augment and upgrade the temple-city."\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "Great master, the stars have moved into a favourable alignment. At your will, it is time to augment and upgrade the temple-city."\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The spawning pools and barrios are crowded, master. We must look to our settlements - expand and enhance. As per the Old Ones’ plan."\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "The spawning pools and barrios are crowded, master. We must look to our settlements - expand and enhance. As per the Old Ones’ plan."\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: It was Chotec, Lord of the Sun, who ignited the closest star and warmed the world, or so claims an ancient plaque discovered by Lord Mazdamundi. However, the plaque was found incomplete; fragments of the text remain lost.\n\nAs with any Old One, Chotec's legacy is an important part of the Great Plan and so should be reclaimed if possible. Mazdamundi orders cohorts of Skinks to begin raids of the local area to hunt for the lost part of the plaque, if riches can also be secured to fund the search, then all the better.

missions.localised_description: It was Chotec, Lord of the Sun, who ignited the closest star and warmed the world, or so claims an ancient plaque discovered by Lord Mazdamundi. However, the plaque was found incomplete; fragments of the text remain lost.\n\nAs with any Old One, Chotec's legacy is an important part of the Great Plan and so should be reclaimed if possible. Mazdamundi orders cohorts of Skinks to begin raids of the local area to hunt for the lost part of the plaque, if riches can also be secured to fund the search, then all the better.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A fragment of the lost plaque is found and hurried into Mazdamundi’s hands. The Slann Mage-Priest studies and learns that Chotec was an Old One whose temper was as fierce as the fire he controlled - as hot as the sun itself! Of all the Slann, Mazdamundi is the fiercest, with a temper just like Chotec.\n\nOn Mazdamundi’s orders, the Skink attendants prepare the way for fire and fury as he begins the chants to initiate the Ritual of Ferocity.

missions.localised_description: A fragment of the lost plaque is found and hurried into Mazdamundi’s hands. The Slann Mage-Priest studies and learns that Chotec was an Old One whose temper was as fierce as the fire he controlled - as hot as the sun itself! Of all the Slann, Mazdamundi is the fiercest, with a temper just like Chotec.\n\nOn Mazdamundi’s orders, the Skink attendants prepare the way for fire and fury as he begins the chants to initiate the Ritual of Ferocity.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The ritual is set; the essence of Chotec has been summoned, but from whence will it come? The plaque alludes to the next step. It is an act that pleases Mazdamundi greatly, for it aligns with his personal interpretation of the Great Plan. Captives must be sought, their blood not yet spilled - although that will come in time. And when it does, knowledge of the radiance of Chotec shall be revealed.

missions.localised_description: The ritual is set; the essence of Chotec has been summoned, but from whence will it come? The plaque alludes to the next step. It is an act that pleases Mazdamundi greatly, for it aligns with his personal interpretation of the Great Plan. Captives must be sought, their blood not yet spilled - although that will come in time. And when it does, knowledge of the radiance of Chotec shall be revealed.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Of course, where else should the essence of Old One come but through the Fallen Gates? This is an ancient portal - a cosmic bridge across which the Old Ones travelled quickly to the City of the Sun and the rest of Lustria.\n\nUpon arrival at the Fallen Gates, preparations are set; the ancient stellar engines start to fire up, the pylons begin to thrum… And then, Chaos comes. The nemesis of the Old Ones - the ancient enemy - emerges from the jungle, desperate to stop the radiance of an Old One being summoned and imbued within the banner of the Solar-City. Lord Mazdamundi turns from the preparations, ready to defend at all costs.

missions.localised_description: Of course, where else should the essence of Old One come but through the Fallen Gates? This is an ancient portal - a cosmic bridge across which the Old Ones travelled quickly to the City of the Sun and the rest of Lustria.\n\nUpon arrival at the Fallen Gates, preparations are set; the ancient stellar engines start to fire up, the pylons begin to thrum… And then, Chaos comes. The nemesis of the Old Ones - the ancient enemy - emerges from the jungle, desperate to stop the radiance of an Old One being summoned and imbued within the banner of the Solar-City. Lord Mazdamundi turns from the preparations, ready to defend at all costs.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The so-called lions of Bretonnia are feeble kittens. Have them murdered.

missions.localised_description: The so-called lions of Bretonnia are feeble kittens. Have them murdered.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Hunt this Gor and take its filthy head!

missions.localised_description: Hunt this Gor and take its filthy head!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Northmen often mistake us as fellow peons to their dark masters. A reminder is needed that the Druchii answer to no one.

missions.localised_description: The Northmen often mistake us as fellow peons to their dark masters. A reminder is needed that the Druchii answer to no one.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As the Dreadlords bicker they send their Khainite servants into the night.

missions.localised_description: As the Dreadlords bicker they send their Khainite servants into the night.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The stunted whisker-hoarder has crossed us - Khaine's wrath upon him!

missions.localised_description: The stunted whisker-hoarder has crossed us - Khaine's wrath upon him!

localised_description.last_approved_text: These inferior creatures do not know their place - murder their champion, spread fear amongst their feeble populace.

missions.localised_description: These inferior creatures do not know their place - murder their champion, spread fear amongst their feeble populace.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Find the Greenskin beast that threatens our plans and sanction his life, as sacrifice to Khaine!

missions.localised_description: Find the Greenskin beast that threatens our plans and sanction his life, as sacrifice to Khaine!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Seek out the Ulthuan cur that frustrates us - take their life and crush their waystone!

missions.localised_description: Seek out the Ulthuan cur that frustrates us - take their life and crush their waystone!

localised_description.last_approved_text: An amphibian of the south dares to frustrate the plans of the Witch King; swift reprisal is called for.

missions.localised_description: An amphibian of the south dares to frustrate the plans of the Witch King; swift reprisal is called for.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The vermin think themselves competent assassins - they have no idea!

missions.localised_description: The vermin think themselves competent assassins - they have no idea!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Dark Magic spinner thinks himself immune from murder simply because he is already dead. Prove him wrong!

missions.localised_description: This Dark Magic spinner thinks himself immune from murder simply because he is already dead. Prove him wrong!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Tree-dwellers of the east may think us cousins, but familial blood will not save this target.

missions.localised_description: The Tree-dwellers of the east may think us cousins, but familial blood will not save this target.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The fragile mayflies that worship the lake-hag think their lands safe… think them protected… they are not.

missions.localised_description: The fragile mayflies that worship the lake-hag think their lands safe… think them protected… they are not.

localised_description.last_approved_text: It is time to draw fresh borders in our chill lands. The map will be drawn in the blood of enemies.

missions.localised_description: It is time to draw fresh borders in our chill lands. The map will be drawn in the blood of enemies.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The mountain halls of the Dawi are the remnants of a dying race - time to put them out of their misery.

missions.localised_description: The mountain halls of the Dawi are the remnants of a dying race - time to put them out of their misery.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The throne of man is fragile and can be easily shattered. Send the ravagers west!

missions.localised_description: The throne of man is fragile and can be easily shattered. Send the ravagers west!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Greenskin lands are arid and worthless, there is no reason to take them other than spite. Never let it be said the Druchii lack this worthy attribute.

missions.localised_description: The Greenskin lands are arid and worthless, there is no reason to take them other than spite. Never let it be said the Druchii lack this worthy attribute.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A worthy mission, one that has been issued before and will be again. Take the realms of the feeble Asur!

missions.localised_description: A worthy mission, one that has been issued before and will be again. Take the realms of the feeble Asur!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Lizardmen hoard great power in their humid, sweltering jungle hovels. We must seek it out, plunder and enslave!

missions.localised_description: The Lizardmen hoard great power in their humid, sweltering jungle hovels. We must seek it out, plunder and enslave!

localised_description.last_approved_text: As distasteful as it is, we must take the Under-lairs away from the vermin. They no longer need them.

missions.localised_description: As distasteful as it is, we must take the Under-lairs away from the vermin. They no longer need them.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The tomb castles of the dead, and the fell lands surrounding them, are saturated in Dark Magic. Such power will be of use.

missions.localised_description: The tomb castles of the dead, and the fell lands surrounding them, are saturated in Dark Magic. Such power will be of use.

localised_description.last_approved_text: It is time to take the trees from the Asrai. They will resent this move above all others. Good!

missions.localised_description: It is time to take the trees from the Asrai. They will resent this move above all others. Good!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The king of the backwater realm mocks us. We will reap a toll from his people and the pretend goddess they revere.

missions.localised_description: The king of the backwater realm mocks us. We will reap a toll from his people and the pretend goddess they revere.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Cloven Ones think to make war with us. Such primitives have no idea what a true war is!

missions.localised_description: The Cloven Ones think to make war with us. Such primitives have no idea what a true war is!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The thralls of the Chaos Gods think to shackle us; it is time to put the Northmen in their place!

missions.localised_description: The thralls of the Chaos Gods think to shackle us; it is time to put the Northmen in their place!

localised_description.last_approved_text: We shall make war! Power is at stake, and the spilling of blood will put us in good stead with the God of Murder!

missions.localised_description: We shall make war! Power is at stake, and the spilling of blood will put us in good stead with the God of Murder!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This should not take long. We will wage a war upon the Dwarfs. It will be short and bloody, just like their corpses.

missions.localised_description: This should not take long. We will wage a war upon the Dwarfs. It will be short and bloody, just like their corpses.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Bring about a violent war upon the cretins of Sigmar, wreath their corpses, towns and lands in blood and fire.

missions.localised_description: Bring about a violent war upon the cretins of Sigmar, wreath their corpses, towns and lands in blood and fire.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Greenskins like war? Then we will give them it, feed them so much violence they shall choke on it!

missions.localised_description: The Greenskins like war? Then we will give them it, feed them so much violence they shall choke on it!

localised_description.last_approved_text: All other wars are a sideshow - there is only, one true war…

missions.localised_description: All other wars are a sideshow - there is only, one true war…

localised_description.last_approved_text: We make war with the reptiles. We shall show these primitive beasts how the civilised kill!

missions.localised_description: We make war with the reptiles. We shall show these primitive beasts how the civilised kill!

localised_description.last_approved_text: It is not for the vermin to dictate to us when death comes. War comes to Hruddithi whether they want it or not!

missions.localised_description: It is not for the vermin to dictate to us when death comes. War comes to Hruddithi whether they want it or not!

localised_description.last_approved_text: If the dead crave war to keep them away from the Dark Prince's embrace, then who are we to disappoint them?

missions.localised_description: If the dead crave war to keep them away from the Dark Prince's embrace, then who are we to disappoint them?

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Asrai are weak - now is the time to make war on the scions of the God of the Hunt and his ailing queen.

missions.localised_description: The Asrai are weak - now is the time to make war on the scions of the God of the Hunt and his ailing queen.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Your mission is clear: seek out the king, or his insipid maid, and bring them low. Murder them in Khaine's name!

missions.localised_description: Your mission is clear: seek out the king, or his insipid maid, and bring them low. Murder them in Khaine's name!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Beastlord taunts you. To kill it in delicious battle will show the consequences of mocking the Druchii.

missions.localised_description: The Beastlord taunts you. To kill it in delicious battle will show the consequences of mocking the Druchii.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Dark Gods send their Champions to test us. Hunt them down in battle and show the Dark Gods what true warriorhood is.

missions.localised_description: The Dark Gods send their Champions to test us. Hunt them down in battle and show the Dark Gods what true warriorhood is.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Who is Khaine's favoured? There is only way to find the answer…

missions.localised_description: Who is Khaine's favoured? There is only way to find the answer…

localised_description.last_approved_text: Take the crown off the fat fool's head… but only when the Dawi cretin is a tiny, lumpen corpse.

missions.localised_description: Take the crown off the fat fool's head… but only when the Dawi cretin is a tiny, lumpen corpse.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The leaders of mankind's broken empire are foolish indeed to challenge your might. Meet them in battle and show them why!

missions.localised_description: The leaders of mankind's broken empire are foolish indeed to challenge your might. Meet them in battle and show them why!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Such beasts waste our time, distracting us from the true cause. Make short work of their leaders and the rest will flee in terror.

missions.localised_description: Such beasts waste our time, distracting us from the true cause. Make short work of their leaders and the rest will flee in terror.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Princes of Ulthuan are our most hated foes, but to kill them in battle is not enough! Make them beg for mercy, but never give them any!

missions.localised_description: The Princes of Ulthuan are our most hated foes, but to kill them in battle is not enough! Make them beg for mercy, but never give them any!

localised_description.last_approved_text: These scaly relics of a forgotten era think themselves relevant - finish them in battle, and prove them irrelevant!

missions.localised_description: These scaly relics of a forgotten era think themselves relevant - finish them in battle, and prove them irrelevant!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Skaven fur is not prized, yet a cloak of their mangy coat made from their most powerful may amuse our gods - if only for a fleeting moment.

missions.localised_description: Skaven fur is not prized, yet a cloak of their mangy coat made from their most powerful may amuse our gods - if only for a fleeting moment.

localised_description.last_approved_text: It is laughable they think themselves nobles - they have neither the poise nor legacy. Slay them in battle - show them how true nobility behaves.

missions.localised_description: It is laughable they think themselves nobles - they have neither the poise nor legacy. Slay them in battle - show them how true nobility behaves.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This king and his tree-pet offer no threat to us - we should kill them at the height of their power and laugh as their followers weep!

missions.localised_description: This king and his tree-pet offer no threat to us - we should kill them at the height of their power and laugh as their followers weep!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The one that disguises herself as some mannish god has champions - show her how weak her chosen are. Make her followers doubt her power!

missions.localised_description: The one that disguises herself as some mannish god has champions - show her how weak her chosen are. Make her followers doubt her power!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A beast seeks a worthy challenger, but it is not worthy of us. Give it a quick death, not out of mercy - never that - but only to prove our point.

missions.localised_description: A beast seeks a worthy challenger, but it is not worthy of us. Give it a quick death, not out of mercy - never that - but only to prove our point.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Northmen dare receive a few gifts from their Gods and thinks them superior to us! There is only one answer to this insult!

missions.localised_description: The Northmen dare receive a few gifts from their Gods and thinks them superior to us! There is only one answer to this insult!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A rival thinks to usurp our progress for his own political game. The time for veiled insults has past - violence upon the battlefield is the only recourse.

missions.localised_description: A rival thinks to usurp our progress for his own political game. The time for veiled insults has past - violence upon the battlefield is the only recourse.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Let the stunted fools list their grudges. There is only one answer for such bookkeepers - to add another insult to their petty list!

missions.localised_description: Let the stunted fools list their grudges. There is only one answer for such bookkeepers - to add another insult to their petty list!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The champions of the Empire must secretly crave death, for theirs is an impotent nation. We should give them their desire.

missions.localised_description: The champions of the Empire must secretly crave death, for theirs is an impotent nation. We should give them their desire.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Orcs are loud and uncouth, lacking the merciless efficiency of the Elven race. They brag and jeer - all mouth and no action, unlike the Druchii!

missions.localised_description: Orcs are loud and uncouth, lacking the merciless efficiency of the Elven race. They brag and jeer - all mouth and no action, unlike the Druchii!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Such precious creatures, these nobles of Ulthuan! More in love with their hairstyle than their skill at arms. That is why we reap them!

missions.localised_description: Such precious creatures, these nobles of Ulthuan! More in love with their hairstyle than their skill at arms. That is why we reap them!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Who stands at the peak of the food chain? These so-called predators? I think not!

missions.localised_description: Who stands at the peak of the food chain? These so-called predators? I think not!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Skaven are rodents who forgot to walk on all-fours. They are parodies, and their champions are the greatest joke of all. Deliver the punchline!

missions.localised_description: Skaven are rodents who forgot to walk on all-fours. They are parodies, and their champions are the greatest joke of all. Deliver the punchline!

localised_description.last_approved_text: While mortals quail when faced with the Undead, see them for what they are: vessels of Dark Magic, a handy source of power when slain.

missions.localised_description: While mortals quail when faced with the Undead, see them for what they are: vessels of Dark Magic, a handy source of power when slain.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The forest is full of weeds, but there are some things weedier than the plants themselves…

missions.localised_description: The forest is full of weeds, but there are some things weedier than the plants themselves…

localised_description.last_approved_text: An army of men gallop upon on lands. When prey comes so willingly into our grasp we should not turn down such gifts.

missions.localised_description: An army of men gallop upon on lands. When prey comes so willingly into our grasp we should not turn down such gifts.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Beastmen sully our lands! Send forth the beast masters to round up this herd!

missions.localised_description: Beastmen sully our lands! Send forth the beast masters to round up this herd!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Chaos Gods send a host past the watchtowers and into our realm. They seek sacrifice, but it is they who will be placed upon the bloody altar!

missions.localised_description: The Chaos Gods send a host past the watchtowers and into our realm. They seek sacrifice, but it is they who will be placed upon the bloody altar!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A rival city sends legions in a mistaken bid for power. The Black Council will hear of this! In the meantime, the Cauldrons of Blood must be filled.

missions.localised_description: A rival city sends legions in a mistaken bid for power. The Black Council will hear of this! In the meantime, the Cauldrons of Blood must be filled.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The impotent chin-hiders have marched into realms claimed by the dynasty of Malekith. Now this Throng will surely end.

missions.localised_description: The impotent chin-hiders have marched into realms claimed by the dynasty of Malekith. Now this Throng will surely end.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Does the Emperor think to cow us with that? A few scared men? Show them why this is such cruel folly.

missions.localised_description: Does the Emperor think to cow us with that? A few scared men? Show them why this is such cruel folly.

localised_description.last_approved_text: An Orc force blunders into our realm - turn it back or turn it inside out!

missions.localised_description: An Orc force blunders into our realm - turn it back or turn it inside out!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Asur dare to trespass - Ulthuan is not enough for them. Find and slay their solitary host!

missions.localised_description: The Asur dare to trespass - Ulthuan is not enough for them. Find and slay their solitary host!

localised_description.last_approved_text: These fools make vows they cannot keep - an errantry war against the Druchii is doomed to failure. Make it so.

missions.localised_description: These fools make vows they cannot keep - an errantry war against the Druchii is doomed to failure. Make it so.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Beastmen invade, but this brayherd will be guided only to its death!

missions.localised_description: The Beastmen invade, but this brayherd will be guided only to its death!

localised_description.last_approved_text: And so the Dark Gods send their thralls. However, we have seen such invasions before and this one is no different, despite what their Everchosen deems.

missions.localised_description: And so the Dark Gods send their thralls. However, we have seen such invasions before and this one is no different, despite what their Everchosen deems.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Black Council is dissolved - for now at least, there is war in Naggaroth until Destroyer is unsheathed…

missions.localised_description: The Black Council is dissolved - for now at least, there is war in Naggaroth until Destroyer is unsheathed…

localised_description.last_approved_text: That little dalliance a few millennia back between the Dwarfs and the Asur is nothing compared to the hurt we will meter out!

missions.localised_description: That little dalliance a few millennia back between the Dwarfs and the Asur is nothing compared to the hurt we will meter out!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Empire dares to invade our realm? It is as unthinkable as it is ridiculous! Unleash the legions, halt this madness and bring back a fat tally of slaves!

missions.localised_description: The Empire dares to invade our realm? It is as unthinkable as it is ridiculous! Unleash the legions, halt this madness and bring back a fat tally of slaves!

localised_description.last_approved_text: One of the Greenskins' fell gods has sent his scum into our realms. Drive them out!
