missions.localised_description: Spiky Dark Elves are hard to kill and even more difficult to eat - lots of spikes to get stuck in throat and between teeth. Even so, it should be done.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Nothing makes the Clanrats chitter more than seeing a dead Dwarf-thing. Keep your Clanrats on-side by getting your best Dwarf-killing helmet on…

missions.localised_description: Nothing makes the Clanrats chitter more than seeing a dead Dwarf-thing. Keep your Clanrats on-side by getting your best Dwarf-killing helmet on…

localised_description.last_approved_text: Seek out the Man-thing in battle and escort him to his doooom!

missions.localised_description: Seek out the Man-thing in battle and escort him to his doooom!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Time for the no-fur Green-things to die. A dagger in the eye of their leader should start things off nicely.

missions.localised_description: Time for the no-fur Green-things to die. A dagger in the eye of their leader should start things off nicely.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Tall. Smug. Fragile. Elf-things are all these, yes-yes! Time to bring these insufferable Elf-things low. Kill their tallest, purest and watch the others cry-cry!

missions.localised_description: Tall. Smug. Fragile. Elf-things are all these, yes-yes! Time to bring these insufferable Elf-things low. Kill their tallest, purest and watch the others cry-cry!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Reptile-things are dominated by the Toad-things - kill them in battle and the serpent-worshippers will run.

missions.localised_description: The Reptile-things are dominated by the Toad-things - kill them in battle and the serpent-worshippers will run.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Another rival - one that wants everything you have acquired-stolen arises. Ensure this creature knows you are the most potent!

missions.localised_description: Another rival - one that wants everything you have acquired-stolen arises. Ensure this creature knows you are the most potent!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The blood-sucking Dead-thing thinks to challenge us. When it turns its rotten back, strike!

missions.localised_description: The blood-sucking Dead-thing thinks to challenge us. When it turns its rotten back, strike!

localised_description.last_approved_text: There's a pointy-eared Elf-thing that doubts your existence. Show it what is real!

missions.localised_description: There's a pointy-eared Elf-thing that doubts your existence. Show it what is real!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Man-things fond of riding the Nag-things charge into our realms. Confront them.

missions.localised_description: The Man-things fond of riding the Nag-things charge into our realms. Confront them.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Beast-things dare hunt in out territory - show them who is really hunted!

missions.localised_description: The Beast-things dare hunt in out territory - show them who is really hunted!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Spiky-things of enemy Gods send an army against us. Intercept - yes-yes!

missions.localised_description: Spiky-things of enemy Gods send an army against us. Intercept - yes-yes!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Spiky-Elf-Things have an army pouncing about our realm. The Grey Seers want it intercepted - do it.

missions.localised_description: The Spiky-Elf-Things have an army pouncing about our realm. The Grey Seers want it intercepted - do it.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Dwarf-things dare send an army of beards into our realm - they think it's their realm, no-no!

missions.localised_description: The Dwarf-things dare send an army of beards into our realm - they think it's their realm, no-no!

localised_description.last_approved_text: An army of Man-things approaches. Are you hungry?

missions.localised_description: An army of Man-things approaches. Are you hungry?

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Green-things have sent a mob against us. Fool-fools! Show them no mercy!

missions.localised_description: The Green-things have sent a mob against us. Fool-fools! Show them no mercy!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Here come the Elf-things. Think they can just wander around Skaven territory. Bite their knees off!

missions.localised_description: Here come the Elf-things. Think they can just wander around Skaven territory. Bite their knees off!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The armies of the Hag-thing that squats in horrible clean water sends the Man-things against us. Fight back!

missions.localised_description: The armies of the Hag-thing that squats in horrible clean water sends the Man-things against us. Fight back!

localised_description.last_approved_text: We have plans-schemes to perform and the Hoof-things are a distraction - let them come, then wipe them out!

missions.localised_description: We have plans-schemes to perform and the Hoof-things are a distraction - let them come, then wipe them out!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Gods that war with the Horned Rat send their minions against His children. We must not fail the Horned One!

missions.localised_description: The Gods that war with the Horned Rat send their minions against His children. We must not fail the Horned One!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Elf-thing reavers come - we must enslave them before then enslave us!

missions.localised_description: The Elf-thing reavers come - we must enslave them before then enslave us!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Dwarf-things come! Take their heads, take their beards, eat their corpses! No mercy for the hated Beard-things!

missions.localised_description: The Dwarf-things come! Take their heads, take their beards, eat their corpses! No mercy for the hated Beard-things!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Man-things dare-dare to invade us? We are their nightmares made real - repel and revenge, yes-yes!

missions.localised_description: The Man-things dare-dare to invade us? We are their nightmares made real - repel and revenge, yes-yes!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Greenskins send a tide to invade our realms. We will out-breed and overwhelm them. Summon the Vermintide!

missions.localised_description: The Greenskins send a tide to invade our realms. We will out-breed and overwhelm them. Summon the Vermintide!

localised_description.last_approved_text: By the Horned Rat's Teeth, the Elf-things dare to invade - an outrage that must be stopped!

missions.localised_description: By the Horned Rat's Teeth, the Elf-things dare to invade - an outrage that must be stopped!

localised_description.last_approved_text: One of the prophecy's etched into the Black Pillar state how the Serpent-God's long tongue will come for the Skaven. And they must be ready.

missions.localised_description: One of the prophecy's etched into the Black Pillar state how the Serpent-God's long tongue will come for the Skaven. And they must be ready.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Civil war… again. Another clan wants our Warpstone. We should take theirs instead!

missions.localised_description: Civil war… again. Another clan wants our Warpstone. We should take theirs instead!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Vampires and their Dead-things invade. After our Warpstone to power their magicks. Stop them-them!

missions.localised_description: The Vampires and their Dead-things invade. After our Warpstone to power their magicks. Stop them-them!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Trees send their roots into our tunnels. The Elf-things and their wood-spirit allies invade. Gnaw at their roots!

missions.localised_description: Trees send their roots into our tunnels. The Elf-things and their wood-spirit allies invade. Gnaw at their roots!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Lizard-things send a force to thwart our plans. Intercept and destroy, yes-yes!

missions.localised_description: The Lizard-things send a force to thwart our plans. Intercept and destroy, yes-yes!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Another clan sends a pack of their Clanrats into our territory. To leave them would be to show weakness…

missions.localised_description: Another clan sends a pack of their Clanrats into our territory. To leave them would be to show weakness…

localised_description.last_approved_text: Dead-things come. Their trespass is a grave error indeed.

missions.localised_description: Dead-things come. Their trespass is a grave error indeed.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Elf-things march a host into our realm! They must be punished, yes-yes!

missions.localised_description: The Elf-things march a host into our realm! They must be punished, yes-yes!

localised_description.last_approved_text: We need an alliance! Make a pact, after all, no other race is as loyal and dependable as us, yes-yes!

missions.localised_description: We need an alliance! Make a pact, after all, no other race is as loyal and dependable as us, yes-yes!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Raid the Man-things - kill their warriors, take their valuables and steal their children!

missions.localised_description: Raid the Man-things - kill their warriors, take their valuables and steal their children!

localised_description.last_approved_text: They think they are good-good at taking slaves? Will shall show them-them!

missions.localised_description: They think they are good-good at taking slaves? Will shall show them-them!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Underway is ours by right - take it from the Dwarf-things!

missions.localised_description: The Underway is ours by right - take it from the Dwarf-things!

localised_description.last_approved_text: It is time to reap what the Man-things have sewn. Raid their lands and bring it back to the Under-Empire.

missions.localised_description: It is time to reap what the Man-things have sewn. Raid their lands and bring it back to the Under-Empire.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Green-things are of limited use, but Clan Moulder always has needs of spare specimens. Go and raid their lands.

missions.localised_description: The Green-things are of limited use, but Clan Moulder always has needs of spare specimens. Go and raid their lands.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Elf-things' lands are said to be incorruptible… we shall see-see about that!

missions.localised_description: The Elf-things' lands are said to be incorruptible… we shall see-see about that!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Sotek's slime-covered lands are ours. Clan Pestilens resurgent - yes-yes!

missions.localised_description: Sotek's slime-covered lands are ours. Clan Pestilens resurgent - yes-yes!

localised_description.last_approved_text: More Warpstone is needed - we shall take-steal it from rivals. The Lords of Decay will never know.

missions.localised_description: More Warpstone is needed - we shall take-steal it from rivals. The Lords of Decay will never know.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Go into the realm of the Dead-things - take-steal what we need.

missions.localised_description: Go into the realm of the Dead-things - take-steal what we need.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Invade their tree-nests - piss on their homes, scat and scavenge their forests!

missions.localised_description: Invade their tree-nests - piss on their homes, scat and scavenge their forests!

localised_description.last_approved_text: More rats are needed. Whip the breeders into action. Grow our forces - engorge the packs for battle.

missions.localised_description: More rats are needed. Whip the breeders into action. Grow our forces - engorge the packs for battle.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Make the Man-things and their Hag-thing god quail, despoil their lakes and burn their cities to the ground!

missions.localised_description: Make the Man-things and their Hag-thing god quail, despoil their lakes and burn their cities to the ground!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The spiky Elf-things look down their fleshy muzzles at us! Bring ruin on their towers.

missions.localised_description: The spiky Elf-things look down their fleshy muzzles at us! Bring ruin on their towers.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Bring about destruction upon the stone nests of the Dwarf-things. It is as we have always done-done!

missions.localised_description: Bring about destruction upon the stone nests of the Dwarf-things. It is as we have always done-done!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Man-things choose to forget what we did in Nuln, years ago. They will believe in us after this!

missions.localised_description: The Man-things choose to forget what we did in Nuln, years ago. They will believe in us after this!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Orc-thing infestation goes beyond annoying - scour their settlements from the surface.

missions.localised_description: The Orc-thing infestation goes beyond annoying - scour their settlements from the surface.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Burn and break the gleaming towers of the Elf-things. Make them cry pretty tears!

missions.localised_description: Burn and break the gleaming towers of the Elf-things. Make them cry pretty tears!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The homes of the Reptile-things cannot just be plundered - they need to be destroyed.

missions.localised_description: The homes of the Reptile-things cannot just be plundered - they need to be destroyed.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This clan has proven a weak enemy - enslave their Clanrats and burn their nests. All their Warpstone is now ours!

missions.localised_description: This clan has proven a weak enemy - enslave their Clanrats and burn their nests. All their Warpstone is now ours!

localised_description.last_approved_text: These dead-things are weak. Invade their realm take their Dark Magic, burn their books-tomes! Good-good.

missions.localised_description: These dead-things are weak. Invade their realm take their Dark Magic, burn their books-tomes! Good-good.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Cut down the trees of the Elf-things. And destroy the rest - make it perfect for-for Skaven occupation.

missions.localised_description: Cut down the trees of the Elf-things. And destroy the rest - make it perfect for-for Skaven occupation.

localised_description.last_approved_text: We need arcane might. Clan Skryre have Warlock Engineers they are willing to-to lend, if we meet their price.

missions.localised_description: We need arcane might. Clan Skryre have Warlock Engineers they are willing to-to lend, if we meet their price.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Time to call upon Clan Eshin and petition for a killer.

missions.localised_description: Time to call upon Clan Eshin and petition for a killer.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Plague Priests sing a hymn of death. Persuade them to your cause.

missions.localised_description: The Plague Priests sing a hymn of death. Persuade them to your cause.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Bolster your pack with a Warp-lightning Cannon and watch the enemy scuttle away!

missions.localised_description: Bolster your pack with a Warp-lightning Cannon and watch the enemy scuttle away!

localised_description.last_approved_text: To toughen your battle line, breed more of the black-furred Stormvermin.

missions.localised_description: To toughen your battle line, breed more of the black-furred Stormvermin.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Runners that fill the ranks of Clan Eshin can strike target's from afar. Before the enemies whiskers can even twitch.

missions.localised_description: The Runners that fill the ranks of Clan Eshin can strike target's from afar. Before the enemies whiskers can even twitch.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Clan Moulder demand a hefty price, but it is worth every Warptoken… bring forth the Abomination!

missions.localised_description: Clan Moulder demand a hefty price, but it is worth every Warptoken… bring forth the Abomination!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The stunt-rats that pilot the Doomwheels are ready - they just need their mounts…

missions.localised_description: The stunt-rats that pilot the Doomwheels are ready - they just need their mounts…

localised_description.last_approved_text: Kroq-Gar has been handed a task most illustrious and most grave by Mazdamundi - to prosecute the destruction of all those not part of the Old Ones Great Plan. There can be no Plan whilst they yet live, so Kroq-Gar's knows his mission is vital.

missions.localised_description: Kroq-Gar has been handed a task most illustrious and most grave by Mazdamundi - to prosecute the destruction of all those not part of the Old Ones Great Plan. There can be no Plan whilst they yet live, so Kroq-Gar's knows his mission is vital.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter I: From Rubble We Begin…

missions.localised_title: Chapter I: From Rubble We Begin…

localised_description.last_approved_text: Lustria lies largely in ruin, thanks to the Great Catastrophe. In the times that follow, warm-blooded men and beasts have settled upon the continent; they have no right to the sacred land they occupy. They must be expelled!

missions.localised_description: Lustria lies largely in ruin, thanks to the Great Catastrophe. In the times that follow, warm-blooded men and beasts have settled upon the continent; they have no right to the sacred land they occupy. They must be expelled!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Lustria is a land of a Lizardmen past; a ruined civilisation, left to be reclaimed by the jungles. It is an outrage and an insult, then, when malfeasant men and heathenish rats make a home amongst the rubble. Put simply, they must all be evicted.

missions.localised_description: Lustria is a land of a Lizardmen past; a ruined civilisation, left to be reclaimed by the jungles. It is an outrage and an insult, then, when malfeasant men and heathenish rats make a home amongst the rubble. Put simply, they must all be evicted.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter III: Fury of the Vengeful

missions.localised_title: Chapter III: Fury of the Vengeful

localised_description.last_approved_text: Kroq-Gar is borne aloft by a centuries-old rage, a fury that was instilled in him by the Great Catastrophe and the coming of Chaos. The fury of those lost at Xhotl will never ebb, and Kroq-Qar will never stop pursuing those responsible.

missions.localised_description: Kroq-Gar is borne aloft by a centuries-old rage, a fury that was instilled in him by the Great Catastrophe and the coming of Chaos. The fury of those lost at Xhotl will never ebb, and Kroq-Qar will never stop pursuing those responsible.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter IV: Call of the Jungle

missions.localised_title: Chapter IV: Call of the Jungle

localised_description.last_approved_text: Every insult that the Lizardmen have been dealt by Chaos, by man, by the snivelling Skaven - all will be repaid tenfold. Every lair they hide in will be crushed, every settlement burned, every defiled temple reclaimed.

missions.localised_description: Every insult that the Lizardmen have been dealt by Chaos, by man, by the snivelling Skaven - all will be repaid tenfold. Every lair they hide in will be crushed, every settlement burned, every defiled temple reclaimed.

localised_description.last_approved_text: From the bowels of the earth, the Skaven rise, an inescapable tide of pestilent destruction. It is the Skaven's desire to reclaim the world from the surface-dwellers, and they will do so in an unending tide of skittering claws and jagged teeth.

missions.localised_description: From the bowels of the earth, the Skaven rise, an inescapable tide of pestilent destruction. It is the Skaven's desire to reclaim the world from the surface-dwellers, and they will do so in an unending tide of skittering claws and jagged teeth.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Skaven once decreed that never again would they be brought low by their own imperfect creations. Such a flawed device nearly led to their eradication in Skavenblight. Since then, it is decreed they should spread the world over, and so they have.

missions.localised_description: The Skaven once decreed that never again would they be brought low by their own imperfect creations. Such a flawed device nearly led to their eradication in Skavenblight. Since then, it is decreed they should spread the world over, and so they have.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Although the Under-Empire is seemingly endless, it is not a squalid subterranean life the Skaven desire. Filled with bile and hatred for the surface-dwellers, they desire to spread across the surface like locusts, and claim what they believe to be theirs.

missions.localised_description: Although the Under-Empire is seemingly endless, it is not a squalid subterranean life the Skaven desire. Filled with bile and hatred for the surface-dwellers, they desire to spread across the surface like locusts, and claim what they believe to be theirs.

localised_description.last_approved_text: It is only the Dwarfs who understand the threat of the Skaven, for every other race does not believe in that which they cannot see. Yet even the mountain-dwellers cannot grasp the true enormity of the threat they encounter in the Underway; for there are always more Skaven...

missions.localised_description: It is only the Dwarfs who understand the threat of the Skaven, for every other race does not believe in that which they cannot see. Yet even the mountain-dwellers cannot grasp the true enormity of the threat they encounter in the Underway; for there are always more Skaven...

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Under Empire is vast, and the Skaven desires for war with the surface dwellers is strong. Beneath every city, lies a verminous lair - eternal strongholds of the ratmen. Each and every one will be used, one day, to bring vile destruction the world over.

missions.localised_description: The Under Empire is vast, and the Skaven desires for war with the surface dwellers is strong. Beneath every city, lies a verminous lair - eternal strongholds of the ratmen. Each and every one will be used, one day, to bring vile destruction the world over.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The frozen lands of Naggaroth are a far cry from the glittering beauty of Ulthuan, but it is the Druchii home now. So, they will claim as much of it as possible, and forge a new kingdom from the chilled wastes.

missions.localised_description: The frozen lands of Naggaroth are a far cry from the glittering beauty of Ulthuan, but it is the Druchii home now. So, they will claim as much of it as possible, and forge a new kingdom from the chilled wastes.

localised_description.last_approved_text: It was by the Druchii's hands that the Sundering was brought about. Malekith's forces duelled with the Asur for control of the Great Vortex, and the struggle resulted in a savage cataclysm that rend the world asunder. Malekith would see that again, if he could.

missions.localised_description: It was by the Druchii's hands that the Sundering was brought about. Malekith's forces duelled with the Asur for control of the Great Vortex, and the struggle resulted in a savage cataclysm that rend the world asunder. Malekith would see that again, if he could.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Dark Elves made their homes in the towering Black Arks that bore them aloft to Naggaroth. Once beached, they became fortresses for the Druchii. From here, they launch expeditions into Naggaroth, to explore and conquer the frozen land.

missions.localised_description: The Dark Elves made their homes in the towering Black Arks that bore them aloft to Naggaroth. Once beached, they became fortresses for the Druchii. From here, they launch expeditions into Naggaroth, to explore and conquer the frozen land.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter III: Wrecked Ships and Chill

missions.localised_title: Chapter III: Wrecked Ships and Chill

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Merciless Host marches with a relentless cadence, beating out a drumbeat to destruction. From the rank and file soldiery to the terrifying and imposing beasts of war, all are aligned with Malekith's singular vision of destruction.

missions.localised_description: The Merciless Host marches with a relentless cadence, beating out a drumbeat to destruction. From the rank and file soldiery to the terrifying and imposing beasts of war, all are aligned with Malekith's singular vision of destruction.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Dark Elves were born to rule over others; strength begets strength, and that strength confers power over the weak; dominion over those unable to stop them. Any Druchii not strong enough to dominate others is fit only for death.

missions.localised_description: The Dark Elves were born to rule over others; strength begets strength, and that strength confers power over the weak; dominion over those unable to stop them. Any Druchii not strong enough to dominate others is fit only for death.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter V: Burn it. Burn it All!

missions.localised_title: Chapter V: Burn it. Burn it All!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Whilst other, lesser creatures think in minutes and hours, Mazdamundi contemplates in centuries. His plans are beyond temporal comprehension, and now, with great deliberation, moves to war. For Mazdamundi sees the wheel of time, and endeavours to turn it himself.

missions.localised_description: Whilst other, lesser creatures think in minutes and hours, Mazdamundi contemplates in centuries. His plans are beyond temporal comprehension, and now, with great deliberation, moves to war. For Mazdamundi sees the wheel of time, and endeavours to turn it himself.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter I: From Rubble We Begin...

missions.localised_title: Chapter I: From Rubble We Begin...

localised_description.last_approved_text: The history of the Lizardmen is written in blood; great volumes of war that have left their mark on land and lizard alike. War is all-consuming for Mazdamundi; only through relentless military undertaking can Chaos be kept at bay, and the Great Plan realised.

missions.localised_description: The history of the Lizardmen is written in blood; great volumes of war that have left their mark on land and lizard alike. War is all-consuming for Mazdamundi; only through relentless military undertaking can Chaos be kept at bay, and the Great Plan realised.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The onslaught of Chaos, and time, have made ruins of so many of the Lustrian temples. As the jungle attempts to reclaim them, so too do others. This cannot be allowed. If the Lizardmen cannot reclaim their homes, they should be destroyed.

missions.localised_description: The onslaught of Chaos, and time, have made ruins of so many of the Lustrian temples. As the jungle attempts to reclaim them, so too do others. This cannot be allowed. If the Lizardmen cannot reclaim their homes, they should be destroyed.

localised_description.last_approved_text: So much was lost in the Great Catastrophe; Chupayotl collapsed into the sea, whilst the city of gold was taken by the Skaven. Now, what is able to be reclaimed, must be reclaimed, and Mazdamundi will see it done. For the Old Ones are surely watching…

missions.localised_description: So much was lost in the Great Catastrophe; Chupayotl collapsed into the sea, whilst the city of gold was taken by the Skaven. Now, what is able to be reclaimed, must be reclaimed, and Mazdamundi will see it done. For the Old Ones are surely watching…

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Old Ones created the Lizardmen as the chosen race, favoured and nurtured by their celestial masters. Others may be permitted, but not at the expense of the Lizardmen. The Slann know this, and must eradicate any that harbour dark desires upon Lustrian ideals.

missions.localised_description: The Old Ones created the Lizardmen as the chosen race, favoured and nurtured by their celestial masters. Others may be permitted, but not at the expense of the Lizardmen. The Slann know this, and must eradicate any that harbour dark desires upon Lustrian ideals.

Malekith's forces duelled with the Asur for control of the Great Vortex, and the struggle resulted in a savage cataclysm that rend the world asunder. Malekith would see that again, if he could.

Yet even the mountain-dwellers cannot grasp the true enormity of the threat they encounter in the Underway; for there are always more Skaven...

localised_description.last_approved_text: This world was once the dominion of the High Elves; now they are brought to lesser significance in the twilight of their race. Yet their fury and pride have not diminished - from Ulthuan, the High Elves continue to strike out at their enemies, in defence of the world.

missions.localised_description: This world was once the dominion of the High Elves; now they are brought to lesser significance in the twilight of their race. Yet their fury and pride have not diminished - from Ulthuan, the High Elves continue to strike out at their enemies, in defence of the world.

localised_description.last_approved_text: After the Sundering, too much was allowed to fall into Druchii hands, and so much else slipped into the oceans. What cannot be saved, must be destroyed, and the enemies of Ulthuan hounded to the ends of the earth!

missions.localised_description: After the Sundering, too much was allowed to fall into Druchii hands, and so much else slipped into the oceans. What cannot be saved, must be destroyed, and the enemies of Ulthuan hounded to the ends of the earth!

localised_description.last_approved_text: There are enemies of the Asur everywhere, and enemies of the Asur are enemies of the world itself. To the west, the Dark Elves plot the destruction of all life, so corrupted have they become. They, and their ilk, cannot be suffered to survive!

missions.localised_description: There are enemies of the Asur everywhere, and enemies of the Asur are enemies of the world itself. To the west, the Dark Elves plot the destruction of all life, so corrupted have they become. They, and their ilk, cannot be suffered to survive!

localised_description.last_approved_text: If Ulthuan is to be free, to know peace, or to regain a semblance of its former glory, then all enemies must be expelled from the land, and then pursued to their source and destroyed.

missions.localised_description: If Ulthuan is to be free, to know peace, or to regain a semblance of its former glory, then all enemies must be expelled from the land, and then pursued to their source and destroyed.

localised_description.last_approved_text: At the heart of Ulthuan lies the Vortex; a dimensional rift that, through the actions of the High Elves, holds the world together. If the Vortex falls - as some would see it do - then the world will be ripped apart. All enemies of the Vortex must therefore be vanquished!

missions.localised_description: At the heart of Ulthuan lies the Vortex; a dimensional rift that, through the actions of the High Elves, holds the world together. If the Vortex falls - as some would see it do - then the world will be ripped apart. All enemies of the Vortex must therefore be vanquished!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This world was once the dominion of the High Elves; now they are brought to lesser significance in the twilight of their race. Yet their fury and pride have not diminished - from Ulthuan, the High Elves continue to strike out at their enemies, in defence of the world.

missions.localised_description: This world was once the dominion of the High Elves; now they are brought to lesser significance in the twilight of their race. Yet their fury and pride have not diminished - from Ulthuan, the High Elves continue to strike out at their enemies, in defence of the world.

localised_description.last_approved_text: After the Sundering, too much was allowed to fall into Druchii hands, and so much else slipped into the oceans. What cannot be saved must be destroyed, and the enemies of Ulthuan hounded to the ends of the earth.

missions.localised_description: After the Sundering, too much was allowed to fall into Druchii hands, and so much else slipped into the oceans. What cannot be saved must be destroyed, and the enemies of Ulthuan hounded to the ends of the earth.

localised_description.last_approved_text: There are enemies of the Asur everywhere, and enemies of the Asur are enemies of the world itself. To the west, the Dark Elves plot the destruction of all life, so corrupted have they become. They, and their ilk, cannot be suffered to survive.

missions.localised_description: There are enemies of the Asur everywhere, and enemies of the Asur are enemies of the world itself. To the west, the Dark Elves plot the destruction of all life, so corrupted have they become. They, and their ilk, cannot be suffered to survive.

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Grand Prince of Clan Mors! Greatest champion with longest tail! My master, Grey Seer Vulscreek, has sent me in his stead - he knows of your-your dislike of Grey Seers. If I may be so humble to pass on a message… he tasks you take the whole province from the Elf-things."\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "Grand Prince of Clan Mors! Greatest champion with longest tail! My master, Grey Seer Vulscreek, has sent me in his stead - he knows of your-your dislike of Grey Seers. If I may be so humble to pass on a message… he tasks you take the whole province from the Elf-things."\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Indolent you are-are! You have let a greater clan take the Warpstone we-we need. Now you must go to war steal it back. I shall go and bribe-treaty with Clan Moulder. We will need them later. But for now-now, kill-maim - capture caverns of Sotek!"\n\nLearn more about ritual resource sites [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_resource_sites]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_resource_sites}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "Indolent you are-are! You have let a greater clan take the Warpstone we-we need. Now you must go to war steal it back. I shall go and bribe-treaty with Clan Moulder. We will need them later. But for now-now, kill-maim - capture caverns of Sotek!"\n\nLearn more about ritual resource sites [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_resource_sites]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_resource_sites}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Pathetic! The Council assign you down here – at my insistence – and already the stench of failure surrounds you! Kill-kill the Elf -things in our way. Take-take that settlement, spray it with your scent. Clan Mors must reign here."\n\nLearn more about settlements [[url:script_link_campaign_settlements]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_settlements}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "Pathetic! The Council assign you down here – at my insistence – and already the stench of failure surrounds you! Kill-kill the Elf -things in our way. Take-take that settlement, spray it with your scent. Clan Mors must reign here."\n\nLearn more about settlements [[url:script_link_campaign_settlements]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_settlements}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Such magnificence - all shall tremble before Queek! Act quickly, my master. Locate the Warpstone deposit and start mining it, yes-yes!"\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "Such magnificence - all shall tremble before Queek! Act quickly, my master. Locate the Warpstone deposit and start mining it, yes-yes!"\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Such idle whiskers! Get to work, fool! Secrets to be found, new knowledge, new innovations to be discovered that you must only share with me-me! Build this thing so research can begin!"\n\nLearn more about technologies [[url:script_link_campaign_technology]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_technology}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "Such idle whiskers! Get to work, fool! Secrets to be found, new knowledge, new innovations to be discovered that you must only share with me-me! Build this thing so research can begin!"\n\nLearn more about technologies [[url:script_link_campaign_technology]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_technology}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "I need more-more Warpstone. That what I summon demands a high tribute! Now other things see the Vortex is weak and seek to snatch it from us-us. Quickly, fools! Collect more Warpstone."\n\nLearn more about ritual currency [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_currency]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_currency}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "I need more-more Warpstone. That what I summon demands a high tribute! Now other things see the Vortex is weak and seek to snatch it from us-us. Quickly, fools! Collect more Warpstone."\n\nLearn more about ritual currency [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_currency]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_currency}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "At last! Now I see what Warlord Gnawdwell sees in you-you. The Elf-things die. Now utterly purge them from this realm!"\n\nLearn more about factions [[url:script_link_campaign_factions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_factions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "At last! Now I see what Warlord Gnawdwell sees in you-you. The Elf-things die. Now utterly purge them from this realm!"\n\nLearn more about factions [[url:script_link_campaign_factions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_factions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Most potent of warriors – you are the Right Claw of Warlord Gnawdwell for good reason, mighty Queek! The province is-is yours. The vermin of Clan Mors await your Commandment."\n\nLearn more about commandments [[url:script_link_campaign_commandments]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_commandments}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "Most potent of warriors – you are the Right Claw of Warlord Gnawdwell for good reason, mighty Queek! The province is-is yours. The vermin of Clan Mors await your Commandment."\n\nLearn more about commandments [[url:script_link_campaign_commandments]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_commandments}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "It is time, Warlord Queek. Enact the Ritual of Dark Scrying, yes-yes!"\n\nLearn more about rituals [[url:script_link_campaign_rituals]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rituals}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "It is time, Warlord Queek. Enact the Ritual of Dark Scrying, yes-yes!"\n\nLearn more about rituals [[url:script_link_campaign_rituals]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rituals}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Your minion is waiting for their first mission, master. Make it a good one!"\n\nLearn more about heroic actions [[url:script_link_campaign_hero_actions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_hero_actions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "Your minion is waiting for their first mission, master. Make it a good one!"\n\nLearn more about heroic actions [[url:script_link_campaign_hero_actions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_hero_actions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Lord-master, this plan to take the Vortex… there are plenty of opportunities for failure and blame. Build things to lure ‘heroes’. If they perform well, the glory is yours for-for recruiting them… If they fail, then they take the blame, yes-yes!"\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "Lord-master, this plan to take the Vortex… there are plenty of opportunities for failure and blame. Build things to lure ‘heroes’. If they perform well, the glory is yours for-for recruiting them… If they fail, then they take the blame, yes-yes!"\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Felicitous news, great one. Facilities are now in place to summon minion-puppets. Begin at once to strengthen your reach across the Southlands!"\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "Felicitous news, great one. Facilities are now in place to summon minion-puppets. Begin at once to strengthen your reach across the Southlands!"\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Careful, Queek. There are plots in Skavenblight, the Lords of Decay play their game and you are a piece. I will-will guide you, yes-yes! There are factions that want you at war with the Lizard-things - confound them, by making treaty-pact of no-fight! Then we strike later, when their eyes swivel elsewhere!"\n\nLearn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_non_aggression_pacts}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "Careful, Queek. There are plots in Skavenblight, the Lords of Decay play their game and you are a piece. I will-will guide you, yes-yes! There are factions that want you at war with the Lizard-things - confound them, by making treaty-pact of no-fight! Then we strike later, when their eyes swivel elsewhere!"\n\nLearn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_non_aggression_pacts}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Master! Master! I hear them plotting… please spare this pathetic scribe, for I am your eyes and ears. That they dare move against mighty Queek shows you have been too lenient of late. Come down on them with a tail of iron! Solve your obedience issues or they will fester."\n\nLearn more about public order [[url:script_link_campaign_public_order]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_public_order}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "Master! Master! I hear them plotting… please spare this pathetic scribe, for I am your eyes and ears. That they dare move against mighty Queek shows you have been too lenient of late. Come down on them with a tail of iron! Solve your obedience issues or they will fester."\n\nLearn more about public order [[url:script_link_campaign_public_order]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_public_order}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "More-more! I need your clan infesting this vile continent. Organise more packs - raise another army, and appoint one you ‘trust’ to lead it-it!"\n\nLearn more about raising armies [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_forces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_raising_forces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "More-more! I need your clan infesting this vile continent. Organise more packs - raise another army, and appoint one you ‘trust’ to lead it-it!"\n\nLearn more about raising armies [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_forces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_raising_forces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Facilities are ready, Lord-master. Your greatest - and most ambitious - minds are poised to begin researching the thousands of ways your enemies will die. It is now for you to select which method they research first!"\n\nLearn more about technologies [[url:script_link_campaign_technology]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_technology}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "Facilities are ready, Lord-master. Your greatest - and most ambitious - minds are poised to begin researching the thousands of ways your enemies will die. It is now for you to select which method they research first!"\n\nLearn more about technologies [[url:script_link_campaign_technology]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_technology}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Man-things come! But these are not from Empire, no-no. They are lost! No masters! Uncertain times have seen a rise in such rogue forces. Kill-kill them before they frustrate our plans."\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "Man-things come! But these are not from Empire, no-no. They are lost! No masters! Uncertain times have seen a rise in such rogue forces. Kill-kill them before they frustrate our plans."\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Old dusty ruins contain Warpstone... sometimes. Other things may also hide in ruins. Search them, yes-yes, but use expendable servants. No, not me-me, I valuable!"\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_treasure_hunting]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_treasure_hunting}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "Old dusty ruins contain Warpstone... sometimes. Other things may also hide in ruins. Search them, yes-yes, but use expendable servants. No, not me-me, I valuable!"\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_treasure_hunting]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_treasure_hunting}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "We must continue this scheme with the Reptile-things, while the politics back in Skavenblight playout. To prevent the lizards getting suspicious perhaps we should deepen our ties? Trade-barter with them, yes-yes? Offer them riches, we can always take them back later."\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreements [[url:script_link_campaign_trade]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_trade}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "We must continue this scheme with the Reptile-things, while the politics back in Skavenblight playout. To prevent the lizards getting suspicious perhaps we should deepen our ties? Trade-barter with them, yes-yes? Offer them riches, we can always take them back later."\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreements [[url:script_link_campaign_trade]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_trade}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Set your engineers to-to work, upgrade your nest-burrows, I need you-you and your packs at peak proficiency to realise my plans."\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "Set your engineers to-to work, upgrade your nest-burrows, I need you-you and your packs at peak proficiency to realise my plans."\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The brood mothers’ bellies are full. New pups are being born and the burrows swell, master. We must make room, before they eat each other. Upgrade the lairs."\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

missions.localised_description: "The brood mothers’ bellies are full. New pups are being born and the burrows swell, master. We must make room, before they eat each other. Upgrade the lairs."\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: Curses! Dwarf Gouger has been stolen. Queek immediately slays two of his most trusted lieutenants, who were clearly to blame; it is irrelevant that he was the last one in possession of it! Killing his loyal followers is not enough to sate the Headtaker’s rage, so he lashes out at the closest enemies, for they are clearly the thieves… in some way. And deep down in his verminous mind he knows that keeping his horde busy will distract them from his own incompetence in losing one of Clan Mors' most priceless artefacts.

missions.localised_description: Curses! Dwarf Gouger has been stolen. Queek immediately slays two of his most trusted lieutenants, who were clearly to blame; it is irrelevant that he was the last one in possession of it! Killing his loyal followers is not enough to sate the Headtaker’s rage, so he lashes out at the closest enemies, for they are clearly the thieves… in some way. And deep down in his verminous mind he knows that keeping his horde busy will distract them from his own incompetence in losing one of Clan Mors' most priceless artefacts.

localised_description.last_approved_text: In the aftermath of Queek’s real - or maybe false - rage, one of his snivelling minions approaches and concludes that a Clan Eshin assassin was the actual thief. For a moment, Queek is tempted to rip out the messenger’s throat at this news, but realises that if he keeps killing his loyal servants he’ll run out of followers. Instead, Queek settles for a swipe with his claw, sending the inferior flying, before rearing to his full height and demanding the perpetrator must be found. He promotes the servant he has just struck to ‘chief-finder’, giving Queek a convenient scapegoat should the search prove fruitless.

missions.localised_description: In the aftermath of Queek’s real - or maybe false - rage, one of his snivelling minions approaches and concludes that a Clan Eshin assassin was the actual thief. For a moment, Queek is tempted to rip out the messenger’s throat at this news, but realises that if he keeps killing his loyal servants he’ll run out of followers. Instead, Queek settles for a swipe with his claw, sending the inferior flying, before rearing to his full height and demanding the perpetrator must be found. He promotes the servant he has just struck to ‘chief-finder’, giving Queek a convenient scapegoat should the search prove fruitless.

localised_description.last_approved_text:
Queek’s agent returns to his master. He approaches cautiously, sniffing the air to pick up what mood the Headtaker is in. As expected, Queek is impatient but stays his wrath until the ‘chief-finder’ has given his report.

 "Most vengeful of warrior-lords", begins the agent, with tail flat on the floor in a sign of submission. Queek’s whiskers twitch in appreciation at the ego-boosting address, but otherwise he remains silent and still. "The assassin-thief has deliberately fled in Dwarf territory. I suspect a trap."

Queek rises to his full height in triumph.

"I knew it! Beard-things!", he says with glee. He ignores the agent’s meek protestations that he suspects a ruse, for Queek has a battle-lust about him and immediately sends his minions scuttling forth to raise a horde as quickly as possible.

missions.localised_description:
Queek’s agent returns to his master. He approaches cautiously, sniffing the air to pick up what mood the Headtaker is in. As expected, Queek is impatient but stays his wrath until the ‘chief-finder’ has given his report.

 "Most vengeful of warrior-lords", begins the agent, with tail flat on the floor in a sign of submission. Queek’s whiskers twitch in appreciation at the ego-boosting address, but otherwise he remains silent and still. "The assassin-thief has deliberately fled in Dwarf territory. I suspect a trap."

Queek rises to his full height in triumph.

"I knew it! Beard-things!", he says with glee. He ignores the agent’s meek protestations that he suspects a ruse, for Queek has a battle-lust about him and immediately sends his minions scuttling forth to raise a horde as quickly as possible.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A Clan Mors force runs through the Underway with Queek at its head. Already the Warlord can taste the stench of the Dwarf-things on the stale air. His underling - the ‘chief-finder’ - in fear of his life, tries once more to state that it’s a trap. But Queek waves the coward away - after all, he is Queek Headtaker, what could go wrong? A messenger intercepted in an off-shoot tunnel is captured, on his way to report to the Grand Warlord himself - this was nothing but a ruse by Gnawdwell himself to keep Queek on his toes! Headtaker takes the news surprisingly well, as he relishes the opportunity to kill lots of Dwarfs and prove himself to his master!

missions.localised_description: A Clan Mors force runs through the Underway with Queek at its head. Already the Warlord can taste the stench of the Dwarf-things on the stale air. His underling - the ‘chief-finder’ - in fear of his life, tries once more to state that it’s a trap. But Queek waves the coward away - after all, he is Queek Headtaker, what could go wrong? A messenger intercepted in an off-shoot tunnel is captured, on his way to report to the Grand Warlord himself - this was nothing but a ruse by Gnawdwell himself to keep Queek on his toes! Headtaker takes the news surprisingly well, as he relishes the opportunity to kill lots of Dwarfs and prove himself to his master!

localised_description.last_approved_text:
Queek Headtaker is the Right-Claw of Warlord Gnawdwell, the chief enforcer of the utterly powerful Clan Mors. While Queek, of late, has spent much of his time in the City of Pillars, his duties as Gnawdwell’s primary intimidator have seen him scamper and skitterleap across continents.

You’d think a rat so busy and dedicated to Clan Mors’ ascendancy would have no time for some lesser rivals’ petty insults, but this is Queek...

Word has reached the Headtaker that a Warlord from a rival clan is boasting that his armour is better. Most would ignore such a slight, or mark it in their memories for vengeance at a more opportune time, but Queek abandons his current objective and puts all his energy into seeking out the liar!

missions.localised_description:
Queek Headtaker is the Right-Claw of Warlord Gnawdwell, the chief enforcer of the utterly powerful Clan Mors. While Queek, of late, has spent much of his time in the City of Pillars, his duties as Gnawdwell’s primary intimidator have seen him scamper and skitterleap across continents.

You’d think a rat so busy and dedicated to Clan Mors’ ascendancy would have no time for some lesser rivals’ petty insults, but this is Queek...

Word has reached the Headtaker that a Warlord from a rival clan is boasting that his armour is better. Most would ignore such a slight, or mark it in their memories for vengeance at a more opportune time, but Queek abandons his current objective and puts all his energy into seeking out the liar!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Headtaker scours the land in search for the one who dares slight him. It is a wasteful campaign, but none in his circle of advisors dares to question the undertaking, lest they face Queek’s wrath instead. In the aftermath of his search, Queek is confronted by several enemy forces; the Warlord is excited by the prospect of topping up his trophy rack. In his lust for battle, he almost forgets why he started this campaign in the first place!

missions.localised_description: Headtaker scours the land in search for the one who dares slight him. It is a wasteful campaign, but none in his circle of advisors dares to question the undertaking, lest they face Queek’s wrath instead. In the aftermath of his search, Queek is confronted by several enemy forces; the Warlord is excited by the prospect of topping up his trophy rack. In his lust for battle, he almost forgets why he started this campaign in the first place!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Queek ignores the alleged insult, but it seems the boaster isn’t done with him. Once more, taunts reach Headtaker, but this time the more cunning side rather than the wrathful part of Queek emerges. Headtaker determines that he will be the richest rat there is - then no snivelling vermin with shiny, more Warpstone-y armour will dare tell him otherwise!

missions.localised_description: Queek ignores the alleged insult, but it seems the boaster isn’t done with him. Once more, taunts reach Headtaker, but this time the more cunning side rather than the wrathful part of Queek emerges. Headtaker determines that he will be the richest rat there is - then no snivelling vermin with shiny, more Warpstone-y armour will dare tell him otherwise!

localised_description.last_approved_text: No little vermin boaster is better than the Right-Claw of Warlord Gnawdwell! Queek's agent reports a sighting of his rival close to nearby ruins. Despite protestations from minions loyal to Clan Mors, Queek orders the area raided – its wealth stolen for Queek… And if the boastful one can be located, then he can be gouged too!

missions.localised_description: No little vermin boaster is better than the Right-Claw of Warlord Gnawdwell! Queek's agent reports a sighting of his rival close to nearby ruins. Despite protestations from minions loyal to Clan Mors, Queek orders the area raided – its wealth stolen for Queek… And if the boastful one can be located, then he can be gouged too!

localised_description.last_approved_text: At last, Queek has the rival Clan Warlord cornered! It is fitting that the boaster was found, cowering, underground, deep below ruins that may have been important to some Wizard or other. Queek cares not; what matters is that the two will face off in battle and the shiniest armour will be the Headtaker's own!

missions.localised_description: At last, Queek has the rival Clan Warlord cornered! It is fitting that the boaster was found, cowering, underground, deep below ruins that may have been important to some Wizard or other. Queek cares not; what matters is that the two will face off in battle and the shiniest armour will be the Headtaker's own!

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Mighty and pestilent Lord Skrolk, Grey Seer Vulscreek entreats that your Clan Pestilens forces move to take the whole of this province. Let all the things know that Clan Pestilens stalks upon Lustria again!"\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Master, I bring worrisome news: Tree-things roam close. They are not with the Elf-things, a rogue force – this is not the last time we shall encounter such armies. They will need-need dealing with."\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "There are secrets and power in the ruins, my plaguelord. Warpstone for sure... although traps and other nasty-sneaky surprises too. I humbly suggest you search with your least loyal minions."\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_treasure_hunting]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_treasure_hunting}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

He believes it will gain trust with the Vampires that can be leveraged later. The Grey Seer’s reasoning is-is sound."\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreements [[url:script_link_campaign_trade]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_trade}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The brood mothers’ bellies are full. New pups are being born and the burrows swell, master. We must make room, before they eat each other. Upgrade the lairs."\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].
