Upgrade the lairs."\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Liber Bubonicus, a rancid tome full of vile lore collected by Pestilens’ plaguelords, is currently in Skrolk’s possession. In a devious move, his minions led a large expedition from the Old World down into the long abandoned Mortuary of Tzulaqua, via a trail of worthless trinkets leading deep under the ruined pyramid. A few of the greedy fools were lost to ancient traps, but most made it to the sacrificial chamber.\n\nThere, on a simple stone plinth, rested the Liber Bubonicus. If the book was left closed they may have lived, but one of the Man-things opened the Liber Bubonicus and from its pages sprouted a thousand plague-flies. The swarm buzzed, biting, laying eggs, and spreading an awful pox. The ploy worked! The Horned Rat is surely pleased, yet Skrolk is weary and must now recuperate.

missions.localised_description: The Liber Bubonicus, a rancid tome full of vile lore collected by Pestilens’ plaguelords, is currently in Skrolk’s possession. In a devious move, his minions led a large expedition from the Old World down into the long abandoned Mortuary of Tzulaqua, via a trail of worthless trinkets leading deep under the ruined pyramid. A few of the greedy fools were lost to ancient traps, but most made it to the sacrificial chamber.\n\nThere, on a simple stone plinth, rested the Liber Bubonicus. If the book was left closed they may have lived, but one of the Man-things opened the Liber Bubonicus and from its pages sprouted a thousand plague-flies. The swarm buzzed, biting, laying eggs, and spreading an awful pox. The ploy worked! The Horned Rat is surely pleased, yet Skrolk is weary and must now recuperate.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Skrolk’s cunning trap worked better than even he could perceive, but the cost was high, so he must bathe in filth and corruption to restore himself once more; a ritual should do the job. When ready, he will return to the Mortuary of Tzulaqua and collect the Liber Bubonicus.

missions.localised_description: Skrolk’s cunning trap worked better than even he could perceive, but the cost was high, so he must bathe in filth and corruption to restore himself once more; a ritual should do the job. When ready, he will return to the Mortuary of Tzulaqua and collect the Liber Bubonicus.

localised_description.last_approved_text: On completion of the ritual, Skrolk quickly gathers about him a verminous horde and scampers to the crypt, where his prize surely waits. The pestilent Lord arrives at the dank cave that leads into the crypt. His Plague Monks gnash the air, eager to descend, but he holds them back with a flick of his claw. Cautiously, he sniffs the air; his whiskers twitch. Something is not quite right…

missions.localised_description: On completion of the ritual, Skrolk quickly gathers about him a verminous horde and scampers to the crypt, where his prize surely waits. The pestilent Lord arrives at the dank cave that leads into the crypt. His Plague Monks gnash the air, eager to descend, but he holds them back with a flick of his claw. Cautiously, he sniffs the air; his whiskers twitch. Something is not quite right…

localised_description.last_approved_text: Skrolk’s deadly rod has been at his side for the many decades the Plaguelord has walked the world. It is said that the rod was awarded to Skrolk in the wake of his blindness. When he clawed at his own eyes after bearing witness to Arch-Plaguelord Nurglitch, Skrolk wished no other vision to obscure that glimpse of pestilent perfection.\n\nDespite this, Nurglitch does not brook failure, and remains unimpressed with Skrolk’s performance since the Vortex became vulnerable. Matters are not helped by the Rod of Corruption’s recent inability to cast rust upon metal. Flesh will still slough from bones when struck, but where before metal would oxidise and corrode, it remains gleaming. Skrolk suspects that the recent Vortex activity and his rod’s lack of corruption are linked, but first he must appease the Arch-Plaguelord and bolster Clan Pestilens' forces.

missions.localised_description: Skrolk’s deadly rod has been at his side for the many decades the Plaguelord has walked the world. It is said that the rod was awarded to Skrolk in the wake of his blindness. When he clawed at his own eyes after bearing witness to Arch-Plaguelord Nurglitch, Skrolk wished no other vision to obscure that glimpse of pestilent perfection.\n\nDespite this, Nurglitch does not brook failure, and remains unimpressed with Skrolk’s performance since the Vortex became vulnerable. Matters are not helped by the Rod of Corruption’s recent inability to cast rust upon metal. Flesh will still slough from bones when struck, but where before metal would oxidise and corrode, it remains gleaming. Skrolk suspects that the recent Vortex activity and his rod’s lack of corruption are linked, but first he must appease the Arch-Plaguelord and bolster Clan Pestilens' forces.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The cold-bloods have become the focus of Skrolk’s impotent rage. Back in Skavenblight, Arch-Plaguelord Nurglitch tuts at Skrolk’s performance, but still the Lizardmen must pay the price. But Lord Skrolk is more cunning than most. To outsiders he may seem to be lashing out, but those who know Skrolk know there is method in his fury. The Lizardmen hide knowledge; they have many secrets and one is the power to eat metal. Once he is rid of the reptiles, he will scour their plaques with eyes that cannot see until he finds out how to restore the Rod of Corruption.

missions.localised_description: The cold-bloods have become the focus of Skrolk’s impotent rage. Back in Skavenblight, Arch-Plaguelord Nurglitch tuts at Skrolk’s performance, but still the Lizardmen must pay the price. But Lord Skrolk is more cunning than most. To outsiders he may seem to be lashing out, but those who know Skrolk know there is method in his fury. The Lizardmen hide knowledge; they have many secrets and one is the power to eat metal. Once he is rid of the reptiles, he will scour their plaques with eyes that cannot see until he finds out how to restore the Rod of Corruption.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Lord Skrolk has discovered what the Lizardmen hide and the thing that he seeks - the power to befoul metal and restore the Rod of Corruption. To the north of Lustria lies the Island of the Crimson Skull; it is the Skull itself that Skrolk seeks, as it is made from a unique mineral that can be powdered into a red oxidising material that eats iron and steel. Once spread upon the Rod of Corruption, Skrolk’s weapon will be powerful once again. Then he can return to his grand schemes.\n\nFirst, he must deal with the Council while the Great Vortex remains unstable, but that is what this lick-spittle scribe is for. Let the Council be distracted by this scheme, so Skrolk can plan his ascension to Arch-Plaguelord without interference.

missions.localised_description: Lord Skrolk has discovered what the Lizardmen hide and the thing that he seeks - the power to befoul metal and restore the Rod of Corruption. To the north of Lustria lies the Island of the Crimson Skull; it is the Skull itself that Skrolk seeks, as it is made from a unique mineral that can be powdered into a red oxidising material that eats iron and steel. Once spread upon the Rod of Corruption, Skrolk’s weapon will be powerful once again. Then he can return to his grand schemes.\n\nFirst, he must deal with the Council while the Great Vortex remains unstable, but that is what this lick-spittle scribe is for. Let the Council be distracted by this scheme, so Skrolk can plan his ascension to Arch-Plaguelord without interference.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The sign of the Jaguar God has been witnessed on both the ground and in the sky. Huanchi is on the prowl and so the cohorts must act. A sacred spawning will come forth should the prey be caught.

missions.localised_description: The sign of the Jaguar God has been witnessed on both the ground and in the sky. Huanchi is on the prowl and so the cohorts must act. A sacred spawning will come forth should the prey be caught.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The signs are in the sky; a sacred spawning is imminent, but first Caxuatn, the Predator, must have his prey.

missions.localised_description: The signs are in the sky; a sacred spawning is imminent, but first Caxuatn, the Predator, must have his prey.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Slann awaken with a start - their equivalent of a nightmare - but it is just the Old One God of War, Tlanxla, making his will known. When he is appeased, a sacred spawning shall be granted.

missions.localised_description: Slann awaken with a start - their equivalent of a nightmare - but it is just the Old One God of War, Tlanxla, making his will known. When he is appeased, a sacred spawning shall be granted.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Solar God is an angry deity - he demands the sacrifice of those that seek to destroy what his servants have built. He will grant a sacred spawning once the tally has been taken.

missions.localised_description: The Solar God is an angry deity - he demands the sacrifice of those that seek to destroy what his servants have built. He will grant a sacred spawning once the tally has been taken.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The snakes migrate in great numbers, a sure sign that Sotek demands action from one of his chosen priests. If they are worthy then their cohort will be blessed with a sacred spawning.

missions.localised_description: The snakes migrate in great numbers, a sure sign that Sotek demands action from one of his chosen priests. If they are worthy then their cohort will be blessed with a sacred spawning.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Old One Quetli, the Warrior - his stars shine brightest of all. This is an omen that a sacred spawning is due, but sacrificial payment in the blood of enemy warriors is first required.

missions.localised_description: The Old One Quetli, the Warrior - his stars shine brightest of all. This is an omen that a sacred spawning is due, but sacrificial payment in the blood of enemy warriors is first required.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Lord of Strength, the Old One, Tzcatli, does not perceive this portent solely as raw vigour, but recognises economic strength as well. The storms that rage over the gold mines are a sure sign that he requires the cohorts to build their wealth. Should the gold be accrued, a sacred spawning will surely follow.

missions.localised_description: The Lord of Strength, the Old One, Tzcatli, does not perceive this portent solely as raw vigour, but recognises economic strength as well. The storms that rage over the gold mines are a sure sign that he requires the cohorts to build their wealth. Should the gold be accrued, a sacred spawning will surely follow.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Old One known as the Arbiter of Duty has sent a prophecy through the frenzied dreams of the builder Skinks: industry is required and with it will come a spawning of revered beasts.

missions.localised_description: The Old One known as the Arbiter of Duty has sent a prophecy through the frenzied dreams of the builder Skinks: industry is required and with it will come a spawning of revered beasts.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Old One who even Slann of the Second Generation dare not name aloud is angry! The skies burn with his wrath; he must be appeased quickly, and in doing so he may issue a sacred spawning, whose reptiles will be special indeed…

missions.localised_description: The Old One who even Slann of the Second Generation dare not name aloud is angry! The skies burn with his wrath; he must be appeased quickly, and in doing so he may issue a sacred spawning, whose reptiles will be special indeed…

localised_description.last_approved_text: Tlazcotl the Impassive is patient and determined. His sign is flocks of birds suddenly becoming still and silent, perching for days and never moving. The Great Plan will be revealed in time; until then the Lizardmen must grow in power both militarily and economically. This will please the Old One and award his followers a sacred spawning.

missions.localised_description: Tlazcotl the Impassive is patient and determined. His sign is flocks of birds suddenly becoming still and silent, perching for days and never moving. The Great Plan will be revealed in time; until then the Lizardmen must grow in power both militarily and economically. This will please the Old One and award his followers a sacred spawning.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Messenger, Uxmac, will bring word of the Old Ones. The cohorts must be prepared, and if they are, a sacred spawning will be awarded.

missions.localised_description: The Messenger, Uxmac, will bring word of the Old Ones. The cohorts must be prepared, and if they are, a sacred spawning will be awarded.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Winds of Magic coalesce and shift along the Geomantic Web. The Old One, Potec, sends an omen. Should the Slann heed his warning then a sacred spawning is surely due.

missions.localised_description: The Winds of Magic coalesce and shift along the Geomantic Web. The Old One, Potec, sends an omen. Should the Slann heed his warning then a sacred spawning is surely due.
Success

localised_description.last_approved_text: "I know you would not let anyone on the Black Council talk to you, yet you need me, so I speak without the riddles and flattery. For thousands of years you have tried the same tactics and yet we remain in Naggaroth. We must research new methods - after all, a torturer should have many tools at his disposal."

missions.localised_description: "I know you would not let anyone on the Black Council talk to you, yet you need me, so I speak without the riddles and flattery. For thousands of years you have tried the same tactics and yet we remain in Naggaroth. We must research new methods - after all, a torturer should have many tools at his disposal."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Come now, my king and queen, the time for influencing from afar is over. Now is a new age of blood - send forth armies of Druchii!"

missions.localised_description: "Come now, my king and queen, the time for influencing from afar is over. Now is a new age of blood - send forth armies of Druchii!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Where is Fellhart? No matter, if the Krakenlord is absent there are plenty of other captains eager for glory and slaves!"

missions.localised_description: "Where is Fellhart? No matter, if the Krakenlord is absent there are plenty of other captains eager for glory and slaves!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "I need you to do something for me… You won't like it but it needs to be done or I will not be able to perform the last ritual. Some political manoeuvring on your part will be required - isn't that what you excel at?"

missions.localised_description: "I need you to do something for me… You won't like it but it needs to be done or I will not be able to perform the last ritual. Some political manoeuvring on your part will be required - isn't that what you excel at?"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The next ritual victim will take us north; I can feel it, the strands of dark magic pull me in that direction. Your majesty, if we dominate that territory then it will be much easier to harvest the victim's lifeforce."

missions.localised_description: "The next ritual victim will take us north; I can feel it, the strands of dark magic pull me in that direction. Your majesty, if we dominate that territory then it will be much easier to harvest the victim's lifeforce."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Hiding behind your son's cloak? It's what you have done for millennia. But do not worry, I have an answer: you must ally with the sisterhood, summon the death dancers!"

missions.localised_description: "Hiding behind your son's cloak? It's what you have done for millennia. But do not worry, I have an answer: you must ally with the sisterhood, summon the death dancers!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "It is time to bring the screaming arboretums, slave arenas and pleasure palaces to the lesser races. Our cities shall flourish, our guests will never leave…"

missions.localised_description: "It is time to bring the screaming arboretums, slave arenas and pleasure palaces to the lesser races. Our cities shall flourish, our guests will never leave…"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Stop these fools, they interrupt my work. I know it amuses you to vex me, but your son has given me this task and if I'm successful, then both of you will wield total power. Now, silence our enemies' armies - declaw them!"

missions.localised_description: "Stop these fools, they interrupt my work. I know it amuses you to vex me, but your son has given me this task and if I'm successful, then both of you will wield total power. Now, silence our enemies' armies - declaw them!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "You demand this of me and yet there is someone in my way. I could have my ally kill them… of course, but he is busy with my own contracts. Don't bluster - do you want eternal power for the Witch King or not? Get it done."

missions.localised_description: "You demand this of me and yet there is someone in my way. I could have my ally kill them… of course, but he is busy with my own contracts. Don't bluster - do you want eternal power for the Witch King or not? Get it done."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "If you want me to quicken my pace, I must seek out the next victim. The ritual will reveal that, but I need Scrolls of Hekarti to power these invocations. Find me a library or scroll-room full of magic!"

missions.localised_description: "If you want me to quicken my pace, I must seek out the next victim. The ritual will reveal that, but I need Scrolls of Hekarti to power these invocations. Find me a library or scroll-room full of magic!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "My king, the Scrolls of Hekarti reveal things to me… Hotek – the renegade smith who forged your armour – was he as skilled as the legends proclaim? Do the runes of spite in your armour fade? I think they do. His sigils have an expiry and that day comes. Why do I tell you this, your majesty? Because you have my soul cage. Drench the sigils in the blood of your enemies and the levy will be paid, the armour restored."\n\nAnd perhaps you'll grant me the boon of returning my soul?"

missions.localised_description: "My king, the Scrolls of Hekarti reveal things to me… Hotek – the renegade smith who forged your armour – was he as skilled as the legends proclaim? Do the runes of spite in your armour fade? I think they do. His sigils have an expiry and that day comes. Why do I tell you this, your majesty? Because you have my soul cage. Drench the sigils in the blood of your enemies and the levy will be paid, the armour restored."\n\nAnd perhaps you'll grant me the boon of returning my soul?"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "This army of dregs and fossils is in our way. Take them as slaves or kill them painfully - either way it must be destroyed."

missions.localised_description: "This army of dregs and fossils is in our way. Take them as slaves or kill them painfully - either way it must be destroyed."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Your majesty, we must show the gods your ambition, for the final rite will depend on them. Muster your most loyal warriors, have the Black Guard of Naggarond march, and all - mortals and gods alike - will never doubt your cause."

missions.localised_description: "Your majesty, we must show the gods your ambition, for the final rite will depend on them. Muster your most loyal warriors, have the Black Guard of Naggarond march, and all - mortals and gods alike - will never doubt your cause."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "You have a pest problem; vermin are after the Vortex. That we know. They are up to something. Your inability to stop them thus far is shameful! Do your job or I'll tell your son all about your incompetence!"

missions.localised_description: "You have a pest problem; vermin are after the Vortex. That we know. They are up to something. Your inability to stop them thus far is shameful! Do your job or I'll tell your son all about your incompetence!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Do not simply destroy. Think about it! Search the ruins and not only could you find prey and slaves, but there may well be secrets to uncover."

missions.localised_description: "Do not simply destroy. Think about it! Search the ruins and not only could you find prey and slaves, but there may well be secrets to uncover."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "I note you tried to kill me again, Hag Queen. Don't worry, my own assassin dealt with your petty minions. But I do not contact you to trade barbs. We need more flesh, more bodies for labour in these works. I suggest you go hunting."

missions.localised_description: "I note you tried to kill me again, Hag Queen. Don't worry, my own assassin dealt with your petty minions. But I do not contact you to trade barbs. We need more flesh, more bodies for labour in these works. I suggest you go hunting."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "I find the reptiles of the south disgusting. No - you misunderstand - I do not care how they look, it is their dogmatic creed and alignment to high, pure magic that is so retch-inducing. Find the stronghold of this nuisance and thwart them."

missions.localised_description: "I find the reptiles of the south disgusting. No - you misunderstand - I do not care how they look, it is their dogmatic creed and alignment to high, pure magic that is so retch-inducing. Find the stronghold of this nuisance and thwart them."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Delightful! The Asur are angry after we culled one of their princelings in the first ritual. It is like scolding a child and watching the inept rage. I am, of course, just a servant, but if I were you I'd go and teach them what real fury is…"

missions.localised_description: "Delightful! The Asur are angry after we culled one of their princelings in the first ritual. It is like scolding a child and watching the inept rage. I am, of course, just a servant, but if I were you I'd go and teach them what real fury is…"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The Winds of Dark Magic gather! The Vortex shudders! Now is the time to cast a rite…"

missions.localised_description: "The Winds of Dark Magic gather! The Vortex shudders! Now is the time to cast a rite…"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The coffers run low. I suggest you send your captains far and wide and begin the harvest, for we will need resources in the days to come."

missions.localised_description: "The coffers run low. I suggest you send your captains far and wide and begin the harvest, for we will need resources in the days to come."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The rituals take their toll. When the chalice is full the Witch King needs to be ready. He or his kin must be at the peak of their power - for the magic will reject the weak and ravage the feeble. Only the strong will survive!"

missions.localised_description: "The rituals take their toll. When the chalice is full the Witch King needs to be ready. He or his kin must be at the peak of their power - for the magic will reject the weak and ravage the feeble. Only the strong will survive!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "I have sent one of my followers to you. They have a task - do not interrupt them, it is critical for our success."

missions.localised_description: "I have sent one of my followers to you. They have a task - do not interrupt them, it is critical for our success."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "My king, we must start the invasion - ravage Ulthuan, bring the hated High Elves to their knees and make them beg in front of their true monarch. Vengeance shall be yours!"

missions.localised_description: "My king, we must start the invasion - ravage Ulthuan, bring the hated High Elves to their knees and make them beg in front of their true monarch. Vengeance shall be yours!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "My lover is dead. There is nothing in this world for me. I see why your heart is so cold now, my king. Tear it down - bring the world to ruin!"

missions.localised_description: "My lover is dead. There is nothing in this world for me. I see why your heart is so cold now, my king. Tear it down - bring the world to ruin!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The time is coming, your majesty. Soon we must move on the weaklings. Unite the warhosts of the Druchii under your banner!"

missions.localised_description: "The time is coming, your majesty. Soon we must move on the weaklings. Unite the warhosts of the Druchii under your banner!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "With the exception of Lothern, our cities are quiet now - the spectre of our diminishment. But we must strike on in these trying times, build up our cities, and perhaps the populace will grow once more."

missions.localised_description: "With the exception of Lothern, our cities are quiet now - the spectre of our diminishment. But we must strike on in these trying times, build up our cities, and perhaps the populace will grow once more."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "We cannot be at war on so many fronts - it is time we force the Lizardmen to listen and acknowledge we are not some petty house servants that should be exiled on Ulthuan. They must understand we are an equal and an ally against the Ancient Enemy and its many forms!"

missions.localised_description: "We cannot be at war on so many fronts - it is time we force the Lizardmen to listen and acknowledge we are not some petty house servants that should be exiled on Ulthuan. They must understand we are an equal and an ally against the Ancient Enemy and its many forms!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Hale news! The Princes of the Phoenix Court have quietened for now, but there remains a faction that has the ear of the Phoenix King. They clamour about your absence, High Loremaster. Those on his Warrior’s Council - even your brother - bemoan that you have abandoned Ulthuan."\n\nLoremaster Talarian assures me this is not the case, and that your cause serves the world, including the Asur, but still, we must show progress. Talarian suggests you expand rapidly, as not only will this help us in finding more way-fragments to power the next ritual, but it will boost confidence in your purpose back home."

missions.localised_description: "Hale news! The Princes of the Phoenix Court have quietened for now, but there remains a faction that has the ear of the Phoenix King. They clamour about your absence, High Loremaster. Those on his Warrior’s Council - even your brother - bemoan that you have abandoned Ulthuan."\n\nLoremaster Talarian assures me this is not the case, and that your cause serves the world, including the Asur, but still, we must show progress. Talarian suggests you expand rapidly, as not only will this help us in finding more way-fragments to power the next ritual, but it will boost confidence in your purpose back home."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Talarian pontificates as his kind are wont to do, but we are running out of time! Battle is the best way to safeguard Ulthuan and exact vengeance upon the most bitter of our enemies."\n\nFocus on slaying lords and princelings; their armies will cave, their soldiers retreat and whatever plan the Witch King has regarding the Vortex will come to ruin!"

missions.localised_description: "Talarian pontificates as his kind are wont to do, but we are running out of time! Battle is the best way to safeguard Ulthuan and exact vengeance upon the most bitter of our enemies."\n\nFocus on slaying lords and princelings; their armies will cave, their soldiers retreat and whatever plan the Witch King has regarding the Vortex will come to ruin!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Though it pains me to say it, at times the Dwarfs and men have us right - the Asur can be arrogant. We think of ourselves as protectors of this world, but the amphibious jungle-dwellers of Lustria were the first. Perhaps we don’t give them the respect they deserve? In any case, war between us is not overly common, so we were unprepared when they struck. They gave us no warnings, attacking without mercy. I fear this is connected to the waning Vortex but while the Squire and I hunt for the Star Crown you, my lord, must deal with the Lizardmen's aggression."

missions.localised_description: "Though it pains me to say it, at times the Dwarfs and men have us right - the Asur can be arrogant. We think of ourselves as protectors of this world, but the amphibious jungle-dwellers of Lustria were the first. Perhaps we don’t give them the respect they deserve? In any case, war between us is not overly common, so we were unprepared when they struck. They gave us no warnings, attacking without mercy. I fear this is connected to the waning Vortex but while the Squire and I hunt for the Star Crown you, my lord, must deal with the Lizardmen's aggression."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "My prince, we must prepare for the next ritual. Now we know what we seek - the missing shards of the Star Crown - it is time for the Phoenix Kings, both living and past, to show us the way."\n\nKing Finubar the Seafarer is eager to help, but wary of the political cost should he fail in the role cast by the upcoming ritual. We must shore up his support. As one of the Twin Princes - the Defenders of Ulthuan - your influence on the Phoenix Court is immeasurable, even if you cannot be there in person."

missions.localised_description: "My prince, we must prepare for the next ritual. Now we know what we seek - the missing shards of the Star Crown - it is time for the Phoenix Kings, both living and past, to show us the way."\n\nKing Finubar the Seafarer is eager to help, but wary of the political cost should he fail in the role cast by the upcoming ritual. We must shore up his support. As one of the Twin Princes - the Defenders of Ulthuan - your influence on the Phoenix Court is immeasurable, even if you cannot be there in person."

localised_description.last_approved_text:
"My lord, I have received a report from our envoy who was sent to parley with the reptiles."

He was taken with the central pyramid of the temple-city, where the smaller breed - a Skink - spoke to him, all the while surrounded by the Lizardmen's warrior caste. The Skink stated that only when the constellation of Abordis has aligned would the Slann awake, and only then could negotiations begin."

I have studied the heavens and such a stellar occurrence is not due for months, maybe even years! We should seek a means to influence this awakening..."

missions.localised_description:
"My lord, I have received a report from our envoy who was sent to parley with the reptiles."

He was taken with the central pyramid of the temple-city, where the smaller breed - a Skink - spoke to him, all the while surrounded by the Lizardmen's warrior caste. The Skink stated that only when the constellation of Abordis has aligned would the Slann awake, and only then could negotiations begin."

I have studied the heavens and such a stellar occurrence is not due for months, maybe even years! We should seek a means to influence this awakening..."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The vermin filth sully our pristine homeland! They have never had so much as a tail-hold before, and now the Lords of Decay have their champions stalk our lands! Does the Everqueen not weep? This cannot be allowed. Seek out their vile leaders, cut off their heads, and the swarm will be easy to purge."

missions.localised_description: "The vermin filth sully our pristine homeland! They have never had so much as a tail-hold before, and now the Lords of Decay have their champions stalk our lands! Does the Everqueen not weep? This cannot be allowed. Seek out their vile leaders, cut off their heads, and the swarm will be easy to purge."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "You risk much, my prince. It is dangerous to call upon such power without the safeguard of the Vortex. Daemons listen… you know N’kari thirsts for your soul. Yet should you prevail with this course of action, then the Druchii cause will be seriously damaged."

missions.localised_description: "You risk much, my prince. It is dangerous to call upon such power without the safeguard of the Vortex. Daemons listen… you know N’kari thirsts for your soul. Yet should you prevail with this course of action, then the Druchii cause will be seriously damaged."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Greetings, my prince, now you have influence both in the Phoenix Court and beyond we must focus on empowering King Finubar for the next ritual. The blessing of Mathlann, Lord of the Deeps and God of the Sea, will temporarily grant our living king with the power to separate the oceans!"

missions.localised_description: "Greetings, my prince, now you have influence both in the Phoenix Court and beyond we must focus on empowering King Finubar for the next ritual. The blessing of Mathlann, Lord of the Deeps and God of the Sea, will temporarily grant our living king with the power to separate the oceans!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "My prince, we have discovered a lost cache of way-fragments, a boon sent by Asuryan that must not be squandered or taken from us. Claim it now, and quickly, before the spiteful ones seek it themselves."

missions.localised_description: "My prince, we have discovered a lost cache of way-fragments, a boon sent by Asuryan that must not be squandered or taken from us. Claim it now, and quickly, before the spiteful ones seek it themselves."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The Elven gods are deaf to the screams of hatred between the Asur and the Druchii. Just as the leopards and lions of Ulthuan hunt their prey, so we must hunt our spiteful kin."

missions.localised_description: "The Elven gods are deaf to the screams of hatred between the Asur and the Druchii. Just as the leopards and lions of Ulthuan hunt their prey, so we must hunt our spiteful kin."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Another battlefield encounter with the Druchii, while satisfying, achieves nothing. Send forth a warrior who can hide amongst our enemy and learn from the Scrolls of Hekarti they are so keen to seek. Then we’ll know how far they their own dark desires have taken them, and what we must do to stop them!"

missions.localised_description: "Another battlefield encounter with the Druchii, while satisfying, achieves nothing. Send forth a warrior who can hide amongst our enemy and learn from the Scrolls of Hekarti they are so keen to seek. Then we’ll know how far they their own dark desires have taken them, and what we must do to stop them!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The Loremasters would have us forsake the world and seek enlightenment in nothing but scrolls hidden away in their towers, yet there is plenty of lore out there. You have taught me that, my prince, and I now repeat the lesson back to you: the search for knowledge is key to victory."

missions.localised_description: "The Loremasters would have us forsake the world and seek enlightenment in nothing but scrolls hidden away in their towers, yet there is plenty of lore out there. You have taught me that, my prince, and I now repeat the lesson back to you: the search for knowledge is key to victory."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Our envoy among the Lizardmen has gained their trust enough for them to reveal something of ill-portent. The Mage-Priest has spoken at last, informing our emissary of how one of its generational-kin has fallen from the Geomantic Web. The creature now exists apart from the other Slann, a chunk of raw Chaos impaled in its head. The lost Mage-Priest’s thoughts are no longer its own, and through it corrupted spawnings strode forth, destroying all."\n\nWith our envoy present, the Mage-Priest reached out to see if he could touch the mind of his tainted kin, but was repulsed by a wall of chittering. It seems Sotek’s nemeses are the ones that hold dominion over the lost Slann and these fell spawnings - they must be destroyed!"

missions.localised_description: "Our envoy among the Lizardmen has gained their trust enough for them to reveal something of ill-portent. The Mage-Priest has spoken at last, informing our emissary of how one of its generational-kin has fallen from the Geomantic Web. The creature now exists apart from the other Slann, a chunk of raw Chaos impaled in its head. The lost Mage-Priest’s thoughts are no longer its own, and through it corrupted spawnings strode forth, destroying all."\n\nWith our envoy present, the Mage-Priest reached out to see if he could touch the mind of his tainted kin, but was repulsed by a wall of chittering. It seems Sotek’s nemeses are the ones that hold dominion over the lost Slann and these fell spawnings - they must be destroyed!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The gods mock us with their timing, for it is a decade since the Everqueen made her last pilgrimage beyond the equator to the Tower of the Sun and performed the rite that prevents the eclipse of the moons. She must go once more. I do not want to even contemplate what should happen if Morrslieb becomes empowered while the Vortex wanes."\n\nBefore the Everqueen sets off on her quest, she must be protected by those that can shield her from the evil moon’s glare."

missions.localised_description: "The gods mock us with their timing, for it is a decade since the Everqueen made her last pilgrimage beyond the equator to the Tower of the Sun and performed the rite that prevents the eclipse of the moons. She must go once more. I do not want to even contemplate what should happen if Morrslieb becomes empowered while the Vortex wanes."\n\nBefore the Everqueen sets off on her quest, she must be protected by those that can shield her from the evil moon’s glare."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Though it pains me, we must contemplate what is currently happening to the souls of our kin. As you know, my prince, an Asur’s soul is bound to the waystones - the fragments of which we currently seek. They, in turn, helped power the perpetual rite that channelled the Great Vortex. With the weakening of the Vortex, I fear that the Dark Prince, Slaanesh, feasts!"\n\nThis reason is perhaps above all others why the Great Vortex must be restored - but in the interim, we must persecute the followers of Chaos at every turn."

missions.localised_description: "Though it pains me, we must contemplate what is currently happening to the souls of our kin. As you know, my prince, an Asur’s soul is bound to the waystones - the fragments of which we currently seek. They, in turn, helped power the perpetual rite that channelled the Great Vortex. With the weakening of the Vortex, I fear that the Dark Prince, Slaanesh, feasts!"\n\nThis reason is perhaps above all others why the Great Vortex must be restored - but in the interim, we must persecute the followers of Chaos at every turn."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Your followers have captured a Naggarothi spy. Not unexpectedly, as that is a role the warriors of Saphery have performed for millennia."\n\nThe spy thinks to shield her mind, but even from here we can fathom her true intentions. The Witch King sends his legions against you, Teclis. He fears your plans will stop his own from coming to fruition. Act first! Read from the Scroll of Hoeth and know the terrible truth."

missions.localised_description: "Your followers have captured a Naggarothi spy. Not unexpectedly, as that is a role the warriors of Saphery have performed for millennia."\n\nThe spy thinks to shield her mind, but even from here we can fathom her true intentions. The Witch King sends his legions against you, Teclis. He fears your plans will stop his own from coming to fruition. Act first! Read from the Scroll of Hoeth and know the terrible truth."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "My prince, as you are all too aware, without the fortress gates in the north of Ulthuan, the Druchii would have scoured the Inner Kingdoms long ago, hollowing out our homeland. And now the Phoenix Gate comes under sustained attack. Our Dark Elf-kin hope the failing Vortex will keep us distracted long enough for them to breach it, but Avelorn lies beyond and the Everqueen herself may be put in harm's reach. She and the Inner Kingdoms must be protected - the Fortress Gate has to hold!"

missions.localised_description: "My prince, as you are all too aware, without the fortress gates in the north of Ulthuan, the Druchii would have scoured the Inner Kingdoms long ago, hollowing out our homeland. And now the Phoenix Gate comes under sustained attack. Our Dark Elf-kin hope the failing Vortex will keep us distracted long enough for them to breach it, but Avelorn lies beyond and the Everqueen herself may be put in harm's reach. She and the Inner Kingdoms must be protected - the Fortress Gate has to hold!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The Everqueen is ready to embark on her pilgrimage to the Tower of the Sun and enact the rite that will keep Morrslieb from destroying us all! The Phoenix King has requested that you plan her journey, my prince."\n\nWe could send her predominantly by land, but it is a longer route and not without risk for the tiger-headed warriors of Ind are aggressive. Or we could use the sea - it will get her to the destination quicker - but the Druchii and vermin are so active upon the ocean and if she fell into their cruel hands… Such a fate is unthinkable! Ensure the ocean is safe."

missions.localised_description: "The Everqueen is ready to embark on her pilgrimage to the Tower of the Sun and enact the rite that will keep Morrslieb from destroying us all! The Phoenix King has requested that you plan her journey, my prince."\n\nWe could send her predominantly by land, but it is a longer route and not without risk for the tiger-headed warriors of Ind are aggressive. Or we could use the sea - it will get her to the destination quicker - but the Druchii and vermin are so active upon the ocean and if she fell into their cruel hands… Such a fate is unthinkable! Ensure the ocean is safe."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Grave tidings, my prince. Through my arcane preparations for the next ritual, I have learned of a terrible fate for our lost kin. As the Vortex deteriorates some of the souls have been drained from the waystones and captured in a dread pool. Like a second vortex, is has sucked lost Asur souls in, ready to be consumed."\n\nMy prince, I feel the hand of N’kari in this… those souls must be freed!"

missions.localised_description: "Grave tidings, my prince. Through my arcane preparations for the next ritual, I have learned of a terrible fate for our lost kin. As the Vortex deteriorates some of the souls have been drained from the waystones and captured in a dread pool. Like a second vortex, is has sucked lost Asur souls in, ready to be consumed."\n\nMy prince, I feel the hand of N’kari in this… those souls must be freed!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "High Loremaster Teclis, the Druchii begin to encroach on your realm. Should they invade, it will make the search for way-fragments even more difficult. Their advances suggest some kind of intelligence regarding your actions; there may be spies or sleeper agents close!"\n\nThe Swordmasters have always been more than mere warrior-scholars and protectors of the White Tower. They have an on-going duty to hunt down Druchii impostors - use them now!"

missions.localised_description: "High Loremaster Teclis, the Druchii begin to encroach on your realm. Should they invade, it will make the search for way-fragments even more difficult. Their advances suggest some kind of intelligence regarding your actions; there may be spies or sleeper agents close!"\n\nThe Swordmasters have always been more than mere warrior-scholars and protectors of the White Tower. They have an on-going duty to hunt down Druchii impostors - use them now!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "It is clear that the Vermin of Hruddithi and the Druchii not only intend to wrest the Vortex from us, but befoul it for their own ends. I fear what the Witch King plans above all; he has coveted the Vortex ever since his failed attempt to unbind it thousands of years ago, which brought about the Sundering. Malekith, his mother, and all their followers must be stopped!"

missions.localised_description: "It is clear that the Vermin of Hruddithi and the Druchii not only intend to wrest the Vortex from us, but befoul it for their own ends. I fear what the Witch King plans above all; he has coveted the Vortex ever since his failed attempt to unbind it thousands of years ago, which brought about the Sundering. Malekith, his mother, and all their followers must be stopped!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The Vermintide floods the southern continent, eating, consuming and ruining everything in its path! We are at a critical juncture in the ritual process - way-fragments must be sought with the spirit of Bel Korhadris invoked next and quickly if we are to maintain a grip on the Vortex. The Vermin of Hruddithi know this and seek to stop us. We must fight back!"

missions.localised_description: "The Vermintide floods the southern continent, eating, consuming and ruining everything in its path! We are at a critical juncture in the ritual process - way-fragments must be sought with the spirit of Bel Korhadris invoked next and quickly if we are to maintain a grip on the Vortex. The Vermin of Hruddithi know this and seek to stop us. We must fight back!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "We search for the Star Crown, but that was just one of three sacred gifts bestowed upon us by the goddess Lileath. The Moon Staff was another, which is why you must keep it close, High Loremaster, for it is precious as it is powerful. Yet its power currently wanes, for the Winds of Magic unravel. Nearby deposits of Warpstone further tamper with the staff's potency. Purge the area of vermin and the staff may awaken."

missions.localised_description: "We search for the Star Crown, but that was just one of three sacred gifts bestowed upon us by the goddess Lileath. The Moon Staff was another, which is why you must keep it close, High Loremaster, for it is precious as it is powerful. Yet its power currently wanes, for the Winds of Magic unravel. Nearby deposits of Warpstone further tamper with the staff's potency. Purge the area of vermin and the staff may awaken."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The ruins that scatter the world hold secrets. The Loremaster is busy preparing the next ritual, but he bequeaths me to urge that you begin searching the lost ruins, as that is where victory might be found."

missions.localised_description: "The ruins that scatter the world hold secrets. The Loremaster is busy preparing the next ritual, but he bequeaths me to urge that you begin searching the lost ruins, as that is where victory might be found."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Hale news, my master! The Princes of the Phoenix Court have quietened… for now. While they are placated, and support for you is high, the time to act is now. Take Ulthuan’s realms under your yoke! We can always cede them back to their traditional Lords once the Vortex has been secured."\n\nWith more realms of Ulthuan under your domination, we can search for way-fragments unimpeded."

missions.localised_description: "Hale news, my master! The Princes of the Phoenix Court have quietened… for now. While they are placated, and support for you is high, the time to act is now. Take Ulthuan’s realms under your yoke! We can always cede them back to their traditional Lords once the Vortex has been secured."\n\nWith more realms of Ulthuan under your domination, we can search for way-fragments unimpeded."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Revered warrior, the moon is red. Tlanxla has spoken and he calls upon the cohorts to align to his will."

missions.localised_description: "Revered warrior, the moon is red. Tlanxla has spoken and he calls upon the cohorts to align to his will."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Revered Lord of the Second Generation, the Forked Tongue of Sotek has disappeared! Its arc has soured the sky - a celestial alignment must be enacted to heal the rends in orbit."

missions.localised_description: "Revered Lord of the Second Generation, the Forked Tongue of Sotek has disappeared! Its arc has soured the sky - a celestial alignment must be enacted to heal the rends in orbit."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Children of the Sun, see your time has just begun. We must gather the yellow element - favoured of Chaqua - and use it to enrich ourselves, for the younger races inexplicably find value in it."

missions.localised_description: "Children of the Sun, see your time has just begun. We must gather the yellow element - favoured of Chaqua - and use it to enrich ourselves, for the younger races inexplicably find value in it."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Quick, master! The Geomantic strands do not knit as they should. A minor rite must be performed to tame the winds, and allow for concurrence."

missions.localised_description: "Quick, master! The Geomantic strands do not knit as they should. A minor rite must be performed to tame the winds, and allow for concurrence."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The Ritual of Contemplation will soon be upon us. We must prepare - construction of further ziggurats and restoration of lost Star Chambers is required."

missions.localised_description: "The Ritual of Contemplation will soon be upon us. We must prepare - construction of further ziggurats and restoration of lost Star Chambers is required."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Most revered master, there is discord. A Mage-Priest presumes to know more than Lord Mazdamundi. His interpretation aligns closer with those who sought to harm the Old Ones. Clarity in the great purpose must be restored."

missions.localised_description: "Most revered master, there is discord. A Mage-Priest presumes to know more than Lord Mazdamundi. His interpretation aligns closer with those who sought to harm the Old Ones. Clarity in the great purpose must be restored."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The ground shakes, the sky heaves - the Old Ones are angry! We must appease them with the sacrifice of enemy spawn!"

missions.localised_description: "The ground shakes, the sky heaves - the Old Ones are angry! We must appease them with the sacrifice of enemy spawn!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The strands of the Geomantic Web begin to unbind, a result of the assault on the Great Warding! We must work fast, revered one, or unmaking will begin sooner than we have foretold!"

missions.localised_description: "The strands of the Geomantic Web begin to unbind, a result of the assault on the Great Warding! We must work fast, revered one, or unmaking will begin sooner than we have foretold!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Our numbers must be increased, ancient master. Should I activate the Geomantic Web and churn the spawning pools?"

missions.localised_description: "Our numbers must be increased, ancient master. Should I activate the Geomantic Web and churn the spawning pools?"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "We must spawn a servant, for there is much to do. Many tasks must be performed to save the Great Warding."

missions.localised_description: "We must spawn a servant, for there is much to do. Many tasks must be performed to save the Great Warding."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "We are all tools of the Old Ones, but to be useful in the struggles ahead we must be ready, prepared and able to withstand the perils sent against us…"

missions.localised_description: "We are all tools of the Old Ones, but to be useful in the struggles ahead we must be ready, prepared and able to withstand the perils sent against us…"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "My Lord Mazdamundi, the plaques need gathering but our patrols suffer. We must control more of the world. The Old Ones decree that Hexoatl's influence must grow beyond its traditional borders."

missions.localised_description: "My Lord Mazdamundi, the plaques need gathering but our patrols suffer. We must control more of the world. The Old Ones decree that Hexoatl's influence must grow beyond its traditional borders."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The accursed Rat-spawn blight us once again. It is strange that I do not feel Sotek's presence, despite the vermin being so prevalent and His comet flying closer than ever before. Perhaps he will answer if many Rat-spawn are sacrificed? Seek out the vermin!"

missions.localised_description: "The accursed Rat-spawn blight us once again. It is strange that I do not feel Sotek's presence, despite the vermin being so prevalent and His comet flying closer than ever before. Perhaps he will answer if many Rat-spawn are sacrificed? Seek out the vermin!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Chameleon Skinks bring back news of a lost librarium - many sacred plaques are said to be there. We must capture it, before the Khanx and Kota steal the secrets within!"

missions.localised_description: "Chameleon Skinks bring back news of a lost librarium - many sacred plaques are said to be there. We must capture it, before the Khanx and Kota steal the secrets within!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Sotek the Deliverer decreed that the Xa'kota must never tread in sacred Lustria or the untouched paradise of the Southlands. Purge the world of vermin; in doing so we protect the Great Warding."

missions.localised_description: "Sotek the Deliverer decreed that the Xa'kota must never tread in sacred Lustria or the untouched paradise of the Southlands. Purge the world of vermin; in doing so we protect the Great Warding."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "This one is an enigma; I have searched the plaques, spoken to many masters, but this being should not exist. They are a cosmic accident that needs cleansing from reality."

missions.localised_description: "This one is an enigma; I have searched the plaques, spoken to many masters, but this being should not exist. They are a cosmic accident that needs cleansing from reality."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The Scrutiny of the Old Ones is upon us. I sense we adjust ourselves to the top of the pyramid. The younger races are prey - let the hunt begin!"

missions.localised_description: "The Scrutiny of the Old Ones is upon us. I sense we adjust ourselves to the top of the pyramid. The younger races are prey - let the hunt begin!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Ancient Scar-leader… Prepare your spear. The vermin come - there is one of their swarm that Sotek has demanded be slain. Its death must be sacrificial, and performed in battle. Now go and hunt!"

missions.localised_description: "Ancient Scar-leader… Prepare your spear. The vermin come - there is one of their swarm that Sotek has demanded be slain. Its death must be sacrificial, and performed in battle. Now go and hunt!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The Itz'xa'Khanx, those servants ringed by the ocean - the ones that have remained on the island as the Old Ones intended - broadly act to preserve our defences against the Ancient Enemy. We should consider aligning with them for the present."

missions.localised_description: "The Itz'xa'Khanx, those servants ringed by the ocean - the ones that have remained on the island as the Old Ones intended - broadly act to preserve our defences against the Ancient Enemy. We should consider aligning with them for the present."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Great Master, it seems the lost servants will not return to the island in peace. They are no longer part of the Great Plan but are incongruent to it. As is your will, they must be decimated."

missions.localised_description: "Great Master, it seems the lost servants will not return to the island in peace. They are no longer part of the Great Plan but are incongruent to it. As is your will, they must be decimated."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "One specific plaque states that to defragment the Great Warding we need a certain spawning. Perhaps I should call upon the Pool Keepers to churn the waters and release those spawnlings?"

missions.localised_description: "One specific plaque states that to defragment the Great Warding we need a certain spawning. Perhaps I should call upon the Pool Keepers to churn the waters and release those spawnlings?"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Chotec rages! He must be appeased. We should wash the ground in the blood of our enemies. I have seen it in the plaques - this is how the great purpose proceeds."

missions.localised_description: "Chotec rages! He must be appeased. We should wash the ground in the blood of our enemies. I have seen it in the plaques - this is how the great purpose proceeds."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Master! With the Vortex in peril, we must quickly synchronise the contemplations of the younger generations and seek out knowledge that the Old Ones left for us and us alone."

missions.localised_description: "Master! With the Vortex in peril, we must quickly synchronise the contemplations of the younger generations and seek out knowledge that the Old Ones left for us and us alone."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Last Defender, the island-hopping Khanx hinder our plans. Set your cohorts against them and persuade them to return to their true home."

missions.localised_description: "Last Defender, the island-hopping Khanx hinder our plans. Set your cohorts against them and persuade them to return to their true home."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Slow! Corpulent you have become-come. The Council demand you work faster. Yes-yes! Spread far and wide - tails and whiskers are needed everywhere!"

missions.localised_description: "Slow! Corpulent you have become-come. The Council demand you work faster. Yes-yes! Spread far and wide - tails and whiskers are needed everywhere!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "I see-see you gain power. Prestige-status. Remember you are my pawn - do not-not forget I Grey Seer with Council backing! You'll never rise above me-me!"

missions.localised_description: "I see-see you gain power. Prestige-status. Remember you are my pawn - do not-not forget I Grey Seer with Council backing! You'll never rise above me-me!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Thirteen-thousand apologies! Please-beg that my punishment for intruding is not as severe as the last one, but I have news from Skavenblight, mighty-tailed one. The Lords of Decay speak - they wish easy ingress into your realm so that the clans may travel more freely. Search the ruins and open an old link - perhaps a Dwarf-thing-way that will connect to-to the tunnels of the Under-Empire?"

missions.localised_description: "Thirteen-thousand apologies! Please-beg that my punishment for intruding is not as severe as the last one, but I have news from Skavenblight, mighty-tailed one. The Lords of Decay speak - they wish easy ingress into your realm so that the clans may travel more freely. Search the ruins and open an old link - perhaps a Dwarf-thing-way that will connect to-to the tunnels of the Under-Empire?"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "A moment of your time, greatest of greater Lords who is-is very great. My master sends words that it is time to enact an Age of Ruin. The Elf-things, the Reptile-things - all things shall quake before my master's wrath. Or so he says. You are his conduit. Bring ruin... Please."

missions.localised_description: "A moment of your time, greatest of greater Lords who is-is very great. My master sends words that it is time to enact an Age of Ruin. The Elf-things, the Reptile-things - all things shall quake before my master's wrath. Or so he says. You are his conduit. Bring ruin... Please."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Most potent of potentates! The power and Warpstone is yours to take. My master, Vulscreek, starts to fear you. Perhaps even a seat on the Council of Thirteen will be yours if you continue to gain influence? Carve an empire and Skavenblight will take notice."

missions.localised_description: "Most potent of potentates! The power and Warpstone is yours to take. My master, Vulscreek, starts to fear you. Perhaps even a seat on the Council of Thirteen will be yours if you continue to gain influence? Carve an empire and Skavenblight will take notice."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "I am sorry to bother you - have I mentioned how much I envy-lust your fine tail, my lord? We have received word from Clan Skurvy. They are on Council's business and request we prepare their arrival by controlling the ports. They will pay in Warpstone."

missions.localised_description: "I am sorry to bother you - have I mentioned how much I envy-lust your fine tail, my lord? We have received word from Clan Skurvy. They are on Council's business and request we prepare their arrival by controlling the ports. They will pay in Warpstone."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Excuse my interference in your empire building, greatest of all whiskered-masters, but the nasty-Elf-things of the North dare to interfere in your great works. If our scout-spies are to be believed, the things also seek out Warpstone for their rituals. Master-Grey Seer Vulscreek orders they must be stopped. He says to do it "now-now" - I am only the messenger!"

missions.localised_description: "Excuse my interference in your empire building, greatest of all whiskered-masters, but the nasty-Elf-things of the North dare to interfere in your great works. If our scout-spies are to be believed, the things also seek out Warpstone for their rituals. Master-Grey Seer Vulscreek orders they must be stopped. He says to do it "now-now" - I am only the messenger!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Well-well? What are you-you waiting for? A personal invite from Seerlord Kritislik? Get on with it! Breed warriors - send them above ground - enslave the no-furs!"

missions.localised_description: "Well-well? What are you-you waiting for? A personal invite from Seerlord Kritislik? Get on with it! Breed warriors - send them above ground - enslave the no-furs!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Why-why they call you Headtaker? Hmm-HMM? I don't see many heads on your trophy rack. Perhaps they should call you Queek Headless-taker? Yes-yes? I would fill up your rack if I were you…"

missions.localised_description: "Why-why they call you Headtaker? Hmm-HMM? I don't see many heads on your trophy rack. Perhaps they should call you Queek Headless-taker? Yes-yes? I would fill up your rack if I were you…"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The Warpstone must be mined-found! These things are in our way! Make them move - make them die-die!"

missions.localised_description: "The Warpstone must be mined-found! These things are in our way! Make them move - make them die-die!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Lord, I will flay myself vigorously for this-this interruption but envoys from Clan Moulder are here - their services are crucial to my master's plan in time. For now, they must be seen to be favoured - we must impress on them how crucial their 'products' are to-to our success."

missions.localised_description: "Lord, I will flay myself vigorously for this-this interruption but envoys from Clan Moulder are here - their services are crucial to my master's plan in time. For now, they must be seen to be favoured - we must impress on them how crucial their 'products' are to-to our success."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Pathetic! So much for the Right-Claw of Gnawdwell! If you are not-not up to the job, perhaps I shall call in the Deathmaster, yes-yes? Make Clan Mors dominant?"

missions.localised_description: "Pathetic! So much for the Right-Claw of Gnawdwell! If you are not-not up to the job, perhaps I shall call in the Deathmaster, yes-yes? Make Clan Mors dominant?"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "For next part of the plan, Clan Moulder are growing something very-very special! They need payment. We must ensure delivery - find funds!"

missions.localised_description: "For next part of the plan, Clan Moulder are growing something very-very special! They need payment. We must ensure delivery - find funds!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Curses! The Reptile-things are agitated. My scrying suggests they think their pitiful Snake-God, Sotek, returns. They are fools! Yet if they believe this then it emboldens them against us-us. We must not repeat what happened last time! My plan requires Clan Pestilens presence in jungle-continent. Assassinate-kill their prophets, yes-yes! Strike down their priests - Sotek be-be forgotten!"

missions.localised_description: "Curses! The Reptile-things are agitated. My scrying suggests they think their pitiful Snake-God, Sotek, returns. They are fools! Yet if they believe this then it emboldens them against us-us. We must not repeat what happened last time! My plan requires Clan Pestilens presence in jungle-continent. Assassinate-kill their prophets, yes-yes! Strike down their priests - Sotek be-be forgotten!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Cast the rite, fool! Quickly, make our enemies fear the power of the Thirteen Lords of Decay!"

missions.localised_description: "Cast the rite, fool! Quickly, make our enemies fear the power of the Thirteen Lords of Decay!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Most cunning magnificence… if I may bother you with an insignificance? I have received intelligence that a rival Warlord seeks to usurp your position. This could upset your - and the Council's - plans, most lordly of lords. If that wasn't enough, he-he called your fur mangy..."

missions.localised_description: "Most cunning magnificence… if I may bother you with an insignificance? I have received intelligence that a rival Warlord seeks to usurp your position. This could upset your - and the Council's - plans, most lordly of lords. If that wasn't enough, he-he called your fur mangy..."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The Council's plan-scheme is nearly complete, but a piece of the machine I still need. Get it for me-me!"

missions.localised_description: "The Council's plan-scheme is nearly complete, but a piece of the machine I still need. Get it for me-me!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "I know you hate us-us, Queek. Despise Grey Seers, yes-yes? Well, I have a task you will-will enjoy. There is another Seer who insists my plan is his plan, taking credit in the Council for my initiatives. He needs to die. Do-do this and I will grant you a boon! Whisper words in Gnawdwell's ear about your greatness! We have pact-deal?"

missions.localised_description: "I know you hate us-us, Queek. Despise Grey Seers, yes-yes? Well, I have a task you will-will enjoy. There is another Seer who insists my plan is his plan, taking credit in the Council for my initiatives. He needs to die. Do-do this and I will grant you a boon! Whisper words in Gnawdwell's ear about your greatness! We have pact-deal?"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "My masters on the Council ask for progress, Lord Skrolk. We must-must soon begin the Ritual of Decay. Use your followers, my-my lord, spread their pestilent gifts far and wide, yes-yes!"

missions.localised_description: "My masters on the Council ask for progress, Lord Skrolk. We must-must soon begin the Ritual of Decay. Use your followers, my-my lord, spread their pestilent gifts far and wide, yes-yes!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "I-I speak for the Council. They are suspicious, yes-yes… They wonder if you put your own interests-desires before theirs? A test-test is needed; prove yourself to the Council of Thirteen, become a willing tool of the Lords of Decay and bring about the end-end of all things!"

missions.localised_description: "I-I speak for the Council. They are suspicious, yes-yes… They wonder if you put your own interests-desires before theirs? A test-test is needed; prove yourself to the Council of Thirteen, become a willing tool of the Lords of Decay and bring about the end-end of all things!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "We have made our play! The Grey Seer Clan is now the sacrifice. They control the Council and will send all the other Clans against us! We must fight-fight, we must win - the Horned Rat will favour us-us!"

missions.localised_description: "We have made our play! The Grey Seer Clan is now the sacrifice. They control the Council and will send all the other Clans against us! We must fight-fight, we must win - the Horned Rat will favour us-us!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Useless! You are-are as incompetent as Thanquol! More things need to die! I have negotiated with Clan Eshin on your behalf. I suggest you-you hire their best."

missions.localised_description: "Useless! You are-are as incompetent as Thanquol! More things need to die! I have negotiated with Clan Eshin on your behalf. I suggest you-you hire their best."

localised_description.last_approved_text: "The-the Vermin Lord, the Screaming One, it still speaks to me… It wants power to force its way unto the-the Shadow Council of Thirteen - I do not know what that is! It says we must infest this realm. Then tribute will be paid in full!"

missions.localised_description: "The-the Vermin Lord, the Screaming One, it still speaks to me… It wants power to force its way unto the-the Shadow Council of Thirteen - I do not know what that is! It says we must infest this realm. Then tribute will be paid in full!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Greetings, oh glorious lord! Your tail is long with many defined segments! I-I could not begin to-to comprehend how you command such great hordes… but if I may - a tiny suggestion? Begin great works. Learn or steal knowledge! Clan Skryre is the most powerful clan due to their technological dominance - we must better them!"

missions.localised_description: "Greetings, oh glorious lord! Your tail is long with many defined segments! I-I could not begin to-to comprehend how you command such great hordes… but if I may - a tiny suggestion? Begin great works. Learn or steal knowledge! Clan Skryre is the most powerful clan due to their technological dominance - we must better them!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Thirteen-thousand apologies, for disturbing you, pestilent lord, but the Reptile-things come! They steal our Warpstone. Casting it into pools of horrible pure light! My master, Vulscreek, insists you-you deal with them. You are of Clan Pestilens - the reptile of Sotek must be destroyed, yes-yes!"

missions.localised_description: "Thirteen-thousand apologies, for disturbing you, pestilent lord, but the Reptile-things come! They steal our Warpstone. Casting it into pools of horrible pure light! My master, Vulscreek, insists you-you deal with them. You are of Clan Pestilens - the reptile of Sotek must be destroyed, yes-yes!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: "Oh, great and powerful lord. I have blessed news that I am unworthy to bear. A great seam of Warpstone has been found close by - fuel to power the rituals and construct our device! We must capture it, great one, at once, before other clans or things get their claws on it!"

missions.localised_description: "Oh, great and powerful lord. I have blessed news that I am unworthy to bear. A great seam of Warpstone has been found close by - fuel to power the rituals and construct our device! We must capture it, great one, at once, before other clans or things get their claws on it!"

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Realm of Chaos plays fast and loose with the concept of time... Once a devout and pure Templar Priest of Sigmar, Archaon searched ancient texts for the means to destroy Chaos, but his studies proved worse than futile. Uncovering a set of heretical manuscripts, he learned a terrible truth which drove him to an unquenchable fury. Rejecting his former gods, he swore himself to the service of Chaos instead. Tearing down the temple, Archaon vowed to become the scourge of the Empire. The scrolls contained details of several artefacts of power and of a great warrior who would win the items and gain the blessing of all the Ruinous Powers. Archaon has vowed to become this man, or die in the attempt. Having cut a bloody swathe across the Empire, he has entered the dreaded Chaos Wastes. Many lesser servants of Chaos have come to follow him, but now he searches for true Warriors of Chaos, sworn "Swords" to form the core of his forces and demonstrate his might.

missions.localised_description: The Realm of Chaos plays fast and loose with the concept of time... Once a devout and pure Templar Priest of Sigmar, Archaon searched ancient texts for the means to destroy Chaos, but his studies proved worse than futile. Uncovering a set of heretical manuscripts, he learned a terrible truth which drove him to an unquenchable fury. Rejecting his former gods, he swore himself to the service of Chaos instead. Tearing down the temple, Archaon vowed to become the scourge of the Empire. The scrolls contained details of several artefacts of power and of a great warrior who would win the items and gain the blessing of all the Ruinous Powers. Archaon has vowed to become this man, or die in the attempt. Having cut a bloody swathe across the Empire, he has entered the dreaded Chaos Wastes. Many lesser servants of Chaos have come to follow him, but now he searches for true Warriors of Chaos, sworn "Swords" to form the core of his forces and demonstrate his might.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As Archaon marches across the surreal wastes, flanked by the Swords of Chaos, his elite guard, he is driven on by a remorseless maxim which beats at his consciousness: strength begets strength! Rare is the man who rises, or falls, to the station of a Chaos Lord. Nevertheless, some have, and each represents a challenge to Archaon, but the fallen Templar knows that all are the playthings of the Dark Gods and that only by amusing these all-powerful beings will he rise to dominance. Archaon resolves to build his strength for the Unholy Quests ahead, the trials of the Everchosen yet to come.

missions.localised_description: As Archaon marches across the surreal wastes, flanked by the Swords of Chaos, his elite guard, he is driven on by a remorseless maxim which beats at his consciousness: strength begets strength! Rare is the man who rises, or falls, to the station of a Chaos Lord. Nevertheless, some have, and each represents a challenge to Archaon, but the fallen Templar knows that all are the playthings of the Dark Gods and that only by amusing these all-powerful beings will he rise to dominance. Archaon resolves to build his strength for the Unholy Quests ahead, the trials of the Everchosen yet to come.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The time is nigh. The weird moon Morrslieb leers down from a sky pregnant with the stuff of change. The gaze of the Dark Gods is full upon the Chaos Wastes and Archaon means to place himself at its centre. He sends an emissary forth to seek a worthy challenger against whom he will display his might.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The gateways that divide worlds swell with power, and the dark shadow of Chaos spills outwards, engulfing all in its path. Before this irresistible tide, the minions of the Dark Powers gather, and Archaon draws them to his cause. Countless tribes of northern barbarians, roving bands of Chaos Warriors and all manner of mutant beasts flock to his banner, attracted by the unmistakable lure of raw power. The world trembles before the horde as city after city is set to torch, the souls of the vanquished on the pyre and devoured by Daemons.

The world trembles before the horde as city after city is set to torch, the souls of the vanquished on the pyre and devoured by Daemons.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Once more Archaon's deeds have drawn the gaze of the Gods of Chaos, and once more he sends forth an emissary with a challenge to any who deem themselves worthy to confront him.

missions.localised_description: Once more Archaon's deeds have drawn the gaze of the Gods of Chaos, and once more he sends forth an emissary with a challenge to any who deem themselves worthy to confront him.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Once more Archaon's deeds have drawn the gaze of the Gods of Chaos, and once more he sends forth an emissary with a challenge to any who deem themselves worthy to confront him.

missions.localised_description: Once more Archaon's deeds have drawn the gaze of the Gods of Chaos, and once more he sends forth an emissary with a challenge to any who deem themselves worthy to confront him.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Ruinous Powers have found some fleeting entertainment in Archaon’s feats to date, but there remain others who also command their attention. Archaon has seen his own destiny though, revealed to him in the heretical manuscripts of Necrodomo the Insane, who tore out his own eyes after having a vision of the destruction of the world at Archaon’s hands. His power waxes ever stronger, and with it the favour of the Dark Gods.

missions.localised_description: The Ruinous Powers have found some fleeting entertainment in Archaon’s feats to date, but there remain others who also command their attention. Archaon has seen his own destiny though, revealed to him in the heretical manuscripts of Necrodomo the Insane, who tore out his own eyes after having a vision of the destruction of the world at Archaon’s hands. His power waxes ever stronger, and with it the favour of the Dark Gods.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Although his accumulation of power is remorseless, Archaon finds himself chafing at the steady pace. Gripped by conviction as to his fate, he searches in vain for a challenge worthy of him. At last, after weeks or perhaps months of aimless wandering, Archaon determines to seek answers from one of the Chaos Sorcerers who have attached themselves to his horde. Such mortals barter fractions of their souls in exchange for greater magical powers. They are seen as the oracles of the Gods and act as prophets, seers and counsellors, guiding their warlords and chieftains to ever greater conquests.
