localised_description.last_approved_text: The fell Gods of Chaos ask for total and complete devotion from their followers, and they grow strong upon the conflict and bloodshed they unleash. In exchange, the Ruinous Powers offer their champions dark blessings - gifts that make the faithful mighty indeed. For the chosen few, whose heaped sacrifices draw the gaze of their patrons time and again, no reward - not even that of immortality - is beyond their grasp. Yet Archaon’s destiny drives an ambition higher still, and as his power grows ever greater it demands a Warshrine to focus the gaze of the Dark Gods upon him above all others.

missions.localised_description: The fell Gods of Chaos ask for total and complete devotion from their followers, and they grow strong upon the conflict and bloodshed they unleash. In exchange, the Ruinous Powers offer their champions dark blessings - gifts that make the faithful mighty indeed. For the chosen few, whose heaped sacrifices draw the gaze of their patrons time and again, no reward - not even that of immortality - is beyond their grasp. Yet Archaon’s destiny drives an ambition higher still, and as his power grows ever greater it demands a Warshrine to focus the gaze of the Dark Gods upon him above all others.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The rewards of the Chaos Gods take many bizarre forms. A champion might be blessed with great strength and fortitude, or his flesh may start to mutate; his limbs twisting into strange and deadly forms or his soul blasted, reducing him to a mindless beast. Other gifts are broader in scope, affecting a Chaos Lord's qualities as a leader. The blood-slick trail that such a man carves upon the groaning face of the world creates a resonance with the Ruinous Powers and, in exchange, followers are drawn to his banner. Blessings such as these are another measure of patronage, and as such Archaon must excel in them, as in all else.

The blood-slick trail that such a man carves upon the groaning face of the world creates a resonance with the Ruinous Powers and, in exchange, followers are drawn to his banner. Blessings such as these are another measure of patronage, and as such Archaon must excel in them, as in all else.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Again the need to vanquish a rival weighs heavy on Archaon. The easy conquests that he has made in mortal lands are as nothing compared to the true test that only a Lord of Chaos can provide. Once more he sends forth his emissary to search the wastes for one who is worthy of facing him blade to blade; and so another trial is enacted.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Far to the north, deep in the roots of the mountains, Kholek Suneater has slept for generations. A Shaggoth of tremendous age, first-born of Krakanrok, father of the Dragon Ogres, he stirs, sensing his time as the Bringer of Darkness is come once more. Dire storm clouds gather around the peaks and crags where the Mountain God is said to slumber, yet Suneater is not fully awake. Before a great chasm that splits the mountains like a gigantic axe wound, hundreds upon hundreds of Northmen kneel in the pelting hail and snow, chanting sonorously as tribute after screaming tribute is hurled bodily down into the cavernous lair. Over the chanting rises another voice, distorted to guttural inhumanity. As a sorcerer-servant of the Ruinous Powers completes the summoning, rocks explode as a cataclysmic lightning bolt lances down.

missions.localised_description: Far to the north, deep in the roots of the mountains, Kholek Suneater has slept for generations. A Shaggoth of tremendous age, first-born of Krakanrok, father of the Dragon Ogres, he stirs, sensing his time as the Bringer of Darkness is come once more. Dire storm clouds gather around the peaks and crags where the Mountain God is said to slumber, yet Suneater is not fully awake. Before a great chasm that splits the mountains like a gigantic axe wound, hundreds upon hundreds of Northmen kneel in the pelting hail and snow, chanting sonorously as tribute after screaming tribute is hurled bodily down into the cavernous lair. Over the chanting rises another voice, distorted to guttural inhumanity. As a sorcerer-servant of the Ruinous Powers completes the summoning, rocks explode as a cataclysmic lightning bolt lances down.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With a mighty crash of thunder and scintillating display of lightning that channels into the deepest of crevices, Kholek emerges from his lair onto the mountainside. The tribes prostrate themselves before their terrible master. And yet this display of utter abasement does nothing to quell the mighty Shaggoth’s rage! Starcrusher, his gigantic arcane hammer, is missing! Vanished while the Dragon Ogre slept. A search must begin, the tribes must find the location of Starcrusher or all will be obliterated by their master’s indescribable wrath!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Prince Sigvald the Magnificent is bored. The Chaos Wastes are all well and good as far as such things go, but they lack certain comforts that a man of Sigvald’s refined tastes has come to expect. Sigvald is the chosen scion of Slaanesh, the Dark Prince of Chaos. Known as the Lord of Excess, Slaanesh is the master of passions and sensual indulgence, but also of cruel torments and despairing agony. He is the patron of the obsessive, and his attention is drawn to those who inflict pain to satisfy their own desires. As the adopted son of Slaanesh, Sigvald is the personification of beauty on the outside, but rot within. He is attended by dozens who attend to his every whim and desire, but a man can never have too many admirers. As he stands in the midst of battle, preening and murmuring compliments to himself while beings die all around him, he has a whim to gather to himself a band of perfectly-skilled retainers to share in this adulation, perhaps holding mirrors that he might see himself more clearly.

missions.localised_description: Prince Sigvald the Magnificent is bored. The Chaos Wastes are all well and good as far as such things go, but they lack certain comforts that a man of Sigvald’s refined tastes has come to expect. Sigvald is the chosen scion of Slaanesh, the Dark Prince of Chaos. Known as the Lord of Excess, Slaanesh is the master of passions and sensual indulgence, but also of cruel torments and despairing agony. He is the patron of the obsessive, and his attention is drawn to those who inflict pain to satisfy their own desires. As the adopted son of Slaanesh, Sigvald is the personification of beauty on the outside, but rot within. He is attended by dozens who attend to his every whim and desire, but a man can never have too many admirers. As he stands in the midst of battle, preening and murmuring compliments to himself while beings die all around him, he has a whim to gather to himself a band of perfectly-skilled retainers to share in this adulation, perhaps holding mirrors that he might see himself more clearly.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Prince Sigvald is not happy. The field of battle is his playground, where his dark father can revel in his son’s cruel deeds. But it is also a place of squalor, of mud, blood and ordure. In every battle, Sigvald is constantly inconvenienced by the need to clean some vile taint from his otherwise spotless armour, be it dirt or the lifeblood of his latest victim. These interruptions are irksome in the extreme and they deprive his followers of precious moments in which to admire and praise their Lord’s perfection. Reluctantly, the Geld-Prince summons a Chaos Sorcerer to advise him. Though the man bears unsightly mutations and cannot be described as sweet-smelling, the fact that he has traded his very soul in servitude to the magic of the Dark Gods means that he may be able to suggest a solution.

missions.localised_description: Prince Sigvald is not happy. The field of battle is his playground, where his dark father can revel in his son’s cruel deeds. But it is also a place of squalor, of mud, blood and ordure. In every battle, Sigvald is constantly inconvenienced by the need to clean some vile taint from his otherwise spotless armour, be it dirt or the lifeblood of his latest victim. These interruptions are irksome in the extreme and they deprive his followers of precious moments in which to admire and praise their Lord’s perfection. Reluctantly, the Geld-Prince summons a Chaos Sorcerer to advise him. Though the man bears unsightly mutations and cannot be described as sweet-smelling, the fact that he has traded his very soul in servitude to the magic of the Dark Gods means that he may be able to suggest a solution.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The mad sorcerer rants wild-eyed of the many visions gifted to him by the Ruinous Powers. There is much spittle-flecked talk of lakes of blood, crystalline butterflies, gardens of rot and so on. Sigvald finds his attention wandering to a complacent consideration of the perfection in his own immaculately manicured hand. However, his attention snaps back to the Sorcerer when the man’s meanderings touch upon a great Lord in shining baroque armour of ensorcelled gold, forever untarnished by age or the tiniest fleck of dirt and surrounded by warm perfumed air, even on the snowy plain across which he marches at the head of a great Chaos host. The ground reshapes itself to let the warrior pass, and his feet float an inch above the world’s surface so that his boots are never touched by the mud or gore of the battlefield. There follows some babbling about the defensive properties of this wondrous mail, but Sigvald hears none of it as he curtly orders the Sorcerer forth to investigate.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Prince Sigvald is in search of a new diversion. The scion of Slaanesh was ever one to satisfy a dark desire, be it carnal, the casual murder of the ugly or irritating, the eradication of whole cities on a whim, or even the sweet savour of flesh. But for every new height of cruel depravity he conquers, there are always greater peaks to be scaled. Jaded in the extreme, Sigvald has decided to allow his caprice free reign amongst his supposed allies. First, all must be compelled to admire Slaanesh’s favoured son, however unwillingly.

missions.localised_description: Prince Sigvald is in search of a new diversion. The scion of Slaanesh was ever one to satisfy a dark desire, be it carnal, the casual murder of the ugly or irritating, the eradication of whole cities on a whim, or even the sweet savour of flesh. But for every new height of cruel depravity he conquers, there are always greater peaks to be scaled. Jaded in the extreme, Sigvald has decided to allow his caprice free reign amongst his supposed allies. First, all must be compelled to admire Slaanesh’s favoured son, however unwillingly.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Feted by a legion of devoted admirers wherever he goes, Prince Sigvald basks in the adulation that is his due. Rare is the man who will not willingly forsake his Lord to follow the Geld-Prince. And yet such men do exist, thralls to Lords who through jealousy will not acknowledge him as Sigvald the Magnificent. An example must be made. One of these malcontents must die, and in a cruel and degrading fashion that will pay homage to the Dark Prince of Chaos.

And yet such men do exist, thralls to Lords who through jealousy will not acknowledge him as Sigvald the Magnificent. An example must be made. One of these malcontents must die, and in a cruel and degrading fashion that will pay homage to the Dark Prince of Chaos.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A great man's appeal is many-faceted, and surely no-one would dispute that Prince Sigvald is the greatest of men. He is devastatingly handsome, moves with the lithe grace of a cat and has a magnetic personality and charm. A throng of admirers follow him wheresoever he goes, strewing his path with lavish gifts as they strive just to be noticed by him.

missions.localised_description: A great man's appeal is many-faceted, and surely no-one would dispute that Prince Sigvald is the greatest of men. He is devastatingly handsome, moves with the lithe grace of a cat and has a magnetic personality and charm. A throng of admirers follow him wheresoever he goes, strewing his path with lavish gifts as they strive just to be noticed by him.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Higher and ever higher, the Geld-Prince’s stock rises. All know him to be the moving hand behind the murder of his rival, yet all applaud his actions. Rumour has it that the mortal had been on the verge of attaining a higher station, a position of power under the full gaze of the Chaos Gods. If any man is well-suited to being gazed at though, it is surely Prince Sigvald the Magnificent.

missions.localised_description: Higher and ever higher, the Geld-Prince’s stock rises. All know him to be the moving hand behind the murder of his rival, yet all applaud his actions. Rumour has it that the mortal had been on the verge of attaining a higher station, a position of power under the full gaze of the Chaos Gods. If any man is well-suited to being gazed at though, it is surely Prince Sigvald the Magnificent.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Higher and ever higher, the Geld-Prince’s stock rises. All applaud his every action and a clamour rises for him to be awarded a higher station, a position of power under the full gaze of the Chaos Gods. If any man is well-suited to being gazed at though, it is surely Prince Sigvald the Magnificent.

missions.localised_description: Higher and ever higher, the Geld-Prince’s stock rises. All applaud his every action and a clamour rises for him to be awarded a higher station, a position of power under the full gaze of the Chaos Gods. If any man is well-suited to being gazed at though, it is surely Prince Sigvald the Magnificent.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As the scion of the Chaos God Slaanesh, none can say that Prince Sigvald is not a generous man. To face him on the field of battle is to watch an artist at work, and his fatal blade has ended the suffering of countless fools who know they are unworthy even to look upon his physical perfection. Now his generous spirit manifests itself once again as he sends forth a herald to share word of his magnificence.

missions.localised_description: As the scion of the Chaos God Slaanesh, none can say that Prince Sigvald is not a generous man. To face him on the field of battle is to watch an artist at work, and his fatal blade has ended the suffering of countless fools who know they are unworthy even to look upon his physical perfection. Now his generous spirit manifests itself once again as he sends forth a herald to share word of his magnificence.

To face him on the field of battle is to watch an artist at work, and his fatal blade has ended the suffering of countless fools who know they are unworthy even to look upon his physical perfection. Now his generous spirit manifests itself once again as he sends forth a herald to share word of his magnificence.

missions.localised_description: As the scion of the Chaos God Slaanesh, none can say that Prince Sigvald is not a generous man. To face him on the field of battle is to watch an artist at work, and his fatal blade has ended the suffering of countless fools who know they are unworthy even to look upon his physical perfection. Now his generous spirit manifests itself once again as he sends forth a herald to share word of his magnificence.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Archaon stands beneath a storm-shaken sky boiling with eldritch power, pelted by an inverted rain of blood, and buffeted by hot winds. Here, one can witness the rebellion of nature itself, where even the elements are torn between the mortal and immortal worlds. Before him looms a monolith, raised to the glory of a Chaos Champion, the twisted ground at its base littered with skulls from whence screams of malice arise “A challenger comes!”

missions.localised_description: Archaon stands beneath a storm-shaken sky boiling with eldritch power, pelted by an inverted rain of blood, and buffeted by hot winds. Here, one can witness the rebellion of nature itself, where even the elements are torn between the mortal and immortal worlds. Before him looms a monolith, raised to the glory of a Chaos Champion, the twisted ground at its base littered with skulls from whence screams of malice arise “A challenger comes!”

localised_description.last_approved_text: The earth groans before the might of Archaon. Having gained the favour of all the Chaos Gods, he stands on the brink of destiny. The Winds of Magic howl from the uttermost north where the gates between worlds strain and then burst asunder, admitting a single diabolical form. A Daemonic champion, a Lord of Change, comes to offer a final test to the man who would unite all of the forces of Chaos into an unholy horde bent on subjugating the entire mortal world.

missions.localised_description: The earth groans before the might of Archaon. Having gained the favour of all the Chaos Gods, he stands on the brink of destiny. The Winds of Magic howl from the uttermost north where the gates between worlds strain and then burst asunder, admitting a single diabolical form. A Daemonic champion, a Lord of Change, comes to offer a final test to the man who would unite all of the forces of Chaos into an unholy horde bent on subjugating the entire mortal world.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Twisted in body and mind, the sorcerer twitches convulsively in the grip of the Gods and howls a vision of mountains twisted into fantastical shapes with gaping maws jutting out of cliff faces bellowing to be fed the flesh of mortals. Before the mountains lies a bloodstained plain bordered by a forest of trees contorted into blackened skeletons, straining their branches towards warm-blooded creatures. In the tumultuous skies overhead, winged death swoops. A once-noble ruler of the skies, now corrupt with change, a two-headed Dragon of Chaos trumpets its challenge.

missions.localised_description: Twisted in body and mind, the sorcerer twitches convulsively in the grip of the Gods and howls a vision of mountains twisted into fantastical shapes with gaping maws jutting out of cliff faces bellowing to be fed the flesh of mortals. Before the mountains lies a bloodstained plain bordered by a forest of trees contorted into blackened skeletons, straining their branches towards warm-blooded creatures. In the tumultuous skies overhead, winged death swoops. A once-noble ruler of the skies, now corrupt with change, a two-headed Dragon of Chaos trumpets its challenge.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As Archaon rides onward, many challenge him, but none can stand before his might. Sparing those who swear fealty, he slays the rest, claiming their warbands as his own by right of conquest. Now he receives word of another challenger, one who will not bend the knee. A mighty Chaos Sorcerer Lord defies him, daring to offer battle with a horde of warriors under his command. The sorcerer wields the wild energies of entropy itself, reshaping reality to better serve his whims and those of his dark masters. A word and a gesture from him can strip the flesh from a man’s bones, or cause a regiment of soldiers to burst into flames. Archaon makes his final preparations to pit the martial might of his troops against the raw magical power of his adversary.

missions.localised_description: As Archaon rides onward, many challenge him, but none can stand before his might. Sparing those who swear fealty, he slays the rest, claiming their warbands as his own by right of conquest. Now he receives word of another challenger, one who will not bend the knee. A mighty Chaos Sorcerer Lord defies him, daring to offer battle with a horde of warriors under his command. The sorcerer wields the wild energies of entropy itself, reshaping reality to better serve his whims and those of his dark masters. A word and a gesture from him can strip the flesh from a man’s bones, or cause a regiment of soldiers to burst into flames. Archaon makes his final preparations to pit the martial might of his troops against the raw magical power of his adversary.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The agent reports that Starcrusher now lies in the ruins of Todtheim - taken there by agents of the Deceiver. The ancient city is being fought over by its winged Undead residents and Orcs. But Kholek is the greater threat by far, and when he comes in thunder to reclaim Starcrusher, flanked by hordes of fanatical Northmen, the thieves will come to know the true meaning of annihilation.

missions.localised_description: The agent reports that Starcrusher now lies in the ruins of Todtheim - taken there by agents of the Deceiver. The ancient city is being fought over by its winged Undead residents and Orcs. But Kholek is the greater threat by far, and when he comes in thunder to reclaim Starcrusher, flanked by hordes of fanatical Northmen, the thieves will come to know the true meaning of annihilation.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The sorcerer sends word that he has located the golden warrior and stands ready to transport his Lord to the location. Sigvald indulges himself with a last yearning gaze into his mirror, his mind filled with a shining vision of himself clad in the Auric Armour, perfection in both form and in function as he blesses the battlefield with new depths of cruelty.

missions.localised_description: The sorcerer sends word that he has located the golden warrior and stands ready to transport his Lord to the location. Sigvald indulges himself with a last yearning gaze into his mirror, his mind filled with a shining vision of himself clad in the Auric Armour, perfection in both form and in function as he blesses the battlefield with new depths of cruelty.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Jealousy - an ugly word to some, sinful even. Yet what man or woman fortunate enough to behold the scion of Slaanesh can help but harbour a kernel of envy at his cruel perfection? Flanked by scores of devoted admirers wherever he goes, a callous and deadly Lord of battle, and spoiled by his indulgent adoptive father Slaanesh, the Geld-Prince’s every wildly-excessive wish is made manifest. But such renown has its price. The Champions of Chaos are forever searching for more power, and with it, the chance to attract the eye of the Gods themselves. They are constantly hunting out rivals and great duels are fought, with the victor winning further infamy and power. Now a Chaos Lord rival challenges Prince Sigvald the Magnificent, driven by envy and a lust for power, and with an army of hideous beasts repellent to the Geld-Prince.

missions.localised_description: Jealousy - an ugly word to some, sinful even. Yet what man or woman fortunate enough to behold the scion of Slaanesh can help but harbour a kernel of envy at his cruel perfection? Flanked by scores of devoted admirers wherever he goes, a callous and deadly Lord of battle, and spoiled by his indulgent adoptive father Slaanesh, the Geld-Prince’s every wildly-excessive wish is made manifest. But such renown has its price. The Champions of Chaos are forever searching for more power, and with it, the chance to attract the eye of the Gods themselves. They are constantly hunting out rivals and great duels are fought, with the victor winning further infamy and power. Now a Chaos Lord rival challenges Prince Sigvald the Magnificent, driven by envy and a lust for power, and with an army of hideous beasts repellent to the Geld-Prince.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The curses of man are many - they think to purge the forests of the warherds! Todbringer sends out his armies from Middenheim to rid the Drakwald of Gors. They have slain bray-kin, while the chieftains vie for petty power. However, should the Cloven Ones flock to one banner, Middenheim stands high on the Ulricsberg plateau, making a brute force attack futile. No, to make Boris Todbringer pay, a more cunning approach is needed if the Children of Chaos are to raze his city to ash and ruin… \n\nKhazrak knows that the Elector Count of Middenheim is an honourable fool. Once he sees his people burning, Boris will surely come to their rescue, luring him away from the Ulricsberg. Such acts will also cause panic and fear in the Empire’s subjects, and quicken Beastmen hearts. Let the carnage begin under Khazrak’s command, so it is his name called as the blood starts to flow.

missions.localised_description: The curses of man are many - they think to purge the forests of the warherds! Todbringer sends out his armies from Middenheim to rid the Drakwald of Gors. They have slain bray-kin, while the chieftains vie for petty power. However, should the Cloven Ones flock to one banner, Middenheim stands high on the Ulricsberg plateau, making a brute force attack futile. No, to make Boris Todbringer pay, a more cunning approach is needed if the Children of Chaos are to raze his city to ash and ruin… \n\nKhazrak knows that the Elector Count of Middenheim is an honourable fool. Once he sees his people burning, Boris will surely come to their rescue, luring him away from the Ulricsberg. Such acts will also cause panic and fear in the Empire’s subjects, and quicken Beastmen hearts. Let the carnage begin under Khazrak’s command, so it is his name called as the blood starts to flow.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The raids go well, but the prey is wanting to flee before the reaving can be begin in earnest. Faster paws are needed to prevent the quarry from warning others of the Beastmen advance. The One-Eye orders more hounds to be gathered for his warherds - he prefers beasts with a toxic bite.

missions.localised_description: The raids go well, but the prey is wanting to flee before the reaving can be begin in earnest. Faster paws are needed to prevent the quarry from warning others of the Beastmen advance. The One-Eye orders more hounds to be gathered for his warherds - he prefers beasts with a toxic bite.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Middenland is reeling. The One-Eye’s rampage will certainly have got Todbringer’s attention. But that is not enough, Khazrak must not only draw the Elector Count’s remaining eye but make him hate too! A further act of spite and defilement is required, to make the Midden-Wolves desperate for vengeance!

missions.localised_description: Middenland is reeling. The One-Eye’s rampage will certainly have got Todbringer’s attention. But that is not enough, Khazrak must not only draw the Elector Count’s remaining eye but make him hate too! A further act of spite and defilement is required, to make the Midden-Wolves desperate for vengeance!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Middenland is ripe with fear - now is the time to plunge a dagger into its quivering heart and force Todbringer to act! Khazrak’s forces take to the beast-paths, surrounding a mannish town that represents everything the Beastmen despise about civilisation! The One-Eye must raze it to the ground and erect a Herdstone in its ruins – the Chaos Gods will be pleased!

missions.localised_description: Middenland is ripe with fear - now is the time to plunge a dagger into its quivering heart and force Todbringer to act! Khazrak’s forces take to the beast-paths, surrounding a mannish town that represents everything the Beastmen despise about civilisation! The One-Eye must raze it to the ground and erect a Herdstone in its ruins – the Chaos Gods will be pleased!

localised_description.last_approved_text: It seems that Todbringer has taken the bait. Khazrak sends out a Gor along the beast-paths to scout for Middenheimers.

missions.localised_description: It seems that Todbringer has taken the bait. Khazrak sends out a Gor along the beast-paths to scout for Middenheimers.

localised_description.last_approved_text: It seems that Todbringer has taken the bait. Khazrak sends out a Gor along the beast-paths to scout for Middenheimers.

missions.localised_description: It seems that Todbringer has taken the bait. Khazrak sends out a Gor along the beast-paths to scout for Middenheimers.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This is Khazrak's time - he embodies the primal force of the forest. He grows tired of Beastlord Graktar’s rule, a dominance only Graktar himself seems to recognise. A lame animal should be put out of its misery, even if the pathetic creature fails to realise it’s for the best.\n\nDespite Khazrak’s standing, Graktar remains a powerful force among those still loyal to him. A head-on collision may not be the best tactic, consult with the Bray-Shaman on how to pierce Graktar’s hide and make him easy prey!

missions.localised_description: This is Khazrak's time - he embodies the primal force of the forest. He grows tired of Beastlord Graktar’s rule, a dominance only Graktar himself seems to recognise. A lame animal should be put out of its misery, even if the pathetic creature fails to realise it’s for the best.\n\nDespite Khazrak’s standing, Graktar remains a powerful force among those still loyal to him. A head-on collision may not be the best tactic, consult with the Bray-Shaman on how to pierce Graktar’s hide and make him easy prey!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Bray-Shaman guts a Tuskgor in a darkling rite. As its steaming innards spill onto the ground, he foresees Khazrak at the head of a great warherd. However, this path is not yet set in stone. To topple Graktar, speaks the Shaman, the One-Eye must seek out a deadly poison from the Black Deeps. Even a creature as twisted as Graktar will fall under the poison’s touch, as it is made from the venom of the deadliest spiders in the forest.

missions.localised_description: The Bray-Shaman guts a Tuskgor in a darkling rite. As its steaming innards spill onto the ground, he foresees Khazrak at the head of a great warherd. However, this path is not yet set in stone. To topple Graktar, speaks the Shaman, the One-Eye must seek out a deadly poison from the Black Deeps. Even a creature as twisted as Graktar will fall under the poison’s touch, as it is made from the venom of the deadliest spiders in the forest.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Greenskins and their arachnid allies have scattered. Khazrak must look elsewhere for a source of poison. This shouldn’t be an impossible task as all races, whether fair or foul, have access to such lethal potions. Guided by witch-sight, a trusted Bray-Shaman knows what to look for. Send him to carry out this dark deed.

missions.localised_description: The Greenskins and their arachnid allies have scattered. Khazrak must look elsewhere for a source of poison. This shouldn’t be an impossible task as all races, whether fair or foul, have access to such lethal potions. Guided by witch-sight, a trusted Bray-Shaman knows what to look for. Send him to carry out this dark deed.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Even for the Beastmen, to enter the web-shrouded realms of the Black Deeps undetected is impossible. The Goblin Spider Boss now hunts the One-Eye, thinking he can use the herd to feed his colony, but the Greenskin deals with an intellect far more cunning than his own. While the Spider Boss searches, Khazrak makes for the heart of the arachnid realm. The dank lair contains many hatchlings - ripe for the picking without the Goblin Boss’ protection.

missions.localised_description: Even for the Beastmen, to enter the web-shrouded realms of the Black Deeps undetected is impossible. The Goblin Spider Boss now hunts the One-Eye, thinking he can use the herd to feed his colony, but the Greenskin deals with an intellect far more cunning than his own. While the Spider Boss searches, Khazrak makes for the heart of the arachnid realm. The dank lair contains many hatchlings - ripe for the picking without the Goblin Boss’ protection.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the venom in the One-Eye’s possession, Graktar has vanished. The Beastlord must have been weaker than even Khazrak suspected; Graktar’s Bray-Shamans must have read their own darkling omens and have got wind of the One-Eye’s plans. The fleeing Beastlord must be found quickly, before he can amass a large herd to protect him. Black-hearted crows bring word of possible herd movements in Esk...

missions.localised_description: With the venom in the One-Eye’s possession, Graktar has vanished. The Beastlord must have been weaker than even Khazrak suspected; Graktar’s Bray-Shamans must have read their own darkling omens and have got wind of the One-Eye’s plans. The fleeing Beastlord must be found quickly, before he can amass a large herd to protect him. Black-hearted crows bring word of possible herd movements in Esk...

The fleeing Beastlord must be found quickly, before he can amass a large herd to protect him. Black-hearted crows bring word of possible herd movements in Esk...

The Beastlord must have been weaker than even Khazrak suspected; Graktar’s Bray-Shamans must have read their own darkling omens and have got wind of the One-Eye’s plans. The fleeing Beastlord must be found quickly, before he can amass a large herd to protect him. Black-hearted crows bring word of possible herd movements in Esk...

localised_description.last_approved_text: There is a reason that Malagor is depicted as the arch-foe of Sigmar in tales and on wood carvings throughout the Empire. He is the Dark Omen that despises all gods in opposition to his Ruinous masters. But it is Sigmar he loathes the most, so where better to strike than at the Sigmarite Cult’s heartland - Reikland?\n\nLet the Uncloven folk who dwell within the borders of Reikland know that the Crowfather now stalks the lands.

missions.localised_description: There is a reason that Malagor is depicted as the arch-foe of Sigmar in tales and on wood carvings throughout the Empire. He is the Dark Omen that despises all gods in opposition to his Ruinous masters. But it is Sigmar he loathes the most, so where better to strike than at the Sigmarite Cult’s heartland - Reikland?\n\nLet the Uncloven folk who dwell within the borders of Reikland know that the Crowfather now stalks the lands.

He is the Dark Omen that despises all gods in opposition to his Ruinous masters. But it is Sigmar he loathes the most, so where better to strike than at the Sigmarite Cult’s heartland - Reikland?\n\nLet the Uncloven folk who dwell within the borders of Reikland know that the Crowfather now stalks the lands.

He is the Dark Omen that despises all gods in opposition to his Ruinous masters. But it is Sigmar he loathes the most, so where better to strike than at the Sigmarite Cult’s heartland - Reikland?\n\nLet the Uncloven folk who dwell within the borders of Reikland know that the Crowfather now stalks the lands.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Men quell in fear, barring their doors at night and hanging fetishes from eaves, not that it will do them any good. Yet while this pleases Malagor, he requires a tangible force to extract his toll in blood and death - a powerful warrior to carry out the next portion of his dark scheme. It is said the strongest beasts are found deep within the Forest of Shadows...

missions.localised_description: Men quell in fear, barring their doors at night and hanging fetishes from eaves, not that it will do them any good. Yet while this pleases Malagor, he requires a tangible force to extract his toll in blood and death - a powerful warrior to carry out the next portion of his dark scheme. It is said the strongest beasts are found deep within the Forest of Shadows...

localised_description.last_approved_text: Morrslieb glowers full this night. It is time to make camp and lay tributes to the Chaos Gods. The Ruinous Powers will surely empower the warherd for the battle to come, leading more bulls along the beast-paths to the Crowfather's sway.

missions.localised_description: Morrslieb glowers full this night. It is time to make camp and lay tributes to the Chaos Gods. The Ruinous Powers will surely empower the warherd for the battle to come, leading more bulls along the beast-paths to the Crowfather's sway.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Harbinger of Destruction’s work is never done. As long as Malagor can fly, he must sow disharmony and destruction on mankind - so it has been ordained by the Dark Gods. The raids continue, such acts of vilification will please the Gods and a reward will surely be granted.

missions.localised_description: The Harbinger of Destruction’s work is never done. As long as Malagor can fly, he must sow disharmony and destruction on mankind - so it has been ordained by the Dark Gods. The raids continue, such acts of vilification will please the Gods and a reward will surely be granted.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Dark Gods have indeed blessed the Malagor's brayherd. They whisper and mutter of the work still to do, showing the Dark Omen a vision of a burning temple in Grunberg and the ruins of civilisation strewn across Averland. Should these acts of vilification be fulfilled then a further blessing upon the Crowfather awaits.

missions.localised_description: The Dark Gods have indeed blessed the Malagor's brayherd. They whisper and mutter of the work still to do, showing the Dark Omen a vision of a burning temple in Grunberg and the ruins of civilisation strewn across Averland. Should these acts of vilification be fulfilled then a further blessing upon the Crowfather awaits.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Crowfather dispatches a minion to lead the warherd across the beast-paths to doomed Grunberg.

missions.localised_description: The Crowfather dispatches a minion to lead the warherd across the beast-paths to doomed Grunberg.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Crowfather dispatches a minion to lead the warherd across the beast-paths to doomed Grunberg.

missions.localised_description: The Crowfather dispatches a minion to lead the warherd across the beast-paths to doomed Grunberg.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Seen by Grimnir in woe and anger, a disgusting Gor - a behorned daemon - set about our honourable throng. Payment in kind is demanded!

missions.localised_description: Seen by Grimnir in woe and anger, a disgusting Gor - a behorned daemon - set about our honourable throng. Payment in kind is demanded!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Under the withering gaze of Valaya did a warrior of the beasts strike down a beloved hero of the Dawi. This tragedy cannot be allowed to stand!

missions.localised_description: Under the withering gaze of Valaya did a warrior of the beasts strike down a beloved hero of the Dawi. This tragedy cannot be allowed to stand!

localised_description.last_approved_text: As witnessed by Gazul, the filthy Beastman did dare to attack our fine Holds and property. Kill the Gor and make this right!

missions.localised_description: As witnessed by Gazul, the filthy Beastman did dare to attack our fine Holds and property. Kill the Gor and make this right!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Shamed in Grimnir’s sight did the bestial horde attack from many different angles, breaking the established rules of war. Cheaters all, and they should be punished!

missions.localised_description: Shamed in Grimnir’s sight did the bestial horde attack from many different angles, breaking the established rules of war. Cheaters all, and they should be punished!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Within Smednir’s vengeful glare did the Gors raid Dawi lands. A foul trespass! Right this wrong!

missions.localised_description: Within Smednir’s vengeful glare did the Gors raid Dawi lands. A foul trespass! Right this wrong!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Spied in the view of Grungni, the warherds of vile, skruff Beastmen pillage and despoil fine Dawi lands. Such a disgrace must be avenged!

missions.localised_description: Spied in the view of Grungni, the warherds of vile, skruff Beastmen pillage and despoil fine Dawi lands. Such a disgrace must be avenged!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Beastmen will only follow a leader who can prove themselves truly capable of shedding the blood of man. Seek out nearby human settlements and lay waste to them, display a fury so great that all Beastmen will yearn to be a part of your warherds!

missions.localised_description: The Beastmen will only follow a leader who can prove themselves truly capable of shedding the blood of man. Seek out nearby human settlements and lay waste to them, display a fury so great that all Beastmen will yearn to be a part of your warherds!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Beastmen will only follow a leader who can prove themselves truly capable of shedding the blood of man. Seek out nearby human settlements and lay waste to them, display a fury so great that all Beastmen will yearn to be a part of your warherds!

missions.localised_description: The Beastmen will only follow a leader who can prove themselves truly capable of shedding the blood of man. Seek out nearby human settlements and lay waste to them, display a fury so great that all Beastmen will yearn to be a part of your warherds!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Beastmen will only follow a leader who can prove themselves truly capable of shedding the blood of man. Seek out nearby human settlements and lay waste to them, display a fury so great that all Beastmen will yearn to be a part of your warherds!

missions.localised_description: The Beastmen will only follow a leader who can prove themselves truly capable of shedding the blood of man. Seek out nearby human settlements and lay waste to them, display a fury so great that all Beastmen will yearn to be a part of your warherds!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Another herd's Hero has become too much of a hazard. Destroy them - see that they never return.

missions.localised_description: Another herd's Hero has become too much of a hazard. Destroy them - see that they never return.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Hero of Chaos has become troublesome. See them dealt with, and remove this threat forever.

missions.localised_description: This Hero of Chaos has become troublesome. See them dealt with, and remove this threat forever.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This unfilthy, Uncloven, stunted Dwarf Hero has been allowed to sow trouble for too long. Bury this fool in his caverns - blot out his light.

missions.localised_description: This unfilthy, Uncloven, stunted Dwarf Hero has been allowed to sow trouble for too long. Bury this fool in his caverns - blot out his light.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This pompous, self-aggrandising Empire Hero believes himself greater than the herd. Bring him down to size - excise this malignancy for good.

missions.localised_description: This pompous, self-aggrandising Empire Hero believes himself greater than the herd. Bring him down to size - excise this malignancy for good.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Hero has become a nuisance to the herd. Send him to a gruesome grave, and remove this threat forever.

missions.localised_description: This Hero has become a nuisance to the herd. Send him to a gruesome grave, and remove this threat forever.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Hero has become a nuisance to the herd. Send him to a gruesome grave, and remove this threat forever.

missions.localised_description: This Hero has become a nuisance to the herd. Send him to a gruesome grave, and remove this threat forever.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This meddlesome Greenskin Hero pesters us, and can no longer be tolerated. Squash this pest underfoot.

missions.localised_description: This meddlesome Greenskin Hero pesters us, and can no longer be tolerated. Squash this pest underfoot.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This unfilthy, Uncloven Hero of the Vampire Counts has haunted our lives for too long. Send him to our Ruinous masters, and remove this Unliving threat forever.

missions.localised_description: This unfilthy, Uncloven Hero of the Vampire Counts has haunted our lives for too long. Send him to our Ruinous masters, and remove this Unliving threat forever.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This unfilthy, Uncloven Hero of the Vampire Counts has haunted our lives for too long. Send him to our Ruinous masters, and remove this Unliving threat forever.

missions.localised_description: This unfilthy, Uncloven Hero of the Vampire Counts has haunted our lives for too long. Send him to our Ruinous masters, and remove this Unliving threat forever.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Beastman Lord is a thorn in our side. See to it that he never again takes arms against us!

missions.localised_description: This Beastman Lord is a thorn in our side. See to it that he never again takes arms against us!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Letting this Lord of Chaos live is no longer an option. Return him to the Ruinous masters - let them decide his final fate!

missions.localised_description: Letting this Lord of Chaos live is no longer an option. Return him to the Ruinous masters - let them decide his final fate!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This tiny Dwarf Lord has caused big problems, but no more. Bring ruin upon him, that he might never make trouble for us again.

missions.localised_description: This tiny Dwarf Lord has caused big problems, but no more. Bring ruin upon him, that he might never make trouble for us again.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A stuffy Empire Lord has become too much of a nuisance to us. Rend his pompous flesh, see him strewn about for feasting!

missions.localised_description: A stuffy Empire Lord has become too much of a nuisance to us. Rend his pompous flesh, see him strewn about for feasting!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Lord has caused too many problems for us - this must stop! Savage him, leave him for dead, and see that he never bothers our herd again!

missions.localised_description: This Lord has caused too many problems for us - this must stop! Savage him, leave him for dead, and see that he never bothers our herd again!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This conniving Greenskin Lord has been too much trouble for too long. Extinguish this pestering ember - leave nought but ashes where once he stood!

missions.localised_description: This conniving Greenskin Lord has been too much trouble for too long. Extinguish this pestering ember - leave nought but ashes where once he stood!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This sallow Lord of the Vampire Counts has been too much trouble for too long. Savage him and see that his Unliving kind never bothers our herd again!

missions.localised_description: This sallow Lord of the Vampire Counts has been too much trouble for too long. Savage him and see that his Unliving kind never bothers our herd again!

localised_description.last_approved_text: It is the wise beast who rips apart his foe on the battlefield; other Beastlords will be happy to see him smashed and will respect your strength for doing so.

missions.localised_description: It is the wise beast who rips apart his foe on the battlefield; other Beastlords will be happy to see him smashed and will respect your strength for doing so.

localised_description.last_approved_text: We should fight this enemy on the battlefield. In victory, your power will be undeniable - the other Beastlords will show respect and deference.

missions.localised_description: We should fight this enemy on the battlefield. In victory, your power will be undeniable - the other Beastlords will show respect and deference.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Only the true beast would consider raiding these lands. A swift victory will say much about your worth to the other Beastlords.

missions.localised_description: Only the true beast would consider raiding these lands. A swift victory will say much about your worth to the other Beastlords.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Burning these settlements and destroying the lands around them would show wisdom, Lord. Other tribes will revel in the destruction, and like us all the more for it.

missions.localised_description: Burning these settlements and destroying the lands around them would show wisdom, Lord. Other tribes will revel in the destruction, and like us all the more for it.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Another Beastlord is bringing his herd through nearby blood-grounds. If we kill him - and break his horns - his herd will be struck a terrible blow and we will grow stronger.

missions.localised_description: Another Beastlord is bringing his herd through nearby blood-grounds. If we kill him - and break his horns - his herd will be struck a terrible blow and we will grow stronger.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A Chaos Lord is driving his armies through our blood-grounds. We will gain great glory and prestige if we smash this army to a bloody pulp!

missions.localised_description: A Chaos Lord is driving his armies through our blood-grounds. We will gain great glory and prestige if we smash this army to a bloody pulp!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A paltry Dwarf Lord is marching his army right into our blood-grounds. They have brought themselves into the hunt - we will gain glory beyond reckoning if we destroy this Dwarfen host.

missions.localised_description: A paltry Dwarf Lord is marching his army right into our blood-grounds. They have brought themselves into the hunt - we will gain glory beyond reckoning if we destroy this Dwarfen host.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A boastful Empire Lord swaggers through our blood-ground. It is an affront! There is man-flesh to rend and rive, and strength to be gained in their devastation!

missions.localised_description: A boastful Empire Lord swaggers through our blood-ground. It is an affront! There is man-flesh to rend and rive, and strength to be gained in their devastation!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A Lord dares to march his army through our blood-grounds. Destroy them, break them into pieces, and gain glory and strength through their defeat!

missions.localised_description: A Lord dares to march his army through our blood-grounds. Destroy them, break them into pieces, and gain glory and strength through their defeat!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A mewling Greenskin is leading his pitiful band through nearby lands. Should we smear their pestilence away and squash their march, we will become stronger.

missions.localised_description: A mewling Greenskin is leading his pitiful band through nearby lands. Should we smear their pestilence away and squash their march, we will become stronger.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A corpselike Lord of the Vampire Counts is processes his army of bones through our blood-grounds. Break them apart, send them to a permanent end, gain glory!

missions.localised_description: A corpselike Lord of the Vampire Counts is processes his army of bones through our blood-grounds. Break them apart, send them to a permanent end, gain glory!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This enemy Beastlord is a powerful adversary, strong-horned and vicious. Defeating him in a bloody battle, and de-horning him, would be a great achievement, showering us in gore and glory!

missions.localised_description: This enemy Beastlord is a powerful adversary, strong-horned and vicious. Defeating him in a bloody battle, and de-horning him, would be a great achievement, showering us in gore and glory!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Chaos Lord has a dark power, giving him skill on the battlefield. If we defeat him, bring true ruin to his force, then the Dark Gods would favour us greatly in return.

missions.localised_description: This Chaos Lord has a dark power, giving him skill on the battlefield. If we defeat him, bring true ruin to his force, then the Dark Gods would favour us greatly in return.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Dwarf Lord has great strength for such a small thing and is courageous in combat. Should we best him - and we will - there would be much glory and honour showered upon us.

missions.localised_description: This Dwarf Lord has great strength for such a small thing and is courageous in combat. Should we best him - and we will - there would be much glory and honour showered upon us.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This conceited Empire Lord has great strength and is heroic in combat. Stripping him of his vaunted skill, destroying him in battle, will exult us; glory through bloodshed!

missions.localised_description: This conceited Empire Lord has great strength and is heroic in combat. Stripping him of his vaunted skill, destroying him in battle, will exult us; glory through bloodshed!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This enemy Lord has great strength and is savage in combat. Killing him in battle -filthy and bloody battle - would be a great achievement, raining glory and strength upon us.

missions.localised_description: This enemy Lord has great strength and is savage in combat. Killing him in battle -filthy and bloody battle - would be a great achievement, raining glory and strength upon us.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This pernicious Greenskin Lord has surprising strength, racking up many victories. There is great glory in felling such a warrior - we should take it upon ourselves to slay him!

missions.localised_description: This pernicious Greenskin Lord has surprising strength, racking up many victories. There is great glory in felling such a warrior - we should take it upon ourselves to slay him!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This cadaverous Lord of the Vampire Counts has a preternatural power and is towering in combat. Rending his soul from his husk and destroying his ambitions will bring great things to us and the herd.

missions.localised_description: This cadaverous Lord of the Vampire Counts has a preternatural power and is towering in combat. Rending his soul from his husk and destroying his ambitions will bring great things to us and the herd.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This enemy herd shall face the true chosen of Chaos - their Ruinous might shall flow through us as their destruction is wrought upon the battlefield!

missions.localised_description: This enemy herd shall face the true chosen of Chaos - their Ruinous might shall flow through us as their destruction is wrought upon the battlefield!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Chaos force shall experience the power of a fully-armed Beastmen army. Attack at will!

missions.localised_description: This Chaos force shall experience the power of a fully-armed Beastmen army. Attack at will!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This shrunken Dwarf army faces the horrible majesty of the Beastmen! Destroy this force in the name of ruin and madness!

missions.localised_description: This shrunken Dwarf army faces the horrible majesty of the Beastmen! Destroy this force in the name of ruin and madness!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This pathetic man-filth Empire army shall be brought to heel; their pomp and pride shall come to naught as they fall before the snarling and smashing of the Beastmen.

missions.localised_description: This pathetic man-filth Empire army shall be brought to heel; their pomp and pride shall come to naught as they fall before the snarling and smashing of the Beastmen.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This enemy army shall face the fury and savagery of a true Beastman army, and they will know our might as they are destroyed!

missions.localised_description: This enemy army shall face the fury and savagery of a true Beastman army, and they will know our might as they are destroyed!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This meddlesome Greenskin army shall fall under hoof as we trample this force of pests into nothing more than mud and blood.

missions.localised_description: This meddlesome Greenskin army shall fall under hoof as we trample this force of pests into nothing more than mud and blood.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Beastmen herd thinks they can encroach on OUR blood-ground. That is not their right. Our land. Our hunt. Our retribution!

missions.localised_description: This Beastmen herd thinks they can encroach on OUR blood-ground. That is not their right. Our land. Our hunt. Our retribution!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A Chaos force marches where they are not welcome. The true chosen of the Chaos Gods desire flesh and war, and so we will repulse this invasion!

missions.localised_description: A Chaos force marches where they are not welcome. The true chosen of the Chaos Gods desire flesh and war, and so we will repulse this invasion!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A band of foolish Dwarfs has trudged onto the blood-grounds. They know not what they do, but will feel our wrath all the same!

missions.localised_description: A band of foolish Dwarfs has trudged onto the blood-grounds. They know not what they do, but will feel our wrath all the same!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A presumptuous Empire army marches onto our blood-grounds. In their arrogance, they have invited our terrible fury down upon themselves. Enact that fury. Destroy them!

missions.localised_description: A presumptuous Empire army marches onto our blood-grounds. In their arrogance, they have invited our terrible fury down upon themselves. Enact that fury. Destroy them!

localised_description.last_approved_text: An enemy army has dared to trespass on our blood-grounds. This makes them fair game. To the hunt!

missions.localised_description: An enemy army has dared to trespass on our blood-grounds. This makes them fair game. To the hunt!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A noisome Greenskin force has moronically entered where they are not wanted. Send them back to their huts and hovels and dung. Smash them apart. Destroy them!

missions.localised_description: A noisome Greenskin force has moronically entered where they are not wanted. Send them back to their huts and hovels and dung. Smash them apart. Destroy them!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The pallid Vampire Counts have dared to snake their dead, crusty tendrils into our lands. Their graves cannot remain empty for long - see them returned!

missions.localised_description: The pallid Vampire Counts have dared to snake their dead, crusty tendrils into our lands. Their graves cannot remain empty for long - see them returned!

localised_description.last_approved_text: These pallid Vampire Counts shall face true terror beyond their reckoning at our hands; to war, to glory, to feast!

missions.localised_description: These pallid Vampire Counts shall face true terror beyond their reckoning at our hands; to war, to glory, to feast!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Another herd has dared challenge us upon the waves. Their fury is no match for ours - send them to the depths!

missions.localised_description: Another herd has dared challenge us upon the waves. Their fury is no match for ours - send them to the depths!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Such small and stunted creatures are not made for the seas. It does not suit their temperament. Show these foolhardy Dwarfs their errors. Flood their senses!

missions.localised_description: Such small and stunted creatures are not made for the seas. It does not suit their temperament. Show these foolhardy Dwarfs their errors. Flood their senses!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The boastful Empire has made a critical mistake in thinking they can best our naval dominance. Show them the true power on the waves. Send them to the deep!

missions.localised_description: The boastful Empire has made a critical mistake in thinking they can best our naval dominance. Show them the true power on the waves. Send them to the deep!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This force has made the error of thinking they can outclass us at sea. Demonstrate their error - smash their ships apart!

missions.localised_description: This force has made the error of thinking they can outclass us at sea. Demonstrate their error - smash their ships apart!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This snivelling Greenskin force has somehow set themselves to sea. They cannot, nor should not, last long. Hasten their departure from our dominion.

missions.localised_description: This snivelling Greenskin force has somehow set themselves to sea. They cannot, nor should not, last long. Hasten their departure from our dominion.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This ghastly Vampire Count force has made the most grave error of setting themselves against us on the waves. It is a lucky thing that the dead float…

missions.localised_description: This ghastly Vampire Count force has made the most grave error of setting themselves against us on the waves. It is a lucky thing that the dead float…

localised_description.last_approved_text: These Dwarfen lands, their holds and their tunnels, are brimming with plunder. Summon the beasts, call them to war - there is hunting to be done!

missions.localised_description: These Dwarfen lands, their holds and their tunnels, are brimming with plunder. Summon the beasts, call them to war - there is hunting to be done!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Empire lands are full of the rich-blooded and the haughty. Their flesh is fat, and so are their coffers. To battle then, for the prize!

missions.localised_description: The Empire lands are full of the rich-blooded and the haughty. Their flesh is fat, and so are their coffers. To battle then, for the prize!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This blood-ground is ready to be ravaged. Summon the herd, begin the hunt! We take what we want, and leave nothing for the carrion!

missions.localised_description: This blood-ground is ready to be ravaged. Summon the herd, begin the hunt! We take what we want, and leave nothing for the carrion!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Greenskin land is filthy, disgusting and remorseless - it is perfect for us. We lay claim to this land, and all within it!

missions.localised_description: This Greenskin land is filthy, disgusting and remorseless - it is perfect for us. We lay claim to this land, and all within it!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Amongst the ash, and bones and towering piles of corpses lie treasures unending. The Beastmen will have these treasures; they can keep the bodies.

missions.localised_description: Amongst the ash, and bones and towering piles of corpses lie treasures unending. The Beastmen will have these treasures; they can keep the bodies.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The more land we conquer, the more territory we own, the larger the force needed to control it. Attract more Gors to the herd; expand our might!

missions.localised_description: The more land we conquer, the more territory we own, the larger the force needed to control it. Attract more Gors to the herd; expand our might!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The oceans are treacherous, fraught with danger for those who do not treat them with respectful caution. The herd must take to the seas - conquer!

missions.localised_description: The oceans are treacherous, fraught with danger for those who do not treat them with respectful caution. The herd must take to the seas - conquer!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Dwarfs' network of tunnels and stone dares to decry our base majesty! Leave nothing of it for them to salvage - turn stone and bones to dust!

missions.localised_description: The Dwarfs' network of tunnels and stone dares to decry our base majesty! Leave nothing of it for them to salvage - turn stone and bones to dust!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This shining, 'civilised' Empire settlement is a brazen affront to the glorious filth of the world! The beasts should ride to defile these pretenders. Call the herd. Destroy man!

missions.localised_description: This shining, 'civilised' Empire settlement is a brazen affront to the glorious filth of the world! The beasts should ride to defile these pretenders. Call the herd. Destroy man!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This settlement cannot be allowed to remain - it is too clean, too pure; it is an insult. Bring it to rubble - bring it to ruin!

missions.localised_description: This settlement cannot be allowed to remain - it is too clean, too pure; it is an insult. Bring it to rubble - bring it to ruin!

localised_description.last_approved_text: These Greenskin hovels are disgusting; admirably filthy, but they still cannot be allowed to endure. Remove this unworthy pestilence!

missions.localised_description: These Greenskin hovels are disgusting; admirably filthy, but they still cannot be allowed to endure. Remove this unworthy pestilence!

localised_description.last_approved_text: These desiccated cadavers believe themselves to be the true heirs to the Empire, the true inheritors of 'civilisation' - there is no such thing! Destroy them! DESTROY THEM ALL!

missions.localised_description: These desiccated cadavers believe themselves to be the true heirs to the Empire, the true inheritors of 'civilisation' - there is no such thing! Destroy them! DESTROY THEM ALL!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Gorebull is a powerful and useful Hero of great advantage to us on the blood-grounds!

missions.localised_description: The Gorebull is a powerful and useful Hero of great advantage to us on the blood-grounds!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Bray-Shaman is a deeply mysterious but extremely effective Hero. Stalking the blood-grounds with us, its power could be brought to bear excellently.

missions.localised_description: The Bray-Shaman is a deeply mysterious but extremely effective Hero. Stalking the blood-grounds with us, its power could be brought to bear excellently.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Although brutal melee is always preferable, there is tactical advantage in bombarding our enemies from afar. We do not have enough artillery under our command - this should be rectified!

missions.localised_description: Although brutal melee is always preferable, there is tactical advantage in bombarding our enemies from afar. We do not have enough artillery under our command - this should be rectified!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A powerful division of cavalry is crucial to victory. We are fielding very little cavalry - something that should be addressed!

missions.localised_description: A powerful division of cavalry is crucial to victory. We are fielding very little cavalry - something that should be addressed!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The melee is everything! Brutal, bloody, savage combat! We do not have nearly enough melee troops - recruit more with haste!

missions.localised_description: The melee is everything! Brutal, bloody, savage combat! We do not have nearly enough melee troops - recruit more with haste!

localised_description.last_approved_text: We prefer to fight with our hands and our hooves and our teeth, yet there is some advantage in softening up the foe with missile fire before the charge. We do not have enough missile troops - this should be rectified!

missions.localised_description: We prefer to fight with our hands and our hooves and our teeth, yet there is some advantage in softening up the foe with missile fire before the charge. We do not have enough missile troops - this should be rectified!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The bigger the beast, the better the slaughter! There are not enough War Beasts in our herds - recruit more with haste!

missions.localised_description: The bigger the beast, the better the slaughter! There are not enough War Beasts in our herds - recruit more with haste!

localised_description.last_approved_text: War Machines help us tear down the world of man. We are not fielding enough - recruit more War Machines and destroy our Uncloven foe!

missions.localised_description: War Machines help us tear down the world of man. We are not fielding enough - recruit more War Machines and destroy our Uncloven foe!

localised_description.last_approved_text: These underlings think to play above their station. Hah! Smash this snivelling, mewling beast into the dirt!

missions.localised_description: These underlings think to play above their station. Hah! Smash this snivelling, mewling beast into the dirt!

localised_description.last_approved_text: An aberration of the highest order dares to move against us. Let no such nonsense stand - eliminate this beastly agent and be done with it.

missions.localised_description: An aberration of the highest order dares to move against us. Let no such nonsense stand - eliminate this beastly agent and be done with it.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Stinkin', stupid Beastmen agent needs to be smashed, crushed, sliced! They'll have to put him back together.

missions.localised_description: Stinkin', stupid Beastmen agent needs to be smashed, crushed, sliced! They'll have to put him back together.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This beastly, uncouth Beastmen agent thinks to tread upon our lands. Drain this fool, leave him for the carrion!

missions.localised_description: This beastly, uncouth Beastmen agent thinks to tread upon our lands. Drain this fool, leave him for the carrion!

localised_description.last_approved_text: If these beasts love war so much, we shall bring war to them and show them the fury of the Ruinous Powers. Fell their general; establish dominance!

missions.localised_description: If these beasts love war so much, we shall bring war to them and show them the fury of the Ruinous Powers. Fell their general; establish dominance!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Savage brutes that know only war are best defeated, comprehensively, on the battlefield. Cut the head from a snake, and watch the body wither.

missions.localised_description: Savage brutes that know only war are best defeated, comprehensively, on the battlefield. Cut the head from a snake, and watch the body wither.

localised_title.last_approved_text: The beasts want to fight, then fight! Yes! Take to the battlefield and smash the big one into the dirt! Then we'll see how much they like fightin'!

missions.localised_title: The beasts want to fight, then fight! Yes! Take to the battlefield and smash the big one into the dirt! Then we'll see how much they like fightin'!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The beasts want to fight, then fight! Yes! Take to the battlefield and smash the big one into the dirt! Then we'll see how much they like fightin'!

missions.localised_description: The beasts want to fight, then fight! Yes! Take to the battlefield and smash the big one into the dirt! Then we'll see how much they like fightin'!

localised_description.last_approved_text: On the battlefield, the beasts are ferocious and savage, but so are we. Let our prowess be known; fell the strongest of them and the others will follow suit!

missions.localised_description: On the battlefield, the beasts are ferocious and savage, but so are we. Let our prowess be known; fell the strongest of them and the others will follow suit!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Beastmen rise from their forests and their filth, frothing over with fury at the 'civilisation' of man. They clamour for blood.

missions.localised_description: The Beastmen rise from their forests and their filth, frothing over with fury at the 'civilisation' of man. They clamour for blood.

localised_description.last_approved_text: From afar, the Beastmen watch the cities of man with a baleful gaze, longing to tear apart that which they so detest. And so it comes to pass.

missions.localised_description: From afar, the Beastmen watch the cities of man with a baleful gaze, longing to tear apart that which they so detest. And so it comes to pass.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With splintering roars, the great throng of Beastmen descend upon the world of men. With much clamour, and a singular hatred, they charge and do not cease.

missions.localised_description: With splintering roars, the great throng of Beastmen descend upon the world of men. With much clamour, and a singular hatred, they charge and do not cease.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Every tower, every gatehouse, every thatched home is an affront to the Beastmen's very essence. With fire, brawn and rage, the unending herds will see it all destroyed.

missions.localised_description: Every tower, every gatehouse, every thatched home is an affront to the Beastmen's very essence. With fire, brawn and rage, the unending herds will see it all destroyed.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The land burns, the seas boil, the world cracks and blooms into destruction. The Beastmen, bloody-handed, see this, and know that it is right.

missions.localised_description: The land burns, the seas boil, the world cracks and blooms into destruction. The Beastmen, bloody-handed, see this, and know that it is right.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter V: The Tree of Wrath

missions.localised_title: Chapter V: The Tree of Wrath

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Beastmen rise from their forests and their filth, frothing over with fury at the 'civilisation' of man. They clamour for blood.

missions.localised_description: The Beastmen rise from their forests and their filth, frothing over with fury at the 'civilisation' of man. They clamour for blood.

localised_description.last_approved_text: From afar, the Beastmen watch the cities of man with a baleful gaze, longing to tear apart that which they so detest. And so it comes to pass.

missions.localised_description: From afar, the Beastmen watch the cities of man with a baleful gaze, longing to tear apart that which they so detest. And so it comes to pass.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With splintering roars, the great throng of Beastmen descend upon the world of men. With much clamour, and a singular hatred, they charge and do not cease.

missions.localised_description: With splintering roars, the great throng of Beastmen descend upon the world of men. With much clamour, and a singular hatred, they charge and do not cease.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Every tower, every gatehouse, every thatched home is an affront to the Beastmen's very essence. With fire, brawn and rage, the unending herds will see it all destroyed.

missions.localised_description: Every tower, every gatehouse, every thatched home is an affront to the Beastmen's very essence. With fire, brawn and rage, the unending herds will see it all destroyed.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The land burns, the seas boil, the world cracks and blooms into destruction. The Beastmen, bloody-handed, see this, and know that it is right.

missions.localised_description: The land burns, the seas boil, the world cracks and blooms into destruction. The Beastmen, bloody-handed, see this, and know that it is right.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter V: The Tree of Wrath

missions.localised_title: Chapter V: The Tree of Wrath

localised_description.last_approved_text: There are yet those who have not yet learned Khazrak's name. The blood-ground calls, and he answers.

missions.localised_description: There are yet those who have not yet learned Khazrak's name. The blood-ground calls, and he answers.
