missions.localised_title: Chapter I: Beasts in the Blood-Ground

localised_description.last_approved_text: Khazrak grows in renown, yet the blood-ground demands more. The One-Eye desires flesh.

missions.localised_description: Khazrak grows in renown, yet the blood-ground demands more. The One-Eye desires flesh.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter II: What Beasts May Come

missions.localised_title: Chapter II: What Beasts May Come

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Uncloven tremble, for they see their end before Khazrak and his unyielding herd.

missions.localised_description: The Uncloven tremble, for they see their end before Khazrak and his unyielding herd.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter III: Khazrak of the Endless Brayherd

missions.localised_title: Chapter III: Khazrak of the Endless Brayherd

localised_description.last_approved_text: At last, the Middenheim army marches forth from its fastness, lured by the defilement of their so-called civilisation. Now, Khazrak will show them why his name is whispered in horrified tones; why he is the most cunning Beastlord to have ever lived! Should he succeed the Bray-Shamans have promised him a great tribute - a cursed lash that will ensure the fealty of the tribes. Ambush the man-filth outside of Middenheim, in the forests of the Drakwald!

missions.localised_description: At last, the Middenheim army marches forth from its fastness, lured by the defilement of their so-called civilisation. Now, Khazrak will show them why his name is whispered in horrified tones; why he is the most cunning Beastlord to have ever lived! Should he succeed the Bray-Shamans have promised him a great tribute - a cursed lash that will ensure the fealty of the tribes. Ambush the man-filth outside of Middenheim, in the forests of the Drakwald!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Graktar is camped near the mannish towns of Kelp and Koldust. As suspected, the Beastlord is gathering his loyal Gors to him, ready to fight back! Using his bestial cunning, the One-Eye sends his forces to surround Graktar’s own warherd, trapping him in place. The time to strike is now; with the venom in Khazrak’s possession, Graktar is no match, and that blackened chainmail he wears can be claimed by the true Beastlord of the Drakwald!

missions.localised_description: Graktar is camped near the mannish towns of Kelp and Koldust. As suspected, the Beastlord is gathering his loyal Gors to him, ready to fight back! Using his bestial cunning, the One-Eye sends his forces to surround Graktar’s own warherd, trapping him in place. The time to strike is now; with the venom in Khazrak’s possession, Graktar is no match, and that blackened chainmail he wears can be claimed by the true Beastlord of the Drakwald!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Minotaur tribes are formidable but won’t fight for a Bray-Shaman, even one as notorious as the Crowfather. Only a Gorebull - a champion amongst its blood-gorging kin - can rouse the tribes to flock to the Dark Omen’s banner. But time grows short; to capitalise on the shroud of fear across Reikland’s borders the Crowfather must act soon. Malagor must dominate the Minotaurs with his eldritch might, forcing them to supplication.

missions.localised_description: The Minotaur tribes are formidable but won’t fight for a Bray-Shaman, even one as notorious as the Crowfather. Only a Gorebull - a champion amongst its blood-gorging kin - can rouse the tribes to flock to the Dark Omen’s banner. But time grows short; to capitalise on the shroud of fear across Reikland’s borders the Crowfather must act soon. Malagor must dominate the Minotaurs with his eldritch might, forcing them to supplication.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Now the chapel of Grunberg is burnt to flaming rubble, Malagor wishes to exact one more cruelty upon the race of Man. Having seen a smoking, festering carcass of a griffon in his earlier vision, Malagor knows his final target is the Knights Griffon. Upon their destruction will his foul fetishes be elevated to blasphemous Icons of vilification.

missions.localised_description: Now the chapel of Grunberg is burnt to flaming rubble, Malagor wishes to exact one more cruelty upon the race of Man. Having seen a smoking, festering carcass of a griffon in his earlier vision, Malagor knows his final target is the Knights Griffon. Upon their destruction will his foul fetishes be elevated to blasphemous Icons of vilification.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Dark Gods are pleased… mankind is ravaged. They have been taunted, hunted and broken by the Children of Chaos. The land is ripe for an even greater invasion; for other followers of the Ruinous Powers to make their mark, as paltry as it will be compared to the triumphs of the Cloven Ones. Yet there remains defiance - the armies of man-filth muster as one, refusing the inevitable. No matter! This is but another opportunity for the Beastmen to prove themselves the most worthy of the Dark Powers' servants. Find this "gathering of might" and ensure the fall of man!

missions.localised_description: The Dark Gods are pleased… mankind is ravaged. They have been taunted, hunted and broken by the Children of Chaos. The land is ripe for an even greater invasion; for other followers of the Ruinous Powers to make their mark, as paltry as it will be compared to the triumphs of the Cloven Ones. Yet there remains defiance - the armies of man-filth muster as one, refusing the inevitable. No matter! This is but another opportunity for the Beastmen to prove themselves the most worthy of the Dark Powers' servants. Find this "gathering of might" and ensure the fall of man!

localised_description.last_approved_text:
Sigmar has ever-been a warrior god, and his clergy have followed his example. They are no mere priests or tranquil monks but warriors all - as eager to split skulls with hammer as preach from a pulpit. At the head of the Cult is the Grand Theogonist, and while many have filled the role over the years, most - if not all - have been intimidating men; full of fury and bombast, and piously devoted to Sigmar's tenets.

Should the Empire come under threat, then it is not always state troops that must face the threat alone. The Cult of Sigmar has often answered the call to war, with the Grand Theogonist at its head, eager as any of his Warrior Priests to smite the foe. It was on one such doomed campaign that the Jade Griffon - a talisman of the Theogonist's office, said to have been blessed by Magnus the Pious himself - went missing. The Grand Theogonist at the time was brought low by Chaos filth, and the Jade Griffon lost somewhere in Kislev.

Many years later, and word has reached Volkmar the Grim that the Jade Griffon has resurfaced. The Grand Theogonist senses that the time is right to go in search of this precious antiquity. Volkmar issues a proclamation that he intends to march for Kislev. In the vanguard of his force go the desperate and the fanatical - those that have lost everything but their faith. Let their zeal light the way.

At the head of the Cult is the Grand Theogonist, and while many have filled the role over the years, most - if not all - have been intimidating men; full of fury and bombast, and piously devoted to Sigmar's tenets.

Should the Empire come under threat, then it is not always state troops that must face the threat alone. The Cult of Sigmar has often answered the call to war, with the Grand Theogonist at its head, eager as any of his Warrior Priests to smite the foe. It was on one such doomed campaign that the Jade Griffon - a talisman of the Theogonist's office, said to have been blessed by Magnus the Pious himself - went missing. The Grand Theogonist at the time was brought low by Chaos filth, and the Jade Griffon lost somewhere in Kislev.

Many years later, and word has reached Volkmar the Grim that the Jade Griffon has resurfaced. The Grand Theogonist senses that the time is right to go in search of this precious antiquity. Volkmar issues a proclamation that he intends to march for Kislev. In the vanguard of his force go the desperate and the fanatical - those that have lost everything but their faith. Let their zeal light the way.

localised_description.last_approved_text: According to the Witch Hunters, Mannfred von Carstein's willing creature, Helman Ghorst, has also started searching for the Jade Griffon. To have a talisman blessed by Magnus fall into the hands of a Necromancer such as he would be a fell thing indeed. Volkmar tasks his agents with breaching Ghorst's lair, thus distracting the liche and halting the Undead servant's search before it can truly begin.

missions.localised_description: According to the Witch Hunters, Mannfred von Carstein's willing creature, Helman Ghorst, has also started searching for the Jade Griffon. To have a talisman blessed by Magnus fall into the hands of a Necromancer such as he would be a fell thing indeed. Volkmar tasks his agents with breaching Ghorst's lair, thus distracting the liche and halting the Undead servant's search before it can truly begin.

localised_description.last_approved_text: According to the Witch Hunters, Mannfred von Carstein's willing creature, Helman Ghorst, has also started searching for the Jade Griffon. To have a talisman blessed by Magnus fall into the hands of a Necromancer such as he would be a fell thing indeed. Volkmar tasks his agents with taking Templehof from the Necromancer's filthy clutches, diverting the Undead servant from his search.

missions.localised_description: According to the Witch Hunters, Mannfred von Carstein's willing creature, Helman Ghorst, has also started searching for the Jade Griffon. To have a talisman blessed by Magnus fall into the hands of a Necromancer such as he would be a fell thing indeed. Volkmar tasks his agents with taking Templehof from the Necromancer's filthy clutches, diverting the Undead servant from his search.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Witch Hunters of the Holy Order of Sigmar have a certain talent for extracting information, even from those of an Undead persuasion. When torture isn't an option there are certain hexes and rituals that may well work. In any case, crucial information has been learned regarding the Necromancer's plans, and they are diabolical indeed. Should Helman and the Brothers Ghorst get hold of the Jade Griffon, then he will use a dark spell from his Cursed Book, one that will taint the talisman and flood it with fell magic. On learning this, Volkmar angrily rises from his chair and spits orders. The Jade Griffon must be found before Ghorst gets his hands on it. And if that means every Kislevite dwelling upturned in the search, then so be it!

In any case, crucial information has been learned regarding the Necromancer's plans, and they are diabolical indeed. The Jade Griffon must be found before Ghorst gets his hands on it, so the Cult of Sigmar will make for Kislev on a war footing. Volkmar knew that he risked the wrath of Ursun and his followers, but there was simply too much at stake.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Despite the Grand Theogonist's best efforts, the Vampires have somehow unearthed the Jade Griffon first, Sigmar damn them! But Volkmar the Grim is not known for giving up. He sends his best Templars of the Holy Order after the Undead thieves. Witch Hunters are famously dogged in pursuing their prey and this agent is no different. Word soon reaches Volkmar that the Witch Hunter has picked up the trail and has divined that the Necromancer is heading for Hel Fenn...

localised_description.last_approved_text:
There has always been a darkness about Volkmar. Not for nothing is he known as "the Grim". Those who know Volkmar well, such as Karl Franz, realise that this brooding nature is a fierce internal piety, frustration that Chaos still thrives and a grim determination to purge the Empire's foes. Yet the office of the Grand Theogonist has always attracted enemies, from both within and without. Volkmar, a man who has never suffered fools, has burned alliances and gained many opponents during Altdorf's courtly political games, so when the malicious rumours started to circulate about Volkmar's behaviour, there were many suspects.

 The rumours were few at first, but have since spread like balefire - "Volkmar communes with Daemons"; "The Grand Theogonist wishes to depose the Emperor"; "He is the arch-heretic". Despite the Emperor's urging, Volkmar refused to waste time defending himself from such vapid gossip. This played into his unseen enemy's hands, and now the Staff of Command - the symbol of the Grand Theogonist's august office - has been reluctantly taken and locked away by the Holy Order of Sigmar, such is the feeling against Volkmar. Even Franz, his closest friend, is politically tied to remain a mere observer whilst the Witch Hunters investigate the allegations, baseless as they are.

Spurred on by strong support within the Cult of Sigmar, Volkmar has at last decided he must act and despatches loyal Warrior Priests throughout the realm to track down the deviant rumour-mongers.

localised_description.last_approved_text:
While tending to their flocks, the Warrior Priests counter the rumours about their liege and spread words of truth - of Volkmar's faith and devotion to Sigmar. They also gather intelligence on the source of these lies, yet no instigator is found.

All is not lost, there are a couple of possible leads. A few tales by wary villagers back in Reikland tell of priests of the Wolf God, Ulric, besmirching Volkmar's name. Tensions between the two cults are often fraught but cordial. However, ever since Volkmar and his Arch Lectors voted against the Ar-Ulric's candidate in the election for Emperor, relations have been strained.

If the Cult of Ulric is spreading these fell rumours, then Volkmar will need the support of the Arch Lectors once more.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Cult of Sigmar's movements have not gone unnoticed. And in response, there are large troop movements, especially in the north, in Middenland, a stronghold of Ulric worship. The Emperor is concerned, but dare not intervene and start a full-scale civil war. Nevertheless, the Cult of Sigmar must bolster its home city should a confrontation become inevitable.

missions.localised_description: The Cult of Sigmar's movements have not gone unnoticed. And in response, there are large troop movements, especially in the north, in Middenland, a stronghold of Ulric worship. The Emperor is concerned, but dare not intervene and start a full-scale civil war. Nevertheless, the Cult of Sigmar must bolster its home city should a confrontation become inevitable.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Grave tidings from Altdorf! The Cult Of Ulric has moved against the city. Never before have the followers of Ulric been so aggressive, maybe there is something more behind this? Even as Karl Franz plays peacekeeper, Volkmar must show the Sigmarites' strength; after all, Sigmar was a warrior in his mortal life and would never cower from a fight. The War Altar of Sigmar should be brought forth as a show of power and defiance!

missions.localised_description: Grave tidings from Altdorf! The Cult Of Ulric has moved against the city. Never before have the followers of Ulric been so aggressive, maybe there is something more behind this? Even as Karl Franz plays peacekeeper, Volkmar must show the Sigmarites' strength; after all, Sigmar was a warrior in his mortal life and would never cower from a fight. The War Altar of Sigmar should be brought forth as a show of power and defiance!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Ulricans main force has moved away from Altdorf's walls due to the brilliant statesmanship of the Emperor. Volkmar, however, is in a rage! The slurs of Ulric's supporters and their armies' trespass must be answered. The Grand Theogonist deploys a Warrior Priest to seek them out.

missions.localised_description: The Ulricans main force has moved away from Altdorf's walls due to the brilliant statesmanship of the Emperor. Volkmar, however, is in a rage! The slurs of Ulric's supporters and their armies' trespass must be answered. The Grand Theogonist deploys a Warrior Priest to seek them out.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The plot is revealed! The Necromancer, in concert with a cabal of Vampires, plan to plunge Sylvania - and then all the Empire - into endless night! The Jade Griffon is the relic they plan to use to power this despicable deed. That such a holy symbol should be considered for this heresy is more than motivation enough for Volkmar to summon a mighty host, as the Vampire Counts must be brought to battle and stopped at all costs! Hel Fenn is a cursed place, where much blood has been spilt, but perhaps it is a good omen to fight here? After all, it was here that the death of Mannfred von Carstein occurred, for a time. If Sigmar sees fit more monsters will perish here!

missions.localised_description: The plot is revealed! The Necromancer, in concert with a cabal of Vampires, plan to plunge Sylvania - and then all the Empire - into endless night! If Sigmar sees fit more monsters will perish here!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The army of the Ar-Ulric has been found, several leagues from Altdorf. They are in the midst of deploying, clearly expecting battle. Volkmar will not disappoint, as his reputation and honour have been despoiled by the Cult of Ulric. While fighting between two such noble religions is regretful, the Middenlanders must be taught a lesson, with victory ensuring the Staff of Command's return.

missions.localised_description: The army of the Ar-Ulric has been found, several leagues from Altdorf. They are in the midst of deploying, clearly expecting battle. Volkmar will not disappoint, as his reputation and honour have been despoiled by the Cult of Ulric. While fighting between two such noble religions is regretful, the Middenlanders must be taught a lesson, with victory ensuring the Staff of Command's return.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Helman arrives with his minions to see that the Cult of Sigmar are already excavating the site, presumably looking for the casket that contains the missing pages of the Liber Noctus. Such a large expenditure of resources proves to Ghorst beyond doubt the pages' importance. Once rebound, this book will give the Necromancer untold power! While the temptation to attack immediately is strong, the cunning Ghorst decides to hold back, letting the Arch Lector do the hard graft and find the casket. In the meantime, the Necromancer prepares an ambush to relieve the Sigmarites of the pages as soon as they have been found!

missions.localised_description: Helman arrives with his minions to see that the Cult of Sigmar are already excavating the site, presumably looking for the casket that contains the missing pages of the Liber Noctus. Such a large expenditure of resources proves to Ghorst beyond doubt the pages' importance. Once rebound, this book will give the Necromancer untold power! While the temptation to attack immediately is strong, the cunning Ghorst decides to hold back, letting the Arch Lector do the hard graft and find the casket. In the meantime, the Necromancer prepares an ambush to relieve the Sigmarites of the pages as soon as they have been found!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Vlad is pleased - the forces of men muster to fight in an army grand-enough to appease the Vampire Count's ego. His sword shall drink deeply from the mortals gathered and Ostermark will burn! A great summoning is needed to call all the creatures of the night from their lairs and awaken those in their graves. As for the living that face Vlad, they will join his ranks soon enough!

missions.localised_description: Vlad is pleased - the forces of men muster to fight in an army grand-enough to appease the Vampire Count's ego. His sword shall drink deeply from the mortals gathered and Ostermark will burn! A great summoning is needed to call all the creatures of the night from their lairs and awaken those in their graves. As for the living that face Vlad, they will join his ranks soon enough!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Vlad has found the meteor site. He wastes little time gathering further intelligence on who or what lays claim to it, for he is keen to return to the court of Sylvania in case any of his kin get 'ambitious'. A lightning strike at the mine is the best approach. Anyone foolish enough to stand in his way will be obliterated or inducted into his army's ranks...

missions.localised_description: Vlad has found the meteor site. He wastes little time gathering further intelligence on who or what lays claim to it, for he is keen to return to the court of Sylvania in case any of his kin get 'ambitious'. A lightning strike at the mine is the best approach. Anyone foolish enough to stand in his way will be obliterated or inducted into his army's ranks...

localised_description.last_approved_text:
The Plague of Blue Roses is a vile disease, sadly common throughout the southern provinces and Tilea. Once its spores have been inhaled, mortal men will quickly perish in a matter of hours, the tell-tale bluish fungus bruises covering their bodies. So it was that a young Helman Ghorst discovered his father and four brothers lying in their beds, taken by the Plague. In a fit of anguish, Helman embraced his dead kin - desperate to contract the plague himself - but fate had other plans for the youngest of the Ghorst family.

Unable to accept his family's deaths, Ghorst sought other, darker means to bring them back. Years later, Helman crossed paths with Mannfred. The Vampire Count saw something in Ghorst, a potential ally perhaps? To that end, he gave Ghorst the Liber Noctus, the Cursed Book of Necromancy. Yet the pages of greatest lore were missing - torn from their binding and scattered across the Empire. No doubt this was Mannfred's true agenda all along - a test - and should Ghorst be successful, he would imbue one of the nine Books of Nagash with great power once more.

Ghorst must begin the hunt for the missing pages immediately or risk disappointing the Gravelord, Mannfred, himself. Fast-moving Dire Wolves will allow the Necromancer to cover more ground.

Once its spores have been inhaled, mortal men will quickly perish in a matter of hours, the tell-tale bluish fungus bruises covering their bodies. So it was that a young Helman Ghorst discovered his father and four brothers lying in their beds, taken by the Plague. In a fit of anguish, Helman embraced his dead kin - desperate to contract the plague himself - but fate had other plans for the youngest of the Ghorst family.

Unable to accept his family's deaths, Ghorst sought other, darker means to bring them back. Years later, Helman crossed paths with Mannfred. The Vampire Count saw something in Ghorst, a potential ally perhaps? To that end, he gave Ghorst the Liber Noctus, the Cursed Book of Necromancy. Yet the pages of greatest lore were missing - torn from their binding and scattered across the Empire. No doubt this was Mannfred's true agenda all along - a test - and should Ghorst be successful, he would imbue one of the nine Books of Nagash with great power once more.

Ghorst must begin the hunt for the missing pages immediately or risk disappointing the Gravelord, Mannfred, himself. Fast-moving Dire Wolves will allow the Necromancer to cover more ground.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Helman Ghorst is on the hunt. The Necromancer is desperate to reunite all the pages of the Liber Noctus - a book that contains even more powerful enchantments than those written in its sister tome, the Liber Necronomica.\n\nThere are whispers that one of the missing pages has been framed and hung up in a tavern, the ignorant peasantry believing it to be some generations old proclamation from an Arch Lector. What fools! The location of the tavern has been narrowed to three townships. Ghorst must find the page and punish these mortals for their ignorance!

What fools! The location of the tavern has been narrowed to three townships. Ghorst must find the page and punish these mortals for their ignorance!

missions.localised_description: Helman Ghorst is on the hunt. The Necromancer is desperate to reunite all the pages of the Liber Noctus - a book that contains even more powerful enchantments than those written in its sister tome, the Liber Necronomica.\n\nThere are whispers that one of the missing pages has been framed and hung up in a tavern, the ignorant peasantry believing it to be some generations-old proclamation from an Arch Lector. What fools! The location of the tavern has been narrowed to the province of Reikland. Ghorst must find the page and punish these mortals for their ignorance!

localised_description.last_approved_text: One of the missing pages is in Ghorst's pallid hands, but there are more still to locate. As Helman's Corpse Cart trundles on rickety roads through the ghoulish countryside, the Necromancer is approached by a hunched-back dreg. The creature bows and scrapes before the Necromancer in false obsequiousness. He brings word from his mistress, a sultry Vampiress who has heard of his quest and has information that could aid him in search for more of the pages. Perhaps a pact is in order?

missions.localised_description: One of the missing pages is in Ghorst's pallid hands, but there are more still to locate. As Helman's Corpse Cart trundles on rickety roads through the ghoulish countryside, the Necromancer is approached by a hunched-back dreg. The creature bows and scrapes before the Necromancer in false obsequiousness. He brings word from his mistress, a sultry Vampiress who has heard of his quest and has information that could aid him in search for more of the pages. Perhaps a pact is in order?

localised_description.last_approved_text: In exchange for spores of the Blue Rose Plague, the Vampire bequeaths Ghorst some pertinent information. The Cult of Sigmar have caught wind of Ghorst's search as, after all, the Necromancer wasn't very subtle in burning down Empire settlements. The Sigmarites are now searching for the last remaining pages to keep them out of Ghorst's, and ultimately Mannfred's, hands. They have tracked the pages to a site deep within the Border Princes - taken there by a Lahmian cult centuries ago, placed in a sealed casket and thrown in a deep gorge to keep them out of Nagash's necrotic hands. Burning the pages would have proved more effective, but many counter-curses ensure the Books of Nagash cannot be so easily destroyed.\n\nAnd so the Cult of Sigmar control the site, hunting for the casket. Ghorst needs the location. The Vampire gives him a redolent smile, stating that while the whereabouts remain a mystery to her, she is aware of a ranking officer that does know. Getting the information from a single Empire soldier shouldn't be too taxing, as will killing him afterwards to ensure his silence. He can then join Ghorst's brothers on the cart!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Blood Drinker thirsts. The sword has lain dormant for centuries, and so the blade has dulled - its once-golden pommel tarnished. The sword must drink, must be bathed in blood - only then will its pommel brighten and blade shine again.\n\nVlad has returned. The sword's one true owner sees it is in a sorry state and begins a campaign to quench its thirst in the blood of Sigmar's sons. Vlad has already decided on a target, he will strike where he did once before; Ostermark sits ripe and plump like a suckling pig basting over a hot fire. It is ready to be consumed...

missions.localised_description: Blood Drinker thirsts. The sword has lain dormant for centuries, and so the blade has dulled - its once-golden pommel tarnished. The sword must drink, must be bathed in blood - only then will its pommel brighten and blade shine again.\n\nVlad has returned. The sword's one true owner sees it is in a sorry state and begins a campaign to quench its thirst in the blood of Sigmar's sons. Vlad has already decided on a target, he will strike where he did once before; Ostermark sits ripe and plump like a suckling pig basting over a hot fire. It is ready to be consumed...

localised_description.last_approved_text: Vlad's rampages through Ostermark, yet the Elector Counts seem unfazed. News takes a while to filter through the Empire, perhaps they have only heard rumours and refuse to acknowledge Vlad's return? Either that or they do not care and look inwardly on their own squabbles.\n\nA surgical strike is needed to make the fools realise that no one is beyond von Carstein's reach!

missions.localised_description: Vlad's rampages through Ostermark, yet the Elector Counts seem unfazed. News takes a while to filter through the Empire, perhaps they have only heard rumours and refuse to acknowledge Vlad's return? Either that or they do not care and look inwardly on their own squabbles.\n\nA surgical strike is needed to make the fools realise that no one is beyond von Carstein's reach!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Vlad's rampages through Ostermark, yet the remnants of the Empire seem unfazed. No doubt the survivors are looking to their own needs, and see the bloodshed and destruction in far off Ostermark as simply not their problem. And so mankind sways further into the clutches of dark gods.\n\nA more surgical strike is needed to make the fools realise that no one is beyond von Carstein's reach!

missions.localised_description: Vlad's rampages through Ostermark, yet the remnants of the Empire seem unfazed. No doubt the survivors are looking to their own needs, and see the bloodshed and destruction in far off Ostermark as simply not their problem. And so mankind sways further into the clutches of dark gods.\n\nA more surgical strike is needed to make the fools realise that no one is beyond von Carstein's reach!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Mankind has finally been shaken into acting, they are mustering forces and prepare to face the Undead legions of Vlad's design. A puppet should be despatched to seek out where this army of mortal dupes gathers.

missions.localised_description: Mankind has finally been shaken into acting, they are mustering forces and prepare to face the Undead legions of Vlad's design. A puppet should be despatched to seek out where this army of mortal dupes gathers.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Carstein Ring has returned its master to Unlife once more. Vlad, the first Vampire Count, patriarch of the Von Carstein bloodline, is abroad and the world should tremble! However, this resurrection has proven a difficult one. The power of the ring fades, so Vlad must do something about it if he is to use its benighted abilities in future. First there are other priorities; Vlad's absence has been a long one, and his kin have been busy in the intervening centuries. They have been plotting for what Vlad feels is little gain - too interested in their own petty disputes and sibling rivalries. It is time for the first von Carstein to wrest back control from these pretenders!\n\nTo enact his grand plans, Vlad needs a companion, after all where would the Count be without his lady?

missions.localised_description: The Carstein Ring has returned its master to Unlife once more. Vlad, the first Vampire Count, patriarch of the Von Carstein bloodline, is abroad and the world should tremble! However, this resurrection has proven a difficult one. The power of the ring fades, so Vlad must do something about it if he is to use its benighted abilities in future. First there are other priorities; Vlad's absence has been a long one, and his kin have been busy in the intervening centuries. They have been plotting for what Vlad feels is little gain - too interested in their own petty disputes and sibling rivalries. It is time for the first von Carstein to wrest back control from these pretenders!\n\nTo enact his grand plans, Vlad needs a companion, after all where would the Count be without his lady?

localised_description.last_approved_text: So, it is fear and blood. Vlad first feasts on those of his brethren foolish enough to outwardly oppose him, but a further show of strength is needed. Target the living flocks, those mortal few that live in the shadow of their Undead Lords. Killing them or those in neighbouring provinces will send a strong message to Vlad's enemies and bring them to heel. Let the smallfolk soil their breeches at his name!

missions.localised_description: So, it is fear and blood. Vlad first feasts on those of his brethren foolish enough to outwardly oppose him, but a further show of strength is needed. Target the living flocks, those mortal few that live in the shadow of their Undead Lords. Killing them or those in neighbouring provinces will send a strong message to Vlad's enemies and bring them to heel. Let the smallfolk soil their breeches at his name!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Vampires are greedy creatures - they always want more, whether that is an immortal span, more blood, or greater power. Vlad has promised to share such resources, but first he must accrue them...

Killing them or those in neighbouring territories will send a strong message to Vlad's enemies and bring them to heel. Let the smallfolk soil their breeches at his name!

localised_description.last_approved_text: With a powerbase established and much of Sylvania back in his thrall, Vlad can restore the Carstein Ring to its former power. For this he will need Warpstone, a material craved by other noisome races and Dark Magic-users alike. Vlad is aware of a Warpstone seam deep in the Desolation of Nagash. A chunk of Morrslieb fell from the sky and struck the area many years back, scattering the area in the Chaos-infused rock. Assuming it hasn't already been mined to exhaustion, there will be more than enough for Vlad's needs.\n\nAn expedition across the World's Edge Mountains is needed to collect the Warpstone, one that Vlad plans on leading himself. To bolster this force, he summons his von Carstein sires from the catacombs, those who have been locked and left to rot within their coffins...

missions.localised_description: With a powerbase established and much of Sylvania back in his thrall, Vlad can restore the Carstein Ring to its former power. A chunk of Morrslieb fell from the sky and struck the area many years back, scattering the area in the Chaos-infused rock. Assuming it hasn't already been mined to exhaustion, there will be more than enough for Vlad's needs.\n\nAn expedition across the World's Edge Mountains is needed to collect the Warpstone, one that Vlad plans on leading himself. To bolster this force, he summons his von Carstein sires from the catacombs, those who have been locked and left to rot within their coffins...

localised_description.last_approved_text: Valaya has wept to see such violence befall our sons. A grudge, once written, must be avenged. Find this forest-dweller, and destroy them!

missions.localised_description: Valaya has wept to see such violence befall our sons. A grudge, once written, must be avenged. Find this forest-dweller, and destroy them!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Below the furious nose of Grimnir, this stinking leaf-lover has enacted a great treason against us. Kill them, and erase this grudge!

missions.localised_description: Below the furious nose of Grimnir, this stinking leaf-lover has enacted a great treason against us. Kill them, and erase this grudge!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Before Grungni’s baleful sight, this Elf-scum has dared to step onto our lands. The grudge is written; throw them out, and avenge it!

missions.localised_title: The Folly of the Moss Men Grudge

localised_description.last_approved_text: Though Valaya is aggrieved to see it, these bark-eaters have stolen a victory from the Dawi. This slight cannot go unavenged. See to it!

missions.localised_description: Though Valaya is aggrieved to see it, these bark-eaters have stolen a victory from the Dawi. This slight cannot go unavenged. See to it!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Grimnir rages at the sight of these leaf-lovers raiding our lands. The grudge has been entered into the Dammaz Kron – strike it out!

missions.localised_description: Grimnir rages at the sight of these leaf-lovers raiding our lands. The grudge has been entered into the Dammaz Kron – strike it out!

missions.localised_title: The Ego of the Soil Servants Grudge

localised_description.last_approved_text: Furious Smednir cries out at these thicketed fools sacking our Karaks. This cannot stand, so says the Book; you must fight, and win, for the grudge!

missions.localised_description: Furious Smednir cries out at these thicketed fools sacking our Karaks. This cannot stand, so says the Book; you must fight, and win, for the grudge!

localised_title.last_approved_text: The Nuisance of the Branch Fancies Grudge

missions.localised_title: The Nuisance of the Branch Fancies Grudge

localised_description.last_approved_text: This vile and unnatural Beastman seems determined to ruin our plans. Show it the fury of the forest - destroy this blight!

missions.localised_description: This vile and unnatural Beastman seems determined to ruin our plans. Show it the fury of the forest - destroy this blight!

localised_description.last_approved_text: What vicious schemes the Chaos Gods wish to rain upon us! Do not let them endanger Athel Loren - smite their corruption from the forest!

missions.localised_description: What vicious schemes the Chaos Gods wish to rain upon us! Do not let them endanger Athel Loren - smite their corruption from the forest!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The diminutive mountaineer thinks to sully our plans. Show him otherwise - let him feed the Worldroots!

missions.localised_description: The diminutive mountaineer thinks to sully our plans. Show him otherwise - let him feed the Worldroots!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The haughtiness of man is apparent. Let no agent of the Empire forestall our progress. Turn them to mulch!

missions.localised_description: The haughtiness of man is apparent. Let no agent of the Empire forestall our progress. Turn them to mulch!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The enemy think we can be taken for granted! They are sorely mistaken - show them the error of their ways.

missions.localised_description: The enemy think we can be taken for granted! They are sorely mistaken - show them the error of their ways.

localised_description.last_approved_text: What schemes does she mean to employ against us? See that they are never brought to fruition.

missions.localised_description: What schemes does she mean to employ against us? See that they are never brought to fruition.

localised_description.last_approved_text: What a vile, fungal nuisance this one is! Cut him down to size and stop his sneaky meddling once and for all!

missions.localised_description: What a vile, fungal nuisance this one is! Cut him down to size and stop his sneaky meddling once and for all!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The dead have no place amongst the living. Their place is in the earth, serving as mulch for the trees. See them sent below!

missions.localised_description: The dead have no place amongst the living. Their place is in the earth, serving as mulch for the trees. See them sent below!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Cadaverous and pallid, this Undead heiress must be swiftly and surely dealt with; never again must she darken the forest!

missions.localised_description: Cadaverous and pallid, this Undead heiress must be swiftly and surely dealt with; never again must she darken the forest!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Too monstrous for us to suffer, the master of this brayherd should not be allowed to live. Send out Athel Loren's best; deal with this slavering Beastman!

missions.localised_description: Too monstrous for us to suffer, the master of this brayherd should not be allowed to live. Send out Athel Loren's best; deal with this slavering Beastman!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The influence of Chaos cannot be allowed to grow, lest they become any more of a threat to the forest. This Lord must fall!

missions.localised_description: The influence of Chaos cannot be allowed to grow, lest they become any more of a threat to the forest. This Lord must fall!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Whatever dark plans this Dwarflord has for the forests, they cannot become reality. Strike him down!

missions.localised_description: Whatever dark plans this Dwarflord has for the forests, they cannot become reality. Strike him down!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This arrogant child of the Empire can no longer be suffered to live. In the name of the forest, have him killed!

missions.localised_description: This arrogant child of the Empire can no longer be suffered to live. In the name of the forest, have him killed!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This enemy threatens to make trouble. See that they never take up arms against us.

missions.localised_description: This enemy threatens to make trouble. See that they never take up arms against us.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This filthy Greenskin drives his disgusting forces before him. Stop them - cut the head from this fool!

missions.localised_description: This filthy Greenskin drives his disgusting forces before him. Stop them - cut the head from this fool!

localised_description.last_approved_text: What is dead can and will be put down again, along with any dark plans of conquest that may be under way! See to it.

missions.localised_description: What is dead can and will be put down again, along with any dark plans of conquest that may be under way! See to it.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Though cavernous and dark, this Dwarf stronghold is a good place to make camp!

missions.localised_description: Though cavernous and dark, this Dwarf stronghold is a good place to make camp!

localised_description.last_approved_text: These Empire settlements are ready-made for us; let us take up positions here!

missions.localised_description: These Empire settlements are ready-made for us; let us take up positions here!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This settlement is as good as any for us to use as an outpost!

missions.localised_description: This settlement is as good as any for us to use as an outpost!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Though filthy and dank, this Greenskin settlement will do well for us.

missions.localised_description: Though filthy and dank, this Greenskin settlement will do well for us.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Athel Loren has been seized! Such an affront cannot stand - reclaim it, at once!

missions.localised_description: Athel Loren has been seized! Such an affront cannot stand - reclaim it, at once!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Though dingy and morose, this Undead settlement will suffice as an outpost.

missions.localised_description: Though dingy and morose, this Undead settlement will suffice as an outpost.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Our kindred have requested that we deal with these warriors. They are the strongest of their kind - their defeat will endear us to our brothers, which is essential for our ultimate victory!

missions.localised_description: Our kindred have requested that we deal with these warriors. They are the strongest of their kind - their defeat will endear us to our brothers, which is essential for our ultimate victory!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Our forest kith request we capture this place. Doing so will strengthen our bonds with them.

missions.localised_description: Our forest kith request we capture this place. Doing so will strengthen our bonds with them.

localised_description.last_approved_text: If we take down these fierce warriors, it will strike a terrible blow to their morale. Our potential allies ask that we do this in the name of greater friendship between us.

missions.localised_description: If we take down these fierce warriors, it will strike a terrible blow to their morale. Our potential allies ask that we do this in the name of greater friendship between us.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Potential friends have asked we take the fight to this army. Defeating them will prove our mettle beyond doubt and their gratitude will greatly endear them to us in return.

missions.localised_description: Potential friends have asked we take the fight to this army. Defeating them will prove our mettle beyond doubt and their gratitude will greatly endear them to us in return.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The key to better relations with our potential allies lies in raiding this territory. They have requested it of us, and by doing so our friendship will be shored-up further.

missions.localised_description: The key to better relations with our potential allies lies in raiding this territory. They have requested it of us, and by doing so our friendship will be shored-up further.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Our kinsmen have requested that we ransack their enemy's lands, swearing fealty if we succeed. Do this and we will increase our chances of their being brought completely under our rule.

missions.localised_description: Our kinsmen have requested that we ransack their enemy's lands, swearing fealty if we succeed. Do this and we will increase our chances of their being brought completely under our rule.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This filthy Beastlord thinks he can trample our sacred territory. Bluntly put, he must be killed, and a terrible lesson taught to our opponents!

missions.localised_description: This filthy Beastlord thinks he can trample our sacred territory. Bluntly put, he must be killed, and a terrible lesson taught to our opponents!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Chaos has no place amongst the civilised, and this Lord of Chaos walks our lands hitherto unchallenged. Put him to the sword, and demonstrate we are not to be crossed!

missions.localised_description: Chaos has no place amongst the civilised, and this Lord of Chaos walks our lands hitherto unchallenged. Put him to the sword, and demonstrate we are not to be crossed!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This bantam-weight warrior thinks he can march through our territory. What idle madness these Dwarfs must dream - put him to the sword!

missions.localised_description: This bantam-weight warrior thinks he can march through our territory. What idle madness these Dwarfs must dream - put him to the sword!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The arrogant and aloof Karl Franz sends one of his leaders against us. Show no mercy to this interloper - strike a blow to the heart of the Empire by cutting him down.

missions.localised_description: The arrogant and aloof Karl Franz sends one of his leaders against us. Show no mercy to this interloper - strike a blow to the heart of the Empire by cutting him down.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As the seasons change, so too do the whims of fools. An enemy leader has camped too long near our lands, and so the Spring of our clemency must become the Winter of our wrath!

missions.localised_description: As the seasons change, so too do the whims of fools. An enemy leader has camped too long near our lands, and so the Spring of our clemency must become the Winter of our wrath!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This filthy Greenskin leader thinks he can defile the sanctity of Athel Loren, leading his troops through our lands. Leave nothing for the carrion; destroy them all, Gork (or Mork) will recognise his own.

missions.localised_description: This filthy Greenskin leader thinks he can defile the sanctity of Athel Loren, leading his troops through our lands. Leave nothing for the carrion; destroy them all, Gork (or Mork) will recognise his own.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With every step this Undead leader takes, it corrupts and besmirches our lands with its decaying touch. Put it back in its grave once and for all!

missions.localised_description: With every step this Undead leader takes, it corrupts and besmirches our lands with its decaying touch. Put it back in its grave once and for all!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Beastlord is a thorn in our side; he is indeed mighty, but by felling him the glory gained will be great!

missions.localised_description: This Beastlord is a thorn in our side; he is indeed mighty, but by felling him the glory gained will be great!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Lord of Chaos is most formidable! Killing him will be a decisive blow to their forces but a great victory for Athel Loren!

missions.localised_description: This Lord of Chaos is most formidable! Killing him will be a decisive blow to their forces but a great victory for Athel Loren!

localised_description.last_approved_text: For something so small, this Dwarf is certainly mighty! If we defeat him, we reap the glory found through the killing of a challenging opponent!

missions.localised_description: For something so small, this Dwarf is certainly mighty! If we defeat him, we reap the glory found through the killing of a challenging opponent!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This Lord of the Empire may be arrogant, yet he remains a powerful warrior. We should bring him down lest he become more than a mere mayfly irritant.

missions.localised_description: This Lord of the Empire may be arrogant, yet he remains a powerful warrior. We should bring him down lest he become more than a mere mayfly irritant.

localised_description.last_approved_text: No matter their strength, all enemies will fall before us. This foe has great skill and power, in their defeat there is great glory to be gained for Athel Loren!

missions.localised_description: No matter their strength, all enemies will fall before us. This foe has great skill and power, in their defeat there is great glory to be gained for Athel Loren!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Though slimy and stunted, this Greenskin warrior is nevertheless powerful. To make him little more than carrion feed would bring us many great boons.

missions.localised_description: Though slimy and stunted, this Greenskin warrior is nevertheless powerful. To make him little more than carrion feed would bring us many great boons.

localised_description.last_approved_text: For a mere corpse, this Vampire is surprisingly formidable. Yet the dead should remain dead, with great glory to be found in returning it to the grave.

missions.localised_description: For a mere corpse, this Vampire is surprisingly formidable. Yet the dead should remain dead, with great glory to be found in returning it to the grave.

localised_description.last_approved_text: No brayherd can stand against us. Smash these ingrates to dust!

missions.localised_description: No brayherd can stand against us. Smash these ingrates to dust!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Chaos is a blight upon the world, and one we will see destroyed utterly!

missions.localised_description: Chaos is a blight upon the world, and one we will see destroyed utterly!

localised_description.last_approved_text: What these Dwarfs dream of in the dark and dank depths shall not be wrought upon our lands!

missions.localised_description: What these Dwarfs dream of in the dark and dank depths shall not be wrought upon our lands!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Haughty, arrogant Empire forces have no place here. Put them to rout, for Athel Loren!

missions.localised_description: Haughty, arrogant Empire forces have no place here. Put them to rout, for Athel Loren!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The forests whisper its desires - that this army be brought utterly to ruin. Enact Athel Loren's will!

missions.localised_description: The forests whisper its desires - that this army be brought utterly to ruin. Enact Athel Loren's will!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This infestation of Orcs and Goblins has no place on this earth - smash them into the dirt, nasty green scumbags!

missions.localised_description: This infestation of Orcs and Goblins has no place on this earth - smash them into the dirt, nasty green scumbags!

localised_description.last_approved_text: These detestable Beastmen infest our lands. They must be pushed back; Athel Loren must not be defiled!

missions.localised_description: These detestable Beastmen infest our lands. They must be pushed back; Athel Loren must not be defiled!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Chaos cannot be allowed to encroach upon the sanctity of Athel Loren. Push its forces back - smash them!

missions.localised_description: Chaos cannot be allowed to encroach upon the sanctity of Athel Loren. Push its forces back - smash them!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The pernicious Dwarfs try to sully and plunder the forests; no more! Meet them in battle and crush them further down to size!

missions.localised_description: The pernicious Dwarfs try to sully and plunder the forests; no more! Meet them in battle and crush them further down to size!

localised_description.last_approved_text: This pretentious, bejewelled Empire army treads where it should not. Show them the error of their ways!

missions.localised_description: This pretentious, bejewelled Empire army treads where it should not. Show them the error of their ways!

localised_description.last_approved_text: No army has the right to march within our sacred boundaries. They must be repelled, and learn their folly is repaid in blood.

missions.localised_description: No army has the right to march within our sacred boundaries. They must be repelled, and learn their folly is repaid in blood.

localised_description.last_approved_text: These fungal pests were not granted permission to enter our territory, nor would they ever be. Squash them, and return purity to these glades.

missions.localised_description: These fungal pests were not granted permission to enter our territory, nor would they ever be. Squash them, and return purity to these glades.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Undead shuffle into our lands in great numbers, bringing with them their corruption and filth. Shatter them and leave their bones for mulch!

missions.localised_description: The Undead shuffle into our lands in great numbers, bringing with them their corruption and filth. Shatter them and leave their bones for mulch!

localised_description.last_approved_text: No army, living or dead, can stand against the might of nature. For Athel Loren, smash these brigands!

missions.localised_description: No army, living or dead, can stand against the might of nature. For Athel Loren, smash these brigands!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Dwarfholds may be dingy and dark, but they contain many riches; riches that we should claim for ourselves!

missions.localised_description: Dwarfholds may be dingy and dark, but they contain many riches; riches that we should claim for ourselves!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Empire may be arrogant, but their territory is wealthy. Why should they have it all, and not us?

missions.localised_description: The Empire may be arrogant, but their territory is wealthy. Why should they have it all, and not us?

localised_description.last_approved_text: The riches of the earth are rightfully ours. We need only march forth and claim them!

missions.localised_description: The riches of the earth are rightfully ours. We need only march forth and claim them!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Greenskins peddle filth wherever they roam, but beneath the dirt treasures can often be found. Treasures that, despite the grime, we should seize!

missions.localised_description: Greenskins peddle filth wherever they roam, but beneath the dirt treasures can often be found. Treasures that, despite the grime, we should seize!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Vampires are decrepit and deceitful, but they hoard great and ancient wealth. How it would benefit us if we were to simply reach out and claim it!

missions.localised_description: The Vampires are decrepit and deceitful, but they hoard great and ancient wealth. How it would benefit us if we were to simply reach out and claim it!

localised_title.last_approved_text: You Can't Take It With You

missions.localised_title: You Can't Take It With You

localised_description.last_approved_text: Athel Loren is threatened, so sound the call - bring more warriors to her defence. Recruit more!

missions.localised_description: Athel Loren is threatened, so sound the call - bring more warriors to her defence. Recruit more!

localised_description.last_approved_text: What the Dwarfs have, we shall take by force. Burn their Holds, and take their treasures by force!

missions.localised_description: What the Dwarfs have, we shall take by force. Burn their Holds, and take their treasures by force!

localised_description.last_approved_text: What mighty towers the Empire constructs! Such affronts to nature should be toppled for their arrogance - see it done!

missions.localised_description: What mighty towers the Empire constructs! Such affronts to nature should be toppled for their arrogance - see it done!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Council has decided, in its wisdom, that this settlement has no right to exist further. See it brought low, for the good of Athel Loren!

missions.localised_description: The Council has decided, in its wisdom, that this settlement has no right to exist further. See it brought low, for the good of Athel Loren!

localised_description.last_approved_text: They pile their filth high and call it a settlement. It is nothing more than heaps of dung, and dung burns SO well…

missions.localised_description: They pile their filth high and call it a settlement. It is nothing more than heaps of dung, and dung burns SO well…

localised_description.last_approved_text: Nothing kills the Undead better than fire, which makes this settlement little more than a glorified funeral pyre. Provide the match.

missions.localised_description: Nothing kills the Undead better than fire, which makes this settlement little more than a glorified funeral pyre. Provide the match.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Branchwraiths are powerful, if twisted, additions to any forest defence force. Athel Loren requires more of them - see it done!

missions.localised_description: The Branchwraiths are powerful, if twisted, additions to any forest defence force. Athel Loren requires more of them - see it done!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Waystalkers are the most keen, determined scouts in all of Athel Loren. Bring more of them into our ranks, to give us an edge over our enemies.

missions.localised_description: The Waystalkers are the most keen, determined scouts in all of Athel Loren. Bring more of them into our ranks, to give us an edge over our enemies.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Spellsingers, elegant and deadly, number too few among our ranks. See this remedied, that they may bring their beautiful ways of death to the battlefield!

missions.localised_description: The Spellsingers, elegant and deadly, number too few among our ranks. See this remedied, that they may bring their beautiful ways of death to the battlefield!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Without cavalry, we are at a severe disadvantage - at risk of being outflanked and charged to devastating effect! We must field more to guard the edge!

missions.localised_description: Without cavalry, we are at a severe disadvantage - at risk of being outflanked and charged to devastating effect! We must field more to guard the edge!

localised_title.last_approved_text: To Steed or Not to Steed…

missions.localised_title: To Steed or Not to Steed…

localised_description.last_approved_text: Melee infantry are the spine of any good army, and we are severely lacking in their regard. We must field more to create a strong central core within our forces!

missions.localised_description: Melee infantry are the spine of any good army, and we are severely lacking in their regard. We must field more to create a strong central core within our forces!

localised_description.last_approved_text: We are the warriors of Athel Loren, we strike from afar and with deadly precision. However, our armies are lacking in archers and scouts - recruit more, and they will surely give us the edge we require.

missions.localised_description: We are the warriors of Athel Loren, we strike from afar and with deadly precision. However, our armies are lacking in archers and scouts - recruit more, and they will surely give us the edge we require.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Without monsters to field, our forces lack the same punch as those of our rivals. We should field some huge creatures as to terrify our enemies!

missions.localised_description: Without monsters to field, our forces lack the same punch as those of our rivals. We should field some huge creatures as to terrify our enemies!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Beastmen rise from their forests and their filth, frothing over with fury at the 'civilisation' of man. They clamour for blood.

missions.localised_description: The Beastmen rise from their forests and their filth, frothing over with fury at the 'civilisation' of man. They clamour for blood.

localised_description.last_approved_text: From afar, the Beastmen watch the cities of man with a baleful gaze, longing to tear apart that which they so detest. And so it comes to pass.

missions.localised_description: From afar, the Beastmen watch the cities of man with a baleful gaze, longing to tear apart that which they so detest. And so it comes to pass.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With splintering roars, the great throng of Beastmen descend upon the world of men. With much clamour, and a singular hatred, they charge and do not cease.

missions.localised_description: With splintering roars, the great throng of Beastmen descend upon the world of men. With much clamour, and a singular hatred, they charge and do not cease.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Every tower, every gatehouse, every thatched home is an affront to the Beastmen's very essence. With fire, brawn and rage, the unending herds will see it all destroyed.

missions.localised_description: Every tower, every gatehouse, every thatched home is an affront to the Beastmen's very essence. With fire, brawn and rage, the unending herds will see it all destroyed.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The land burns, the seas boil, the world cracks and blooms into destruction. The Beastmen, bloody-handed, see this, and know that it is right.

missions.localised_description: The land burns, the seas boil, the world cracks and blooms into destruction. The Beastmen, bloody-handed, see this, and know that it is right.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter V: The Tree of Wrath

missions.localised_title: Chapter V: The Tree of Wrath

localised_description.last_approved_text: At the centre of the realms of Athel Loren lies the Oak of Ages, beating heart of the forest and the sacred shrine of the Asrai. From the mighty Oak, life flows into the forest and through the world.

missions.localised_description: At the centre of the realms of Athel Loren lies the Oak of Ages, beating heart of the forest and the sacred shrine of the Asrai. From the mighty Oak, life flows into the forest and through the world.

localised_description.last_approved_text: From the Oak of Ages, Orion is reborn each year. The Oak gives life to the King of the Asrai, and he in turns gives purpose to his Elvish subjects.

missions.localised_description: From the Oak of Ages, Orion is reborn each year. The Oak gives life to the King of the Asrai, and he in turns gives purpose to his Elvish subjects.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter II: The Oak of Oaks

missions.localised_title: Chapter II: The Oak of Oaks

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Wood Elves believe their fate, and that of Athel Loren, to be intrinsically linked to the Oak of Ages. Many have tried to despoil it, and for eons many have failed. If - gods forbid - the Oak should fall, so too would the forest itself.

missions.localised_description: The Wood Elves believe their fate, and that of Athel Loren, to be intrinsically linked to the Oak of Ages. Many have tried to despoil it, and for eons many have failed. If - gods forbid - the Oak should fall, so too would the forest itself.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter III: What Grows Beneath Mighty Boughs

missions.localised_title: Chapter III: What Grows Beneath Mighty Boughs

localised_description.last_approved_text: It is said that no artefact forged by the mortals of the world can match the magical power of but a single acorn from the Oak of Ages. When the Winds of Magic blow strong through Athel Loren, the Oak of Ages radiates with an otherworldly power.

missions.localised_description: It is said that no artefact forged by the mortals of the world can match the magical power of but a single acorn from the Oak of Ages. When the Winds of Magic blow strong through Athel Loren, the Oak of Ages radiates with an otherworldly power.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter IV: Great Things Grow Greater

missions.localised_title: Chapter IV: Great Things Grow Greater
