missions.localised_description: It is said that no artefact forged by the mortals of the world can match the magical power of but a single acorn from the Oak of Ages. When the Winds of Magic blow strong through Athel Loren, the Oak of Ages radiates with an otherworldly power.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter IV: Great Things Grow Greater

missions.localised_title: Chapter IV: Great Things Grow Greater

localised_description.last_approved_text: Wherever Morghur treads, Chaos follows with him. A dark tide of ravening madness and mutagenic power swirls around Morghur, corrupting and changing all those around him - friend and foe alike. This power, however, is beyond the control of Morghur even - to contain the swirling essence of Chaos that trails the Master of Skulls is beyond the capability of any mortal container. For this essence to be caught, and harnessed, something more... immortal is required. Such vessels are not made easily; they require macabre and difficult to obtain materials, but needs must.\n\nYou must start with the spines of the Orcs.

missions.localised_description: Wherever Morghur treads, Chaos follows with him. A dark tide of ravening madness and mutagenic power swirls around Morghur, corrupting and changing all those around him - friend and foe alike. This power, however, is beyond the control of Morghur even - to contain the swirling essence of Chaos that trails the Master of Skulls is beyond the capability of any mortal container. For this essence to be caught, and harnessed, something more... immortal is required. Such vessels are not made easily; they require macabre and difficult to obtain materials, but needs must.\n\nYou must start with the spines of the Orcs.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Greenskin spines are seemingly difficult to come by these days, as their kind has been almost eradicated. Yet no matter, Morghur has his ways, and there are always alternatives, particularly as the Greenskins are so-often spineless in their behaviour. The price must instead by paid in souls - a great number of souls. To this end, Morghur must... harvest them.

missions.localised_description: Greenskin spines are seemingly difficult to come by these days, as their kind has been almost eradicated. Yet no matter, Morghur has his ways, and there are always alternatives, particularly as the Greenskins are so-often spineless in their behaviour. The price must instead by paid in souls - a great number of souls. To this end, Morghur must... harvest them.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Defeating the Greenskins was not the difficult part - that was removing the spine in one piece from their bodies. Nevertheless, Morghur now stands over the emptied corpses of a dozen felled Orcs, their spinal cords stored safely away. His attention turns now, in crazed and macabre bloodlust, to the Dwarfs. Their stern and thick craniums will be the next important part of the ritual. As many as can be obtained must be, and as fast as possible!

missions.localised_description: Defeating the Greenskins was not the difficult part - that was removing the spine in one piece from their bodies. Nevertheless, Morghur now stands over the emptied corpses of a dozen felled Orcs, their spinal cords stored safely away. His attention turns now, in crazed and macabre bloodlust, to the Dwarfs. Their stern and thick craniums will be the next important part of the ritual. As many as can be obtained must be, and as fast as possible!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Dwarfen skulls are of great importance to the ritual. Yet thick and hardy as they are, the innate Dwarfen inability to channel the Winds of Magic leaves them at a significant disadvantage. The leaves rustle and the trees themselves seem to shiver as Morghur unveils the final part of his plan: the Wood Elves. The Asrai and their forests are steeped in magic, old as the world itself. A waystone, thieved from deep within the sanctuary forests of Athel Loren, will be more than sufficient to sate Morghur's desires. Let none of the Elves or Treekin stand in your way - cut them down in the name of this quest!

missions.localised_description: The Dwarfen skulls are of great importance to the ritual. Yet thick and hardy as they are, the innate Dwarfen inability to channel the Winds of Magic leaves them at a significant disadvantage. The leaves rustle and the trees themselves seem to shiver as Morghur unveils the final part of his plan: the Wood Elves. The Asrai and their forests are steeped in magic, old as the world itself. A waystone, thieved from deep within the sanctuary forests of Athel Loren, will be more than sufficient to sate Morghur's desires. Let none of the Elves or Treekin stand in your way - cut them down in the name of this quest!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The insidious Elves are never far behind; the forests speak to them and reveal all the secrets that lie beneath the canopy. Ariel is no fool either, she knows Morghur better than any of his enemies, and has tracked him down. In her stead, she sends a champion, at the head of an Asrai host, to put an end to Morghur's dreams of destruction and return Athel Loren to 'peace'. This is but a fleeting hope, however, for Morghur will not suffer these forest folk to interrupt his desires. This champion will be eviscerated and returned to Ariel in a dozen Ruinous pieces, each more garishly transformed than the last.

missions.localised_description: The insidious Elves are never far behind; the forests speak to them and reveal all the secrets that lie beneath the canopy. Ariel is no fool either, she knows Morghur better than any of his enemies, and has tracked him down. In her stead, she sends a champion, at the head of an Asrai host, to put an end to Morghur's dreams of destruction and return Athel Loren to 'peace'. This is but a fleeting hope, however, for Morghur will not suffer these forest folk to interrupt his desires. This champion will be eviscerated and returned to Ariel in a dozen Ruinous pieces, each more garishly transformed than the last.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the required items in his possession, Morghur can begin his ritual. But not here, not amongst all this… normality. He must return to his lair, where he can be alone amongst his twisted creations. Within this dank and unknowable cavern, Morghur's physical form is hewn from countless gifts and boons from the Ruinous Powers, coalesced together to create the Master of Skulls. It is here that he will capture the essence of Chaos and make it his own.

missions.localised_description: With the required items in his possession, Morghur can begin his ritual. But not here, not amongst all this… normality. He must return to his lair, where he can be alone amongst his twisted creations. Within this dank and unknowable cavern, Morghur's physical form is hewn from countless gifts and boons from the Ruinous Powers, coalesced together to create the Master of Skulls. It is here that he will capture the essence of Chaos and make it his own.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the required items in his possession, Morghur can begin his ritual. But not here, not amongst all this… normality. He must return to his lair, where he can be alone amongst his twisted creations. Within this dank and unknowable cavern, Morghur's physical form is hewn from countless gifts and boons from the Ruinous Powers, coalesced together to create the Master of Skulls. It is here that he will capture the essence of Chaos and make it his own.

missions.localised_description: With the required items in his possession, Morghur can begin his ritual. But not here, not amongst all this… normality. He must return to his lair, where he can be alone amongst his twisted creations. Within this dank and unknowable cavern, Morghur's physical form is hewn from countless gifts and boons from the Ruinous Powers, coalesced together to create the Master of Skulls. It is here that he will capture the essence of Chaos and make it his own.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Eventually, Durthu and his retinue burst into a copse to find a battle fully joined! The Glade Scouts of Athel Loren pitch themselves desperately against hordes of Undead, who rive and shift at them in seemingly-endless waves. Though Durthu has no love for any but those embodied by the forest spirits, he knows the Undead are the greatest scourge and must be purged immediately!

missions.localised_description: Eventually, Durthu and his retinue burst into a copse to find a battle fully joined! The Glade Scouts of Athel Loren pitch themselves desperately against hordes of Undead, who rive and shift at them in seemingly-endless waves. Though Durthu has no love for any but those embodied by the forest spirits, he knows the Undead are the greatest scourge and must be purged immediately!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Durthu had suspected the hand of the Necromancer Heinrich Kemmler, but instead his nefarious student was behind the Undead horde. The damp and pallid hallmarks of Kemmler are all over his protégé's work as he advances on the forest with his desiccated horde in tow. The forest must be protected, and Durthu will give no quarter in its defence. Let these dark and twisted fiends feel the full wrath of the Deepwood, with the wrathful Ancient as its instrument of war!

missions.localised_description: Durthu had suspected the hand of the Necromancer Heinrich Kemmler, but instead his nefarious student was behind the Undead horde. The damp and pallid hallmarks of Kemmler are all over his protégé's work as he advances on the forest with his desiccated horde in tow. The forest must be protected, and Durthu will give no quarter in its defence. Let these dark and twisted fiends feel the full wrath of the Deepwood, with the wrathful Ancient as its instrument of war!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A great horde of Beastmen besiege the Oak of Ages! There are brayherds present from every corner of the Old World; Morghur has summoned to him the Dark Omen, Malagor, and even Khazrak the One-Eye is said to be stalking the field. The Beastmen are drawn here to enact a final, bitter blow against the roots of life itself. Should they succeed, all will be plunged into a hell beyond reckoning and without end. They must be stopped before they bring this land to Ruin. Defend the Oak; defend the Old World!

missions.localised_description: A great horde of Beastmen besiege the Oak of Ages! There are brayherds present from every corner of the Old World; Morghur has summoned to him the Dark Omen, Malagor, and even Khazrak the One-Eye is said to be stalking the field. The Beastmen are drawn here to enact a final, bitter blow against the roots of life itself. Should they succeed, all will be plunged into a hell beyond reckoning and without end. They must be stopped before they bring this land to Ruin. Defend the Oak; defend the Old World!

localised_description.last_approved_text: So it has come to this. Morghur has thrown an almost endless torrent of Beastmen at the Wood Elves, yet they have pushed back the tide. Now the Shadowgave makes one final gambit - a push for the Silver Spire itself, intent on poisoning the water supply that nurtures so much of the land and leaving it for dead. He cannot be allowed to succeed. Yet Morghur has dark and twisted schemes that make him extremely difficult to kill - the Asrai must watch carefully and use their superior Elven intelligence to overwhelm his trickery. Hold fast against these desperate beasts, see the day won and the Old World saved!

missions.localised_description: So it has come to this. Morghur has thrown an almost endless torrent of Beastmen at the Wood Elves, yet they have pushed back the tide. Now the Shadowgave makes one final gambit - a push for the Silver Spire itself, intent on poisoning the water supply that nurtures so much of the land and leaving it for dead. He cannot be allowed to succeed. Yet Morghur has dark and twisted schemes that make him extremely difficult to kill - the Asrai must watch carefully and use their superior Elven intelligence to overwhelm his trickery. Hold fast against these desperate beasts, see the day won and the Old World saved!

localised_description.last_approved_text: So it has come to this. Morghur has thrown an almost endless torrent of Beastmen at the Wood Elves, yet they have pushed back the tide. Now the Shadowgave makes one final gambit - a push for the Silver Spire itself, intent on poisoning the water supply that nurtures so much of the land and leaving it for dead. He cannot be allowed to succeed. Yet Morghur has dark and twisted schemes that make him extremely difficult to kill - the Asrai must watch carefully and use their superior Elven intelligence to overwhelm his trickery. Hold fast against these desperate beasts, see the day won and the Old World saved!

missions.localised_description: So it has come to this. Morghur has thrown an almost endless torrent of Beastmen at the Wood Elves, yet they have pushed back the tide. Now the Shadowgave makes one final gambit - a push for the Silver Spire itself, intent on poisoning the water supply that nurtures so much of the land and leaving it for dead. He cannot be allowed to succeed. Yet Morghur has dark and twisted schemes that make him extremely difficult to kill - the Asrai must watch carefully and use their superior Elven intelligence to overwhelm his trickery. Hold fast against these desperate beasts, see the day won and the Old World saved!

localised_description.last_approved_text: It is clear now that the Glade Lord has been deceived by Slaanesh; the temptation of power and pleasure was far too corrupting. They have fallen to Chaos, and now the dreaming woods - Athel Caiellin - call. They cannot be allowed to enter that realm of terror and malice with the Cloak of Isha. It must be secured and, for both their own sake and that of the realm, the Glade Lord and retinue must be put to the sword. The forest watches with fearful anticipation; the Night Glens seem to grow darker as the hour of battle approaches. Orion knows he cannot flinch, and that everything he does, he does in the defence of his realm.

missions.localised_description: It is clear now that the Glade Lord has been deceived by Slaanesh; the temptation of power and pleasure was far too corrupting. They have fallen to Chaos, and now the dreaming woods - Athel Caiellin - call. They cannot be allowed to enter that realm of terror and malice with the Cloak of Isha. It must be secured and, for both their own sake and that of the realm, the Glade Lord and retinue must be put to the sword. The forest watches with fearful anticipation; the Night Glens seem to grow darker as the hour of battle approaches. Orion knows he cannot flinch, and that everything he does, he does in the defence of his realm.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With a zeal that could inspire any being, Orion breaks into the clearing and blasts the Horn of the Wild Hunt. With a crack of lightning, and the scream of several displaced spirits, the magical aura is purged, and the beast-path revealed. However, the Horn is entirely drained of energy, if only temporarily. Orion is unconcerned, however, as with the passage open, the moment of his revenge is at hand. Rallying the Wood Elves to his side, he pushes onwards to find Morghur and sate his bloodlust. As the Elves edge forward, the path closes in around them and the moment of battle draws near...

missions.localised_description: With a zeal that could inspire any being, Orion breaks into the clearing and blasts the Horn of the Wild Hunt. With a crack of lightning, and the scream of several displaced spirits, the magical aura is purged, and the beast-path revealed. However, the Horn is entirely drained of energy, if only temporarily. Orion is unconcerned, however, as with the passage open, the moment of his revenge is at hand. Rallying the Wood Elves to his side, he pushes onwards to find Morghur and sate his bloodlust. As the Elves edge forward, the path closes in around them and the moment of battle draws near...

localised_description.last_approved_text: Orion and his forces rush to the defence of the Oak of Ages, and find the sole surviving warrior of the feast at the head of the rebel army - a traitor through-and-through. They explains how they were chosen by Anath Raema to be her champion. Having infiltrated the Oak of Ages, Anath Raema - Goddess of the Savage Hunt - planned to supplant Ariel and ascend to an Athel Loren shaped by her malicious desires. Orion's final act must be to destroy this Glade Lord and put Anath Raema's destructive desires to the sword once and for all.

missions.localised_description: Orion and his forces rush to the defence of the Oak of Ages, and find the sole surviving warrior of the feast at the head of the rebel army - a traitor through-and-through. They explains how they were chosen by Anath Raema to be her champion. Having infiltrated the Oak of Ages, Anath Raema - Goddess of the Savage Hunt - planned to supplant Ariel and ascend to an Athel Loren shaped by her malicious desires. Orion's final act must be to destroy this Glade Lord and put Anath Raema's destructive desires to the sword once and for all.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The forests of Athel Loren once again bloom into majesty, yet all is not well within the woods. Durthu wakes; once wise and kind, he is now twisted by ages of war and destruction beyond counting. His rage is limitless, his sorrow unbound. He exists now to protect the Deepwood against any and all interlopers and blackguards. He can sense them, swarming and encroaching upon its bounds. No tactless fool can be suffered to besmirch the sanctity of the forests. They must be crushed; they must ALL be crushed.

missions.localised_description: The forests of Athel Loren once again bloom into majesty, yet all is not well within the woods. Durthu wakes; once wise and kind, he is now twisted by ages of war and destruction beyond counting. His rage is limitless, his sorrow unbound. He exists now to protect the Deepwood against any and all interlopers and blackguards. He can sense them, swarming and encroaching upon its bounds. No tactless fool can be suffered to besmirch the sanctity of the forests. They must be crushed; they must ALL be crushed.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Though the interlopers have been extricated from the branches and brambles of the Deepwood, and now lie battered and bloodied across the marshes, their foul stench of decay and corruption lingers in the trees. Returning to the glade, Durthu is greeted only by haunted memories and perished spirits of his past. His sorrow and rage are tempered only by his understanding that something is terribly wrong within the Deepwood. There can be no delaying; he summons his loyal Treekin to him, intent on discovering the truth behind the forest's ailment.

missions.localised_description: Though the interlopers have been extricated from the branches and brambles of the Deepwood, and now lie battered and bloodied across the marshes, their foul stench of decay and corruption lingers in the trees. Returning to the glade, Durthu is greeted only by haunted memories and perished spirits of his past. His sorrow and rage are tempered only by his understanding that something is terribly wrong within the Deepwood. There can be no delaying; he summons his loyal Treekin to him, intent on discovering the truth behind the forest's ailment.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Durthu and his kin delve deeper into the forest, led by a growing sense of darkness and half-heard screams. As he continues exploring, the light filtering desperately through the canopy far above him, the screams and sounds of battle grow ever louder. As he marches further on, the restricting miasma of corruption and dread seeps into every pore of the forest, seeming almost to exude from the trees themselves. With increasing haste, Durthu pushes on...

missions.localised_description: Durthu and his kin delve deeper into the forest, led by a growing sense of darkness and half-heard screams. As he continues exploring, the light filtering desperately through the canopy far above him, the screams and sounds of battle grow ever louder. As he marches further on, the restricting miasma of corruption and dread seeps into every pore of the forest, seeming almost to exude from the trees themselves. With increasing haste, Durthu pushes on...

localised_description.last_approved_text: With Durthu's help, the Glade Guard scouts emerge victorious; the battlefield is littered with scattered limbs and Undead detritus. Though afeared of the lumbering, vengeful Ancient of the forest, the Guard nevertheless tell him that this force was but a fraction of a larger, more dangerous Undead horde that lurks not far from here. They advise caution and to wait for further Elven reinforcements, but Durthu knows better than these Asrai. Yet they cannot be wholly blamed for their ignorance - their lives are so fleeting compared to his; he has observed this a thousand times before and undoubtedly will a thousand more. No, there will be no waiting. He will move now, and strike this threat at the source - the Necromancer behind this will die, and his stumbling thralls will collapse like abandoned marionettes.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The High Realm of the Wood Elves, Modryn, has long languished in eternal shadow. No light pierces the dense canopy above, yet even in a land as darkened as this, a new and creeping sense of dread lingers. The Cloak of Isha, much revered relic of the goddess herself, is missing - presumed stolen. The Elves speak of dark omens and shadowy whispers pervading the Night Glens, and even Ariel herself feels the changing of the forest as surely as she feels the shifting of the season. The cloak must be returned and Athel Loren restored. To this end, she dispatches her consort-King, Orion, to lead the hunt. She also sends her most trusted of maidens, who know the forests almost as well as she does, to assist him. Together, they will find the source of this trouble. Indeed, they must, for all hangs in the balance...

missions.localised_description: The High Realm of the Wood Elves, Modryn, has long languished in eternal shadow. No light pierces the dense canopy above, yet even in a land as darkened as this, a new and creeping sense of dread lingers. The Cloak of Isha, much revered relic of the goddess herself, is missing - presumed stolen. The Elves speak of dark omens and shadowy whispers pervading the Night Glens, and even Ariel herself feels the changing of the forest as surely as she feels the shifting of the season. The cloak must be returned and Athel Loren restored. To this end, she dispatches her consort-King, Orion, to lead the hunt. She also sends her most trusted of maidens, who know the forests almost as well as she does, to assist him. Together, they will find the source of this trouble. Indeed, they must, for all hangs in the balance...

localised_description.last_approved_text: Nothing in Athel Loren escapes the notice of the Sisters of Thorn. They hear the whispers in the glades, the birdsong in the canopies, and everything in between. Before long, the Sisters locate a message bound for Modryn, and pluck it from its destination with the delicate hand of fate. The letter is most certainly alien to these parts; written and sealed with all manner of foul and forbidden glyphs and mannerisms. It undoubtedly belongs to the Cult of Pleasure; the worshippers of Slaanesh. The message speaks of their prowling of Athel Loren's glades, but nobody can know exactly where. Orion's rage is great. He is moments away from ordering the destruction of the glade, in order to find the interlopers, when the Sisters present an alternate plan. The letter hails from Bretonnia, tracing its source would enable its destination to be ascertained and much destruction avoided. After all, the devastation of Bretonnian lands is much preferable to that of Athel Loren.

missions.localised_description: Nothing in Athel Loren escapes the notice of the Sisters of Thorn. They hear the whispers in the glades, the birdsong in the canopies, and everything in between. Before long, the Sisters locate a message bound for Modryn, and pluck it from its destination with the delicate hand of fate. The letter is most certainly alien to these parts; written and sealed with all manner of foul and forbidden glyphs and mannerisms. It undoubtedly belongs to the Cult of Pleasure; the worshippers of Slaanesh. The message speaks of their prowling of Athel Loren's glades, but nobody can know exactly where. Orion's rage is great. He is moments away from ordering the destruction of the glade, in order to find the interlopers, when the Sisters present an alternate plan. The letter hails from Bretonnia, tracing its source would enable its destination to be ascertained and much destruction avoided. After all, the devastation of Bretonnian lands is much preferable to that of Athel Loren.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Much Bretonnian land is burned in the name of the truth, and Orion watches dispassionately as field after field is torched as part of his investigation. Eventually, in a mansion belonging to a 'Krueger', his scouts discover an unsent letter hidden in a secret chamber, addressed to a Glade Lord. If the letter is to be believed, the Cloak of Isha is to be given to the Cult of Pleasure in exchange for the Mark of Slaanesh. Orion is incensed; a Glade Lord, sworn to the defence of Athel Loren, plots against the forest and plans to usurp it! There is no time to waste, haste must be made back to the forest to confront this errant and treacherous Lord before it is too late!

missions.localised_description: Much Bretonnian land is burned in the name of the truth, and Orion watches dispassionately as field after field is torched as part of his investigation. If the letter is to be believed, the Cloak of Isha is to be given to the Cult of Pleasure in exchange for the Mark of Slaanesh. Orion is incensed; a Glade Lord, sworn to the defence of Athel Loren, plots against the forest and plans to usurp it! There is no time to waste, haste must be made back to the forest to confront this errant and treacherous Lord before it is too late!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Dark news reaches the court of Athel Loren; shadows loom on the outskirts of the forest, and the waystone fence is threatened. Outposts beyond the perimeter have not been heard from in many moons and are presumed lost, down to the last. Although Orion sped there with the wind at his back he found no evidence of who or what was responsible. Although the desire for revenge runs deep, he knows there can be no offensive against his enemies whilst Athel Loren lies vulnerable; the defences must be rebuilt before any vengeance can be taken. To the battlements!

missions.localised_description: Dark news reaches the court of Athel Loren; shadows loom on the outskirts of the forest, and the waystone fence is threatened. Outposts beyond the perimeter have not been heard from in many moons and are presumed lost, down to the last. Although Orion sped there with the wind at his back he found no evidence of who or what was responsible. Although the desire for revenge runs deep, he knows there can be no offensive against his enemies whilst Athel Loren lies vulnerable; the defences must be rebuilt before any vengeance can be taken. To the battlements!

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the perimeters of the forest secured, a relative sense of normality is restored to the forest. However, foulness still lurks beneath the trees, and Orion will see the source of it uncovered and eliminated. Reports reach the king that a herd of Beastmen, using the confusion sown by the attacks, slipped through the perimeter and defiled another waystone. Before he could intercept them, however, they used their hidden beast-paths to slink back into the undergrowth and, with all the subtlety they could muster, out of sight. However, Orion and his scouts detected the foul and pestilent aura of Dark Magic at the site of the Beastman raid - an aura that could belong to only one Beastman that Orion knows of: Morghur. As ill an omen as it is that the Master of Skulls is abroad, the lingering magical detritus provides an opportunity. If it can be analysed then it can be traced, and the enemies of the Elves can be brought to justice. To do this, however, the Spellsingers must be consulted...

missions.localised_description: With the perimeters of the forest secured, a relative sense of normality is restored to the forest. However, foulness still lurks beneath the trees, and Orion will see the source of it uncovered and eliminated. Reports reach the king that a herd of Beastmen, using the confusion sown by the attacks, slipped through the perimeter and defiled another waystone. Before he could intercept them, however, they used their hidden beast-paths to slink back into the undergrowth and, with all the subtlety they could muster, out of sight. However, Orion and his scouts detected the foul and pestilent aura of Dark Magic at the site of the Beastman raid - an aura that could belong to only one Beastman that Orion knows of: Morghur. As ill an omen as it is that the Master of Skulls is abroad, the lingering magical detritus provides an opportunity. If it can be analysed then it can be traced, and the enemies of the Elves can be brought to justice. To do this, however, the Spellsingers must be consulted...

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Spellsingers are mystical and arcane beings, and Orion does not profess to understand even half of what they do, yet he knows he must be patient as they do it. After days of pondering, enchanting and researching, the Spellsingers emerge, and present Orion with an ancient artefact, imbued with the essence of starwood pyre; the Horn of the Wild Hunt, Orion's treasured relic. A sharp blast will dispel the magical residue left behind by Morghur's minions and reveal the path back to his location. Orion is overjoyed, the burning desire for vengeance bubbling up in him as the moment of justice grows nearer. As if guided by the hand of fate itself, a report reaches him that another raid is taking place. Seizing his chance, he bounds off into the forest, the Horn in hand and his retinue close behind.

missions.localised_description: The Spellsingers are mystical and arcane beings, and Orion does not profess to understand even half of what they do, yet he knows he must be patient as they do it. localised_description.last_approved_text: Time marches ever onwards, Winter grows ever closer and with it the time of Orion's return to the Oak of Ages, and to renewal. The Wild Riders are charged with the sacred task of seeking out a new host to meet with Ariel. If she finds their choice to be appropriate, she will forge him into the new Orion, who will emerge from the Oak of Ages the following Spring. For this, the most sacred of hunts, the Wild Riders must be called and readied.

missions.localised_description: Time marches ever onwards, Winter grows ever closer and with it the time of Orion's return to the Oak of Ages, and to renewal. The Wild Riders are charged with the sacred task of seeking out a new host to meet with Ariel. If she finds their choice to be appropriate, she will forge him into the new Orion, who will emerge from the Oak of Ages the following Spring. For this, the most sacred of hunts, the Wild Riders must be called and readied.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Wild Riders have searched far and wide, returning with a number of young warriors they feel may please Ariel. Yet the Queen of Athel Loren demands, as ever, that all candidates be tested; put through a crucible of endurance to see who is most worthy. She sends them into the field to fight for the honour of her attention, yet knows others have a more sinister desire. Not all suitors can be trusted, and not all have altruism in their hearts - there are those who would see Orion reborn to their liking, for their own purposes. These evils must be rooted out and defeated, lest they send Athel Loren down the path of ruin.

missions.localised_description: The Wild Riders have searched far and wide, returning with a number of young warriors they feel may please Ariel. Yet the Queen of Athel Loren demands, as ever, that all candidates be tested; put through a crucible of endurance to see who is most worthy. She sends them into the field to fight for the honour of her attention, yet knows others have a more sinister desire. Not all suitors can be trusted, and not all have altruism in their hearts - there are those who would see Orion reborn to their liking, for their own purposes. These evils must be rooted out and defeated, lest they send Athel Loren down the path of ruin.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The suitors of Ariel return, battered but victorious, proud of their achievements in the field and eager to see if they will be chosen for rebirth as King in the Woods. Yet there are forces of darkness that would see this path curtailed all too quickly. A poison, vicious and cloying, flows through the candidates by means of tainted chalices. By morning, they are all as cold as winter's breath. All except one, who has vanished without trace. Athel Loren is in uproar; fear sets in like a deep chill, which shatters into panic when a rebel force reveals itself, advancing on the Oak of Ages. Enraged and alarmed, Orion rushes back to defend the Oak. Even as he feels his strength sapping away, he knows he must do this one last thing...

localised_description.last_approved_text: Belegar Ironhammer has made bold oaths to reclaim his lost kingdom. The fabled treasures of this legendary fortress should be returned to honest, noble Dawi hands. It is said that King Lunn himself sealed away the mighty hammer of the Angrund Clan and only a true heir shall reclaim it. Among Belegar's many oaths is a pledge to seek out the legendary hammer, but first the area must be purged of Greenskin filth so the search may begin unimpeded!

missions.localised_description: Belegar Ironhammer has made bold oaths to reclaim his lost kingdom. The fabled treasures of this legendary fortress should be returned to honest, noble Dawi hands. It is said that King Lunn himself sealed away the mighty hammer of the Angrund Clan and only a true heir shall reclaim it. Among Belegar's many oaths is a pledge to seek out the legendary hammer, but first the area must be purged of Greenskin filth so the search may begin unimpeded!

missions.localised_description: Belegar Ironhammer has made bold oaths to reclaim his lost kingdom. The fabled treasures of this legendary fortress should be returned to honest, noble Dawi hands. It is said that King Lunn himself sealed away the mighty hammer of the Angrund Clan and only a true heir shall reclaim it. Among Belegar's many oaths is a pledge to seek out the legendary hammer, but the first the area must be purged of foes so the search may begin unimpeded!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The path towards King Lunn's lost vault is cluttered with urks and other degenerate creatures. Belegar and his kin must rebuild the former glories of his Ancestors, Hold by Hold, using the bodies and blood of the hated Greenskins as their foundations!

missions.localised_description: The path towards King Lunn's lost vault is cluttered with urks and other degenerate creatures. Belegar and his kin must rebuild the former glories of his Ancestors, Hold by Hold, using the bodies and blood of the hated Greenskins as their foundations!

localised_description.last_approved_text: One of Belegar's doubters was the High King. Thorgrim wanted Eight Peaks back within the Karaz Ankor as much as any Dwarf, but thought the cost in kin and resources too high at this point. Yet Belegar's expedition and the tenacity of the Angrund Clan has impressed the High King. He sends a request to Karak Azul that their Angrund brothers be aided with stalwart Dwarf war machines.

missions.localised_description: One of Belegar's doubters was the High King. Thorgrim wanted Eight Peaks back within the Karaz Ankor as much as any Dwarf, but thought the cost in kin and resources too high at this point. Yet Belegar's expedition and the tenacity of the Angrund Clan has impressed the High King. He sends a request to Karak Azul that their Angrund brothers be aided with stalwart Dwarf war machines.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Thorek Ironbrow, the Master Runelord of Karak Azul, is as impressed with Ironhammer's progress as the High King is, and while the war machines from Azul's forges would no doubt be a boon in the wars to come, Thorek wants to do more to aid his kin. He reveals the location of the vault’s secret door to Belegar; King Lunn’s hammer will be in its rightful owner’s hands again soon enough.

missions.localised_description: Thorek Ironbrow, the Master Runelord of Karak Azul, is as impressed with Ironhammer's progress as the High King is, and while the war machines from Azul's forges would no doubt be a boon in the wars to come, Thorek wants to do more to aid his kin. He reveals the location of the vault’s secret door to Belegar; King Lunn’s hammer will be in its rightful owner’s hands again soon enough.

He reveals the location of the vault’s secret door to Belegar; King Lunn’s hammer will be in its rightful owner’s hands again soon enough.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Dwarfs of the Angrund Clan have a special hatred of urki and grobi, even more so than other Dawi, for it was the Greenskins -along with fell underground allies - that drove the descendants of King Lunn from Karak Eight Peaks, a Greathold whose majesty was eclipsed only by Everpeak itself. The entire Angrund Clan can trace their lineage back to King Lunn and all become outraged at the thought of those dark times.\n\nKing Belegar Ironhammer lives with this rage on a daily basis. He is the True King of Eight Peaks and his Clan's goal is to inhabit their mighty Dwarfhold once more. Even now, wherever Ironhammer holes up, trouble with the Greenskins seems to follow. Since the Chaos Moon arose, weeks prior, the raids have dramatically increased. It is not just Skarsnik's minions alone that attack - a new green-skinned enemy has entered the fray. Belegar orders his throng forth, as it is better to meet this fresh threat head on than hide meekly behind the barricades.

missions.localised_description: The Dwarfs of the Angrund Clan have a special hatred of urki and grobi, even more so than other Dawi, for it was the Greenskins -along with fell underground allies - that drove the descendants of King Lunn from Karak Eight Peaks, a Greathold whose majesty was eclipsed only by Everpeak itself. The entire Angrund Clan can trace their lineage back to King Lunn and all become outraged at the thought of those dark times.\n\nKing Belegar Ironhammer lives with this rage on a daily basis. He is the True King of Eight Peaks and his Clan's goal is to inhabit their mighty Dwarfhold once more. Even now, wherever Ironhammer holes up, trouble with the Greenskins seems to follow. Since the Chaos Moon arose, weeks prior, the raids have dramatically increased. It is not just Skarsnik's minions alone that attack - a new green-skinned enemy has entered the fray. Belegar orders his throng forth, as it is better to meet this fresh threat head on than hide meekly behind the barricades.

localised_description.last_approved_text: This should be a time of great celebration throughout the Karaz Ankor, for the urki and grobi have been scattered, their tribes have been broken and the World's Edge Mountains are free of their taint and ripe for reclamation by Dawi hands.\n\nYet for the Dwarfs of Clan Angrund, led by Belegar Ironhammer, Ancestor of King Lunn, there seems to be no respite. No matter how many times the Greenskins are crushed they seem to emerge again from under their fetid rocks. There have been reports of Greenskin activity on Death Pass and the Silver Road. If Belegar's throngs control these important trade routes, further investigation on where the urks are skulking could be undertaken.

missions.localised_description: This should be a time of great celebration throughout the Karaz Ankor, for the urki and grobi have been scattered, their tribes have been broken and the World's Edge Mountains are free of their taint and ripe for reclamation by Dawi hands.\n\nYet for the Dwarfs of Clan Angrund, led by Belegar Ironhammer, Ancestor of King Lunn, there seems to be no respite. No matter how many times the Greenskins are crushed they seem to emerge again from under their fetid rocks. There have been reports of Greenskin activity on Death Pass and the Silver Road. If Belegar's throngs control these important trade routes, further investigation on where the urks are skulking could be undertaken.

localised_description.last_approved_text: These Greenskin attacks are different to those Ironhammer has witnessed in his countless years fighting the urks. They seem more disciplined and better equipped than even Skarsnik's rabble. Answers must be sought. Belegar tasks one of his most trusted champions to hunt down, interrogate and then slay one of the Greenskin bosses. Any information this agent gleans will help counter the Greenskin threat.

missions.localised_description: These Greenskin attacks are different to those Ironhammer has witnessed in his countless years fighting the urks. They seem more disciplined and better equipped than even Skarsnik's rabble. Answers must be sought. Belegar tasks one of his most trusted champions to hunt down, interrogate and then slay one of the Greenskin bosses. Any information this agent gleans will help counter the Greenskin threat.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Belegar's champion returns with a trove of information. An Orc Warboss had taken Dawi he had found imprisoned deep under Black Crag and all but forgotten by their jailer, Gorfang Rotgut. The Warboss stole away the Dwarfs and, under enslavement, forced them to dig new passages within the Underway, secret to all but his own rabble of filthy Orcs.\n\nBelegar is outraged! He at once recognises the captive Dawi as kin - fine folk taken from Karak Azul in a raid years past. This is a fell deed that demands vengeance! However, Ironhammer knows it is not a grudge he can right on its own; King Kazador of Karak Azul still broods on this outrage and so must be informed at once. Dwarf tradition states that news of such great import be given with a surety - a bond between kings - so that no Dawi could doubt its severity. Belegar doesn't hesitate and sends his shield as his oath.

localised_description.last_approved_text: It is said that there is a whole chapter in the Dammaz Kron on Skarsnik, the self-proclaimed Warlord of the Eight Peaks. Both the Dwarfs and the Skaven despise him, and yet none doubt his supremacy over the region. The fact he has achieved such an iron grip, although merely a Night Goblin and not some brutal Orc, says more about his malign intelligence than any chapter in some stunties' silly book!\n\nDwarfs are stubborn, but even that fat fool at Everpeak at least acknowledges that the Eight Peaks are lost. Yet the Angrund Clan refuse to accept the status quo - they deny the truth, that their ancestral home is beyond their meagre, stunted grasp. Even now they are set on another foolish attempt to wrest control from Skarsnik! However, nothing escapes the eyes and ears of the Warlord. News of a fresh expedition quickly reaches him and in his unusually astute Greenskin brain another wicked plan is formulated. To begin, Skarsnik will send this new throng his personal ‘greetings’...

missions.localised_description: It is said that there is a whole chapter in the Dammaz Kron on Skarsnik, the self-proclaimed Warlord of the Eight Peaks. Both the Dwarfs and the Skaven despise him, and yet none doubt his supremacy over the region. The fact he has achieved such an iron grip, although merely a Night Goblin and not some brutal Orc, says more about his malign intelligence than any chapter in some stunties' silly book!\n\nDwarfs are stubborn, but even that fat fool at Everpeak at least acknowledges that the Eight Peaks are lost. Yet the Angrund Clan refuse to accept the status quo - they deny the truth, that their ancestral home is beyond their meagre, stunted grasp. Even now they are set on another foolish attempt to wrest control from Skarsnik! However, nothing escapes the eyes and ears of the Warlord. News of a fresh expedition quickly reaches him and in his unusually astute Greenskin brain another wicked plan is formulated. To begin, Skarsnik will send this new throng his personal ‘greetings’...

localised_description.last_approved_text: It is said that there is a whole chapter in the Dammaz Kron on Skarsnik, the self-proclaimed Warlord of the Eight Peaks. Both the Dwarfs and the Skaven despise him, and yet none doubt his supremacy over the region. The fact he has achieved such an iron grip, although merely a Night Goblin and not some brutal Orc, says more about his malign intelligence than any chapter in some stunties' silly book!\n\nThe Angrund Clan is no more. However, that doesn’t mean Skarsnik can sit safely on his throne of rat skulls. Many covet the lost valuables buried deep in the ancient Dwarf citadel. However, nothing escapes the eyes and ears of the Warlord. News of an enemy treasure-seeking expedition quickly reaches him and a wicked plan begins to form within the chief gobbo’s mind. For starters, Skarsnik will send his regards to the homelands of those who seek to steal from his domain!

localised_description.last_approved_text: While the stunties are distracted by the loss of their pathetic Lord, Skarsnik's forces storm through the Peaks, raiding and destroying anything in sight. This is Skarsnik’s way, a method tempered through years of dealing with the power-hungry Orcs that have tried to take his throne: perceive the threat and then utterly destroy the foe before it can act against you!

missions.localised_description: While the stunties are distracted by the loss of their pathetic Lord, Skarsnik's forces storm through the Peaks, raiding and destroying anything in sight. This is Skarsnik’s way, a method tempered through years of dealing with the power-hungry Orcs that have tried to take his throne: perceive the threat and then utterly destroy the foe before it can act against you!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Whether the Karaz Ankor functions or not, no Dwarf could sit idle while Skarsnik’s hordes raided across the mountains. Valaya would weep tears of blood if such a thing was left unchallenged, and so the Dwarfs, or their remnants, muster.\n\nOf course, this was what Skarsnik desired all along. It is but another of his ‘sneaky schemes’. By cunning placement of his gobbo scouts, the stunties are lured to Death Pass, where the bulk of his horde lies in wait to ambush them. All that is needed now is the appearance of the Warlord himself!

missions.localised_description: Whether the Karaz Ankor functions or not, no Dwarf could sit idle while Skarsnik’s hordes raided across the mountains. Valaya would weep tears of blood if such a thing was left unchallenged, and so the Dwarfs, or their remnants, muster.\n\nOf course, this was what Skarsnik desired all along. It is but another of his ‘sneaky schemes’. By cunning placement of his gobbo scouts, the stunties are lured to Death Pass, where the bulk of his horde lies in wait to ambush them. All that is needed now is the appearance of the Warlord himself!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Well that was exhausting! It was a sight to warm Skarsnik's rotten heart - to see the Dwarfs scatter with their beards between their little legs! However, the Goblin boss can't help brood - how can he impose his will if an Orc has a better reach? Maybe he needs a long stick like those wizards always carry around with them? While he ponders on the problem, his best 'recruiterz' are sent to bolster the horde, as a few were killed during the fight. The Warlord demands they be replaced by 'somefing arder dan Orcs'.

missions.localised_description: Well that was exhausting! It was a sight to warm Skarsnik's rotten heart - to see the Dwarfs scatter with their beards between their little legs! However, the Goblin boss can't help brood - how can he impose his will if an Orc has a better reach? Maybe he needs a long stick like those wizards always carry around with them? While he ponders on the problem, his best 'recruiterz' are sent to bolster the horde, as a few were killed during the fight. The Warlord demands they be replaced by 'somefing arder dan Orcs'.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Dwarfs are returning - the fools want another go and don't know when they're beaten! This gives the Warlord another idea, he takes a wicked-lookin' halberd from his pile of shiny stuff. It may have belonged to a humie wizard or one of them long-eared gits - he cares not. Skarsnik summons Kruggler, his most 'trusted' hench-gobbo, and orders him to the battlefield before the Dwarfs' second attack. There he must smear the new 'prodder' in the spent blood of the stunties littering the ground. Skarsnik will follow with an army and collect his new extra pointy, extra nasty prodder after the fight!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Badlands have always been, well… bad. In the past, it was a realm of several dark and doomed empires, but now it is an arid backwater dominated by the Greenskins. The Orcs and Goblins thrive in this forsaken place. It was the birthplace of many a Waaagh! that has gone on to devastate Dwarf and humie kingdoms alike. While a Waaagh! can occur ‘naturally’ sometimes these things need a catalyst. For years, that catalyst has been Wurrzag, 'Da Great Green Prophet'. \n\nHowever, word has reached the Savage Orc Shaman that some gobbo in the south is claiming to be the new prophet, denouncing Wurrzag as an "air-a-tick" and "pretenda"! Now that is fightin’ talk! Wurrzag immediately gathers loyal believers around him to put down this false prophet and prove he is the one and only true voice of da Green Godz!

missions.localised_description: The Badlands have always been, well… bad. In the past, it was a realm of several dark and doomed empires, but now it is an arid backwater dominated by the Greenskins. The Orcs and Goblins thrive in this forsaken place. It was the birthplace of many a Waaagh! that has gone on to devastate Dwarf and humie kingdoms alike. While a Waaagh! can occur ‘naturally’ sometimes these things need a catalyst. For years, that catalyst has been Wurrzag, 'Da Great Green Prophet'. \n\nHowever, word has reached the Savage Orc Shaman that some gobbo in the south is claiming to be the new prophet, denouncing Wurrzag as an "air-a-tick" and "pretenda"! Now that is fightin’ talk! Wurrzag immediately gathers loyal believers around him to put down this false prophet and prove he is the one and only true voice of da Green Godz!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The false prophet is intimidated by Wurrzag's support, but the crafty little git is not defeated yet. One of his followers is sent to slay Wurrzag, but you don’t get to be Mork and Gork’s best mate if you could be so easily shiv'd! Wurrzag foils the attack with ease but the minion makes a decent run for it before he can be severely slapp’d.\n\nHowever, it turns out the would-be killer was merely a diversion! While the Shaman was dealing with the assassin, his mask - the one with the baleful glare, an important part of his mantle as da Great Green Prophet - is stolen. There can only be one culprit - this infuriating Gobbo with delusions of grandeur. The mask and its thief must be found at all costs!

missions.localised_description: The false prophet is intimidated by Wurrzag's support, but the crafty little git is not defeated yet. One of his followers is sent to slay Wurrzag, but you don’t get to be Mork and Gork’s best mate if you could be so easily shiv'd! Wurrzag foils the attack with ease but the minion makes a decent run for it before he can be severely slapp’d.\n\nHowever, it turns out the would-be killer was merely a diversion! While the Shaman was dealing with the assassin, his mask - the one with the baleful glare, an important part of his mantle as da Great Green Prophet - is stolen. There can only be one culprit - this infuriating Gobbo with delusions of grandeur. The mask and its thief must be found at all costs!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The false prophet is intimidated by Wurrzag's support, but the crafty little git is not defeated yet. One of his followers is sent to slay Wurrzag, but you don’t get to be Mork and Gork’s best mate if you could be so easily shiv'd! Wurrzag foils the attack with ease but the minion makes a decent run for it before he can be severely slapp’d.\n\nHowever, it turns out the would-be killer was merely a diversion! While the Shaman was dealing with the assassin, his mask - the one with the baleful glare, an important part of his mantle as da Great Green Prophet - is stolen. There can only be one culprit - this infuriating gobbo with delusions of grandeur. The mask and its thief must be found at all costs! This is a difficult task, since the Greenskin tribes have been scattered, yet if Wurrzag can control the swathes of the Badlands, he'll be able to find the mask and set about reassembling the Waaagh!, as after all that is what Gork and Mork put him on this world to do.

missions.localised_description: The false prophet is intimidated by Wurrzag's support, but the crafty little git is not defeated yet. One of his followers is sent to slay Wurrzag, but you don’t get to be Mork and Gork’s best mate if you could be so easily shiv'd! Wurrzag foils the attack with ease but the minion makes a decent run for it before he can be severely slapp’d.\n\nHowever, it turns out the would-be killer was merely a diversion! While the Shaman was dealing with the assassin, his mask - the one with the baleful glare, an important part of his mantle as da Great Green Prophet - is stolen. There can only be one culprit - this infuriating gobbo with delusions of grandeur. The mask and its thief must be found at all costs! This is a difficult task, since the Greenskin tribes have been scattered, yet if Wurrzag can control the swathes of the Badlands, he'll be able to find the mask and set about reassembling the Waaagh!, as after all that is what Gork and Mork put him on this world to do.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Savage Orc Shaman’s forces rage across the land. But the false prophet has gone to ground, along with Wurrzag's mask. However, Da Great Green Prophet is not out of options just yet; someone knows where the Goblin is hiding and if piety to da 'tru' prophet doesn’t motivate them to talk, then some teef or a few shiny trinkets put in an Orc’s hand should do the job. Of course, there are other ways too, but Wurrzag thinks it best to try the carrot before he gets out the stick or, in his case, the extra pointy stabba!

missions.localised_description: The Savage Orc Shaman’s forces rage across the land. But the false prophet has gone to ground, along with Wurrzag's mask. However, Da Great Green Prophet is not out of options just yet; someone knows where the Goblin is hiding and if piety to da 'tru' prophet doesn’t motivate them to talk, then some teef or a few shiny trinkets put in an Orc’s hand should do the job. Of course, there are other ways too, but Wurrzag thinks it best to try the carrot before he gets out the stick or, in his case, the extra pointy stabba!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Wurrzag acts on the information taken from the bribed - and now eaten - Goblin. Yet Wurrzag isn’t some dense Squig - he is kunning, and isn’t going blunder into a trap set by the false prophet. So he sends one of his followers instead. If it isn’t a lure and the information is genuine, Wurrzag will follow with his horde and rain down righteous fists on the lying, conniving mask-stealin’ git!

missions.localised_description: Wurrzag acts on the information taken from the bribed - and now eaten - Goblin. If it isn’t a lure and the information is genuine, Wurrzag will follow with his horde and rain down righteous fists on the lying, conniving mask-stealin’ git!

If it isn’t a lure and the information is genuine, Wurrzag will follow with his horde and rain down righteous fists on the lying, conniving mask-stealin’ git!

missions.localised_description: Wurrzag acts on the information taken from the bribed - and now eaten - Goblin. Yet Wurrzag isn’t some dense Squig - he is kunning, and isn’t going blunder into a trap set by the false prophet. So he sends one of his followers instead. If it isn’t a lure and the information is genuine, Wurrzag will follow with his horde and rain down righteous fists on the lying, conniving mask-stealin’ git!

localised_description.last_approved_text:
When the Green Godz call upon their prophet they care not for the Shaman’s availability, whether he’s visiting da dropz, in the middle of a battle or simply prancing around the campfire. When Gork or Mork calls, Wurrzag will fall into a trance that can last minutes, hours, even days!

Wurrzag has fallen into such a trance. Luckily he was nowhere near da drops, but in the midst of chomping on a Snotling when a particularly powerful vision struck. All night, Wurrzag remained silent and still, the half-eaten Snotling frantically trying to prise the Savage Orc’s jaws apart. When the Shaman came to, and finally emptied his mouth with a big gulp, he immediately gathered the tribe and told them of what he had seen. It was a vision of confusing sights - blood and death, ruined Dwarf Halls, a group of smug humie adventurers, and a mountain passage of black rock and fire.

Most Orcs look confused, but Wurrzag is enthused with a sense of purpose. While not entirely sure what that exact purpose is, he is convinced that the lands before the Black Mountains should be taken in Gork's… or Mork’s name.

When the Green Godz call upon their prophet they care not for the Shaman’s availability, whether he’s visiting da dropz, in the middle of a battle or simply prancing around the campfire. When Gork or Mork calls, Wurrzag will fall into a trance that can last minutes, hours, even days!

Wurrzag has fallen into such a trance. Luckily he was nowhere near da drops, but in the midst of chomping on a Snotling when a particularly powerful vision struck. All night, Wurrzag remained silent and still, the half-eaten Snotling frantically trying to prise the Savage Orc’s jaws apart. When the Shaman came to, and finally emptied his mouth with a big gulp, he immediately gathered the tribe and told them of what he had seen. Most Orcs look confused, but Wurrzag is enthused with a sense of purpose. While not entirely sure what that exact purpose is, he is convinced that the lands before the Black Mountains should be taken in Gork's… or Mork’s name.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As Wurrzag’s influence spreads towards the petty fiefs of the Border Princes, the Shaman has another vision. Once more he sees that mountain pass of light and dark, fire and blackness. At its centre stands a Shaman, waving a staff of bone, green energy channelling through the staff, coruscating around the Orc and flooding into the creature’s eyes. Who is this Shaman? A threat or an ally?\n\nAnswers must be sought, but they will not be found on the battlefield or in the razed towns of the humies. Wurrzag needs a special space to commune with his masters and seek further understanding.

missions.localised_description: As Wurrzag’s influence spreads towards the petty fiefs of the Border Princes, the Shaman has another vision. Once more he sees that mountain pass of light and dark, fire and blackness. At its centre stands a Shaman, waving a staff of bone, green energy channelling through the staff, coruscating around the Orc and flooding into the creature’s eyes. Who is this Shaman? A threat or an ally?\n\nAnswers must be sought, but they will not be found on the battlefield or in the razed towns of the humies. Wurrzag needs a special space to commune with his masters and seek further understanding.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The crooked moon appeared in the sky for many nights, its baleful grin seen clearly by the tribe. Is it Gork or Mork’s face in the green moon? Depends which tribe you ask. Some boyz wanted to query Wurrzag about it, but none dare enter his hovel, for to disturb him would surely invite great doom.\n\nDa Prophet finally emerged from his ramshackle hut, pulling away the fetid hide that covered the doorway, revealing himself to the tribe. The Greenskins gathered, keen to hear what da Godz' desire. According to Wurrzag, it is to Blackfire Pass they must go, and the Shaman in the prophet’s vision is, of course, Wurrzag himself, imbued with power from Mork’s breath. The prophet immediately dispatches one of his most trusted disciples to Blackfire Pass, to make sure the humies or the stunties aren’t camping in it to cause Wurrzag bother.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Wurrzag is fond of his Squiggly Beast, in so much as an Orc can be affectionate towards anything. The beast was once a rival Shaman in the Bone Nose tribe until magical energy arched from Wurrzag’s eyes. The green lightning struck the Shaman and instantly transformed him into the Squiggly Beast that has been his companion ever since. Da Great Green Prophet will often pet it while deep in contemplation, deciphering the visions of the Green Godz, or set the beast on the Snotling herds and watch dispassionately as it happily munches through several swarms.\n\nAnd so when Wurrzag woke from a deep trance to find the Squiggly Beast had gone missing, he was not at all pleased. There was a rage and anger there that even Grimgor could not match. Magical energy flicked across the Savage Orc Shaman’s eyes - the Squiggly Beast had to be found or another member of the tribe would unwittingly become Wurrzag’s new pet!

missions.localised_description: Wurrzag is fond of his Squiggly Beast, in so much as an Orc can be affectionate towards anything. The beast was once a rival Shaman in the Bone Nose tribe until magical energy arched from Wurrzag’s eyes. The green lightning struck the Shaman and instantly transformed him into the Squiggly Beast that has been his companion ever since. Da Great Green Prophet will often pet it while deep in contemplation, deciphering the visions of the Green Godz, or set the beast on the Snotling herds and watch dispassionately as it happily munches through several swarms.\n\nAnd so when Wurrzag woke from a deep trance to find the Squiggly Beast had gone missing, he was not at all pleased. There was a rage and anger there that even Grimgor could not match. Magical energy flicked across the Savage Orc Shaman’s eyes - the Squiggly Beast had to be found or another member of the tribe would unwittingly become Wurrzag’s new pet!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Wurrzag’s beloved Squiggly Beast remains lost. Those he sent cower before him as he rants about their abject failure and how they displease Gork and Mork. One, while remaining cowed by the Prophet’s anger, does raise the possibility of a lead. During his search he noticed that many Squig herds have also gone missing. Wurrzag dismisses them all with a strong cuff to the head with his staff. However, he does agree that missing Squig herds cannot be a coincidence. He decides to hire some "professionalz" to get to the bottom of this mystery, and who better than those Squig Hoppers who have just lost their Squigs?

missions.localised_description: Wurrzag’s beloved Squiggly Beast remains lost. Those he sent cower before him as he rants about their abject failure and how they displease Gork and Mork. One, while remaining cowed by the Prophet’s anger, does raise the possibility of a lead. During his search he noticed that many Squig herds have also gone missing. Wurrzag dismisses them all with a strong cuff to the head with his staff. However, he does agree that missing Squig herds cannot be a coincidence. He decides to hire some "professionalz" to get to the bottom of this mystery, and who better than those Squig Hoppers who have just lost their Squigs?

localised_description.last_approved_text: Those Night Goblins who were recently robbed of their Squigs wander the land on the trail of their missing mounts. They are gone for a while, but on their return bring news that an especially cunning gobbo had tried to rustle a large herd of Cave Squigs from the Tattered Ear Night Goblins. The rustler was fought off and went to ground at one of two possible locations before he could be caught, hog-tied and brought to Wurrzag.\n\nThis is all the information that Wurrzag requires. He demands that his followers raid the settlements and find his Squiggly Beast, or the git who’s dared to steal ‘im!

He demands that his followers find his Squiggly Beast, or the git who’s dared to steal ‘im!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The rustler is found! The trembling gobbo is bought before Wurrzag whose anger has cooled to a steely need for vengeance. The Goblin speaks, terrified as to what fate the Green Prophet has install for him. It turns out that he works for a Goblin Warboss known as Gashtoof, who has discovered a unique fungus patch that feeds off a chunk of "glowy green rock". Once the mushrooms from this patch are given to the ever-hungry Squigs, they grow in size and become even more vicious!\n\nGashtoof has been sending out minions to capture as many Squigs as possible, so he may range an army of 'soopa-Squigs'! Wurrzag decides to let the Goblin off lightly by merely roasting him alive. He is now ready to face Gashtoof and sends a willing follower out to find the Squig army.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Seen as an oath unfulfilled, and a sore point for all Dwarfs, the loss of Karak Eight Peaks was a low point for the Karaz Ankor. Since its fall many Dwarfs have tried, and failed, to reconquer it - Belegar is the latest of these who has dedicated his life to reclaiming this famous Hold. As a direct descendant of the last ruler of Karak Eight peaks, Belegar, and all those in Clan Angrund, consider its occupation their greatest grudge.

missions.localised_description: Seen as an oath unfulfilled, and a sore point for all Dwarfs, the loss of Karak Eight Peaks was a low point for the Karaz Ankor. Since its fall many Dwarfs have tried, and failed, to reconquer it - Belegar is the latest of these who has dedicated his life to reclaiming this famous Hold. As a direct descendant of the last ruler of Karak Eight peaks, Belegar, and all those in Clan Angrund, consider its occupation their greatest grudge.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Angrund Clan is beset by tribulation. Far from their Ancestral home, and with little of their former power, they nevertheless cling to hope. Angrund strength endures in Belegar; aided by the spirits of his restless, vengeful Ancestors, and supported by allied Clans, he will see the Dwarfs’ glory restored!

missions.localised_description: The Angrund Clan is beset by tribulation. Far from their Ancestral home, and with little of their former power, they nevertheless cling to hope. Angrund strength endures in Belegar; aided by the spirits of his restless, vengeful Ancestors, and supported by allied Clans, he will see the Dwarfs’ glory restored!

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the Time of Woes a distant memory, the Dwarfs should look to the future and the restoration of the Karaz Ankor. The more territory around and even beyond their traditional mountain homes the Dwarfs can claim, the more the Ancestors will be pleased.

missions.localised_description: With the Time of Woes a distant memory, the Dwarfs should look to the future and the restoration of the Karaz Ankor. The more territory around and even beyond their traditional mountain homes the Dwarfs can claim, the more the Ancestors will be pleased.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Dwarf expeditionary forces are a brave and vital element of the Dwarf military - they can roam far and secure Holds in the name of their race's glory. Grudges will be wiped from the Dammaz Kron, and the Dwarfs will once again know their rightful glory!

missions.localised_description: The Dwarf expeditionary forces are a brave and vital element of the Dwarf military - they can roam far and secure Holds in the name of their race's glory. Grudges will be wiped from the Dammaz Kron, and the Dwarfs will once again know their rightful glory!

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter III: One Dwarfhold at a Time

missions.localised_title: Chapter III: One Dwarfhold at a Time

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Angrund Clan will know greatness again; Belegar has declared it and his is a fierce and renowned determination. A Dwarf's oath is his honour, and his word his bond. The regions outside of Dawi control must be reclaimed, and made part of their dominion as soon as possible.

missions.localised_description: The Angrund Clan will know greatness again; Belegar has declared it and his is a fierce and renowned determination. A Dwarf's oath is his honour, and his word his bond. The regions outside of Dawi control must be reclaimed, and made part of their dominion as soon as possible.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Not since Valaya and Grungni strode the mountains have the Dawi been in such a positon. A few more realms taken will see the Karaz Ankor restored to its rightful stature - an empire ruled by those who have committed their all to see it restored, enduring as the mountains themselves. One last push, brave Dawi, one final push...

missions.localised_description: Not since Valaya and Grungni strode the mountains have the Dawi been in such a positon. A few more realms taken will see the Karaz Ankor restored to its rightful stature - an empire ruled by those who have committed their all to see it restored, enduring as the mountains themselves. One last push, brave Dawi, one final push...

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter V: A Second Golden Age

missions.localised_title: Chapter V: A Second Golden Age

localised_description.last_approved_text: Skarsnik is the self-styled 'Warlord of the Eight Peaks', sat atop a Dwarf throne, laying waste to all who challenge his dominion. Now he finds himself in the west, with the humies and stunties between him and his mountains. Might as well wreak some havoc on the way back, eh?

missions.localised_description: Skarsnik is the self-styled 'Warlord of the Eight Peaks', sat atop a Dwarf throne, laying waste to all who challenge his dominion. Now he finds himself in the west, with the humies and stunties between him and his mountains. Might as well wreak some havoc on the way back, eh?

localised_description.last_approved_text: If the Greenskins are going to fear Skarsnik - and they should - then he must use his influence and build up a great green horde to launch an invasion and crush all his enemies. The local tribes must fall into line or get a proper bootin'!

missions.localised_description: If the Greenskins are going to fear Skarsnik - and they should - then he must use his influence and build up a great green horde to launch an invasion and crush all his enemies. The local tribes must fall into line or get a proper bootin'!

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter II: Get da Gits in Order

missions.localised_title: Chapter II: Get da Gits in Order

localised_description.last_approved_text: It's time to stop messing around and put the boot in! The Badlands, the World's Edge, the Empire - all of it belongs to the Greenskins! Destroy the trespassers, take their lands and get the Waaagh! started.

missions.localised_description: It's time to stop messing around and put the boot in! The Badlands, the World's Edge, the Empire - all of it belongs to the Greenskins! Destroy the trespassers, take their lands and get the Waaagh! started.

localised_title.last_approved_text: Chapter III: Put da Boot In

missions.localised_title: Chapter III: Put da Boot In

localised_description.last_approved_text: The momentum shifts as the Orc realms expand. The Dwarfs quail, the Empire shudders, even the forces of Chaos stutter as the Green Tide rises. Now is the time to bring outlying territories into the clutches of the scheming, devilish Skarsnik.

missions.localised_description: The momentum shifts as the Orc realms expand. The Dwarfs quail, the Empire shudders, even the forces of Chaos stutter as the Green Tide rises. Now is the time to bring outlying territories into the clutches of the scheming, devilish Skarsnik.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A Waaagh! is happening! The Orcs gather in great numbers - they must bring as many regions as possible must under the Greenskins' control - such an act will appease Gork and Mork and ensure that Skarsnik's name is revered for all time!

missions.localised_description: A Waaagh! is happening! The Orcs gather in great numbers - they must bring as many regions as possible must under the Greenskins' control - such an act will appease Gork and Mork and ensure that Skarsnik's name is revered for all time!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Wurrzag does not call any one place home, yet wherever he decides to roam is his dominion. He inspires otherwise wretched and useless gangs of Greenskins to greatness in all corners of the earth, and charges them with achieving greatness across the Badlands and beyond. Or else.

missions.localised_description: Wurrzag does not call any one place home, yet wherever he decides to roam is his dominion. He inspires otherwise wretched and useless gangs of Greenskins to greatness in all corners of the earth, and charges them with achieving greatness across the Badlands and beyond. Or else.

localised_description.last_approved_text: If the Greenskins are going to fear Wurrzag - and they should - then he must use his influence and build up a great green horde to launch an invasion to crush all enemies in the name of Gork (or Mork). The local tribes must fall into line or get a proper bootin'!

missions.localised_description: If the Greenskins are going to fear Wurrzag - and they should - then he must use his influence and build up a great green horde to launch an invasion to crush all enemies in the name of Gork (or Mork). The local tribes must fall into line or get a proper bootin'!
