missions.localised_title: Chapter III: Put da Boot In

localised_description.last_approved_text: The momentum shifts as the Orc realms expand. The Dwarfs quail, the Empire shudders, even the forces of Chaos stutter as the Green Tide rises. Now is the time to bring outlying territories into the clutches of 'Da Great Green Prophet'.

missions.localised_description: The momentum shifts as the Orc realms expand. The Dwarfs quail, the Empire shudders, even the forces of Chaos stutter as the Green Tide rises. Now is the time to bring outlying territories into the clutches of 'Da Great Green Prophet'.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A Waaagh! is upon us. The Orcs gather in great numbers and so as many regions as possible must be brought under the Greenskins' control - such an act will appease Gork and Mork and ensure that da Great Green Godz are revered for all time!

missions.localised_description: A Waaagh! is upon us. The Orcs gather in great numbers and so as many regions as possible must be brought under the Greenskins' control - such an act will appease Gork and Mork and ensure that da Great Green Godz are revered for all time!

localised_description.last_approved_text: At the foot of the mountains the Greenskins lurk, a vile blemish on the Peaks the Dwarfs once called home. It seems the grobi have been gathered to see off another foe inhabiting the dark, but upon coming across Belegar's expedition they quickly deploy for battle - keen to munch on Dawi bones! The would-be King of Eight Peaks is not about to suffer defeat this close to his birthright, with the mighty hammer lying just out of reach in the vault beyond!

missions.localised_description: At the foot of the mountains the Greenskins lurk, a vile blemish on the Peaks the Dwarfs once called home. It seems the grobi have been gathered to see off another foe inhabiting the dark, but upon coming across Belegar's expedition they quickly deploy for battle - keen to munch on Dawi bones! The would-be King of Eight Peaks is not about to suffer defeat this close to his birthright, with the mighty hammer lying just out of reach in the vault beyond!

localised_description.last_approved_text: A throng from Karak Azul is on its way. With them they carry Belegar's shield as a sign of trust, gratitude and alliance. Ironhammer's forces immediately begin preparations for war, sealing the new portals created by the Dawi prisoners to trap the Orc Warboss' mobs within the ruined halls of the Ancestors. With the throng of Karak Azul close, it is time to strike before the Greenskins can slip away unavenged!

missions.localised_description: A throng from Karak Azul is on its way. With them they carry Belegar's shield as a sign of trust, gratitude and alliance. Ironhammer's forces immediately begin preparations for war, sealing the new portals created by the Dawi prisoners to trap the Orc Warboss' mobs within the ruined halls of the Ancestors. With the throng of Karak Azul close, it is time to strike before the Greenskins can slip away unavenged!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The trap is set - the stunties will not know what has hit them! Unleash the beasts, send forth Skarsnik’s hordes! The Goblin Warlord points the way, only then noticing that his reach isn’t quite impressive enough. If only he had something to prod and point with...

missions.localised_description: The trap is set - the stunties will not know what has hit them! Unleash the beasts, send forth Skarsnik’s hordes! The Goblin Warlord points the way, only then noticing that his reach isn’t quite impressive enough. If only he had something to prod and point with...

localised_description.last_approved_text: With Kruggler already at the battle site, busy preparing Skarsnik's new prodder, the Warlord gathers his horde to go and collect it. Slaughtering a few more stunties on arrival, he pauses for the briefest of thoughts: life is good when you're mean and green!

missions.localised_description: With Kruggler already at the battle site, busy preparing Skarsnik's new prodder, the Warlord gathers his horde to go and collect it. Slaughtering a few more stunties on arrival, he pauses for the briefest of thoughts: life is good when you're mean and green!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Turns out, the information was correct. The false prophet has been found, it is time to put an end to this gobbo’s sacrilege, get the mask back and show the git who the real Prophet of the Waaagh! is. Wurrzag’s followers are desperate for bloodshed and to bring the wrath of Mork an' Gork on the actual "pretenda". Best not disappoint them.

missions.localised_description: Turns out, the information was correct. The false prophet has been found, it is time to put an end to this gobbo’s sacrilege, get the mask back and show the git who the real Prophet of the Waaagh! is. Wurrzag’s followers are desperate for bloodshed and to bring the wrath of Mork an' Gork on the actual "pretenda". Best not disappoint them.

localised_description.last_approved_text: If Wurrzag’s army had marched straight through the pass instead of halting in the Border Princes for Mork-knows-how-long while he had a long trance, then who knows what state the southern Empire would be in now? As it is, the time spent loitering allowed the Empire to not only get wind of the oncoming attack, but to prepare a defensive force and trap the Greenskins in Blackfire pass, as they have done countless times throughout history.\n\nWurrzag is unperturbed, even when his spies inform him that a vanguard of the Empire's heroes - fresh from questing in a nearby dungeon - have sworn to bring the Savage Orc Shaman’s head directly to Karl Franz. Wurrzag smiles his most crooked grin, these are the gits from his vision, all that time ago. Once they are dead, his staff of bone will be imbued with Mork’s breath. He knows this; he has already seen it!

missions.localised_description: If Wurrzag’s army had marched straight through the pass instead of halting in the Border Princes for Mork-knows-how-long while he had a long trance, then who knows what state the southern Empire would be in now? As it is, the time spent loitering allowed the Empire to not only get wind of the oncoming attack, but to prepare a defensive force and trap the Greenskins in Blackfire pass, as they have done countless times throughout history.\n\nWurrzag is unperturbed, even when his spies inform him that a vanguard of the Empire's heroes - fresh from questing in a nearby dungeon - have sworn to bring the Savage Orc Shaman’s head directly to Karl Franz. Wurrzag smiles his most crooked grin, these are the gits from his vision, all that time ago. Once they are dead, his staff of bone will be imbued with Mork’s breath. He knows this; he has already seen it!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The follower finds it surprisingly easy to locate Gashtooth’s army of soopa-Squigs in the Grey Mountains. The Goblin Warlord obviously feels cocky enough to take on the wrath of Gork and Mork’s chosen prophet. The Savage Orc Shaman orders his horde to move on Gashtooth’s forces - he wants his Squiggly Beast back!

missions.localised_description: The follower finds it surprisingly easy to locate Gashtooth’s army of soopa-Squigs in the Grey Mountains. The Goblin Warlord obviously feels cocky enough to take on the wrath of Gork and Mork’s chosen prophet. The Savage Orc Shaman orders his horde to move on Gashtooth’s forces - he wants his Squiggly Beast back!

localised_description.last_approved_text: My lord, the dukes of Bretonnia have resided under a chivalrous code for many years. Honour this tradition, build upon the great foundations of Gilles le Breton, and lead the Knightly Orders forward, to glory!

missions.localised_description: My lord, the dukes of Bretonnia have resided under a chivalrous code for many years. Honour this tradition, build upon the great foundations of Gilles le Breton, and lead the Knightly Orders forward, to glory!

localised_description.last_approved_text: My lord, the dukes of Bretonnia have resided under a chivalrous code for many years. Honour this tradition, build upon the great foundations of Gilles le Breton, and lead the Knightly Orders forward, to glory!

missions.localised_description: My lord, the dukes of Bretonnia have resided under a chivalrous code for many years. Honour this tradition, build upon the great foundations of Gilles le Breton, and lead the Knightly Orders forward, to glory!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Our lands prosper under your chivalrous rule, yet evil still breeds in every corner. Many look to destroy Bretonnia, and their power grows as quickly as our own. Stave off their advances and unite the banners of Bretonnia with your chivalric actions!

missions.localised_description: Our lands prosper under your chivalrous rule, yet evil still breeds in every corner. Many look to destroy Bretonnia, and their power grows as quickly as our own. Stave off their advances and unite the banners of Bretonnia with your chivalric actions!

missions.localised_description: Our lands prosper under your chivalrous rule, yet evil still breeds in every corner. Many look to destroy Bretonnia, and their power grows as quickly as our own. Stave off their advances and unite the banners of Bretonnia with your chivalric actions!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Bretonnia flowers in true splendour - tales shall be told of your chivalric deeds for years to come. As our borders expand so our code of chivalry spreads with it. Do not relent, for Bretonnia will be the beacon of light in this ever crumbling world.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Alberic of Bordeleaux has dreamed of a life spent questing, yet when his father died he was thrust unexpectedly into the dukedom and has never been able to relinquish the awesome responsibility bestowed upon him. Yet opportunity has arisen at last in the form of dire tidings; the ancestral tomb of the Bordeleaux dukes has been ransacked and amongst the items stolen is the Trident of Manann, said to be descended from the God of the Sea himself. Although horrified, Alberic is also instilled with an excitement. He knows he must rescue the relic and restore safety to the dukedom, and so must investigate personally...

missions.localised_description: Alberic of Bordeleaux has dreamed of a life spent questing, yet when his father died he was thrust unexpectedly into the dukedom and has never been able to relinquish the awesome responsibility bestowed upon him. Yet opportunity has arisen at last in the form of dire tidings; the ancestral tomb of the Bordeleaux dukes has been ransacked and amongst the items stolen is the Trident of Manann, said to be descended from the God of the Sea himself. Although horrified, Alberic is also instilled with an excitement. He knows he must rescue the relic and restore safety to the dukedom, and so must investigate personally...

localised_description.last_approved_text: The first and most obvious place to begin the investigation is the thrice-damned city of Mousillon, and Alberic knows it. The dark and twisted visions within its walls are often linked to murders, kidnappings and other deviations; Alberic's quest must begin with those depraved creatures - he will bring justice and righteous fury to those who conspire against Bordeleaux and Bretonnia.

missions.localised_description: The first and most obvious place to begin the investigation is the thrice-damned city of Mousillon, and Alberic knows it. The dark and twisted visions within its walls are often linked to murders, kidnappings and other deviations; Alberic's quest must begin with those depraved creatures - he will bring justice and righteous fury to those who conspire against Bordeleaux and Bretonnia.

localised_description.last_approved_text: All that Alberic's agent was able to learn during his time in Mousillon is that the city is as damnable and decrepit as ever. Frustrated by a lack of leads, yet energised by the investigation, Alberic knows precisely what must be done next. The Trident of Manann billows on the flag of Bordeleaux as the duke rallies his forces to war - Mousillon will be taken by force, and any surviving inhabitants will answer to Alberic, or face his blade.

missions.localised_description: All that Alberic's agent was able to learn during his time in Mousillon is that the city is as damnable and decrepit as ever. Frustrated by a lack of leads, yet energised by the investigation, Alberic knows precisely what must be done next. The Trident of Manann billows on the flag of Bordeleaux as the duke rallies his forces to war - Mousillon will be taken by force, and any surviving inhabitants will answer to Alberic, or face his blade.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The agent returns having found nothing related to the investigation in Mousillon, and informs Alberic that the quest must move further afield if any answers are to be uncovered. The duke is frustrated by this setback, but the agent attempts to allay his worries with news that something unrelated, yet potentially advantageous, has been found in the caverns beneath the cursed city. Alberic, ever inquisitive and now addicted to the quest, readies his steed and makes haste for Mousillon himself.

missions.localised_description: The agent returns having found nothing related to the investigation in Mousillon, and informs Alberic that the quest must move further afield if any answers are to be uncovered. The duke is frustrated by this setback, but the agent attempts to allay his worries with news that something unrelated, yet potentially advantageous, has been found in the caverns beneath the cursed city. Alberic, ever inquisitive and now addicted to the quest, readies his steed and makes haste for Mousillon himself.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Every lead that Alberic pursued having dried up, the duke has no choice but to return to Bordeleaux and begin his investigation anew. The scene of the crime may yet yield a nugget of truth or an actionable link that was missed the first time around. With a grim countenance, yet no less of a determined spirit, Alberic sets out to return to his dukedom, where he is certain he will unlock the mystery of this dark crime...

missions.localised_description: Every lead that Alberic pursued having dried up, the duke has no choice but to return to Bordeleaux and begin his investigation anew. The scene of the crime may yet yield a nugget of truth or an actionable link that was missed the first time around. With a grim countenance, yet no less of a determined spirit, Alberic sets out to return to his dukedom, where he is certain he will unlock the mystery of this dark crime...

localised_description.last_approved_text: Although much of the groundwork on the investigation has already been completed, a few locals are induced to offer up some additional information. They cannot be sure these men were the thieves, but several locals report seeing a group of suspicious men boarding a ship bound for Brionne. Alberic is gleeful - finally, a clue! Yet his hopes are summarily dashed; the harbour master reports that the ship never reached Brionne and its whereabouts is now unknown. Although frustrated by failure yet again, the duke is determined to discover where the ship ended up. As such, funds must be raised if a search party is to be launched...

missions.localised_description: Although much of the groundwork on the investigation has already been completed, a few locals are induced to offer up some additional information. They cannot be sure these men were the thieves, but several locals report seeing a group of suspicious men boarding a ship bound for Brionne. Alberic is gleeful - finally, a clue! Yet his hopes are summarily dashed; the harbour master reports that the ship never reached Brionne and its whereabouts is now unknown. Although frustrated by failure yet again, the duke is determined to discover where the ship ended up. As such, funds must be raised if a search party is to be launched...

localised_description.last_approved_text: With his lips now loosened, the stranger reveals that he is part of a confederacy of thieves hired to steal the artefacts. Whilst their employer is keen to remain anonymous, no good thief is without his ways… He and his companions have discovered that they were hired by a rogue Knight, one with a grievance against Alberic that he was willing to settle by any means necessary. Alberic has heard of the roaming brigands that plague Estalia, but he had no idea they were so personally committed to his own misfortune. The duke is enraged - they were under his very nose and he had no idea! Well, he shan't be falling foul of them again; forces must be raised, and this scourge put to the sword of justice!

missions.localised_description: With his lips now loosened, the stranger reveals that he is part of a confederacy of thieves hired to steal the artefacts. Whilst their employer is keen to remain anonymous, no good thief is without his ways… He and his companions have discovered that they were hired by a rogue Knight, one with a grievance against Alberic that he was willing to settle by any means necessary. Alberic has heard of the roaming brigands that plague Estalia, but he had no idea they were so personally committed to his own misfortune. The duke is enraged - they were under his very nose and he had no idea! Well, he shan't be falling foul of them again; forces must be raised, and this scourge put to the sword of justice!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Alberic is encamped in Estalia, and word moves fast across the land that a renegade duke has come to settle a score – someone with a personal grievance against him. The duke had heard of the roaming brigands that plague Estalia, but he had no idea they were so personally committed to his own misfortune! The proverbial gauntlet is thrown harshly to the ground, challenging the 'weak and ineffectual' Alberic to face an army on the field of battle and decide who is the better Knight, once and for all. The duke, naturally, is not prepared to back down. Enraged, he raises a force to put this scourge to the sword of justice!

missions.localised_description: Alberic is encamped in Estalia, and word moves fast across the land that a renegade duke has come to settle a score – someone with a personal grievance against him. The duke had heard of the roaming brigands that plague Estalia, but he had no idea they were so personally committed to his own misfortune! The proverbial gauntlet is thrown harshly to the ground, challenging the 'weak and ineffectual' Alberic to face an army on the field of battle and decide who is the better Knight, once and for all. The duke, naturally, is not prepared to back down. Enraged, he raises a force to put this scourge to the sword of justice!

localised_description.last_approved_text: In her dreams, the Fay Enchantress sees what has been, what is, and what may yet be. She stands upon the coastline and watches as an endless fleet of ships, seething with the servants of Chaos, crashes through the waves towards Bretonnian shores. With the power of her Chalice of Potions, the Enchantress summons forth a storm of unseen enormity upon the approaching fleet. Yet though many of them are sent to calamitous, watery graves, even that cannot stop all the invaders. Still they come, the very sea seeming to boil and froth beneath their prows; an invasion without end, a fight without hope. As they pour from their vessels onto the land, unstoppable, the Ruinous hordes seem intent to rip the very heart from the breast of Bretonnia...\n\nThe Fay Enchantress awakes with a start, a deep fear settling, ice cold, within her. She knows, in this moment, that this was no mere nightmare but a vision - sent by the Lady - of what could be, should her strength be insufficient to stop it. The Enchantress knows what must be done, and knows there is very little time in which to do it.

missions.localised_description: In her dreams, the Fay Enchantress sees what has been, what is, and what may yet be. She stands upon the coastline and watches as an endless fleet of ships, seething with the servants of Chaos, crashes through the waves towards Bretonnian shores. With the power of her Chalice of Potions, the Enchantress summons forth a storm of unseen enormity upon the approaching fleet. Yet though many of them are sent to calamitous, watery graves, even that cannot stop all the invaders. Still they come, the very sea seeming to boil and froth beneath their prows; an invasion without end, a fight without hope. As they pour from their vessels onto the land, unstoppable, the Ruinous hordes seem intent to rip the very heart from the breast of Bretonnia...\n\nThe Fay Enchantress awakes with a start, a deep fear settling, ice cold, within her. She knows, in this moment, that this was no mere nightmare but a vision - sent by the Lady - of what could be, should her strength be insufficient to stop it. The Enchantress knows what must be done, and knows there is very little time in which to do it.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Through days of ceaseless toil and mind-wearying study, the Enchantress discovers rituals that may yield the answers she seeks, rituals that could make her potions strong enough to stop the Chaos invasion from her vision. Yet as is to be expected, the rituals are by no means simple; the Chalice must be charged by three rituals, all of which must triangulate with it from precise locations. The first point of the ritual lies in Nordland, to the east, far across the marches and into the lands of the Empire of Man. Knowing that time is crucial, and that Chaos grows ever-nearer, she dispatches a faithful servant to Nordland to begin the ritual.

missions.localised_description: Through days of ceaseless toil and mind-wearying study, the Enchantress discovers rituals that may yield the answers she seeks, rituals that could make her potions strong enough to stop the Chaos invasion from her vision. Yet as is to be expected, the rituals are by no means simple; the Chalice must be charged by three rituals, all of which must triangulate with it from precise locations. The first point of the ritual lies in Nordland, to the east, far across the marches and into the lands of the Empire of Man. Knowing that time is crucial, and that Chaos grows ever-nearer, she dispatches a faithful servant to Nordland to begin the ritual.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the first ritual began, a flame of hope is lit for Bretonnia. Yet it is a weak thing, dim and guttering; the Enchantress knows there is much more to be done, and the hour is growing late. Even now, she can feel the dark forces at play, threatening to overpower the world itself. The next ritual location plunges deep into the heart of that darkness - atop the gnarled peaks of the Vanaheim Mountains; the very heart of enemy territory. Yet the Fay Enchantress knows that she cannot relent; the tribes surrounding the mountains must be quashed, and the ritual began in relative safety.

missions.localised_description: With the first ritual began, a flame of hope is lit for Bretonnia. Yet it is a weak thing, dim and guttering; the Enchantress knows there is much more to be done, and the hour is growing late. Even now, she can feel the dark forces at play, threatening to overpower the world itself. The next ritual location plunges deep into the heart of that darkness - atop the gnarled peaks of the Vanaheim Mountains; the very heart of enemy territory. Yet the Fay Enchantress knows that she cannot relent; the tribes surrounding the mountains must be quashed, and the ritual began in relative safety.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Each second that passes is another interminable tick of the clock, another agonising beat of the Fay Enchantress' heart. She knows she has done all she can do, and that the potion is as strong as it can be. Now all she can do is wait and worry - wait for the dark forces to encroach upon Bretonnia, and worry that she has not done enough.\n\nThey will come from the north, she reasons, they will come for Couronne. She must make ready there.

missions.localised_description: Each second that passes is another interminable tick of the clock, another agonising beat of the Fay Enchantress' heart. She knows she has done all she can do, and that the potion is as strong as it can be. Now all she can do is wait and worry - wait for the dark forces to encroach upon Bretonnia, and worry that she has not done enough.\n\nThey will come from the north, she reasons, they will come for Couronne. She must make ready there.

localised_description.last_approved_text:
The dark and prophetic visions that plagued the Fay Enchantress have at last come to pass. Dark clouds gather off the northern shore of Bretonnia, and reports reach Couronne of a fleet, manned by servants of the Ruinous Powers in numbers beyond counting. They are so many, it is as if a great cloak is reaching across the ocean. Panic grips the people, but the Enchantress remains calm.

Upon the shores, she grasps the Chalice of Potions and channels its power in the name of the Lady. The ritual draws power from the swirling and tumultuous Winds of Magic, conjuring a dark and vicious storm. Bolts of lightning arc down at the approaching fleet, dashing them to pieces, whilst winds of enormous magnitude hurl yet more ships away to a watery demise. The spell is beyond anything ever seen before, and far greater than the one in the Enchantress' vision. When it is done, most of the fleet is consigned to oblivion. Yet despite it all, more advance. A sizeable force lands upon Bretonnian shores, still intent on seeing the land burn.

The Enchantress knows what must be done. These remnants must be faced, they must be fought and, finally, they must be utterly crushed.

localised_description.last_approved_text: My lord! The outriders have returned from their reconnaissance with reports of a Greenskin force massing ahead of us. They are encamped on a defensible ridge, and have brought their bizarre artillery to further fortify the position – they appear ready to fight to the last. Further reports seem to indicate that they are bolstered by a great gathering of Warbosses, who seem bent on bringing their full strength to bear against you. It is clear they want the same thing we do – a decisive battle to decide our fates once and for all. We must not relent – their scourge must be wiped from the world!

missions.localised_description: My lord! The outriders have returned from their reconnaissance with reports of a Greenskin force massing ahead of us. They are encamped on a defensible ridge, and have brought their bizarre artillery to further fortify the position – they appear ready to fight to the last. Further reports seem to indicate that they are bolstered by a great gathering of Warbosses, who seem bent on bringing their full strength to bear against you. It is clear they want the same thing we do – a decisive battle to decide our fates once and for all. We must not relent – their scourge must be wiped from the world!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Our march through the Chaos Wastes have been tough, Sire, but at last our courage seems to have been rewarded. Along the Cliff of Beasts, our scouts return with news that the forces of Ruin have decided to meet us in battle. Led by Archaon the Everchosen, and accompanied by the Prince of Slaneesh, Sigvald the Magnificent, the Chaos army seem ready to offer us a fight for the ages! The skies above, ever ominous during our perilous journey, turn now even more despondent. Thunder rolls across the grizzly clouds, and in the distance, lightning arcs through the deepening sky. The air hisses with static; could this be the moment of our destiny?

missions.localised_description: Our march through the Chaos Wastes have been tough, Sire, but at last our courage seems to have been rewarded. Along the Cliff of Beasts, our scouts return with news that the forces of Ruin have decided to meet us in battle. Led by Archaon the Everchosen, and accompanied by the Prince of Slaneesh, Sigvald the Magnificent, the Chaos army seem ready to offer us a fight for the ages! The skies above, ever ominous during our perilous journey, turn now even more despondent. Thunder rolls across the grizzly clouds, and in the distance, lightning arcs through the deepening sky. The air hisses with static; could this be the moment of our destiny?

localised_description.last_approved_text: A mist rolls down from the mountains covering the lands of Bretonnia. The origin of this dense effluvium is as murky as the mist itself; all the people of Bretonnia know is that what was not there before is there now, obfuscating and obscuring all. Yet more troubling than the mist itself is what lies beyond - the shouting and smashing of the Greenskin hordes haunt the dreams of the peasants, who fear they may be next. The people panic, refusing to leave their homes, lest they be next victims of the slavering, rampaging Orcish host.

missions.localised_description: A mist rolls down from the mountains covering the lands of Bretonnia. The origin of this dense effluvium is as murky as the mist itself; all the people of Bretonnia know is that what was not there before is there now, obfuscating and obscuring all. Yet more troubling than the mist itself is what lies beyond - the shouting and smashing of the Greenskin hordes haunt the dreams of the peasants, who fear they may be next. The people panic, refusing to leave their homes, lest they be next victims of the slavering, rampaging Orcish host.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The fog has affected all. It has become so thick that the light of the sun cannot pierce it. So it is across the Bretonnian marches; a land of quarrelsome yet bright climate now despairs under the infernal fog, forsaken by the sun. As the light fades from the land, so too does the Sword of Couronne's aura ebb and dim. King Leoncoeur grows concerned and so, sealing the ancestral blade away, endeavours to discover the source and solution to the impenetrable mist.\n\nAll across Bretonnia, dukedoms report that the mist is giving rise to mania; a Greenskin horde rampages there, taking advantage of the murk to smash, pillage and spread destruction across the land. Although it may not be a permanent solution, the king has an immediate duty to protect his people.

missions.localised_description: The fog has affected all. It has become so thick that the light of the sun cannot pierce it. So it is across the Bretonnian marches; a land of quarrelsome yet bright climate now despairs under the infernal fog, forsaken by the sun. As the light fades from the land, so too does the Sword of Couronne's aura ebb and dim. King Leoncoeur grows concerned and so, sealing the ancestral blade away, endeavours to discover the source and solution to the impenetrable mist.\n\nAll across Bretonnia, dukedoms report that the mist is giving rise to mania; a Greenskin horde rampages there, taking advantage of the murk to smash, pillage and spread destruction across the land. Although it may not be a permanent solution, the king has an immediate duty to protect his people.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As Leoncoeur puts paid to the enemy forces, it becomes apparent that the Greenskins were not a unified fighting force but more of an advance party - a mere rabble, hurtling full-tilt from the fog and the forests ahead of a much larger and better-disciplined host. Driven by curiosity and a desire to see the fog dispersed, the king attempts to investigate. Yet upon entering, he is led by vines and half-hidden pathways back the way he came. No matter how many times he tries, the forest repeatedly turns Leoncoeur away. \n\nConvinced that something dark, devious, and infinitely more menacing is picking its way through the forests of Bretonnia, yet frustrated by failure, the king returns to court. There, his advisors suggest an investigation of Artois - the first dukedom to be shrouded by the fog's appearance. Finding their advice to be worthy, the king prepares a sortie.

missions.localised_description: As Leoncoeur puts paid to the enemy forces, it becomes apparent that the Greenskins were not a unified fighting force but more of an advance party - a mere rabble, hurtling full-tilt from the fog and the forests ahead of a much larger and better-disciplined host. Driven by curiosity and a desire to see the fog dispersed, the king attempts to investigate. Yet upon entering, he is led by vines and half-hidden pathways back the way he came. No matter how many times he tries, the forest repeatedly turns Leoncoeur away. \n\nConvinced that something dark, devious, and infinitely more menacing is picking its way through the forests of Bretonnia, yet frustrated by failure, the king returns to court. There, his advisors suggest an investigation of Artois - the first dukedom to be shrouded by the fog's appearance. Finding their advice to be worthy, the king prepares a sortie.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As Leoncoeur puts paid to the enemy forces, it becomes apparent they were not a unified fighting force but more of an advance party - a mere rabble, hurtling full-tilt from the fog and the forests ahead of a much larger and better-disciplined host. Driven by curiosity and a desire to see the fog dispersed, the king attempts to investigate the forests. Yet upon entering, he is led by vines and half-hidden pathways back the way he came. No matter how many times he tries, the forest repeatedly turns Leoncoeur away.\n\nConvinced that something dark, devious, and infinitely more menacing is picking its way through the forests of Bretonnia, yet frustrated by failure, the king returns to court. There, his advisors suggest an investigation of Artois - the first dukedom to be shrouded by the fog's appearance, and the first to fall to the filthy green tide lurking beneath. Finding their advice to be worthy, the king prepares a force to retake the dukedom and find his answers!

missions.localised_description: As Leoncoeur puts paid to the enemy forces, it becomes apparent they were not a unified fighting force but more of an advance party - a mere rabble, hurtling full-tilt from the fog and the forests ahead of a much larger and better-disciplined host. Driven by curiosity and a desire to see the fog dispersed, the king attempts to investigate the forests. Yet upon entering, he is led by vines and half-hidden pathways back the way he came. No matter how many times he tries, the forest repeatedly turns Leoncoeur away.\n\nConvinced that something dark, devious, and infinitely more menacing is picking its way through the forests of Bretonnia, yet frustrated by failure, the king returns to court. There, his advisors suggest an investigation of Artois - the first dukedom to be shrouded by the fog's appearance, and the first to fall to the filthy green tide lurking beneath. Finding their advice to be worthy, the king prepares a force to retake the dukedom and find his answers!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Artois is deeply affected by the descent of the all-consuming mist, but the people still, somehow, endure, in a display of bold Bretonnian resilience. When pressed for information, the peasants mention something about a nameless, shrouded wanderer spreading rumours of an 'evil fog' approaching just before the self-same miasma descended upon them. At last report, the wanderer was headed in the direction of the Forest of Arden.\n\nLeoncoeur knows that even the hardiest Knight of Bretonnia would be in great peril so close to Athel Loren. This wanderer knows something of the ever-present mist, yet is still in great danger. More to the point, his demise would sever the only lead the king has in this mystery. With great haste, he dispatches an agent to intercept the mysterious man.

missions.localised_description: Artois is deeply affected by the descent of the all-consuming mist, but the people still, somehow, endure, in a display of bold Bretonnian resilience. When pressed for information, the peasants mention something about a nameless, shrouded wanderer spreading rumours of an 'evil fog' approaching just before the self-same miasma descended upon them. At last report, the wanderer was headed in the direction of the Forest of Arden.\n\nLeoncoeur knows that even the hardiest Knight of Bretonnia would be in great peril so close to Athel Loren. This wanderer knows something of the ever-present mist, yet is still in great danger. More to the point, his demise would sever the only lead the king has in this mystery. With great haste, he dispatches an agent to intercept the mysterious man.

localised_description.last_approved_text:
The wanderer is discovered, but it is too late to save him from the perils that lay in the mist. The King's agent sends word that he was found on the outskirts of the Arden Forest, battered and bloodied and, ultimately, beyond saving. Yet hope remains; a notebook was found on his desecrated cadaver, which the agent delivered to the King with great urgency.

Upon its battered and weathered pages, it is revealed that the wanderer was an elder Questing Knight, lost to the records of the Bretonnians, whose final pledge was to 'clear the mist of all evil'. Accompanying his final quest is a an intricately-detailed map of the Forest of Arden; at the centre, deep within the woods, he has marked a clearing, labelled only as the 'source of evil', which must be the camp of the Orc Warboss presiding over the destruction.

Leoncoeur has no other leads, and if this Knight is to be believed, the mist's source, and ultimate defeat, lies at the heart of the Forest of Arden. Steeling his courage, the king musters his armies, and prepares to forge ahead into the dense forest to save his realm...

missions.localised_description:
The wanderer is discovered, but it is too late to save him from the perils that lay in the mist. The King's agent sends word that he was found on the outskirts of the Arden Forest, battered and bloodied and, ultimately, beyond saving. Yet hope remains; a notebook was found on his desecrated cadaver, which the agent delivered to the King with great urgency.

Upon its battered and weathered pages, it is revealed that the wanderer was an elder Questing Knight, lost to the records of the Bretonnians, whose final pledge was to 'clear the mist of all evil'. Accompanying his final quest is a an intricately-detailed map of the Forest of Arden; at the centre, deep within the woods, he has marked a clearing, labelled only as the 'source of evil', which must be the camp of the Orc Warboss presiding over the destruction.

Leoncoeur has no other leads, and if this Knight is to be believed, the mist's source, and ultimate defeat, lies at the heart of the Forest of Arden. Steeling his courage, the king musters his armies, and prepares to forge ahead into the dense forest to save his realm...

localised_description.last_approved_text: When Thorgrim declared the new Age of Retribution, his intention was that it would be founded on a new, renewed spirit of co-operation between the remaining Dwarfholds. For too long have the Dwarfs been weakened by often bloody grudge-feuds between their kings. As High King, Thorgrim will put a stop to this, even if his axe must do the talking!

missions.localised_description: When Thorgrim declared the new Age of Retribution, his intention was that it would be founded on a new, renewed spirit of co-operation between the remaining Dwarfholds. For too long have the Dwarfs been weakened by often bloody grudge-feuds between their kings. As High King, Thorgrim will put a stop to this, even if his axe must do the talking!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The power of the Dwarfs grows. Many long-harboured grudges have been settled and a spirit of co-operation between the Holds has given new vigour to Thorgrim’s plans. In days of yore, the Dwarfs wandered throughout the Old World, seeking new lodes of the ores they prize. New Holds were founded, from the Grey Mountains in the west to the Mountains of Mourn in the east, from the Dragonback Mountains in the south to the ice-locked peaks of Norsca in the north. Then came the Time of Woes, when a series of disasters led to the fall of countless Holds and the sons of Grungni found themselves penned into their remaining Karaks. With the reclamation of the World's Edge Mountains under way, Thorgrim’s thoughts turn northwards to the once-mighty Hold of Kraka Drak in Norsca. If the Norscan Dwarfs have endured the Time of Woes and Kraka Drak remains unconquered, it would be invaluable in the struggle against the Norscan tribes who feed the forces of Chaos. The High King dispatches emissaries northwards.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Now communication has been re-established with the Norse Dwarfs, Thorgrim has a clearer picture of events in that frozen land. He receives regular reports on the movements of the Norscan tribes, and other significant events. Soon an emissary from Kraka Drak brings word that the Troll Country, a malign wilderness in south-eastern Norsca, has seen a steady rise in the numbers of hideous creatures stalking its ice-wracked forests and tundra. Countless numbers of Trolls and Giants, displaced by the increased competition for food and territory, are a threat to Kraka Drak whilst others encroach into the World's Edge Mountains and other civilised lands. It is time for a cull, and whenever there is a foul monster in need of vanquishing, there you will find the Slayers: death-sworn followers of the Slayer Cult, and therefore ever in search of the most dangerous adversaries upon which to unleash their mighty axe-craft.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As the throng gathers to Thorgrim's banner, he sends a ranger ahead to reconnoitre the route.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Engineers' Guild have some new designs for an exciting improvement to the Gyrocopter, which would allow for increased speed and lifting capacity. These dark times call for a departure from the Dwarfs' customary adherence to tradition and suspicion of anything 'new'. Though these plans have been only half a century in the making, almost an insult to the Ancestors in their hasty preparation, the Guild has decided to bring them to Thorgrim's attention, though the Guild hall has been the scene of lengthy and heated debate on the matter. Now a Master Engineer has been tasked with producing the final technical drawings and prototypes before production can begin. However, the experimental processes involved will require further investment in the Guild's workshops, and this will not come cheap.

missions.localised_description: The Engineers' Guild have some new designs for an exciting improvement to the Gyrocopter, which would allow for increased speed and lifting capacity. These dark times call for a departure from the Dwarfs' customary adherence to tradition and suspicion of anything 'new'. Though these plans have been only half a century in the making, almost an insult to the Ancestors in their hasty preparation, the Guild has decided to bring them to Thorgrim's attention, though the Guild hall has been the scene of lengthy and heated debate on the matter. Now a Master Engineer has been tasked with producing the final technical drawings and prototypes before production can begin. However, the experimental processes involved will require further investment in the Guild's workshops, and this will not come cheap.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Engineers' Guild is in uproar. The Master Engineer tasked with developing the plans has presented his initial prototypes, together with a proposal to roll the improvements out within a matter of months. The unseemly haste of this timeframe has polarised opinion between the younger members, uneasy with such novel thinking, yet intrigued by the possibilities it presents, and the traditionalists who advocate the more usual decades of testing and would have the "trial-and-error charlatan tinkerer" thrown out in disgrace. Hearing the outcry, the High King steps in and orders that the prototype be put into full production.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Early test flights of the Gyrocopters have been fruitful. The machines have shown that they are ready to be deployed against the enemy. In addition, during long-range testing to verify operational ranges, the test pilots observed a large gathering of Greenskins around a location in the Badlands known as the Pillar of Bone. Thorgrim despatches a Ranger to gather more detailed intelligence from the area.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Great Book of Grudges groans under the weight of the outrages, injustices that fill its many, many pages. High King Thorgrim spends many hours brooding over the tome and planning the means to exact payment in full for every grievance recorded therein. When the weight of his fury becomes too great to bear, he often descends to the vaults to seek solace amongst the riches heaped there. But gold itself presents another means to achieve vengeance, and as such a king can never have enough of it. Thorgrim is determined to fill the vaults to bursting, and then to delve new vaults and fill them with the treasure which will fuel his plans for ultimate vengeance and enable him to strike out every grudge within the book.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The workshops of the Hold blaze with light from the incandescent forges, and the ring with the hammers of the smiths who work there day and night. A tide of goods flow in to flood the deep vaults. Once more Everpeak is the nexus of a mighty trade empire. Yet still grit fouls the cogs of this mighty machine and daily Thorgrim must scratch out new grudges in the Great Book. Old enemies prey upon the trade caravans, butchering the traders and plundering their wealth. Of late, no caravan has made it through the ill-omened province of Sylvania. Whilst it's true that there are other routes into the Empire, the Sylvanian route offers certain advantages, and besides, there are fresh scores to be settled. First things first: Thorgrim needs to know what he's up against. He summons a Thane and orders him to reconnoitre the area.

localised_description.last_approved_text: On being acclaimed High King, Thorgrim Grudgebearer swore a solemn oath that his reign would signal the dawn of a new age: the Age of Reckoning. It is his dream to avenge the wrongs done to his people by striking clean the entire ledger in the Great Book of Grudges. This begins with the reclamation of the fallen Holds.

missions.localised_description: On being acclaimed High King, Thorgrim Grudgebearer swore a solemn oath that his reign would signal the dawn of a new age: the Age of Reckoning. It is his dream to avenge the wrongs done to his people by striking clean the entire ledger in the Great Book of Grudges. This begins with the reclamation of the fallen Holds.

localised_description.last_approved_text: In ages past, the Dwarfs stood shield-to-shield with the men of the Empire, braced against the constant attacks of their common enemies. Over the centuries though, the ties have loosened inexorably. Beset by ever greater threats and a series of defeats, the Dwarfs retreated into their remaining mountain Holds, and the power of the Empire dwindled under the yoke of weak, foolish or wicked Emperors. Now Thorgrim’s great oath of vengeance requires that the Dwarfs re-establish old alliances.

missions.localised_description: In ages past, the Dwarfs stood shield-to-shield with the men of the Empire, braced against the constant attacks of their common enemies. Over the centuries though, the ties have loosened inexorably. Now Thorgrim’s great oath of vengeance requires that the Dwarfs re-establish old alliances.

localised_description.last_approved_text: In ages past, the Dwarfs stood shield to shield with the men of the Empire, braced against the constant attacks of their common enemies. Over the centuries though, the ties have loosened inexorably. Beset by ever greater threats and an inexorable series of defeats, the Dwarfs retreated into their remaining mountain Holds, and the power of the Empire dwindled under the yoke of weak, foolish or wicked Emperors, until it was finally brought to its knees. Now the men of the Empire are fugitives, driven from their homelands and forced to find refuge in remote places. Yet pride and the love of their warrior god still burn within them, and they would surely embrace any chance to avenge themselves on their enemies. Thorgrim dispatches messengers to locate and establish contact with the fugitives.

Thorgrim dispatches messengers to locate and establish contact with the fugitives.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Unable to find trustworthy allies elsewhere, Thorgrim resolves to contact a band of Empire fugitives, forced from their homelands and finding refuge in remote places. Yet pride and the love of their warrior god still burn within them, and they would surely embrace any chance to avenge themselves on their enemies. Thorgrim dispatches messengers to locate and establish contact with the fugitives, bringing them gold and supplies to sustain them.

localised_description.last_approved_text: There are dire tidings from the South: Rangers report that a brutal Orc Warboss has arisen and that hordes of Greenskins are flocking to fight under his leadership. A mighty Waaagh! is forming and seems to be heading north toward the gateway to the Empire’s southern border: the fabled Black Fire Pass. This route through the mountains has witnessed countless titanic struggles over the centuries, many of them pivotal to the survival of the Old World, where Dwarfs and men stood together to hold back disaster. Thorgrim sends a scout to Black Fire Pass to gather intelligence.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Ungrim Ironfist, the Slayer King of Karak Kadrin is a restless Dwarf. His five-time great grandsire suffered a terrible loss and in his torment swore the Oath of Slayers. This vow to seek out death conflicted with his vow as king to protect his people. In the end, good Dwarf sense prevailed and he found a way to honour all commitments by founding the Slayer Shrine of Karak Kadrin, establishing a haven for Slayers that continues to this day. Now Ungrim, bound by the same oaths, spends many hours before the shrine, chafing at his fate. Though he cannot seek death himself, he can certainly seek out opportunities to slay the enemy, and it is this that affords him a modicum of solace.

missions.localised_description: Ungrim Ironfist, the Slayer King of Karak Kadrin is a restless Dwarf. His five-time great grandsire suffered a terrible loss and in his torment swore the Oath of Slayers. This vow to seek out death conflicted with his vow as king to protect his people. In the end, good Dwarf sense prevailed and he found a way to honour all commitments by founding the Slayer Shrine of Karak Kadrin, establishing a haven for Slayers that continues to this day. Now Ungrim, bound by the same oaths, spends many hours before the shrine, chafing at his fate. Though he cannot seek death himself, he can certainly seek out opportunities to slay the enemy, and it is this that affords him a modicum of solace.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Ungrim kneels before the Slayer Shrine once more, fingering his notched axe as his battle rage cools. In his last battle, a reverie came upon him again. Whilst in the midst of slaying, he felt a discordant note amongst the otherwise perfect rhythm of battle. Contemplation brought him to the realisation that his own axe was the source of the disharmony. Reforged from the shattered remnants of the az of the first Slayer King, it is missing a section which has been replaced with Gromril. Though Gromril weapons are amongst the most deadly in the Old World, the replacement section is blank, lacking the runes of power that are etched into the rest of the blade. The secrets of many of the ancient runes of power have been lost over the millennia but the axe is not whole and the missing runes must somehow be reforged if the weapon is to sing true once more. Ungrim summons a Runesmith to discuss the matter.

The secrets of many of the ancient runes of power have been lost over the millennia but the axe is not whole and the missing runes must somehow be reforged if the weapon is to sing true once more. Ungrim summons a Runesmith to discuss the matter.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Having consulted with his Guild, the Runesmith reports that the missing runes are amongst those whose mysteries have been lost to the Dwarfs for centuries. However, the Guild’s council suspects that in revealing its song to Ungrim, the axe is attempting to make itself whole once more, seeking the aid of Ungrim’s kindred warrior soul to do so. By wholly aligning his spirit with the axe in the crucible of battle, the Slayer King may be able to provide the counterpoint to mend the blade’s song. Such perfection of alignment is more likely to be achieved in a high place, closer to the Ancestor gods, and against an adversary of great skill in battle-craft. In his many hours of contemplation before the Slayer Shrine, Ungrim catches a gossamer thread of song coming from the north. Rising, he orders the horns sounded to summon his throng.

missions.localised_description: Having consulted with his Guild, the Runesmith reports that the missing runes are amongst those whose mysteries have been lost to the Dwarfs for centuries. However, the Guild’s council suspects that in revealing its song to Ungrim, the axe is attempting to make itself whole once more, seeking the aid of Ungrim’s kindred warrior soul to do so. By wholly aligning his spirit with the axe in the crucible of battle, the Slayer King may be able to provide the counterpoint to mend the blade’s song. localised_description.last_approved_text: A message has arrived from High King Thorgrim Grudgebearer. The scroll is a long one with well over half of it detailing the many enmities recorded in the Great Book of Grudges against the foul Greenskins, an interminable list that is engraved as deeply on Ungrim’s heart as on that of any other Dwarf. Now Thorgrim plans to set in motion a campaign to strike a telling blow against the urks and grobi, so that their stain might be erased from the face of the Old World once and for all. Before the final blow can be struck, they must be weakened in stages, and the first step is to reconnoitre their territory in force.

missions.localised_description: A message has arrived from High King Thorgrim Grudgebearer. The scroll is a long one with well over half of it detailing the many enmities recorded in the Great Book of Grudges against the foul Greenskins, an interminable list that is engraved as deeply on Ungrim’s heart as on that of any other Dwarf. Now Thorgrim plans to set in motion a campaign to strike a telling blow against the urks and grobi, so that their stain might be erased from the face of the Old World once and for all. Before the final blow can be struck, they must be weakened in stages, and the first step is to reconnoitre their territory in force.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Though the Orc and Goblin menace seems to have been dealt with for now, the High King knows that somewhere in the wilds scattered bands of fugitives will be hiding, just waiting for a new Warboss to rise so that they can flock to his banner in another mighty Waaagh! Constant vigilance is called for and Ungrim is ordered to send out scouts to keep watch.

missions.localised_description: Though the Orc and Goblin menace seems to have been dealt with for now, the High King knows that somewhere in the wilds scattered bands of fugitives will be hiding, just waiting for a new Warboss to rise so that they can flock to his banner in another mighty Waaagh! Constant vigilance is called for and Ungrim is ordered to send out scouts to keep watch.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Goblins have been seen sneaking through Dwarfen territories, particularly in the central World's Edge Mountains. Ungrim especially despises these underhand Goblin sneaks who lack even the Orcs' one redeeming feature of being prepared to stand and fight. Fire must be fought with fire. Ungrim sends out an ally to put an end to the foul creature before he can do any harm!

missions.localised_description: Goblins have been seen sneaking through Dwarfen territories, particularly in the central World's Edge Mountains. Ungrim especially despises these underhand Goblin sneaks who lack even the Orcs' one redeeming feature of being prepared to stand and fight. Fire must be fought with fire. Ungrim sends out an ally to put an end to the foul creature before he can do any harm!

localised_description.last_approved_text: The war drums are pounding in the Badlands. The settlements belonging to the Greenskins seethe like anthills as the enraged Orcs gather to strike back at their tormentors. According to the High King’s plan, the trick is to ensure that the counterattack is channelled in a direction of the Dwarf’s choosing so that the final confrontation is on ground that favours them. Broken Leg Gully is a low pass in the World's Edge Mountains perfect for such a battle. All that is required is some bait to draw the raging Greenskin horde there. Summoning a trusted champion, Ungrim instructs him to infiltrate a Greenskin settlement and plant a scroll indicating the presence of a secret tunnel entrance in Broken Leg Gully and leading to the nearby Hold of Karak Kadrin. Such a tunnel doesn’t exist, but in their current state of rage, the Orcs will surely take the bait!

missions.localised_description: The war drums are pounding in the Badlands. The settlements belonging to the Greenskins seethe like anthills as the enraged Orcs gather to strike back at their tormentors. According to the High King’s plan, the trick is to ensure that the counterattack is channelled in a direction of the Dwarf’s choosing so that the final confrontation is on ground that favours them. Broken Leg Gully is a low pass in the World's Edge Mountains perfect for such a battle. All that is required is some bait to draw the raging Greenskin horde there. Summoning a trusted champion, Ungrim instructs him to infiltrate a Greenskin settlement and plant a scroll indicating the presence of a secret tunnel entrance in Broken Leg Gully and leading to the nearby Hold of Karak Kadrin. Such a tunnel doesn’t exist, but in their current state of rage, the Orcs will surely take the bait!

localised_description.last_approved_text: Though the agent failed to plant the scroll, it would seem that the ruse wasn't required anyway. The Goblins were scouting the area ahead of a huge Greenskin Waaagh! which landed south of the Badlands and made its way north by secret paths. Ungrim despatches a scout to track them and discover their objective.

The Goblins were scouting the area ahead of a huge Greenskin Waaagh! which landed south of the Badlands and made its way north by secret paths. Ungrim despatches a scout to track them and discover their objective.

missions.localised_description: Though the agent failed to plant the scroll, it would seem that the ruse wasn't required anyway. The Goblins were scouting the area ahead of a huge Greenskin Waaagh! which landed south of the Badlands and made its way north by secret paths. Ungrim despatches a scout to track them and discover their objective.

localised_description.last_approved_text: During his escape from the Greenskin settlement, Ungrim's agent spotted a group of Goblin scouts sneaking away to the North. On a hunch, the agent tracked the Goblins north to Broken Leg Gully. Eavesdropping on their foul conversation he learned that they were a scouting party sent out ahead of a large-scale Greenskin attack planned for somewhere in the vicinity. Having read the report, Ungrim dispatches a scout to watch the area whilst he gathers the throng and marches to join them.

missions.localised_description: During his escape from the Greenskin settlement, Ungrim's agent spotted a group of Goblin scouts sneaking away to the North. On a hunch, the agent tracked the Goblins north to Broken Leg Gully. Eavesdropping on their foul conversation he learned that they were a scouting party sent out ahead of a large-scale Greenskin attack planned for somewhere in the vicinity. Having read the report, Ungrim dispatches a scout to watch the area whilst he gathers the throng and marches to join them.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Dark clouds have enveloped the accursed province of Sylvania. Such a spectacle has not been seen since Count Mannfred von Carstein, the Vampire Lord of that realm, was last vanquished. Now reports reach Ungrim of sinister black-robed old men roaming the high peaks. He suspects that death has regained mastery of Sylvania and the interlopers herald the spread of its corruption to neighbouring regions. The Slayer King will need to act in order to protect his people.

missions.localised_description: Dark clouds have enveloped the accursed province of Sylvania. Such a spectacle has not been seen since Count Mannfred von Carstein, the Vampire Lord of that realm, was last vanquished. Now reports reach Ungrim of sinister black-robed old men roaming the high peaks. He suspects that death has regained mastery of Sylvania and the interlopers herald the spread of its corruption to neighbouring regions. The Slayer King will need to act in order to protect his people.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Ungrim's agents send word that they have tracked two of the cloaked figures, who appear to be Necromancers, and have worked out likely locations where they might be cornered. There seems to be no good reason for the Necromancers to be roaming the high peaks, and Ungrim sends word for his agents to act against them to put an end to whatever scheme they are engaged in.

missions.localised_description: Ungrim's agents send word that they have tracked two of the cloaked figures, who appear to be Necromancers, and have worked out likely locations where they might be cornered. There seems to be no good reason for the Necromancers to be roaming the high peaks, and Ungrim sends word for his agents to act against them to put an end to whatever scheme they are engaged in.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Whilst the Necromancers could not be found, the throng have reported rumours of Vampiric activity in the darkest corners of Sylvania. Ungrim sends a scout to investigate the area.

missions.localised_description: Whilst the Necromancers could not be found, the throng have reported rumours of Vampiric activity in the darkest corners of Sylvania. Ungrim sends a scout to investigate the area.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The scout watching Sylvania's border reports a chance encounter with a terrified Sylvanian peasant who lay hidden and witnessed the passing of a hideous army of the dead. At its head rode two pale figures on dead horses, one in crimson armour, the other robed in black. The armoured figure slapped his mount's neck with a mailed fist and cursed in a voice as cold as death "Weeks of searching the mountain caves and still you have failed to find what I desire. If you are wrong about the locations to the northwest, and we should find no dragon's corpse to serve me into death, I shall feast upon your soul". It seems that the Undead Lord is searching for new materials for use in his foul Necromancy. It would seem that the dead have found at least two possible locations for what they seek and are now moving to claim their vile prize. King Ungrim marches from his hall, shouting for the throng to be assembled. In the meantime he must decide which of the Undead hordes his scout should track.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the decoy force destroyed, Ungrim orders his throng to pursue the second Undead horde, again sending a scout ahead to mark the way.

missions.localised_description: With the decoy force destroyed, Ungrim orders his throng to pursue the second Undead horde, again sending a scout ahead to mark the way.

localised_description.last_approved_text: A number of strange incidents have occurred within the Empire of late: tombs have been desecrated and libraries broken into. Oddly, nothing has been taken. The Emperor's spies report that a number of ill-omened individuals have been connected to some of the misdeeds. The trick now is to catch one of them and learn more.

missions.localised_description: A number of strange incidents have occurred within the Empire of late: tombs have been desecrated and libraries broken into. Oddly, nothing has been taken. The Emperor's spies report that a number of ill-omened individuals have been connected to some of the misdeeds. The trick now is to catch one of them and learn more.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The information received indicates that the intrusions are connected with the search for a magical amulet, believed to have been buried in the tomb of a powerful Lord centuries ago. The fact that the enemy are searching over a large area, and in libraries as well as tombs, suggests that they are yet to discover the amulet's precise location. However, they seem to be concentrating their efforts within the eastern realms and this provides a clue. Balthasar Gelt advises the Emperor that the search would best be orchestrated by the Colleges of Magic.

missions.localised_description: The information received indicates that the intrusions are connected with the search for a magical amulet, believed to have been buried in the tomb of a powerful Lord centuries ago. The fact that the enemy are searching over a large area, and in libraries as well as tombs, suggests that they are yet to discover the amulet's precise location. However, they seem to be concentrating their efforts within the eastern realms and this provides a clue. Balthasar Gelt advises the Emperor that the search would best be orchestrated by the Colleges of Magic.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Wizard reports back to Gelt that their researches have turned up two possible locations: the barrow of the ancient tribal Chieftain Marbad in Middenland, or the tomb of an unknown Lord in the dusty foothills of distant Estalia. Gelt decides that it is time for research is over. The leads must be investigated in person.

missions.localised_description: The Wizard reports back to Gelt that their researches have turned up two possible locations: the barrow of the ancient tribal Chieftain Marbad in Middenland, or the tomb of an unknown Lord in the dusty foothills of distant Estalia. Gelt decides that it is time for research is over. The leads must be investigated in person.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As the last echoes of battle dwindle and the silence descends upon the tomb once more, Gelt searches for any sign of the magical amulet. Grave goods there are aplenty but the amulet is not among them, and even the most rapacious looter amongst the surviving men is strangely reluctant to so much as lay a finger on any of the treasures piled amid the ancient bones. His metallic voice betraying nothing of the frustration he feels, the Supreme Patriarch gives orders to investigate the lead in Estalia.

missions.localised_description: As the last echoes of battle dwindle and the silence descends upon the tomb once more, Gelt searches for any sign of the magical amulet. Grave goods there are aplenty but the amulet is not among them, and even the most rapacious looter amongst the surviving men is strangely reluctant to so much as lay a finger on any of the treasures piled amid the ancient bones. His metallic voice betraying nothing of the frustration he feels, the Supreme Patriarch gives orders to investigate the lead in Estalia.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Balthasar Gelt has always been fascinated with the purity of gold. In his eyes, no other metal can compare. He has laboured long in probing its secrets and inevitably these studies have led him towards solving the ultimate mystery of transmutation - the permanent transformation of base iron into gold. Now his search is nearing its goal, but the Supreme Patriarch requires raw materials for his research.

missions.localised_description: Balthasar Gelt has always been fascinated with the purity of gold. In his eyes, no other metal can compare. He has laboured long in probing its secrets and inevitably these studies have led him towards solving the ultimate mystery of transmutation - the permanent transformation of base iron into gold. Now his search is nearing its goal, but the Supreme Patriarch requires raw materials for his research.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Dwarfs have ever-been adept at fashioning metal, and Gelt suspects that their smiths may have uncovered secrets that will be useful to him. However, their methods are guarded more closely than their lives and the Supreme Patriarch will need to employ guile to wrest the knowledge he needs from the ancient Dwarf halls. He despatches a Hero to negotiate with the Dwarfs.

missions.localised_description: Dwarfs have ever-been adept at fashioning metal, and Gelt suspects that their smiths may have uncovered secrets that will be useful to him. However, their methods are guarded more closely than their lives and the Supreme Patriarch will need to employ guile to wrest the knowledge he needs from the ancient Dwarf halls. He despatches a Hero to negotiate with the Dwarfs.

localised_description.last_approved_text: As Gelt suspected, the Dwarfs flatly refuse to share their knowledge. His emissary does mention that as he prepared to leave the Hold, a Gyrocopter pilot arrived with news of a Greenskin warband that had attacked a Dwarfen trade caravan and stolen the precious Gromril ore it was carrying. Ever a planner, Gelt sends a pathfinder to the gully to assess the threat.

missions.localised_description: As Gelt suspected, the Dwarfs flatly refuse to share their knowledge. His emissary does mention that as he prepared to leave the Hold, a Gyrocopter pilot arrived with news of a Greenskin warband that had attacked a Dwarfen trade caravan and stolen the precious Gromril ore it was carrying. Ever a planner, Gelt sends a pathfinder to the gully to assess the threat.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The knowledge Balthasar Gelt seeks would have been recorded in one of the Dwarfs' Guild books. Many of these have been destroyed during the fall of the Dwarfholds. One Greenskin Warboss is said to carry a personal store of them, torn pages from which he takes with him whenever he visits "Da Drops". Scouts report that this Boss is currently to be found in Broken Leg Gully. Ever a planner, Gelt sends a pathfinder to the gully to assess the threat.

missions.localised_description: The knowledge Balthasar Gelt seeks would have been recorded in one of the Dwarfs' Guild books. Many of these have been destroyed during the fall of the Dwarfholds. One Greenskin Warboss is said to carry a personal store of them, torn pages from which he takes with him whenever he visits "Da Drops". Scouts report that this Boss is currently to be found in Broken Leg Gully. Ever a planner, Gelt sends a pathfinder to the gully to assess the threat.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Dwarf lore reveals synergies between alchemy and the manufacture of Black Powder. With the raw materials and key knowledge in place, Gelt sends word ahead to Altdorf to prepare his laboratories whilst he rides for the capital.

missions.localised_description: The Dwarf lore reveals synergies between alchemy and the manufacture of Black Powder. With the raw materials and key knowledge in place, Gelt sends word ahead to Altdorf to prepare his laboratories whilst he rides for the capital.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Gelt's researches lead him to the location of an ill-omened cave, shunned by any unfortunate enough to live in its vicinity. He dispatches a scout to reconnoitre the route whilst he recovers from his injuries.

missions.localised_description: Gelt's researches lead him to the location of an ill-omened cave, shunned by any unfortunate enough to live in its vicinity. He dispatches a scout to reconnoitre the route whilst he recovers from his injuries.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Gelt's researches lead him to the location of an ill-omened cave, shunned by any unfortunate enough to live in its vicinity. He dispatches a scout to reconnoitre the route whilst he recovers from his injuries.

missions.localised_description: Gelt's researches lead him to the location of an ill-omened cave, shunned by any unfortunate enough to live in its vicinity. He dispatches a scout to reconnoitre the route whilst he recovers from his injuries.

localised_description.last_approved_text: The Colleges of Magic in Altdorf are abuzz with intrigue. Every eight years, a wizard who has proven himself worthy may challenge the Master of the Colleges to a magical duel, with the winner becoming the next Supreme Patriarch. The competition even to become a candidate is white hot. Wizards, being what they are, mean the selection process is at best pedantic; at its worst, real enmities can develop. Balthasar Gelt is the Patriarch of the Gold Order, and tipped to win, but a rival Light Wizard, Gottfried Orr, desperate for the position, wants rid of Gelt before they even reach the Hall of Duels. While this is an open secret, no direct accusation can be made as that is not how wizards manage their affairs. However, Gelt is something of a maverick and knows he needs the edge when Orr inevitably makes his move. As such, the Gold Wizard sets about locating a valuable lodestone and harnessing its power. Lodestones sometimes occur in areas struck by lightning - areas such as Kislev, which has recently experienced heavy storm activity.

missions.localised_description: The Colleges of Magic in Altdorf are abuzz with intrigue. Every eight years, a wizard who has proven himself worthy may challenge the Master of the Colleges to a magical duel, with the winner becoming the next Supreme Patriarch. The competition even to become a candidate is white hot. Wizards, being what they are, mean the selection process is at best pedantic; at its worst, real enmities can develop. Balthasar Gelt is the Patriarch of the Gold Order, and tipped to win, but a rival Light Wizard, Gottfried Orr, desperate for the position, wants rid of Gelt before they even reach the Hall of Duels. While this is an open secret, no direct accusation can be made as that is not how wizards manage their affairs. However, Gelt is something of a maverick and knows he needs the edge when Orr inevitably makes his move. As such, the Gold Wizard sets about locating a valuable lodestone and harnessing its power. Lodestones sometimes occur in areas struck by lightning - areas such as Kislev, which has recently experienced heavy storm activity.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With his rival dispatched, Gelt returns to Altdorf to face the current Supreme Patriarch, Thyrus Gormann, in the Hall of Duels. Gelt was unconcerned by the Bright Wizard, after all he had a far more powerful contender in Orr. So, perhaps arrogantly, Gelt considered the Staff of Volans his in all but name until confirmed as the Supreme Patriarch.

missions.localised_description: With his rival dispatched, Gelt returns to Altdorf to face the current Supreme Patriarch, Thyrus Gormann, in the Hall of Duels. Gelt was unconcerned by the Bright Wizard, after all he had a far more powerful contender in Orr. So, perhaps arrogantly, Gelt considered the Staff of Volans his in all but name until confirmed as the Supreme Patriarch.

localised_description.last_approved_text: Emperor Karl Franz has received an urgent message from the college of the Celestial Order. Skilled in divination, the Celestial Wizards have been concerned by unusual eddies within the Wind of Azyr. Using the vast magical astrolabe which lies at the heart of the college's sixteen towers, the astromancers have divined a dire conjunction of certain astral bodies, portending doom for the Empire. However, the fluctuations in the sorcerous winds are obscuring the precise nature of the threat. Only by taking observations from another geographic location can the wizards triangulate a more accurate divination.

missions.localised_description: Emperor Karl Franz has received an urgent message from the college of the Celestial Order. Skilled in divination, the Celestial Wizards have been concerned by unusual eddies within the Wind of Azyr. Using the vast magical astrolabe which lies at the heart of the college's sixteen towers, the astromancers have divined a dire conjunction of certain astral bodies, portending doom for the Empire. However, the fluctuations in the sorcerous winds are obscuring the precise nature of the threat. Only by taking observations from another geographic location can the wizards triangulate a more accurate divination.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With fresh observations, the Celestial Wizards are closer to a definitive reading, but their astrolabe requires certain adjustments and intricate additions in order to perform the calculation. The latter will require rare materials which will not come cheaply.

missions.localised_description: With fresh observations, the Celestial Wizards are closer to a definitive reading, but their astrolabe requires certain adjustments and intricate additions in order to perform the calculation. The latter will require rare materials which will not come cheaply.

localised_description.last_approved_text: With the adjustments to their magical astrolabe completed, the wizards of the Celestial College report back their findings, and the portents could not be more dire. A great Orc Warboss has arisen somewhere in the lands south of the Black Mountains. His fearsome reputation has gathered many Greenskin tribes behind him in a Waaagh! which is now headed for the main route from the Badlands into the Empire: Black Fire Pass. The first priority is to prevent further Orc warbands from travelling to join the Waaagh! Meanwhile, messengers are sent to summon all allies to face this threat.

Whilst messengers are dispatched to alert the Dwarfs, the Emperor tasks one of his most trusted champions to locate the Orc Waaagh!
